TESO339: Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks

plots: the Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis against Adamus Phillida
title: Permanent Retirement
objective: assassinate Adamus Phillida when he is out of his Legion armor with or without the Rose of Sithis
description:
I have another assassination contract for you.
Do you recall the name Adamus Phillida? The Imperial Legion pest? It's time he joined Death in the Void. Think you're up to the task?
Adamus Phillida has spent his entire career investigating the Dark Brotherhood, interrupting our contracts, killing our family members! We tried to eliminate Phillida, of course, but failed on three separate occasions. He's a powerful man, and was surrounded by powerful associates. Now the Legion's pig's years of service have come to an end. He has retired. Phillida must not be allowed such a victory! His destiny is... darker. Phillida now resides in Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks, an honored guest of the soldiers there. He is, in fact, more vulnerable than ever.
The Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis. It is a magic arrow specifically enchanted to kill its target. In this case, Phillida. As long as the arrow hits Phillida, he will die. But it cannot pierce armor! Shoot while Phillida is armored, and the Rose will be wasted. Travel to Leyawiin. Track Phillida. Learn his schedule. Observe when he removes that blasted Legion armor! And then, let fly the Rose of Sithis! Kill Phillida in any way, Rose or not, and the contract is complete. But to receive a bonus, you must go beyond murder. You must send a message! Once Phillida is dead, take the very finger from his corpse, the one that bears an Imperial Legion signet ring! Deposit this finger in the desk of Phillida's successor, in his office in the Prison Barracks, in the Imperial City! Do this, and the bonus is yours.

plots: the Alchemist destroyed Torchlight
title: Warn the Estherians
objective: head up the pass to the Enclave, and warn the Estherians that the Alchemist is coming to them
tasks: find Commander Vale and let her know what happened
description:
Someone needs to warn the Estherians. Head up the pass to their Enclave. Find my old friend, Commander Vale, and let her know what happened.
Tell them that the Alchemist destroyed Torchlight, and is headed their way. He may be there already...

plots: the player is a noble
Tolmas Bendelia's caravan was waylaid by bandits
Tolmas Bendelia owns the deed to more than one local farmhold
title: The Angry Merchant
objective: find out why Tolmas Bendelia is angry
tasks: grant an audience to Tolmas Bendelia
description:
Greetings, Your Grace. I actually have a rather angry merchant by the name of Tolmas Bendelia that has been demanding to see you.
It might have something to do with his caravan being waylaid by bandits passing through the region, but he refuses to speak to anyone but Your Grace. He is an influential merchant in this area; I believe he owns the deed to more than one local farmhold. Will you grant this man an audience, my liege? I shall show him in.

plots: the player asked Elmus if they could help him
title: Mead for Elmus
objective: retrieve one bottle of Ashfire Mead for Elmus
tasks: grab a bottle of Ashfire Mead
description:
Actually, now that I think of it, I have been missing the Ashfire Mead. It's a special brew that we make at Thirsk.
If you could... somehow... get up there and grab a bottle, I'd be a long way towards forgetting how miserable it is down here.

plots: there is an open grave in Falkreath graveyard: Vighar broke free from the grave
Dengeir of Stuhn's family is entrusted with keeping Vighar buried: somebody stole the wardstone that kept Vighar in the grave
title: Dark Ancestor
objective: destroy Vighar
description:
You may have seen the open grave in our graveyard. Most of the townsfolk think it's the work of a corpse thief. The truth is less pleasant. It is...was, the grave of Vighar, my own ancestor, dead for centuries now.
Vighar is a vampire. My family is entrusted with keeping him buried, but recently someone stole the wardstone that sealed him in the grave, and Vighar escaped. It's too late for the wardstone. Vighar must be destroyed. If this gets out, my family will suffer great shame.
See that Vighar is destroyed. He will have fled to gather others of his kind at Bloodlet Throne.

BG1178: the gnoll stronghold, in the west

plots: Minsc, Boo, and Dynaheir traveled far to explore this land
gnolls have captured Dynaheir
Minsc and Boo will join the player
title: Rescuing Dynaheir
objective: free Dynaheir from gnolls with Minsc
description:
Greetings, we are Minsc and Boo. Boo is my faithful hamster companion, and more than he seems.
We have traveled far to explore this land, but now my charge Dynaheir has been taken from us. 'Twas gnolls, and once we have tracked them I will beat sense into their heads until they release her.
Accompany us, and bards will sing the deeds of Minsc and Boo... and friends.
Onward to the gnoll stronghold in the west!

plots: the player is the leader of a party of adventurers that has both men and women: Shar-Teel Dosan only duels men
if Shar-Teel Dosan wins the duel the player has to give 20 gold to her
Shar-Teel Dosan will kill anyone who tries to interfere the duel
title: A duel with Shar-Teel Dosan
objective: win duel against Shar-Teel Dosan
tasks: select the male party member who shall duel Shar-Teel Dosan
description:
Hold, traveler! I, Shar-Teel Dosan, challenge your best warrior to a duel. I don't fight women, so only men should step forward.
I win, and you give me 20 gold. In the unlikely event that one of you bests me, I'll pledge my sword to your cause, however stupid it may be..
Will your champion step forward? I only fight men, so your women will have to be satisfied with just watching. Don't entertain any thoughts about cheating. If any of the rest of you try to interfere in this fight, I'll kill them outright.

plots: NONE
title: Striking the Heart
objective: force the Silver Hand in hiding
description:
I've been hearing rumors of Silver Hand activity. A group of them has holed up in Hjaalmarch, in a camp called Orotheim.
Assassinate their leader and the rest should go hiding. Run fast, my friend.

plots: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
as the player can see, the Black Hand have dealt with Lucien Lachance
Lucien Lachance tricked the player to kill the Black Hand off: the player killed the Listener and the Listener's successor
Arquen promotes the player to Speaker from Silencer: the player becomes a member of the Black Hand
there are only five members of the Black Hand, including the player
title: Honor Thy Mother
objective: perform an ancient ritual to wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance
tasks: ask about the Night Mother from Arquen between 12.00 PM and 3:00 AM
go to the Night Mother's home with Arquen
description:
Silencer! At last you've arrived! Fear not, for the crisis that has threatened the Dark Brotherhood has finally come to an end. I am Arquen, Speaker for the Black Hand.
As you can see, we have dealt with the betrayer, Lucien Lachance! No longer will you serve as his puppet! It seems Lachance wanted revenge against the Dark Brotherhood for some reason, and used you to do his dirty work. But now, we can begin anew!
I bestow upon you the title of Speaker. You will take Lucien Lachance's place on the Black Hand! Welcome! As you know, the Black Hand is now in a state of disarray. Lachance ordered you to kill us off! We five, including you, are now all that remain. Even worse, you killed the Listener! The Black Hand without a Listener is like a hand with no thumb. Even the Listener's successor is dead!
So, we have no choice but to invoke an ancient ritual. We must wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance! Between the hours of midnight and 3:00 AM, ask me about the Night Mother, and we will away to our Lady's home in Bravil. Only then will the ritual begin.
May the Night Mother hold you in her cold embrace.

plots: the player has come back to the Palace
The Font of Madness in the middle of the throne room in the Palace has been tainted with Order: as goes the Font of Madness, so goes the Realm
soon we will all be serving a new master, Jyggalag: the forces of Order have poisoned the Pools of Mania and Dementia that feed the Font of Madness
the traitor Thadon is probably behind the poisoning instead of Jyggalag himself
title: The Roots of Madness
objective: cleanse the Pools of Madness and the Font of Madness from the taint of Order
tasks: find the source of the taint of Order
description:
Ah, you're back. You may have noticed that we have a... bit of a problem.
My Liege of course noticed the Font when you arrived in the Palace. The Font of Madness, in the middle of the throne room.
The taint of Order appeared only a short time ago, but it has spread quickly. As goes the Font of Madness, so goes the Realm. Soon we will all be serving a new master, Jyggalag.
Somehow the forces of Order have poisoned the Pools of Mania and Dementia that feed the Font. I suspect the traitor Thadon. Jyggalag has never had an original thought in his existence. Be that as it may. You will have to enter the Fountainhead beneath the Tree and find the source of the poison.

plots: Sprocket traveled here from his home village to find Blue Boletus for his cousins who are afflicted with the Black Blindness
title: The Blue Boletus
objective: bring Blue Boletus flesh to Sprocket
description:
Oh, please - perhaps you can help us! On the advice of our village's healer, I have traveled here seeking a cure. My cousins are afflicted with the Black Blindness, an ailment peculiar to our race.
Black Blindness is an insidious disease - it dims the vision and makes speech impossible, and if not treated within a few weeks, can become permanent. The only known treatment is produced from the flesh of the Blue Boletus - a species of mushroom creatures that grows only in the Fungal Caves near here. I find that they are, ah, BIGGER than I had anticipated, however.
Perhaps YOU could retrieve some Blue Boletus flesh for us? We would be forever in your debt!

plots: this is the player's last trial
title: The Horn of Jurgen Windcaller
objective: retrieve the horn of Jurgen Windcaller
tasks: find the horn of Jurgen Windcaller in his tomb
description:
You are now ready for your last trial. Retrieve the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller, our founder, from his tomb in the ancient fane of Ustengrav.
Remain true to the Way of the Voice, and you will return. Then it is time for us to recognize you formally as Dragonborn.

plots: Lucien Lachance has awoken the player from their sleep: the player is a murderer whose work pleases the Night Mother
Lucien Lachance gives the player a new blade
title: A Knife in the Dark
objective: complete your initiation to the Dark Brotherhood
tasks: Go to Inn of Ill Omen.
description:
You sleep rather soundly for a murderer. That's good. You'll need a clear conscience for what I'm about to propose.
I am Lucien Lachance, a Speaker for the Dark Brotherhood. And you, you are a killer. A taker of life. A harvester of souls. Your work, your deathcraft, pleases the Night Mother. And so, I come to you with an offering. An opportunity... to join our rather unique family.
On the Green Road to the north of Bravil lies the Inn of Ill Omen. There you will find a man named Rufio. Kill him, and your initiation into the Dark Brotherhood will be complete. Know that Rufio is old and weak, and sleeps his days away. You could kill him before he even has a chance to wake. If you so choose. Do this, and the next time you sleep in a location I deem secure, I will reveal myself once more, bearing the love of your new family.
Please accept this token from the Dark Brotherhood. It is a virgin blade, and thirsts for blood. May it serve you well, as does your silence.

plots: Eldoth and the player can blackmail money from Entar Silvershield after capturing Skie
Eldoth will join the player's party
title: Eldoth and Skie
objective: capture Skie with Eldoth
tasks: help Skie escape from her father
description:
I'm Eldoth, a traveling bard. Pleased to make your acquaintance. You look like the type to be on the outlook for ways to improve the quality of your life.
Well, I have a proposal that could help you in that endeavor. You see, there's a girl, my lover in fact, who desires to escape her father and live on her own. Her father is Entar Silvershield, one of the dukes of Baldur's Gate. This, of course, makes her desires more difficult than that of the average city girl.
However, with your assistance, we could help her escape the tyrannical clutches of Entar. Here's the punchline: Since Entar's going to be hunting us anyway, we can blackmail him for hoards of cash and not worry about our captive escaping. After all, we're doing it all for the sake of Skie.
Now, we needn't go about this right away. In fact, I'll help you with whatever you're doing until you decide to head up to Baldur's Gate. Just think of it as one favor deserving another.

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #3" has been addressed toward the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
J'Ghasta turned down the offer to marry a prominent Cyrodiil noble's daughter: the noble hired the Dark Brotherhood to kill J'Ghasta
J'Ghasta is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the Bruma streets
title: Broken Vows
objective: assassinate J'Ghasta
description:
Dead Drop Orders #3
by Lucien Lachance

Are you ready to get your hands dirty, Silencer?
Your next target is a Khajiit nobleman by the name of J'Ghasta, who can be found at his home in the city of Bruma. J'Ghasta was recently offered the hand of a prominent Cyrodiil noble's daughter, but turned down the offer when he learned of the girl's rather negligible dowry. The girl's family is outraged, of course, and has hired the Dark Brotherhood to make J'Ghasta pay for his insolence.
Go to J'Ghasta's house in Bruma and end his miserable life. But be warned! The Khajiit is rich and bored, and spends most of his time honing his skills in unarmed combat. Any opponent who can kill with merely his hands is not to be trifled with, so tread carefully. Even worse, J'Ghasta is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the city streets.
When the target has been eliminated, you will find your next dead drop in a rotten box under the Old Bridge, just south of the Imperial City. The box will contain your reward for killing J'Ghasta, as well as information regarding your next contract.

plots: Lord Taldimut has been studying the crests
title: The Lost Key
objective: help Lord Taldimut bring the Golden Gear to Zeryphesh
description: I have continued studying the crests, and I am more convinced than ever that the Golden Gear is hidden in the the Whispering Cave. If you can retrieve it, I can bring it back to Zeryphesh, to aid in the city's defense against the Ezrohir siege.

plots: the player has summoned Molag Bal
Melus Petilius has sworn an oath to never to raise a weapon against another man again: Molag Bal wants Melus Petilius to break his oath
Molag Bal will save the player's life when Melus Petilius kills the player
title: Molag Bal's Dark Bidding
objective: goad Melus Petilius into killing you with the Cursed Mace
description:
Another mortal come to do my bidding. I, Molag Bal, only wish suffering and death. You will bring me both. I want to see a man brought to the edge. And pushed.
Near Brindle Home you will find Melus Petilius. A good man. An honorable man. He disgusts me. He has sworn an oath: never to raise a weapon against another man again. I want him to break that oath, and damn himself forever.
You will let him kill you with this: the Cursed Mace. As you are doing this for me, I'll save your miserable life. Probably. Get out of my sight.

plots: half-ogres wounded Bjornin
title: Half-ogres Near Beregost
objective: kill the half-ogres who battled Bjornin
description:
I'm still healing from my latest encounters. They did quite a number on me, those half-ogres. There's a band of them fortifying themselves in the mountains south-southwest of here...
If you could give them a taste of justice by testing your steel against them, that would do me, Bjornin, proud.
In an effort to encourage such deeds of righteousness, allow me to present to you this shield as a reward upon your return...

plots: Dar-Ma was supposed to make a delivery to Etira Moslin, because Seed-Neeus was not feeling well
Dar-Ma went with Blossom
title: A Shadow Over Hackdirt
objective: find Dar-Ma
tasks: find clues about Dar-Ma's whereabouts from Etira Moslin
description:
I'm Seed-Neeus. I don't mean to impose, but I'm hoping you can help me. My daughter, Dar-Ma is missing and I don't know what to do.
Dar-Ma never came back from Hackdirt. I'm dreadfully worried something may have happened to her. Can you help?
Dar-Ma was supposed to make a delivery to Etira Moslin in Hackdirt, so I would start there. Hackdirt is a rather isolated village, south of Chorrol. We do some business with the trader there. Small volume, but she pays well. Normally I make the deliveries, but I wasn't feeling well so Dar-Ma insisted on going this time. In case it may be useful, she was with Blossom -- her horse, I mean. Dar-Ma loves that animal, and would never willingly abandon her.
If you find my daughter, you have my friendship and gratitude to the end of my days!

plots: the player asked Andragil to train the player in blocking
title: Block Training
objective: demonstrate your blocking skills to Andragil
tasks: block Andragil's attacks with your shield
description:
You want training, from me? Well, perhaps I can accommodate you. If you're worth the time and effort, that is. I think a little test is in order.
Thinking you know how to use a shield is one thing. Actually using one is quite another. So here's what we're going to do. We're going to find out whether or not you can hold up in combat. You put up your shield, and I hit you. If you're still standing when I'm done, you've earned the right to learn what I have to teach.
Shall we find out what you really know? Now, put up your guard, and let's begin. I'm losing interest in this.

plots: slaughterfish nearly took off Aelwin Merowald's leg
Aelwin Merowald could retire with the money he would get from the slaughterfish scales
title: Go Fish
objective: bring 12 slaughterfish scales to Aelwin Merowald
tasks: kill slaughterfish and collect their scales
description:
You know, stranger, there comes a time in every man's life when he has to admit that he's lost the fight.
Well, I've fought and I've lost. Who did I lose to? Who is my great enemy? Well, don't laugh... it's a bunch of damn fish.
I'm a fisherman. Or at least, I was. Until one of those slaughterfish damn near took my leg off. I was collecting their scales, see. I had a contract with this young alchemist. You wouldn't believe what he was paying for those scales! Then last month, one of the bastards got ahold of my leg. Took me right out of the business. But this alchemist, he needs the scales right away. The alchemist was paying so much for the scales that I'm close to having enough saved so that I can retire. But now, I can't get out there to Lake Rumare -- not with this leg. I only needed twelve more scales! Can you believe it? I was so close!
I've picked up a few things in my travels. If you head out there and bring me back the twelve scales that I need, I can make it worth your time. Help an old fisherman out, won't you?

BG2248: Marlowe's home, a simple, safe dwelling atop the east cliff
BG2249: Marlowe's home, a simple, safe dwelling atop the east cliff

plots: Marlowe assumes that the player is one of the strangers that all the locals have been talking about, an adventurer from the north
Marlowe and his daughter shall surely perish without the player's help
title: Marlowe's Plea for Help
objective: find out what Marlowe needs help with
description:
Excuse me, I... I do not mean to be rude... but you *are* one of the strangers that all the locals have been talking about, aren't you? An adventurer from the north? Yes, yes, of course you are. Anyone can see that you are an extraordinary person. Please forgive me.
I would not bother you, stranger, but I am in terrible peril! I need your aid! I beg you for a boon or I and my daughter both shall surely perish! I... cannot speak more of this here. Please come to my home on top of the cliff, I beg you! We can speak freely there!
My home is atop the east cliff, adventurer. It is a simple dwelling but... safe, for the moment. My name is Marlowe... please meet me there and I shall explain everything, I swear.

plots: NONE
title: The Merryweather Poultice
objective: help Medrus treat himself
tasks: bring some Merryweather Leaves to Medrus
description:
Hello! I thought I heard someone moving around out there.
Listen, my name's Medrus. I got ambushed by some raiders, and managed to get clear... but I got pretty badly injured in the process. I can treat it, but I need some Merryweather Leaves. They grow around here, but I'm too weak to look for them.
Think you can find some for me, bring 'em back here? You'll be rewarded, I promise.

plots: the player has been rising through the ranks of the College of Winterhold
title: Arniel's Endeavors
objective: help Arniel Gane with his unofficial research project
description:
I can't help but notice that you're doing quite well for yourself, rising through the ranks and all.
It may not be "official", but there is a, uhh, project I've been working on. I wonder if perhaps you could assist with it.
Just... Just bring me some Dwemer Cogs. I need to examine them for the methods used in forging them. Ten of them should be enough for me to get a better understanding of how they were crafted. That's all I need, all right?

plots: Sir Sarles demands illithium as his art medium
if the player sees the representatives of the other churches, the player must kill them
title: Gain the services of Sir Sarles for the Temple of Talos
objective: convince Sir Sarles to create a work of art for the temple of Talos
description:
I, Talon Yarryl, priest of Talos, have a mission for you!
Talos demands proper tribute, and that occasionally means artwork pleasing to the eye. If a piece of his fury can be represented, more might see and fear it.
An artist visits Athkatla now. The artist travels under the name Sir Sarles, though it is surely a fake. He is pretentious, demanding, and very good.
We must command a commission from him. But he is not being cooperative. His commission is outlandish, and he demands illithium as his medium! He may as well have asked for dragon tears.
Convince him to work for Talos. Use whatever means you must. Other churches are trying the same... if you cross their representatives, kill them.
Incur what debts you must, and use force where it will help. Stop at nothing. This man must realize there is no choice but to work in the service of Talos.

plots: a storm sank the player's ship
there are beasts outside the village wall
title: Durlyle's Task
objective: bring the cloak that draped the village center back to Durlyle
description:
I am Durlyle, and I am glad to be meeting. I have but a mundane task to ask of you, if you hear me out?
The storm you felt that took your ship? It was fierce here too, and a cloak that draped the village center was cast to the wind. I think it is beyond the wall, and will not risk the beasts to get it. Will you?

plots: the player is meeting Harkon for the first time: Harkon and his family are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim
the player returned Harkon's daughter and her Elder Scroll to him
title: Bloodline
objective: become a vampire, or be banished from Castle Volkihar
tasks: decide whether you want to become a vampire or remain mortal
description:
I am Harkon, lord of this court. By now, my daughter will have told you what we are. We are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim.
You have done me a great service, and now you must be rewarded. There is but one gift I can give that is equal in value to the Elder Scroll and my daughter.
I offer you my blood. Take it, and you will walk as a lion among sheep. Men will tremble at your approach, and you will never fear death again.
However, if you refuse my gift you will be prey, like all mortals. I will spare your life this once, but you will be banished from this hall.
I await your decision.

plots: Sir Juncan died while seeking out the Boots of the Crusader
title: Nature's Fury
objective: retrieve the Boots of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: talk to the priests of Kynareth
description:
My name was Sir Juncan.
I wish to see you succeed where I failed. I was on the path to the Boots of the Crusader, but died before I reached them.
I cannot tell you exactly how to find the Boots, for that will be up to Kynareth. I can tell you to seek out her Priests, though. West of the Imperial City, on the edge of the Great Forest, is a shrine. You will find them there, and they will tell you what you need to know.

plots: NONE
title: The Firewine Ruins
objective: kill kobolds
description:
Well met, traveler. Gandolar Luckyfoot, at your disposal.
If I might pull on your coattail a moment more, I have a proposition for you. It's usually nature-quiet by the Firewine ruins, even with its violent bygone. Those who died and did not sleep have mostly found their rest over time. It's a live threat that comes now, with a band of kobolds that moved in.
Perhaps we could prevail upon you to rid us of this menace, and in return, a gift from us you shall receive. Keep whatever you find as well.

plots: Commander Vale believes that the Alchemist might attack the Wellspring Temple: the Alchemist wants to reach the Guardian of Water
title: Protect the Guardian!
objective: protect the Guardian of Water
description:
Commander Vale believes that the Alchemist might attack the Wellspring Temple, in an attempt to reach the Guardian of Water ... for what nefarious purpose I am afraid to speculate. There has been no word from either Vale, or the Guardian.
Scout the Wellspring Temple, and determine if the Guardian of Water is in any danger.

plots: NONE
title: White Wolf Pelts
objective: bring a white wolf's pelt to the merchant
description:
I am but a humble merchant. Interested in a little business on the side, friend?
I've a man who swears by his grandmother he glimpsed a white wolf up in the Cloudpeak ice fields. It was but a short ways south, and she be easy pickings for a smart sword.
I'd pay you good money for its pelt, so it's a guaranteed sale if you go.
Keep it in mind on your travels.

plots: Feran Sadri gives the player Dawnguard armor, and a note for framing the Dawnguard
title: Deceiving the Herd
objective: frame the Dawnguard for murder
tasks: murder someone influential in public while wearing Dawnguard armor and plant a note on the victim
description:
The Dawnguard have increased their operations and have been aggressively recruiting in Whiterun.
We need to put a damper on their efforts and give those trouble makers something to worry about other than harassing our interests.
You are to make a public show of murdering someone. Do it in the streets for all to see. The higher the profile the better. Someone attached to the court, a merchant, a bard, a priest, someone with stature. Make it seem you are a member of the Dawnguard, thus sowing confusion among the herd. Wear this armor and plant this note on the victim.
The people will put pressure on the Dawnguard who are apparently murdering their fellows without provocation. Their focus will be shifted from us, giving us one less nuisance to deal with.

TL265: near the altars in the Rotting Crypt
TL266: near the altars in the Rotting Crypt
TL267: the depths beyond the Rotting Crypt

plots: NONE
title: The Locket
objective: kill the Wraith Lord and find Estherian Spectre's remains along the Locket
tasks: place the Sanguine Gems on the altars to open the path to the Wraith Lord
description:
I am bound to this place, and may not pass beyond the threshold. 
If you seek my remains, you must find the Sanguine Gems - they may be found in the depths beyond. Place them upon these altars, and the path to the Wraith Lord will be revealed.
If you can best him, you will discover my remains there - and the Locket Jessa seeks.

plots: Urag gro-Shub gives the player a note that tells the player the location of the book
title: Fetch Me That Book!
objective: find a book for Urag gro-Shub
description:
If you're feeling adventurous, I'm always looking for someone to procure valuable books from some more... dangerous locations.
Here, I scribbled down the last place I'd heard about. Check it out, but be careful.

plots: the player asked a recommendation from Kud-Ei
Varon Vamori stole Ardaline's mage's staff
Kud-Ei gives the player a scroll with a powerful Illusion charm spell
title: Mixed Feelings
objective: recover Ardaline's mage's staff
tasks: charm Varon Vamori and make him tell you where Ardaline's mage's staff is
description:
I'm afraid I haven't had time to prepare anything conventional for your recommendation. I'm very preoccupied with this situation concerning Ardaline.
Perhaps you can help with that, however. I can't directly get involved, for fear of embarrassing the poor girl. Varon Vamori's been bothering Ardaline every day for a while now. He even stole her Mages' Staff! Perhaps he thinks it's amusing; I don't know. But it needs to stop. It's making her miserable.
I'll need you to have a little chat with Varon Vamori to get Ardaline's staff back, and you can learn something about the power of Illusion in the process. Take this charm scroll. With it, you should find Varon more receptive to questioning.
Don't come back without that staff. I'll write you a recommendation for your help.

plots: the player is a student at the College of Winterhold
Sergius Turrianus gives the player the name and the location of the client
title: Enchanting Pick-Up
objective: bring an item from a client to Sergius Turrianus
tasks: get the item from Sergius Turrianus' client
description:
There's more enchanting to be done. You can acquire whatever it is and bring it back here, and I'll take care of it.
Be quick about it, will you? This is a good way for the College to bring in some money.
Here's the name and location of the client.

BG2176: within the city in tombs such as this one
BG2177: within the city in tombs such as this one

plots: Kangaxx has been cursed to eternal entrapment in this tomb by his enemies
Kangaxx's curse can be reversed by collecting the pieces of his body: he will become mortal again
title: Restore Kangaxx's Body
objective: reverse Kangaxx's curse
tasks: find Kangaxx's arms, legs, and torso
description:
I am Kangaxx, and I have been cursed. I am dead yet not dead.
Cursed to eternal entrapment in this tomb by cruel enemies! Cursed to a fate worse than death! But the curse can be reversed! With your assistance, I may live again. I have suffered for so long... will you help me?
The fiends that did this to me keep me from returning by tearing apart my mortal form and keeping the pieces separated. You must find my body that I might again take mortal form. The pieces are very close! I have no doubt that they lie within the city in tombs such as this. My enemies are predictable if nothing else. Seek my arms, legs, and torso.
I will give you anything you want. Power, riches beyond number! Anything!

plots: Modryn Oreyn sent Viranus Donton and some other Fighters Guild members on a troll killing mission to Forsaken Mine: Modryn Oreyn felt that they were up to the task
title: Trolls of Forsaken Mine
objective: find out what happened at Forsaken Mine and report back to Modryn Oreyn
tasks: find Viranus Donton and other Fighters Guild members who went missing
description:
I have got another job for you. It's a sensitive one. I need you to find Viranus Donton.
I sent him on a mission to Forsaken Mine. He and some others were supposed to clear the place of trolls. Haven't heard back from them in days. I want you to go check it out. I don't need to tell you how sensitive a matter this is.
We'd been contracted to clear the place of trolls. It was a tough job, but I felt the men I sent were up to it. I want to know what happened.
Get moving, and report back to me as soon as possible.

plots: Garren Windspear left his home in the player's care
Jierdan Firkraag and his hooligans kidnapped Garren Windspear's daughter from Garren Windspear's home
the player will travel unmolested, because Garren Windspear pleaded the player's virtue at the Radiant Heart
title: Rescue Garren's Child from Firkraag
objective: rescue Garren Windspear's daughter, and avenge the slain knights of the Radiant Heart
description:
My daughter is gone! I left my home in your care! I... I... no, no, I know it was not you... I know who my enemies are. Damn that Jierdan Firkraag! What is his grief with me?! I don't know where you will find him. His hooligans prevent searching. I don't know... Perhaps the ruins in the northeast? I don't know...
Please rescue my child, no matter the risk. You will travel unmolested, for my pleas of your virtue were heard at the Radiant Heart. They demand justice for the slain knights, so that is your task now. Do this, and your honor shall be restored.

plots: the bandit leader thinks that his men are going to mutiny: Herd and Brodir are leading their own cliques within the bandits
the bandit leader is going to gather up gold and escape downriver to Dragon Bridge
title: Robber's Stash
objective: find the bandit leader's stash by the old tree stump
tasks: go to the island to the south and find the old tree stump
description:
Bandit Leader's Journal

5th of First Seed, 4E 201
Idiots! Brodir and Herd were at each others' throats again today, and nearly came to blows. The whole camp is on edge. I've ordered an extra ration of mead, but unless this fighting stops, we'll tear ourselves apart.

11th of First Seed, 4E 201
Rumor is that Herd's gathering followers for a mutiny. Brodir's not stupid; he's probably doing the same, just for insurance. I'd kill them both myself, but the camp's split right down the middle. If I tried, there'd be a knife in my back within a week.
I can't take this anymore. I've begun skimming a little gold from the take, bringing it down here when I can. If I can scrape enough together, I'll make a run for it, head downriver to Dragon Bridge.

28th of First Seed, 4E 201
Brodir's getting suspicious -- I caught him poking around in the cove this afternoon. I don't think he found my stash, but it's not safe here. I took the boat out tonight and stowed it on the island to the south, by the old tree stump.
Had a good haul this week. Another caravan or two and I can finally get out of here, and not a moment too soon.

plots: Idolaf Battle-Born saw the player assault Nazeem
title: Scare My Enemy
objective: assault someone for Idolaf Battle-Born
description:
Letter from Idolaf Battle-Born
by Idolaf Battle-Born

Dragonborn,
I'm aware of your recent assault on Nazeem. Rest assured I have no interest in that particular matter. I do, however, have an interest in your willingness to employ force when the need arises.
If you are able to assist me, I will gladly pay you for your troubles.
Next time you are visiting Whiterun, please call on me.
Sincerely, Idolaf Battle-Born

plots: NONE
title: The Brave Ones
objective: destroy the Ezrohir machines that pump "Manatoxin" in Zeryphesh's water supply
description:
My friend, I need your help! My squad and I had observed a group of Ezrohir moving in and out of the Undercurrents. They have installed machines to pump a virulent poison into the city's water supply. Their "Manatoxin" is specifically designed to disrupt Zeraphi physiology. Unfortunately, the noxious atmosphere seems to have attracted a horde of poisonous beasts, and I only just escaped with my life. If you can enter the Undercurrents and destroy those machines for me, I will reward you. What do you say?
I won't lie to you: Destroying those machines won't be simple... but it's vital, and you're the only one who can do it.

plots: NONE
title: Brelyna's Practice
objective: help Brelyna Maryon by allowing her to practice her spells on you
description:
We're all trying to become better mages, right?
Well, I need someone I can practice a few spells on. Nothing dangerous, really.
Would you be willing to assist me? I can't practice that kind of spell on myself. Believe me when I say I wouldn't be asking if it weren't necessary. You just have to stand there...
You might wish to help out one of your fellow mages. If that is not enough, I have this amulet you could take.

plots: Sinding killed a little girl, because he lost control of his transformations
Hircine cursed the Ring of Hircine when Sinding obtained it: it transforms him at the worst of times
Sinding will escape from the prison after giving the quest
title: Ill Met by Moonlight
objective: take the Ring of Hircine back to Hircine
tasks: hunt down the beast to draw out Hircine
description:
Come to gawk at the monster?
A little girl is dead because of me. Believe me, it wasn't anything I ever intended to do. I just... lost control. I tried to tell them, but none of them believe me.
It's all on account of this blasted ring. This is the Ring of Hircine. I was told it could let me control my transformations. Perhaps it used to. But I'll never know. Hircine didn't care for my taking it, and threw a curse on it. I put it on... and the changes just came to me. I could never guess when. It would be at the worst times. Like... with the little girl.
I don't suppose there's a point in keeping the secret if I'm going to die in here anyway. I'm sure you've heard of men who shift to beasts under the influence of the moons. I am one of them. A werewolf. It's my secret, and my shame. That's why I wanted the ring... it was said to give men like me control. Now I may look like a man, but I still feel the animal inside of me, as strong as ever.
You would take the ring back to Hircine? Oh my. You would do this for me? Here, take it. I don't want anything to do with this wretched thing anymore. Seek out the beast. He wanders these woods. Bring him down and... well, the Lord of the Hunt should smile on you and appear before you.
I wish you luck, but should leave here while I still have my skin. Should our paths cross again, I will remember your kindness. Farewell.

plots: the player has stolen something from their fellow Fighters Guild members: this is the player's first offense
title: Expelled from the Fighters Guild
objective: bring 20 bear pelts to Vilena Donton
description:
You would steal from your brothers? If you had a need for something, why would you not just ask?
I will give you a chance, though. As it is only your first offense, do not return until you have collected 20 bear pelts.
Use this time to reflect on your actions.

plots: NONE
title: The Gardener of Men
objective: bring the secrets of the Skaal to Hermaeus Mora
tasks: convince the Skaal to reveal their secrets
description:
I am Hermaeus Mora, the Gardener of Men, knower of the unknown, master of fates. You stand in my realm, mortal.
You have sought out the forbidden knowledge that only one other has obtained. You are a seeker of knowledge and power, like Miraak before you.
The Skaal have withheld their secrets from me for many long years. The time has come for this knowledge to be added to my library. Convince them to give up their secrets. My word is as true as fate, as inevitable as destiny. Bring me what I want, and I will give you what you seek.

plots: the Flame of Agnon is at Cylarne: Sheogorath's minions are fighting over Cylarne in their eternal quest to please him
title: The Cold Flame of Agnon
objective: get the Flame of Agnon to relight the great torch over New Sheoth
description:
You've seen the Great Torch that burns brightly over New Sheoth? No? Because it doesn't. It should. But it doesn't. You'll fix that. You'll go to Cylarne and bring back the Flame of Agnon to relight the torch.
Oh... and take care with my minions at Cylarne. In their eternal quest to please me, they're constantly fighting over Cylarne. It can be tiresome. But, really, it's divine. Divinely tiresome. Well. That's your problem now.
Off with you. I don't want to see you again until the Great Torch is lit. I wouldn't want to have to hurt you.

plots: the player asked Pranal to give them heavy armor training
Pranal wants to get a gift to Malene: Pranal gives the player 50 gold to cover the costs of the gift
title: Heavy Armor Training
objective: get some useful items to Pranal, and talk to him
tasks: get a silver pitcher, and a set of four glasses
description:
You desire heavy armor training from me? Goodness me, I'm retired! I'm afraid combat doesn't interest me any more.
All that matters to me now is Malene. I'm no fool. I know she'd never be interested in an old man like me. It's enough just to be around her, to be in her company.
Well, if you're dead set on learning something from me, then how about you do a little something for me, first? Something for her, to be honest.
I'd like to get her a gift of a sort. Nothing terribly fancy, and something useful... How about a nice silver pitcher, and a set of four glasses. Here's 50 gold to cover the costs, that should be more than enough. Come see me when you've got everything, and we'll talk more.

TESO436: each local guild hall in Cyrodiil
TESO438: each local guild hall in Cyrodiil
TESO439: each local guild hall in Cyrodiil

plots: the player wants to join the Mages Guild: Carahil makes the player an Associate of the Mages Guild
all recommendations must be sent to the Council of Mages before the player can enter the Arcane University
title: Join the Mages Guild
objective: advance in the Mages Guild
description:
Hello there. Is there something with which I can assist you? Perhaps you're curious about joining the Mages Guild?
All right, then. You're now an Associate of the Mages Guild. Congratulations! You'll need to receive a recommendation from each local guild hall in Cyrodiil to advance in the guild, and be given any sort of responsibility. They can be done in any order, but they all must be sent in to the Council before you can enter the Arcane University.

plots: Galmar Stone-Fist is addressing the player and the player's fellow Stormcloaks: the true sons and daughters of Skyrim
Imperial legionnaires have been stationed on the walls of Whiterun
title: Storm over Whiterun
objective: take Whiterun in the name of the Stormcloaks
tasks: tear through the barricades, and find a way to drop the drawbridge into Whiterun
description:
This is it men! They say that our cause is false and that we are nothing more than thieves, thugs and murderers! But no! We are farmers! We are craftsmen! We are sons and daughters of shopkeepers, maid servants and soldiers!
We are the sons and daughters of Skyrim! And we have come this far because our cause is true. Because we fight as one. And because our hearts are bursting with anger! What we do here today, we do for our country! For all the true Nords of Skyrim!
Whiterun's walls are tall, but they are old and crumbling, like the Empire whose Legion lines them. They've barricades to block us, but we'll tear through them and the Imperials behind them! Our objective is the drawbridge. If we can find a way to drop it, the city will be ours!
Everyone on me. Let's show these Imperial milk drinkers what true Nords look like! Rrrrraaaaaarrrrr!!!!!

plots: Dexion said the player and Serana needed two other Elder Scrolls
Valerica told Serana that she'd go somewhere safe, somewhere that Serana's father would never search
title: Chasing Echoes
objective: get information about an Elder Scroll from Valerica
tasks: search for clues about Valerica's whereabouts with Serana
description:
That Moth Priest, Dexion. He said we needed two other Elder Scrolls. I think I know where we can start looking. We need to find my mother, Valerica. She'll definitely know where one of the Scrolls is, and if we're lucky, she actually has it herself.
The last time I saw her, she said that she'd go somewhere safe... somewhere that my father would never search. Other than that, she wouldn't tell me anything. But the way she said it... "someplace he would never search." It was cryptic, yet she called attention to it.
Wait... There's a courtyard in Castle Volkihar. I used to help her tend a garden there. All of the ingredients for our potions came from there. She used to say that my father couldn't stand the place. Too... peaceful. I don't think we'll actually trip over her there. But it's worth a look.

plots: Tolgerias seeks to employ the player in a matter of some urgency: Madeen has been given little knowledge of the matter
title: Tolgerias' Task
objective: find out what Tolgerias wants you to do
description:
Greetings. I am Madeen. I represent one of the masters of the Athkatla order of the Cowled Wizards. He seeks to employ you in a matter of some urgency.
The matter is most sensitive... I have been given little knowledge of it. Tolgerias, the one whom I speak for, is eager to meet with you and discuss these matters.
Master Tolgerias can be found in the government building behind me... you may go within. Do not tarry overlong, my friend.

plots: something has taken control of most of the people of Solstheim, including the Skaal: it makes them work on horrible creations that corrupt the stones
Storn says that Miraak has returned to Solstheim, but that is impossible
title: The Temple of Miraak
objective: uncover what lies beneath the Temple of Miraak
tasks: find a way into the Temple of Miraak with Frea
description:
I am Frea of the Skaal. I am here to either save my people, or avenge them.
Something has taken control of most of the people of Solstheim. It makes them forget themselves, and work on these horrible creations that corrupt the Stones, the very land itself. My father Storn, our shaman, says Miraak has returned to Solstheim, but that is impossible.
If you want to know what lies beneath the Temple of Miraak, then let us go together. First, we need to find a way into the Temple of Miraak.

plots: the player is a cleric of Lathander, and one of Lathander's favored
Lara will send the player someone who needs the guidance of Lathander
title: Guide the Followers of Lathander
objective: lend your wisdom to the believers of Lathander
tasks: give guidance to someone that needs the guidance of Lathander
description:
Hello there, I am Lara, and I shall be your tutor.
Not that you need schooling, but you might be unfamiliar with the duties you are to perform.
In exchange for the many benefits you will enjoy as a favored of Lathander, you will have a few tasks to perform while here. They are humble, but very important.
You are to lend your wisdom to the wounded and afflicted, those that are suffering from a misdirection of the heart. Guide them in the light of the Morninglord's glory.
We shall introduce you slowly to the work. I shall send you someone that needs the guidance of Lathander, and then we shall evaluate how you have done.

plots: the player is Sheogorath's newest and only noble in the realm
a messenger told Sheogorath that Order has attacked Brellach and routed his soldiers
title: The Helpless Army
objective: free Brellach from Order
description:
There's a perfect job for you, my newest and only Noble in the realm!
A messenger told me that Order has attacked my army's stronghold at Brellach and routed my soldiers! If Order has truly entered my army's stronghold, things have taken a disturbing turn. It means Order has tried subterfuge... not its strong suit. Amazing! Perhaps things aren't going as poorly as I'd imagined.
You'll want to get all the details from the messenger. Unless you already have. You haven't, have you?

plots: the player is a ranger
Delon has been looking for the player again
Imnesvale is in danger again: Umar has threatened to kill everyone if they don't leave
the Minister will tell the player everything
title: Umar the Witch
objective: deal with Umar
description:
Hey! It's me, Delon. I... I've found you again, my noble ranger! It's... it's so hard to find you sometimes! The... the village is in danger again! The Minister has asked for you!
It's Umar! The witch! She's come back, and she's threatened to kill everyone if they don't go an' leave right now! The... the Minister says he will tell you everything!

plots: Esmond Tyne stole Glover Mallory's bonemold formula
Esmond Tyne talked about trying to fence goods to the Rieklings at Castle Karstaag
title: Paid in Full
objective: recover the bonemold formula for Glover Mallory
description:
Eager to make some coin, eh? That's the spirit. I'll tell you what. The Guild's got a problem out here that I've been trying to deal with for years, but haven't been able to handle.
A fellow Breton who went by the name Esmond Tyne showed up on my doorstep about a fortnight ago. He stole something from me: my own formula for improved bonemold. Took me years to perfect.
Before he ran off, he was talking some nonsense about trying to fence goods to the Rieklings at Castle Karstaag. I told him he was crazy to even think about talking to those vicious little buggers, but he wouldn't listen. I'd bet a fat purse of coin that he's either dead or hiding out up there.

TESS69: an inn in Dragon Bridge or Rorikstead
TESS70: an inn in Dragon Bridge or Rorikstead
TESS72: an inn in Dragon Bridge or Rorikstead

plots: NONE
title: A False Front
objective: deliver false orders to the Imperial Legate in Morthal
tasks: convince an innkeeper to help you locate an Imperial runner, get the Imperial orders from the runner, and replace them with forgeries
description:
I Need you to deliver some false orders to the Imperial Legate in Morthal. But first we need to get our hands on some Imperial orders to make the forgeries.
The inns at Dragon Bridge and Rorikstead are frequent stops for Imperial runners. See if you can't "convince" one of those innkeepers to help you. One way or another, get me those documents.
Talos guide you.

plots: "Orders" is addressed toward the player: the player is an Eliminator
the player should not share the contents of this message with anyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, including Ocheeva, and make no mention of their journey to Fort Farragut
Fort Farragut is guarded by rotting sentinels who will attack any interlopers on sight
title: A Prelude to the End
objective: put a stop to the unseen powers that are unraveling the very fabric of the Dark Brotherhood
tasks: discuss your special assignment with Lucien Lachance
description:
Orders
by Lucien Lachance

Eliminator,
You have served the Dark Brotherhood well in the short time you have been with us. Indeed, the rate of your advancement has been rather remarkable. Now the Black Hand itself is in need of your abilities.
You must proceed with all haste to my private refuge in the ruins of Fort Farragut, located in the forest northeast of the Cheydinhal Sanctuary. When you arrive, we will discuss the nature of your special assignment.
I cannot stress to you enough the importance of your swift arrival at Fort Farragut. There are unseen powers working to unravel the very fabric of the Dark Brotherhood. The Black Hand is counting on you to prevent this disaster.
Do not share the contents of this message with anyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, including Ocheeva, and make no mention of your journey to Fort Farragut! Also, be warned -- my refuge within Fort Farragut is guarded by denizens who will attack any interloper on sight. Get through these rotting sentinels and you will surely have earned the right to visit my private sanctum.
Lucien Lachance

plots: the player killed the skin dancers that attacked Raissa
the skin dancers turned Raissa into a skin dancer: they peeled her skin from her bones and one of them put Raissa's skin on like a coat
Raissa took her skin back
a spell of restoration can cure Raissa
title: Heal Raissa's Skin Dancer Condition
objective: cure Raissa
tasks: talk to the temple superior about a restoration spell
description:
Y-you... you killed those monsters? It was so... horrible! They turned me, Raissa, into one of them: a skin dancer. Peeled my skin from m-my bones and... and now I've put it back! They turned me into one of them. He took my skin like it was some kind of coat and put it on. He told me that now I was a skin dancer too.
I... I cannot go anywhere like this! I can feel that magic, that evil, growing inside of me! Please, my noble savior... help me! Wh-when he was... taking my skin, the skin walker said the only way to stop the process was a spell of restoration. B-but he laughed, saying I would never receive it.
If... if you could find that spell, could you not cast it upon me? Maybe... maybe the temple superior at the Waukeenar Temple would have something!
I have no coin. I know such magic is very expensive... but if you could find it in your heart to save me, I would be eternally grateful!

plots: blindness is abhorrent to Helm
the Cult of the Eyeless is hiding in the sewers: the player must infiltrate the sewers and find a hidden passage leading to the Cult of the Eyeless
title: Investigate the Cult of the Eyeless
objective: investigate the Cult of the Eyeless
description:
The task I ask will be treacherous, but you seem capable. Serve well, and you will be rewarded. Display any treachery, and it will be seen. Now to the task.
A cult of the eyeless has emerged: He of the Unsleeping Eyes must know of this cult. The blindness they promote is abhorrent to Helm. We ask you to investigate and identify the cult.
The Vigilant One informs us that the cult is underground and close, but we cannot see past the sewers. You must infiltrate it, as friend or conqueror. You must suffer the filth of the sewers to find the filth of the cult. They are not hiding amidst the pipes, so there must be a passage leading further away.
Our resources are thin at the moment, but an ally of Helm and servant of Torm is awaiting you in the sewers now. Seek Keldorn to serve with you. Faith guide you both.

plots: NONE
title: Hunt the Hunter
objective: assassinate Anoriath
description:
There's Anoriath, a Wood Elf, who owns a market stall in the city of Whiterun.
He may run a stall in the city, but he retreats to the plains outside Whiterun to hunt. Kill him there, and no one will bear witness...
The hunter shall come to know the fear of the hunted, hmm? And I shall have your payment waiting for you, my friend.

plots: Dagail hears voices without her amulet
title: Voices Without Bodies
objective: help Dagail to find her amulet
description:
You seek wisdom from me, child? Ah, no. You seek words of recommendation. Words are... difficult. They come and go. The voices, though. So loud they are, they drown out the words. Without my amulet, my stone to lock the voices away, the words will never come and stay. Would you lift your hands to help another, to help me find the words?
Seek Agata, child. She will see the path, and set you on it. She may be young, but her heart is old and wise. It guides her well through these troubled times.
I must rest.

plots: Svidi found out that Sibbi Black-Briar had an affair and told Wulfur about it
Wulfur attacked Sibbi Black-Briar: Sibbi Black-Briar killed Wulfur and was arrested for Wulfur's murder
Sibbi Black-Briar has to stay in jail for 8 months
title: The Lover's Requital
objective: help Sibbi Black-Briar in his plans to kill Svidi
description:
Look, we all have our flaws; mine is that women can't get enough of me. So I had this little affair going on while I was betrothed to a beautiful girl named Svidi. Well, she finds out and she tells her brother, Wulfur. Then her brother attacks me with a knife... I mean, I had to defend myself!
So I got arrested for his murder. And now I have to stare at these bars for eight months. Can you believe it? I was about to let that wench Svidi marry into the richest family in Riften, and this is how she repays me. I'd do anything to have that whore's head on a platter. All I need to know is where she is.
Find her and I promise you'll be well compensated. Svidi was a young woman... buxom, with long flowing black hair. She used to sing the most lovely songs to me when we were courting. I've never heard a voice so beautiful.
All that talent will go to waste when I'm finished with her.

plots: the player is meeting Aran Linvail for the first time
Aran Linvail's shipments and employees are disappearing on the docks
title: Shipment Shenanigans
objective: guard Aran Linvail's shipments, and report to him if anything happens
description:
Welcome to this place. I've looked forward to seeing you. I am, as you know, Aran Linvail.
Strange things are afoot on the docks. Shipments are disappearing, as are my employees with them. We are significantly weakened by this. I think it unlikely you would be captured or wooed to the enemy. If you go to the docks and bolster the guard on the shipments, it will strengthen our position.
Go at night, and you will find my present guard captain there already, a woman by the name of Mook. Take note of anything odd that happens.
Good hunting. Report to me if anything happens. Oh, and the reward I have set aside for you... I'll let you have some magical items. You will find them useful, I am sure.

BG2101: in this area, atop a holy altar

plots: Gaal will gives the player a key to the inner chambers
the door to the inner chambers is located a short distance back the way the player came, at the sewer passages
title: Serve the One God
objective: retrieve an item for the One God
tasks: venture below, and retrieve the item
description:
I am Gaal, high priest of the One God.
There is... something that you could do that the great one cannot, despite his vast power.
The Unseeing Eye knows of a valuable item in this area.
The item is a rod... or part of a rod, rather, that you will find atop a holy altar. I cannot tell you more than that. You must let your faith guide you.
If you were to venture below, you could prove your worth by retrieving this artifact for him. Do this, and I will allow you into our ranks and the One's divine presence.
I have a key I can give you... This will allow you entrance to the inner chambers through a door a short distance back the way you came, at the sewer passages.

TESO294: a Guild Hall of the Mages Guild
TESO295: a Guild Hall of the Mages Guild

plots: NONE
title: A Missing Mage
objective: find Erthor
description:
My research occupies nearly all of my time.
Now that I think about it, I do have a small problem concerning Erthor. He's one of the guild mages here. Think you can do something about it?
I just don't have the time to search for him again, but I do need to consult him about some notes he borrowed. You might want to ask around the Guild Hall, and see if anyone can be of some help. Let me know when he's back, and you'll have your recommendation.

plots: NONE
title: Endless Adventure
objective: navigate to all sorts of places from the Mapworks
description: The legendary Mapworks is operational once more! From the Mapworks, you can navigate to all sorts of wondrous places! Many fine adventures surely await you within.

plots: the bandits are working for someone
title: Vai's Bounty Upon Bandits
objective: find out why the bandit raids have been getting worse
description:
I am Officer Vai of the Flaming Fist and, to be honest, I could use your help.
The bandit raids have been getting worse. I used to think that they were just your usual brigands out to make a quick buck in troubled times, but not anymore. They're working for someone... Damn it, this is a fine mess, isn't it?
I'll pay 50 gold pieces for every bandit scalp you can bring me — and spread the news. I want this whole region cleared, and I want to know what in the Nine Hells is going on here.

plots: the player has found Peryite's shrine that is filled with Peryite's paralyzed followers: Peryite's worshipers cast a spell in the hopes of summoning Peryite and got trapped between worlds
Peryite will transport the player to the plane of Oblivion in which his worshipers are trapped: when the player has collected the worshipers' souls, Peryite will return the player here
title: Peryite's Foolish Followers
objective: rescue the souls of Peryite's worshipers from Oblivion
tasks: enter the plane of Oblivion where Peryite's worshipers' souls are trapped
description:
This one moves! A welcome change. So, mortal, you have found my shrine, and you have seen my followers. They are an embarrassment to me, Peryite.
The fools cast a spell in the hopes of summoning me to them. It was prideful and foolish, and it has had its consequences. My followers are trapped between worlds; their bodies here on this plane, their souls in Oblivion. I would have you reunite the bodies and the souls.
I will transport you to the plane of Oblivion in which they are trapped. Find their souls. When all are collected, I will return you here.
You shall have Spell Breaker, with my blessing. May it bring you order.

plots: Marek has poisoned the player: the player has 10 days to live
Lothander wants to help the player get an antidote to the poison
Lothander was forced to work for the Iron Throne with a geas
title: Marek and Lothander
objective: get an antidote before you die of Marek's poison
tasks: talk to Haspur who can possibly reverse Lothander's geas
description:
I am Lothander.
I do not wish you harm. My partner, Marek, has poisoned you. While you slept, he slipped a slow-acting magical poison into your food. You have about ten days to live. Common priest spells won't help you. Only one thing can, and that's the antidote. I can help you find it, if you help me first.
My problem is this: I don't work for the Iron Throne because I wish to but rather because I have been forced. I have been enspelled with a geas. If I do not obey everything that Marek orders of me the spell will take effect and I shall waste away. I need a way to rid myself of the spell. I know of a diviner at the market square who may have the answers I seek, but I don't have the money to pay him. Will you help me?

plots: the player taught Captain Burd and his guardsmen how to close Oblivion Gates: however, they cannot defend Bruma alone from the innumerable Daedra of Oblivion
title: Allies for Bruma
objective: bring in reinforcements for Bruma from the other cities of Cyrodiil and the Elder Council before the Mythic Dawn opens a Great Oblivion Gate in Bruma
tasks: speak to the leaders of the other cities of Cyrodiil and the Elder Council and ask them to send help to Bruma
description:
Good work. Captain Burd and his guardsmen should be able to handle any additional Gates, at least for now. But the Bruma Guard cannot defend the city indefinitely. The Daedra of Oblivion are innumerable; the guardsmen of Bruma are not.
We need to gather what allies we can before Bruma is hopelessly besieged. If the Mythic Dawn manages to open a Great Gate here, the city will need a stronger garrison for there to be any hope of defending it.
You should speak to the rulers of the other cities of Cyrodiil, as well as the Elder Council. Ask them to send aid to Bruma before it is too late.

BG226: the entrance to the large orange building
BG227: large orange building, in the southwest part of the Docks District
the entrance to the large orange building
BG228: the entrance to the large orange building
BG229: the entrance to the large orange building

plots: Renfeld has friends nearby in a large orange building
Rylock is guarding the entrance to the large orange building
title: Bring the Poisoned Man to his Friends
objective: save Renfeld from dying of poison
description:
My... my name is Renfeld...
*groan*
I have been poisoned...
I beg you to take me to... friends...
they have a building not far away from here... please, I beg you! It is a large building...
a large orange building in the southwest part of the Docks District.
There will be a man guarding the door... his name is Rylock. Please, take me to him...
I... I have nothing to offer you... aside from my gratitude and those of my friends.
Please... I do not have much time...

plots: Farwil entered the Oblivion Gate with six other Knights of Thorn: Count Indarys posted guards around the Oblivion Gate
Farwil formed the Knights of the Thorn two years ago
title: The Wayward Knight
objective: save Farwil from Oblivion, and close the Oblivion Gate
description:
About two days ago, Count Indarys's son, Farwil, entered the Oblivion Gate with six other men. We haven't heard from them since then. The Count fears the worst, and has posted guards here so we can watch and see if anyone comes back out. So far, nothing.
At this point, Count Indarys is offering a reward for the recovery of his son from inside the gate... or confirmed news of his demise. If you find him or the rest of the Knights of the Thorn, get them out of there. I'm sure that the Count would also be pleased if the gate was closed.
The Knights of the Thorn are a bunch of rabble who fancy themselves true knights. Farwil formed the group around two years ago. They make grand boasts, and talk a good talk, but that's all they are. The real work goes to us, the City Guard. I hate to speak ill of them, as something horrible may have happened, but their own bravado got them into this mess.

plots: NONE
title: Bounty: Sturmbeorn!
objective: alleviate the threat of the Sturmbeorn
description:
BOUNTY!
The Sturmbeorn raiders are a threat to the Estherians and to the brave settlers of the Empire. Commander Vale is authorized to pay a reward to anyone who assists the Vanquisher Corps in ridding the Temple Steppes of these savage brutes.
This bounty shall be paid to anyone who slays 10 or more Sturmbeorn in the Temple Steppes.

plots: NONE
title: The Mastermind
objective: infiltrate the Thalmor Embassy, and find out who's behind the dragons
tasks: meet Delphine to talk about her plan to get inside the Thalmor Embassy
description:
The first thing we need to do is figure out who's behind the dragons. The Thalmor are our best lead. If they aren't involved, they'll know who is.
If we could get into the Thalmor Embassy... it's the center of their operations in Skyrim... Problem is, that place is locked up tighter than a miser's purse. They could teach me a few things about paranoia...
I have a few ideas about getting inside the Embassy, but I'll need some time to pull things together... Meet me back in Riverwood. If I'm not back when you get there, wait for me. I shouldn't be long.
Keep an eye on the sky. This is only going to get worse.

plots: Montaron was captured by Harpers
title: Find Out What Happened to Montaron
objective: return to Xzar after you have found Montaron
description:
My friend Montaron has been taken captive by those irksome Harpers. I would have you enter their building and find Monty for me. Short... halfling... thief... even one of your intellectual capacity can't miss him.
Go to their building and return once you have found him.

plots: Water's Edge is marked on the player's map
title: Amelion's Contract
objective: retrieve something from Biene Amelion's ancestral tomb for her
tasks: talk to Biene Amelion about her contract
description:
I've got another contract for you, meat. I assume you won't embarrass yourself.
It's from Biene Amelion at the Water's Edge settlement. She needs something retrieved from her ancestral tomb. You'll find her at the Water's Edge settlement. It's marked on your map.
Try not to muck it up.

plots: NONE
title: Dragon Research
objective: help Esbern complete his research on dragons
tasks: bring Esbern dragon scales and bones
description:
I need to finish my research on dragons.
While you're out hunting dragons, keep a sharp eye open for any dragon scales and bones you might find. I'd be interested in looking at them.
Have you ever heard of the expression, "the scale of the lizard that bit you?" No, I guess not. Well, the principle applies here. I'll make you a potion, made from those dragon parts.

plots: the player has obtained artifacts for Umbacano before
Umbacano gives the player a sketch depicting the High Fane: the High Fane dates from the Late Ayleid Period, following the fall of White Gold Tower
the drawing on the bottom of the page Umbacano gave the player depicts a carved panel from the central chamber of the High Fane
Umbacano gives the player the key to the inner chamber of the High Fane
title: Nothing You Can Possess
objective: retrieve a decorative carving from the High Fane for Umbacano
tasks: locate the ruins of the High Fane
description:
You have proven yourself more than a simple grave robber. I believe you can handle a more complicated assignment. Are you interested?
Here, take a look at this sketch. The ancient texts refer to this site only as the "High Fane." Do you know it? Your first task is to locate the ruins of the High Fane. I believe it must now be known by a different name.
The High Fane dates from the Late Ayleid Period, following the fall of White Gold Tower, a very troubled time for that ancient people. A time I find most fascinating. The drawing on the bottom of the page I gave you depicts a carved panel from the central chamber of the High Fane. I believe this carving will shed new light on Ayleid history, if I am able to examine it closely. I would like you to retrieve it for me.
You will need this as well. It is the key to the inner chamber of the High Fane. I part with it reluctantly, so guard it well. It is what began my search for the High Fane, many years ago.

plots: the player is an Associate of the mages' guild
another Associate tossed the Ring of Burden down the locked well behind the guild hall
title: Falcar's Recommendation
objective: retrieve the Ring of Burden for Falcar
tasks: get the key to the locked well from Deetsan
description:
What is it, Associate? Don't tell me you're here for a recommendation from me.
There was a particular Ring of Burden I was testing some time ago. Another stupid Associate somehow got his hands on it, and managed to misplace it. If I didn't know better, I'd say he purposely tossed it down the well behind the guild hall. Why he would do such a thing is beyond me.
You will retrieve this ring for me. Should you manage to do so, I shall consider sending a recommendation to the Arcane University.
The well is locked, so you'll need the key. Deetsan should have a copy of it. Now get moving.

plots: NONE
title: Honor Thy Family
objective: regain the trust of your fellow Dark Brotherhood members
description:
You disrespected the Dark Brotherhood. And it'll cost you. You want back into the Family, you pay the price. 500 gold, and all is forgiven.
I suggest you "collect" it. Until you pay the fine, you are effectively cut off from all Dark Brotherhood duties and contracts.
No contracts. No rewards. No respect.

plots: NONE
title: Rescue from Fort Neugrad
objective: rescue Stormcloak soldiers from the Imperials, and capture Fort Neugrad
tasks: meet some fellow Stormcloaks, and find a way slip into Fort Neugrad
description:
You're going to Fort Neugrad. The Imperials have some of our boys locked up there. But with a little luck, we can turn that to our advantage.
I've sent some men to scout out the area. Meet them near Fort Neugrad, see if you can't find a way to slip in the fort, free our men, and take over the fort. They'll never suspect an attack from the inside. This won't be easy. But that's why I'm sending you.
You got the grit to get this done?

TESS58: in the center of the cistern room

plots: NONE
title: Under New Management
objective: become the guild master of the Thieves Guild
tasks: meet the members of the Thieves Guild
description:
Well, my friend... the time's come to make it official. It's time to become our Guild Master.
Don't worry, I promise this will be short and sweet. If you'll just meet us in the center of the cistern room, we can begin.

plots: rules for the fistfight: no weapons, no tricks, no magic
title: Bloody Nose
objective: win the wager against Hofgrir Horse-Crusher
tasks: match Hofgrir Horse-Crusher's bet, and beat him in a fistfight
description:
Bah, I'm not afraid of anything out here. Walls are just a weakling's hiding spot. Now me, I'm no weakling. In fact, I bet I've got the strongest arms in all of Skyrim.
You bet against me? Oh! Sounds like I've got a challenger. Tell you what. How about a friendly wager, just between us. I bet you my entire purse of septims I can beat you in a fistfight. You match the bet and we fight until one of us gives in.
All right, remember... this is a clean fight. No weapons, no tricks. And none of those fancy magic spells, either. Here we go!

plots: Onmund traded Enthir his amulet, but now Onmund wants his amulet back
title: Onmund's Request
objective: help Onmund get his amulet from Enthir
tasks: talk to Enthir about Onmund's amulet
description:
I need your help with something. Something private.
I may have entered into an... agreement with Enthir. He had something I needed, so I traded him something of mine.
It was a mistake, and now I want back what I gave him. It's an amulet that belonged to my family, and I never should've given it to Enthir. But he won't deal with me. Talk to him; see what it'll take to get my amulet back.

plots: the guests falsely believe that they cannot leave Summitmist Manor before finding a chest containing gold and the key to Summitmist Manor
the door to Summitmist Manor will be locked behind the player until the other guests are dead: the doorman will explain the rest
title: Whodunit?
objective: assassinate the other five guests at the party
description:
Do you like parties? Because you've been invited to one. Of course you'll be killing all the other guests. Each guest, at some point in the past, wronged their mysterious host. Now he's hired us to exact his revenge. Are you ready to attend?
You need to go to the city of Skingrad, to the large house known as Summitmist Manor. There you will meet up with five very unlucky guests. In order to receive your bonus, you must kill each guest secretly, one by one. If anyone sees you committing murder, the bonus is forfeit. The guests believe there is a chest of gold hidden in the house, and have agreed to be locked inside until one of them finds it. In fact, the guests believe the key to the manor is inside the chest, and only by satisfying their greed will they be allowed to leave. Poor fools. There is, of course, no chest of gold. The guests will find no key. After you arrive, the doors will be locked behind you, as everyone expects. When all the guests lie dead, you will be free to leave.
Now go, see the doorman at Summitmist Manor. He will explain the rest. Have fun.

plots: the player is a knight
the player's prayers have woken Pelinal Whitestrake from death
Umaril the Accursed found a way back to life
Pelinal Whitestrake's friends built a shrine upon Vanua: Pelinal Whitestrake can show the player where Vanua once stood
title: The Shrine of the Crusader
objective: seek Pelinal Whitestrake's Relics, and destroy Umaril the Accursed
tasks: visit the shrine of Pelinal Whitestrake
description:
Hail knight! I am Pelinal Whitestrake, whose Relics you seek with a worthy heart!
Your prayers have woken me from my endless dream. Or perhaps you have entered my dream, and I still sleep. I think others have sometimes spoken to me, others like you, but my memory is doubtful. Perhaps the others came after you. Your need must be great for the gods to allow us to speak. Has Umaril the Accursed found a way back? The foulest of a foul race. A thousand curses upon his unholy name!
I thought I'd won. But I should have known. The Slavemasters are a cunning breed. Umaril found a way to cheat death, as I could not. If you would seek for my Relics, I know little that can help you. All that has passed since my death is like mist that my mind cannot take hold of. My friends built a shrine upon the site of my death, Vanua, where the Ayleid Elves tormented me in a final act of revenge. I can show you where it once stood. Perhaps it is there still.
Fare thee well, sir knight. May the gods grant you to destroy Umaril utterly, as I failed to do.

plots: the player told Grisvar the Unlucky that they want protection
title: Shiv
objective: obtain a shiv from Grisvar the Unlucky
tasks: bring Duach's bottle of Skooma to Grisvar the Unlucky
description:
Ah, you want protection? I can get you what you need. Maybe you can do something for me, first?
Duach has a bottle of Skooma. Finest distilled Moon Sugar. I'm shaking just thinking about it.
Get that bottle of Skooma, and I'll have a shiv ready for you. Promise you won't ever use it on me, okay?

plots: Froki thinks that the Divines are impostor gods
Froki gives the player the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever: this will compel the guardian to appear when the player reaches the guardian's lair
title: Kyne's Sacred Trials
objective: participate in Kyne's Sacred Trials by hunting the guardian beasts blessed by Kyne
tasks: defeat the guardian wolf, crab and skeever and return to Froki
description:
The Divines are stolen idols! Impostor gods, sold by silver tongues. No thank you. Froki will not forget Kyne, or her Sacred Trials.
Kyne's Sacred Trials is an old tradition, a test to prove your worth in the eyes of Kyne. Show that you're a hunter and no simple butcher. Kyne teaches us to respect the beasts and blesses the hunter who will face their champions. True hunters are those who survive the Trials.
Do you think you're strong enough for Kyne's blessing? I would be glad to pass this tradition down. You must defeat guardian beasts, blessed by Kyne. I'll anoint you with the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever. This will compel the guardian to appear when you reach his lair.
Return when you've defeated the guardian wolf, crab and skeever.

plots: NONE
title: Ancestral Worship
objective: help Golldir save Agna, and stop Vals Veran from defiling Hillgrund's Tomb
tasks: meet Golldir inside Hillgrund's Tomb, and go after Vals Veran with Golldir
description:
Can you help me? There's a necromancer in the tomb; doing Gods know what with my dead relatives.
The necromancer's called Vals Veran. My family has never really seen eye to eye with him and he has finally gone off the deep end. He's gone in to defile our family tomb by using our ancestors for his filthy dark elf necromancy.
My aunt went in after him, but she hasn't come out yet and I'm afraid to go in by myself. I'm not proud of it. I'm terrified of that place and Aunt Agna knows it. My Da locked me in there in a drunken rage when he left us... three days in there eating the offerings left for our dead before Aunt Agna found me.
I'll unlock the door and meet you inside, then you can lead the way. We should get after Vals Veran before he does more damage here.

plots: the Ezrohir captured the Guardian of Mana again: they stripped away her magic and enslaved her
title: Artifice of Evil
objective: save the Guardian of Mana, and Zeryphesh
description:
The Ezrohir prepare today for war
Their legions number in the score.
Their Alchemy and Artifice suffice
To capture Mana... not once but twice.
Imprisoned in the Vaults Forsaken:
Subdued, enslaved, her magic taken.
Forced to lead their troops in battle
From Guardian... to so much chattel.
The Ezrohir have Mana enslaved
But there's still hope; she might yet be saved.
The enemy lie in this foul creche.
Save the Guardian... save Zeryphesh.
