plots: the player recently assumed the ownership of the sphere-like building: by all rights, the Cowled Wizards should have the sphere
the Cowled Wizards let the player operate as a wizard in the sphere if the player agrees to do tasks for them
title: Claiming the Sphere
objective: accept Teos' special deal
tasks: do tasks for the Cowled Wizards
description:
I am Teos, a Cowled Wizard, and I have been assigned to offer you... a special deal.
You just recently took this sphere, and by all rights we should have it, but my superiors said to offer an alternative. It would seem we have need of you.
That said, they would like to offer an exchange. You may operate in this awkwardly placed sphere if you agree to certain duties for the Cowled Wizards.
It is simple: You may have this place and act freely as a wizard. In exchange, you do the odd task for us, acting when we can't because of political or other reasons.

BG135: to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn
BG137: to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn

plots: Unshey had to bargain her new Girdle of Piercing for her life
title: A Rogue Ogre
objective: bring the Girdle of Piercing to Unshey
tasks: kill the ogre holding the Girdle of Piercing
description:
Hey, I'm Unshey, an aspiring writer.
Have you heard? There's a rogue ogre with a belt fetish to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn. I had to bargain my new girdle of piercing for my life out there. Wasn't even interested in an autographed copy of my book. Hey, if you can get that belt back to me, I'd be mighty grateful.
You'll get 95 gold pieces for your trouble, and a new history book I've just completed.

plots: NONE
title: Escaped Criminal
objective: hunt down an escaped criminal
description:
You're looking for work? It seems that law-breakers in the Pale have no desire to stay there. I don't blame them.
One of them's escaped, and you're going to find that coward. At this point they don't care what happens to him and neither do I. Best to just kill him and be done with it.
Be careful. This man is known to be dangerous.

plots: Melicamp of Beregost was turned into a chicken by a spell gone wrong
Melicamp of Beregost will nest in the player's pack
title: Melicamp the Chicken
objective: turn Melicamp of Beregost back into a human from a chicken
description:
Buc-becaw! HELLLLP-becaw! I am "no ordinary talking chicken," and I am in need of your *cluck* help. I am Melicamp of Beregost, a *cluck* mage adept in the mystical arts.
A... misread... incantation seems to be *cluck* the source of my troubling form. 'Tis been over a month since I *cluck* uttered a polymorph spell, and I simply cannot return to my normal *cluck* form!
There is a tower directly to the west of *cluck* Beregost, about which can be found the mage Thalantyr. I am his apprentice, and I am certain he will *cluck* aid me. I'll just nestle in your pack until we get there.

BG2104: Kalah's riddle, the poorest have it, the richest need it, but if either were to eat it, they would certainly perish
BG2105: Kalah's riddle, the poorest have it, the richest need it, but if either were to eat it, they would certainly perish

plots: Kalah won't allow the player to pass this bridge before the player answers Kalah's riddle
title: Solve Kalah's Riddle
objective: make Kalah allow you to pass this bridge
description:
Aha! I see a wayfarer has come to amuse Kalah! You must answer a riddle, naturally, ere I will allow you to pass this bridge.
Here's the riddle, my friend: The poorest have it, the richest need it, but if either were to eat it, they would certainly perish. Tell me what it is!

plots: the player asked Sorex Vinius who is in charge of Solitude
title: Sating the Steward's Thirst
objective: deliver a bottle of Stros M'Kai Rum to Falk Firebeard
description:
Jarl Elisif the Fair is in charge of solitude. Poor woman. Losing her husband and king like that. It was a dark day for us all.
Damn, that reminds me, I have a delivery to make to her steward, Falk Firebeard. He ordered a special bottle of Stros M'Kai Rum.
You could deliver it for me. Save me a lot of trouble. Here. Take it to the Blue Palace.

plots: Varulae sent the crew of Serpent's Wake to the Summerset Isle to retrieve Varulae's crystal ball: someone murdered the crew when they came back to Anvil
Varulae gives the player a key
title: The Ghost Ship of Anvil
objective: return the crystal ball to Varulae
tasks: get Varulae's crystal ball from a chest in the Serpent's Wake's hold
description:
This is a travesty. A complete and utter travesty. The crystal ball is just sitting there in the hold, but I'll be damned if I'm going back onboard. And nobody will help me. Nobody! Not with those spirits roaming the decks. I don't suppose you'll help me? No, of course you won't...
Wait... Did you actually say you'd help me? I've been going out of my mind ever since my crew was murdered! This is my ship, you see. The Serpent's Wake. I hired the crew to sail to Summerset Isle to retrieve a family heirloom, my mother's crystal ball. They made the journey, and arrived back all right, but then... Someone murdered them! All of them! Now their spirits are haunting the ship!
The crystal ball is in a chest in the ship's hold, but I can't get to it. I made it as far as the captain's cabin, but the spirits nearly killed me! Get the crystal ball and return it to me here, and I'll make it worth your trouble. Here, you'll need this key. Thank you so much!
There will be a reward waiting for you! It's the captain's enchanted cutlass. I managed to grab it when I was in his cabin, before his spirit chased me out!

plots: NONE
title: Feeding the Addiction
objective: convince Geldis to let Bralsa Drel drink at The Retching Netch
tasks: talk to Geldis about Bralsa Drel
description:
Doesn't everyone pity the hopeless? Look at me... I'm no better than a beggar.
I used to be a miner, a good one too. I made more gold digging up ore in a month than some people earn in a lifetime. When the mine dried up, I was lost. I have no other trade, so I spend my time drinking my fortune away at the Retching Netch... or I used to anyway.
That fetcher Geldis won't even allow me inside. Said I was bad for business. If I want to spend my last bag of coins getting drunk, that's my business. What does he care?
If you can get that stubborn mule to let me into the Netch, I'll make sure you get what's coming to you.

plots: the player agreed to meet Mercer Frey outside Snow Veil Sanctum
Mercer Frey found Karliah's horse and killed it
title: Speaking With Silence
objective: catch Karliah
description:
Good, you're finally here. I've scouted the ruins and I'm certain Karliah is still inside.
I did not find her in flesh. No, I found her horse. Don't worry, I've taken care of it... she won't be using it to escape. Let's get moving, I want to catch her inside while she's distracted. Take the lead.
Just make certain you keep your eyes open. Karliah is as sharp as a blade. The last thing I need is you blundering into a trap and warning her that we're here.

plots: NONE
title: Bullying Braith
objective: convince Braith to stop bullying Lars Battle-Born
description:
I'm having trouble. Braith bullies me all the time. All the elders think I'm a milk drinker 'cause I can't fight. Nobody understands.
If you can get Braith to leave me alone, I'll be your best friend... forever! I'll pay you, too! My whole life's savings - two septims!

TESS852: the passphrase to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary: "Silence, my brother."

plots: the player told Commander Maro that the player killed Astrid
title: Destroy the Dark Brotherhood!
objective: destroy the Dark Brotherhood
tasks: use "Silence, my brother." to enter the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary
description:
The leader of the Dark Brotherhood? You mean that woman Astrid? Dead? And this is no jest? Ha! This is a stroke of good fortune. Long have I watched the Dark Brotherhood's movements... waiting for the time to strike. That time is now!
My agents have recently acquired the passphrase to their Sanctuary. It is, "Silence, my brother." Every assassin in that hole must be put down! You, my friend. You've slain their leader. This honor should be yours. Do this, and you will be rewarded most handsomely!

plots: if the attackers have breached the inner courtyard of the de'Arnise Keep, they will be hard to rout
Nalia de'Arnise's father would not leave the de'Arnise Keep
title: The de'Arnise Keep Has Been Invaded
objective: defeat the attackers at the de'Arnise Keep
description:
I, Nalia de'Arnise, need a strong hand to help me. My land is under siege, and none of this rabble will aid me! And after all I've done for their kind, too! Please, can you assist me?
There is no time! I only hope that the attackers have not made it inside. If they have... if they have breached the inner courtyard, they will be hard to rout.
I will tell you what secrets I can. Perhaps you will be able to sneak in and attack from a more vulnerable spot. I hope Father is all right. He... would not leave.
Please, hurry to the de'Arnise Keep and find Daleson.

plots: the Night Mother spoke to the player

Vittoria Vici has Imperial connections, and her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks: their marriage is a step toward reconciliation between the Empire and the Stormcloaks, but a murder at the wedding will stall the peace process and send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire
title: Bound Until Death
objective: lure Titus Mede II to Skyrim so that the Dark Brotherhood can assassinate him
tasks: Go to Temple of the Divines.
assassinate Vittoria Vici at her own wedding
description:
Splendid. We're ready to begin. Or, more specifically, you're ready to begin. After all, you're the one the Night Mother spoke to.
Now then. I hope you have something nice to wear. Because you're going to a wedding. Well, more like the public reception. It should be a lovely affair. You'll mingle with the guests, eat some cake... stab the bride.
Oh yes. You've got to kill the bride. At her wedding. And they say romance is dead. Your target's name is Vittoria Vici. She oversees the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude. The wedding is being held in that city, at the Temple of the Divines. Her death will cause an uproar, which is exactly what we want.
Vittoria Vici is the first cousin to our dear Emperor, Titus Mede II. Vici has obvious Imperial connections. Her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks. Their union is a step toward reconciliation. So if there's a murder at the wedding... Not only will it stall the peace process - it will send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire. The Emperor's hand will be forced. He'll have to travel to Skyrim to deal with the aftermath... and he'll find the Dark Brotherhood waiting.
Vici is likely to address her guests frequently, as is the wedding custom. Kill her when she does that, and I promise you a significant bonus.
Now go. And give the city of Solitude a celebration they're not likely to forget.

plots: the player asked illusion training from Martina Floria
title: Illusion Training
objective: bring 10 Welkynd Stones to Martina Floria
description:
Martina Floria, Master Enchanter for the Mages Guild.
You wish to learn illusion spells? Hmm. A trade is in order, don't you think? My services in exchange for... oh, let's say ten Welkynd Stones. I'd say that's fair.
Let me know when you have them.

plots: a wizard split all citizens of Split into two people: one demented and other manic
Horkvir Bear-Arm cannot resolve the issue himself: there are rules and he does not want to end up on the Hill of Suicides
title: The Great Divide
objective: resolve the trouble of doubles
tasks: kill the demented citizens of Split
description:
Yes, I, Horkvir Bear-Arm, can take a moment to talk with you.
I'd get more work done if it weren't for my layabout double living in town. Terrible drain on productivity. Never know who's who. It's been a problem for too long.
A wizard did it. Stupid layabout mage. Had a theory about each of us having a Manic and Demented side. He decided to test the theory. Cast a spell. Split us all in two. Do we get twice the work done? No! Ridiculous. We're not allowed to take care of it either. There are rules. And I don't want to end up on the Hill of Suicides. You, on the other hand....
Get rid of that Demented bunch. Useless, anyway. Don't get a lick of work done around Split. If you get rid of them, I'll make it worth your while.

plots: Bjalfi the Contemptible snatched Rockshatter, and took off to join a local marauder gang at Fort Strand
title: When the Vow Breaks
objective: recover the Rockshatter for Maeva the Buxom
description:
Perhaps you can help me. I'm Maeva the Buxom. My husband's name is Bjalfi the Contemptible. My father said I was a fool to marry him, but I didn't listen. At our wedding, my father gave us a family heirloom as a gift; Rockshatter, a mace that's been in my family for many generations.
Bjalfi snatched Rockshatter from our mantle and took off to "find his fortune" with the local Marauder gang at Fort Strand. I want that mace back. Please, I don't think he's ever coming back, and I'd hate to lose such a precious heirloom to a gang of thugs.

plots: Aleron Loche wasted Ursanne and his hard earned money on bets: Aleron Loche wanted to move him and Ursanne to the Imperial City
Aleron Loche borrowed money from Kurdan gro-Dragol: Aleron Loche owes Kurdan gro-Dragol 500 gold
Aleron Loche did not return home after meeting Kurdan gro-Dragol at the Lonely Suitor Lodge yesterday
title: Caught in the Hunt
objective: find Aleron Loche
description:
I'm Ursanne. I'm sorry to impose upon you like this, but I'm in need of assistance, and I don't know what to do. My husband, Aleron, is missing.
It all started when Aleron became foolish, and started gambling. He'd visit the arena every week and spend our hard earned money on bets. I told him to stop, but he didn't listen. He was certain he could win us a fortune and move us somewhere nicer, like the Imperial City. It didn't take long for Aleron to begin losing. He resorted to borrowing money from a usurer to cover his losses and place new bets. As you can imagine, it didn't pay off. He ended up owing around 500 gold. We could never have that kind of money to pay back the usurer.
Yesterday, the usurer, Kurdan gro-Dragol, sent for my husband to meet him at the Lonely Suitor Lodge. He hasn't returned since. I fear for his life. Kurdan isn't known for his patience. Please, I'm not wealthy, but I'd give anything to see Aleron again. Please, find Aleron.
Farewell, and be careful, Kurdan is not to be trusted.

plots: NONE
title: Nadarin and the Basilisk
objective: kill a basilisk and return to Nadarin for your reward
description:
Hey, you! Are you either bored or foolish? Either way, I, Nadarin, could use your services.
Some wiseacre tried to send a basilisk by freight and now it's broken free and is making a mess of one of the warehouses at the harbor.
There'll be 500 gold pieces for taking care of that on such short notice. Also, you might want these. They're an item I obtained from a fence I know in a far-away city. You never know, they might fit you.

plots: when Brand-Shei was found by his Argonian father, Brand-Shei was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni
title: Distant Memories
objective: help Brand-Shei uncover his past
description:
I may be dark elf by birth, but I was raised Argonian. Through reasons I'm still trying to discover, I ended up orphaned then taken in by a kindly Argonian family in Black Marsh. I hope one day to find out what happened to me... how I ended up like that.
I know when I was found by my Argonian father, I was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni. It was one of the great houses in Morrowind long ago. Whether that means I was one of them or not, I'm uncertain.
If you come across anything in your travels that might provide me with the answers I'm looking for, I'd be grateful.

plots: every time the Red Mountain belches, more of Heart Stones land on Solstheim: the player may need to pick away at stone to pry the Heart Stone
title: Heart Stones
objective: bring a Heart Stone to Neloth
description:
I'm running low on Heart Stones. If you have any with you, I'll buy one. Otherwise, I can tell you where you might find one.
Every time the Red Mountain belches, more of them land here on Solstheim. Look around for impact craters, exposed rock, that sort of thing. You may need to pick away at it to pry the heart stone itself loose, but you look... strong.
Good luck.

TESS733: Lucan Valerius's shop in the town
TESS734: Lucan Valerius's shop in the town

plots: the golden dragon claw was stolen from Lucan Valerius' shop
title: The Golden Claw
objective: retrieve a golden dragon claw for Lucan Valerius
description:
We did have a bit of a... break-in. But we still have plenty to sell. Robbers were only after one thing. An ornament, solid gold. In the shape of a dragon's claw.
I've got some coin coming in from my last shipment. It's yours if you bring my claw back. If you're going after those thieves, you should head to Bleak Falls Barrow, northeast of town.

plots: the player asked mercantile training from Palonirya
title: Mercantile Training
objective: prove to Palonirya that you have enough capital to receive her expertise
description:
Training? Well, my dear, good business sense is just something that comes naturally to me. You've got to have the know-how, or else I can't teach you anything at all.
Do you have what it takes? Do you even know what it takes? Gold, that's what! Septims, and lots of them! Show me that you've got the starting capital, at least ten thousand in liquid assets.
Afterwards, I'll help you learn how to put it to good use.

plots: Muiri has performed the Black Sacrament
do whatever Muiri wishes, be professional, represent the Dark Brotherhood well, and get the job done
title: Mourning Never Comes
objective: assassinate an ex-lover for Muiri
tasks: speak with Muiri, set up the contract with her, and fulfill it
description:
Ah, there you are. We've got some business to discuss.
You must go to the city of Markarth, and speak with the apothecary's assistant. You'll probably find her in the shop, The Hag's Cure. The girl's been running her mouth, wants an ex-lover killed. She's apparently performed the Black Sacrament. Her name is Muiri. I need you to talk to her, set up the contract, and carry it out.
Just do whatever the contact wishes. Be professional, represent us well, and get the job done. Since it's your first contract, I'll let you keep whatever Muiri pays. She'll be generous, I'm sure. They always are.

plots: Dalton went on an adventure to Durlag's Tower
Dalton and his fellow adventurers bought a ward token from Galken
Dalton did not return from Durlag's Tower
title: Therella's Missing Son
objective: find out what happened to Dalton
description:
Greetings, adventurer. I have, or perhaps I should say had, a son named Dalton. He fell in with a crew of adventurers from Waterdeep. Dalton was always obsessed with the idea of being a hero.
Alas, he has neither the brains nor the ability. Such is a mother's lot in life, however, to watch her children perform acts of idiocy despite her warnings or concerns.
He and his thick-skulled cohorts took it upon themselves to plumb the depths of Durlag's Tower. They bought a ward token from that shyster, Galken, and made ready to leave. Though I begged and cried, Dalton still insisted on going. The band never returned. I fear that they were destroyed by the mad dwarf's machinations. That is the tale, sad but true.
Please find my son if he still lives.

plots: Dawnbringer Sain is supposed to acquire art for the temple of Lathander
title: Gain the services of Sir Sarles for the Temple of Lathander
objective: convince Sir Sarles to sculpt a statue for the temple of Lathander
description:
Greetings, I am known as Dawnbringer Sain, a priest of Lathander.
I am charged with the acquisition of art for the temple. The beauty of the dawn must be captured in every nook and cranny of Lathander's home.
Athkatla is blessed with the presence of perhaps the greatest sculptor of our age. The artist is known as Sir Sarles, and he is making an all too brief visit. We would be foolish not to seize upon the opportunity to have him work for us.
I would ask you to convince Sir Sarles that it would be best for him to work for us. Go to him now.
Sir Sarles is staying at the Jysstev estate. It is in the southeast section of the Government District.
Remember, you speak for Lathander in this matter.

plots: the Thalmor are also looking for Esbern
title: A Cornered Rat
objective: locate Esbern, and ask where he was on the 30th of Frostfall
tasks: talk to Brynjolf about finding Esbern
description:
We've got to find Esbern in Riften before the Thalmor do. He'll know how to stop the dragons if anybody does. You'd better get to Riften. Talk to Brynjolf. He's... well-connected. A good starting point at least.
Oh, and when you find Esbern... if you think I'm paranoid... you may have some trouble getting him to trust you. Just ask him where he was on the 30th of Frostfall. He'll know what it means.

plots: the player is meeting Arch-Mage Traven face-to-face for the first time
Raminus has told Arch-Mage Traven good things about the player: the player has advanced quickly, and shows great promise

the Council of Mages has been aware of the increased Necromancer activity in Cyrodiil for some time: Mucianus Allias was sent to infiltrate the ranks of the necromancers, but he stopped sending reports to the Council of Mages
the Council of Mages distrusts Mucianus Allias, unlike Arch-Mage Traven
title: Liberation or Apprehension?
objective: locate Mucianus Allias, and return him safely to the Arcane University
tasks: find Mucianus Allias before the battlemages of the Mages Guild apprehend him
description:
Greetings. It is high time that we met face to face, don't you think? Raminus has told me good things about you. You have advanced quickly, and show great promise. I now intend to put your talents to a more direct test.
I have a difficult task that you can, perhaps, assist with. Let me explain what is at stake. The Council of Mages has been aware of the increased Necromancer activity in Cyrodiil for some time. It had been our position to sit back and watch what unfolded, but that time has clearly passed. We cannot tolerate these attacks on the guild. Most of our information on Necromancers has come from an informant inside the cult itself, a guild member who offered to infiltrate their ranks.
Though the information he has provided is limited, it has given us a sense of their scope and power. The Council was initially reluctant to believe the information was reliable, but with recent events, they have little choice but to trust it. I fear that our informant is in danger, and that is why I have called you here.
The informant is a mage called Mucianus Allias. He is not a Council member, but has long served the guild here at the Arcane University. Aware in the growing interest in the guild after the band of Necromancy was put into place, he offered to help the Council track the cult's actions. With my blessing, he infiltrated the group, and has fed us information for quite some time, until recently. I have not heard from him, and I fear for his safety.
The lack of reports from Mucianus has disturbed the Council, and they are now concerned about the legitimacy of his information. A group of Battlemages were dispatched to Mucianus's last know location, with the intent on bringing him in for questioning. I argued against it, but eventually agreed to maintain order in the Council. I regret that decision, and that is why I wish to send you there. I fear the Battlemages may mistreat Mucianus, if they do not mistake him for one of the many Necromancers no doubt present in the ruins.
I wish for you to find Mucianus, and ensure his safe return to the Arcane University. I do not want anything to go wrong. Please, hurry. The Battlemages will arrive there soon, if they have not already, and time is of the essence. If for any reason they are unsuccessful, Mucianus' life will be forfeit. You must make sure he is safe. Go now, and bring word to me as soon as he has been escorted to safety. Mucianus last reported being sent to the ruins of Nenyond Twyll, south of the Imperial City. That is where the Battlemages went. South of the White Rose River, nearly halfway to the border of Elsweyr. I'm afraid I know nothing more about the location, or what you may expect to find once you arrive.

plots: NONE
title: A New Book to Read
objective: deliver "Olaf and the Dragon" to Giruad Gemane
tasks: find Giruad Gemane and ask for a tip
description:
I write drama, friend. The legends and history of the world made to excite and inspire.
Poor Giruad Gemane at the Bards College has been waiting for my latest work, "Olaf and the Dragon," for weeks now. Roads are a mess.
You'll deliver the book for me? You're sure? When you see Giruad, ask for a tip. I'm sure he'll be in a good mood after reading this.

TL269: the catacombs, where dark things live

plots: Jessa and her father came here to recover the Wraithring: they wanted to bring it to the Temple for study
Jessa's father wears a locket around his neck
title: The Wraithring
objective: discover Jessa's father's fate
description:
Please, traveler! Wait a moment! I am Jessa - a traveler from Estheria. My father and I came to this place to recover an ancient artifact - the Wraithring - which is said to have power over death itself. We sought to bring it to the Temple for study.
My father entered the catacombs while I tended our camp - but he has not returned, and there are dark things stirring below.
Please - I only ask that you discover his fate - perhaps he is wounded and only needs aid to escape!
If the worst comes to pass... he wears a locket around his neck, and you will know him by it.

plots: NONE
title: A Drink to Win
objective: win the drinking contest against Sam Guevenne
description:
You look like someone who can hold their liquor. How about a friendly contest to win a staff?
Ha! So you think that I don't have a chance against you. We'll see about that. This is a special brew, very strong stuff. Let's get started.

TESS308: volumes of Arondil's journals, necromantic ravings
TESS312: volumes of Arondil's journals, necromantic ravings

plots: Arondil used to live in Dawnstar: his house was burned down when his necromantic experiments became public knowledge
title: Toying With The Dead
objective: retrieve the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals for Vekel the Man
tasks: find the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals
description:
I have a buyer with a very odd taste in literature, looking for some particular books.
I'm told they're the ravings of a madman, a wizard named Arondil, and his peculiar cravings. It's said to be in four volumes and very hard to come by. My client is offering quite a reward for them, which I'd split with you.
Recently, a woman was found... naked and shivering along the road to Dawnstar. The only information the guard could get from her were tales of strange experiments and Arondil scribbling in his journals.
He used to have a home in Dawnstar until they burned it down. The people say he was doing unspeakable experiments on reanimation... rituals only a necromancer would perform. After he made for Yngvild, he was never heard from again.
In his later years, Arondil moved into some ice caves known as Yngvild. He preferred the solitude in which to perform his, um... experiments.

plots: Nurelion's assistant won't let Nurelion get the White Phial himself
Nurelion gives the player the alchemical mixture that is needed to reach Curalmil's resting place
title: The White Phial
objective: retrieve the White Phial for Nurelion
description:
I've finally derived the location of the White Phial, but my doting busybody of an assistant won't let me get it.
It's buried with its maker, Curalmil, in Forsaken Cave, a long forsaken cave to the west of here. Curalmil was a crafty one, even in death. You would need the skills of a master alchemist to reach his resting place.
Luckily for you, I've already made the required mixture. Here, take it. Please... don't dally. I've wasted enough time arguing with my useless assistant here.

plots: NONE
title: Under Saarthal
objective: look for anything interesting
tasks: locate enchanted artifacts for Arniel Gane
description:
We are looking for anything at all that might be of interest. That's why I adore Saarthal... we have no idea what we're going to find. And if, along the way, my message about the dangers of magic should happen to sink in for a few students, that would be a happy coincidence.
Hmm. Well, why don't you see if you can assist Arniel Gane? He's one of our scholars, here working on cataloging our finds.
I expect he'd appreciate some help in locating any additional magical artifacts here in the ruins. Any enchanted items will do; the usefulness of the enchantment is irrelevant. If you find anything, the class can look it over.

plots: Torkild may have become a werebear: a bear-like cursed creature
title: Filial Bonds
objective: find Torkild
tasks: see if Torkild is with the werebears of the glacier
description:
In days past, my brother Torkild and I would share the hunt, but that was... long ago.
Torkild had a wild gleam in his eye, more than most. In my darkest times, I fear he fell in among the werebears of the glacier.
Werebears are twisted, cursed beasts. True bears are noble and great creatures of the wild. I've heard tell of men who, by curse or by heart's desire, become transformed into one of those vile things. It is a pitiable fate. And one that I fear has fallen to my brother.
If you happen to cross his path, be wary. He was a fierce warrior as a man. If he fell prey to his more bestial side, he could be deadly.

plots: Martin needs the blood of a Divine for the ritual to open the portal to Camoran's Paradise in addition to the first item, the blood of a Daedra
title: Blood of the Divines
objective: recover the blood of a Divine for Martin
tasks: talk to Jauffre about obtaining the blood of Tiber Septim
description:
I've figured out another item needed for the ritual to open the portal to Camoran's Paradise. The second item is the counterpart to the first: the blood of a Divine.
This was a terrible puzzle to me. Unlike the Daedra, the gods have no artifacts, and do not physically manifest themselves in our world.
How then to obtain the blood of a god? But Jauffre solved it. The blood of Tiber Septim himself, who became one of the Divines. This is a secret remembered only by the Blades, passed down from one Grandmaster to the next.
Jauffre should tell it to you himself.

plots: Isran will address the player's fellow Dawnguard members before leaving for Castle Volkihar: the Dawnguard has gained the upper hand in the fight against the vampires
title: Judgment
objective: destroy Harkon
tasks: meet up with Isran and the rest of your Dawnguard allies
description:
The day hasn't been won while the vampire Harkon still walks Tamriel.
Let me address the Dawnguard, and then we'll be off. The men deserve to know that we've finally gained the upper hand. It's time we take the fight to their door.
Gather your things and rest well, my friend. We meet outside Castle Volkihar.

plots: Thorley Aethelred built a fence around his sheep: it did not help with his bear problem
title: Bear Season
objective: bring the fangs of the 6 West Weald Bears as proof to Thorley Aethelred
tasks: kill 6 West Weald Bears to protect Thorley Aethelred's flock of sheep
description:
It seems I'm having a bear problem and I just don't know what to do.
I've had attacks on my small flock of sheep lately. I was hoping that building a fence would solve the problem, but it hasn't helped at all. Then, one day when I was just about to step outside, I saw the culprits. A group of West Weald Bears was dragging away a sheep carcass. There's no way I can fight those ferocious beasts off on my own.
If you could thin the population a bit, they would probably leave the area. Kill six of the things, bring me their fangs as proof, and I'll reward you well.
Please, you're my only hope.

plots: Phlydia knows the player
title: Phlydia's Book
objective: bring "The History of Halruaa" back to Phlydia
description:
Oh, hello! It's me, Phlydia!
Have you seen my copy of "The History of Halruaa" anywhere? You know how I can't stand the constant shuffling of arthritic feet up in the library... So I thought I'd get a bit of fresh air just east of here and... Oh, I hate being so absent-minded! Please, if you find it, I really do need it back.
If you do, you can take this little gem of mine. Maybe a merchant will give you a little something for it.

plots: Ginia grew up in Brynnlaw, which used to be a pleasant town
pirates lead by Desharik invaded Brynnlaw
pirates drove people from their homes: Ginia's father tried to take their home back from the pirates but was executed
Desharik gave Ginia and Ason to Chremy for their father's actions
Calahan could take Ginia and Ason away from Brynnlaw, but Ginia and Ason can't pay him
title: Ginia's Tale
objective: talk to Calahan near the docks about taking Ginia and Ason
description:
I should begin with my name... Ginia. I grew up here in Brynnlaw.
Things have not always been like this. Brynnlaw was once a pleasant town, though my memories may be influenced by happier times in my own life.
Then the pirates arrived, led by the despot Desharik. Desharik had lost a war with another pirate king. Forced to this island, his ships invaded the town. They took our homes. Desharik killed our mayor and dumped his body into the sea. We were forced out into the streets.
My father could take no more injustice. He tried to get back into our house and was executed for breaking the law of the pirates. Once they've stolen something, the owner has no claim on it.
Desharik said that we would have to pay for our father's "crime." He gave us to Chremy, his lieutenant, as a reward for service. He put me to work as a courtesan for the drunken pirates. It's horrible, traveler! He says that he'll kill my brother Ason if I don't do it.
There is no escape for Ason and me. There is a smuggler who will take us, but we cannot afford to pay him. There is nowhere to run on this island.
Chremy can be found near the inn. The smuggler's name is Calahan. I hope that Calahan will take us with him when you kill Chremy. He will be near the docks. Please be careful!

BG1156: in the hills west of Beregost, close to the High Hedge
BG1158: in the hills west of Beregost, close to the High Hedge

plots: NONE
title: Perdue's Short Sword
objective: kill the gnoll who stole Perdue's short sword
description:
Hullo. The name's Perdue.
There's a gnoll 'oled up in the hills due west of 'ere, close to the High Hedge. Damn thievin' ball-o-fur stole my short sword two days back. The sword ain't worth the tin she's made from.
I'll give ya 75 gold pieces just to seal that yappin' mouth of 'is for good.

plots: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
Fjotli was robbed and murdered: Torsten Cruel-Sea tracked down the murderer, a member of the Summerset Shadows, and killed him
title: Summerset Shadows
objective: remove the Summerset Shadows from the picture, and return Torsten Cruel-Sea's silver locket to him
tasks: find information about the Summerset Shadows
description:
My daughter Fjotli... she was murdered a few months ago. Left her laying on the ground in a pool of her own blood. I assume they were after her valuables... she always wore far too much jewelry in public. When I told her it'd be the death of her, I never thought...
No need to explain, I'm well aware of your Guild's methods do not include killing. It took me weeks, but I finally tracked down the killer. A bloody Altmer at that. Can you imagine? Let's just say I'm a firm believer in an eye for an eye and leave it at that.
The killer fancied himself a thief in some sort of a new Guild forming around here. Gave me some valuable information before... well, you know. Well, I think we can help each other. You recover what I'm looking for and take out a rival Guild in the process. One of the pieces stolen from Fjotli was a silver locket, a Cruel-Sea family heirloom. I want it back.
The only name I have is Niranye. Has a house right here in Windhelm. That's where you should begin looking.

TESS7: an Ancestor Glade in Skyrim, in the pine forest

plots: the ritual of the Ancestor Moth: the player must remove the bark from a canticle tree with a draw knife to attract Ancestor Moths to them
title: Unseen Visions
objective: read "Blood"
tasks: perform the ritual of the Ancestor Moth to gain the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls
description:
Scattered across Tamriel are secluded locations known only as Ancestor Glades. There's one in Skyrim, in the Pine Forest.
Performing the Ritual of the Ancestor Moth within the glade should provide the answers you seek. It involves carefully removing the bark from a Canticle Tree which will in turn attract Ancestor Moths to you.
In keeping with tradition, you must use a specific tool in the Ancestor Glade, an implement known as a Draw Knife. Every Moth Priest is taught this ritual, but few ever get the chance to perform it... you should consider yourself fortunate if it works for you.
Once enough of the moths are following, they'll provide you with the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls. From what I saw in the vision, the Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals is the key to the prophecy.

TL2114: the temple, houses thousands of years of historical artifacts and documents, overrun by the Sturmbeorn

plots: NONE
title: Coming Out Ahead
objective: save the Bronze Head of Grunnheim from destruction by Sturmbeorn
tasks: recover the Bronze Head of Grunnheim
description:
We are relatively safe here, but the brutish Sturmbeorn will surely destroy everything that isn't made of gold! The temple is home to thousands of years of historical artifacts and documents, and it grieves me immeasurably to think of all of those treasures lost!
We were able to gather up some of the artifacts, as we fled, but the Bronze Head of Grunnheim was left behind! Please, find it! Some of its records are the only accounts we have of major historic events!

plots: the player and Higgold are in front of the player's playhouse
Higgold will look for actors and a play to put in production for a week: six weeks after that the playhouse will start producing coin
Higgold will send the player a message when he's ready to go
title: Running the Playhouse
objective: provide the investment to stage the play, and make important decisions about the play
tasks: wait for a message from Higgold
description:
Greetings, greetings, greetings! I am Higgold, director of fine theatricals, musicals, and other entertainments. Most recently from Calimport, where I needn't return quickly due to the sensitivity of one particular huzzah...
..but we needn't get into that. Now, let's see... yes, mm-hm... yes, this looks like a fine playhouse. I know a few actors that aren't working, but it'll take some time to find them, as well as a worthy play to put into production. A week for that, I think. About six weeks after that for rehearsing and then this playhouse of yours should start making decent coin, so long as all goes well.
Your part, my good friend, is to provide the investment to stage the play as well as make important decisions. You'll also reap the majority of the profits. I'll start looking for actors and a play right away. It shouldn't take more than half a week, and I'll send word as soon as I'm ready to go.

plots: Tsun judges which heroic souls are allowed to go to the Hall of Valor
the player pursues Alduin: Shor did not let the heroic, angry souls of Sovngarde to attack Alduin
title: Sovngarde
objective: go over the Whalebone Bridge to the Hall of Valor
description:
I am Tsun, shield-thane to Shor. The Whalebone Bridge he bade me guard and winnow all those souls whose heroic end sent them here, to Shor's lofty hall where welcome, well earned, awaits those I judge fit to join that fellowship of honor.
You pursue Alduin, the World Eater. A fateful errand. No few have chafed to face the Worm since first he set his soul-snare here at Sovngarde's threshold. But Shor restrained our wrathful onslaught - perhaps, deep counseled, your doom he foresaw.
Living or dead, by decree of Shor, none may pass this perilous bridge 'till I judge them worthy by the warrior's test.

plots: the player is a holy knight
Sir Roderic is dead: he was questing for the holy Relics at the Prophet's call with Lathon

Sir Roderic prayed at all the shrines, and received a disturbing vision featuring Sir Berich: Sir Berich had found the Greaves of the Crusader and the Sword of the Crusader, but had then turned to evil
Sir Roderic found the Relics and the wraith of Sir Berich within Sir Berich's tomb: Sir Roderic shouted for Lathon to take the Greaves of the Crusader
Lathon gives the player the Greaves of the Crusader
the wraith of Sir Berich attacked Sir Roderic with the Sword of the Crusader
title: The Sword of the Crusader
objective: avenge Sir Roderic, and recover the Sword of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: find the the wraith of Sir Berich
description:
Sir knight! I have terrible news. Sir Roderic... I think he's dead.
Sir Roderic was a holy knight, like you, questing for the Relics at the Prophet's call. I, Lathon, was his squire. I believed he was chosen by the gods to reclaim the Relics. At first things were going well. He prayed at all the shrines, and received a vision. A disturbing vision. "The shade of Sir Berich spoke to me," was all he said. "We must put him to rest." He said that Sir Berich's tomb was in Underpall Cave -- which is no cave, but some kind of buried keep.
He had learned that Sir Berich had once been a questing knight, like us. He had found the Greaves and Sword of the Crusader, but then turned to evil. Sir Roderic hoped to find the Relics within Sir Berich's tomb. And he did. But we also found a terrible guardian -- the wraith of Sir Berich.
I brought you... Sir Roderic shouted for me to take them... the Greaves of the Crusader. The holy Relic. They're yours. The wraith used the Sword of the Crusader against Sir Roderic. I don't know how that evil thing could use the holy weapon, but it did.
You must avenge Sir Roderic by killing the foul wraith and get yourself the Sword of the Crusader!

plots: the player asked Oengul War-Anvil whether he is the castle blacksmith
Oengul War-Anvil is working an a sword: the Jarl of Windhelm wants it to look like High Queen Freydis' sword
title: The Queen's Sword
objective: retrieve High Queen Freydis' sword for Oengul War-Anvil
description:
Of course I am the castle blacksmith. What do I look like, a tavern wench? Ah, don't let my words cut you too deep. I've just been working the forge too hard. Trying to set this sword right.
Jarl wants it to look like an ancient blade. High Queen Freydis ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, and her sword was legendary. Getting the real sword would be even better than making a copy, but no one wants to risk getting it from its resting place, Cronvangr Cave.
If you find that sword, traveler, I'd be grateful.

plots: Azzan only has one more contract for the player
title: The Stone of St. Alessia
objective: return the stolen Stone of St. Alessia to the Bruma Chapel
description:
I've only got one more thing on my plate for you, but it's an important one. The Stone of St. Alessia has been stolen from the Bruma Chapel.
I don't know if you're religious, but a lot of folks are, and the Stone is important. Talk to Cirroc in Bruma. He'll fill you in on the details.

plots: the player told Regulus Terentius that they are looking to buy a house in Bravil
Nilawen sells furnishings
title: Buying a house in Bravil
objective: purchase the house in Bravil
description:
Regulus Terentius, Count of Bravil. So you're looking for a house to buy here in Bravil? Really?
It just so happens there is a modest shack overlooking the canal. It's not much to look at, but the smell will soon make you forget how ugly it is. Pay me 4,000 gold, and it's all yours.
I'll have my steward register the deed of ownership. It's squalid little shack, I'm sorry to say. Oh, and the place is fairly bare. If I were you, I'd head on over to Nilawen at The Fair Deal and get some furnishings. Or you could always eat off the floor... doesn't matter to me.

plots: the player is the patron of the playhouse
Higgold and others are making progress in rehearsals, but strange things have been happening
actors believe there is a curse assailing them
title: The Curse?
objective: investigate the strange things that have occurred during the production of the play
tasks: talk to the person who has offered to help with the curse
description:
You... would not believe what has been occurring. We are finally making progress in rehearsals, and now... other things are happening... We've had props inexplicably fall from tables! A cistern broke and ruined an entire backdrop! An actress slipped yesterday and almost broke her foot! There's been other strange things, too... noises during the night, creakings and moanings. One of the stagers almost died falling out of the rafters!
All the actors are frightened; they believe the curse is assailing us, and I... am beginning to believe it too. Oh, what a fool I was to disregard it!
You are the patron of the playhouse... I need you to talk to someone who has offered to help.

plots: the player has summoned Sanguine
the Countess is hosting a dinner party
Sanguine gives the player a spell: the player should use it on the Countess and her guests to liven up the dinner party
the dinner party is invitation only
title: Sanguine, the Party Prince
objective: crash a dinner party at Castle Leyawiin and play a prank on the guests
tasks: find a way in to the dinner party
description:
Ah... another mortal come to beg Sanguine to add a bit of spice to an otherwise drab existence. I would have you perform a service for me.
The Castle Leyawiin is a dull, dreary place. The mistress is an especially somber soul, and tomorrow she will hold another excruciating dinner party. I want you to liven it up. Use this spell on the Countess and her guests. I think it will make the party much more interesting. You should probably try to be inconspicuous. Or they might kill you. Oh, and the party is by invitation only. You'll have to find a way in.
Have fun!

plots: NONE
title: It's All in the Taste
objective: spread the word about Geldis Sadri's new Sujamma
description:
The house specialty is the finest Sujamma to cross your lips, friend. My own personal formula that I call 'Sadri's Sujamma'.
In fact, I've just added some new ingredients to the mixture that I think makes it taste better than ever. All I need to do is get the word out that it's ready and they'll flock here for it.
Here, take these ten samples of the Sujamma and spread the word. If you get rid of all of them, there's something extra in it for you.

plots: NONE
title: Telrav's Request
objective: help Telrav
tasks: escort Telrav back to his camp nearby
description:
Bandits attacked and ransacked my cart. Can you help me?
My camp is nearby in the ruins of Nilheim. Get me there safely and you'll be rewarded.

plots: Erandur's necromantic studies got Erandur and Vangaril expelled from the Guild of Mages
Vangaril tried to get from the Guild of Mages after Erandur became a lich, but Vangaril was turned away: Vangaril went to face Erandur alone
title: Lich of Lost Boy Caverns
objective: follow the story of Vangaril trying to save Erandur from lichdom
tasks: explore the Lost Boy Caverns for more clues about the fate of Vangaril and Erandur
description:
Weathered Journal
by Vangaril

Long have I sought to purge the evils haunting Erandur. Even when his necromantic studies resulted in our mutual expulsion from the Guild of Mages, I persisted in guiding him towards good with a gentle hand. Alas, in our exile, my old friend has mired himself in the foul practice, and in shocking discovery I learned he had become a miserly disciple of the Worm King, a cunning wraith. A Lich.
Frail memory strengthened by dogmatic resolve, the Archmages turned me away when I came to them with my discovery. My pleas for a detachment of battlemages ignored, only my long-past expulsion remembered. And thus, the grave duty falls only to me. I must bear the burden of purging the Lich that was once a friend.
I wander now into the foreboding maw of these catacombs known as the Lost Boy Caverns, far from the climes of common elves and men. With pure spirit and rites of cleansing, I hope to strike down the fearsome Lich and set free the soul of Erandur, but I leave this testament behind, lest I may never return from these depths; as a warning to those who may follow my path.
Faithful, even in Exile,
Vangaril

plots: the player is one of Helm's chosen: a cleric of Helm
title: Work as a Cleric for the Temple of Helm
objective: hear questions from believers of Helm
tasks: reassure believers of Helm that duty is above all
description:
Greetings, I'm Acolyte Byron.
I will be your tutor in your duties here as one of Helm's chosen.
You have many things you are responsible for.
As a favored of Helm, you will hear questions from those that seek guidance in their duty. They merely needed to be reassured that duty is above all, and that reverence for such duty is the way to happiness.
You will steer them on the true path to Helm's grace.
You have the wisdom that has secured your position within the church.
You will dispense it to those that are needy.
This is a sacred trust that you are given. Do not disappoint.

plots: the gatekeeper won't let Farthing go and get her doll
title: Farthing's Dolly
objective: return Farthing's doll to her
description:
My name's Farthing. I'm only five. In a few years my papa will let me hunt. Are you allowed to hunt?
I've lost my dolly out in the woods. The gatekeeper won't let me go and get it. Can you get it for me?

plots: NONE
title: New Silence
objective: help Neloth with his silence experiment
tasks: let Neloth cast a new kind of silence spell on you
description:
You could help me with my research. I believe I've discovered a new form of silence. Some philosophers postulate seven orders of silence, but I believe there's an eighth.
If you allow me, I'd like to envelop you in the eighth form, to study the mental effects. If this works, I'll prepare a version that you can cast yourself, if you ever wish to inflict... er, study silence.

plots: the player has asked training from Alix Lencolia: the player is not well known
title: Blade Training
objective: become known as a hero or a villain
description:
Training? From me? I'm sorry, friend, but I have no idea who you are. Never heard of you. I'm afraid I don't offer training to just anyone. If you were famous, perhaps... or infamous, I suppose... that might count for something. But, alas, you're not.
Until I hear your name spoken by others, don't expect any training from me. When you're known as a hero or a villain, I might change my mind.

plots: NONE
title: A Fair Wage
objective: convince Torbjorn Shatter-Shield pay his Argonian dockhands fairly
description:
Torbjorn Shatter-Shield is giving me trouble. I wish someone would beat the coin out of his fat fists. He clings to every coin.
He says an Argonian's labor is only worth a tenth of a "proper Nord worker." My people are not slaves! You can try talking with him, but we've gotten nowhere talking to him ourselves.

plots: Rustleif runs the forge together with his wife Seren, who is a Redguard
Seren worries how she will pass along her traditions to Rustleif and her child
title: A Cultured Gift
objective: bring Rustleif "Night Falls on Sentinel"
description:
My wife Seren and I run the forge together. She still smiths even though we found out she is with child.
Our son or daughter isn't going to get much Redguard culture here in Skyrim. I know my wife worries how she will pass along her traditions.
Hey, if you find a book called "Night Falls on Sentinel", could you bring it to me? It's a story from my wife's people. Be good to have.
Don't know what the Redguards see in books, but it would make my Seren happy. Let me show you some tricks around the forge, when you return with the book.

plots: NONE
title: The Growing Rift
objective: see whether the Rift is closed; if not, close it
description:
Listen: If you're headed out to the Sundered Battlefield, there's something you should know. We were surveying out there, and discovered some kind of... hole, in thin air, in the pit mine we've been calling Gravedeep. The hole is very small, right now, but we could see things inside... powerful things, but horrible. Malign.
If you're going out there, see if you can find the hole. If we're lucky, it disappeared. But, if not, you should do your best to find a way to close it, before the things we saw get through!

plots: Feldepost hired some thugs to hurt Silke Rosena, because she did not perform at Feldepost's inn when she was supposed to
title: The Silke Dilemma
objective: become a bodyguard for Silke Rosena
description:
Hail, adventurers. I'm Garrick, and I work for Silke Rosena. She's the most skilled musician and actor along the Sword Coast. 
I have a proposal for you. How would you like a well-paying job as a bodyguard for my mistress? She's been having some problems of late. Some thugs have been hired by Feldepost to hurt her bad because she didn't perform at his inn when she was supposed to. You can't blame her for not showing up, what with a villain like Feldepost running the place.
Just meet me outside of the Red Sheaf Inn, if you are interested in the job.

BG2159: inn in the slums, The Copper something, one of the bedrooms in the back

plots: Llynis killed Wellyn and stole Littleman
title: Put the Spirit of the Child Wellyn to Rest
objective: return Littleman to Wellyn
description:
I... my name is Wellyn. I just want... I just want my stuffed bear back...
It's my favorite bear, Littleman... The bad man who came into our house... he—he hurt me, and he took Littleman with everything else... *sob* I can never go to sleep without Littleman! The bad man has it at that inn in the slums. The Copper something. *sniff* He's in one of those bedrooms in the back! I think his name is "Llynis"...
I've... I've gone to him... *sob*... I've tried to tell him that I just want my bear, please, but he just gets too frightened of me. *sob* Oh, please get it from him!

plots: Captain Wayfinder's mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house
Captain Wayfinder's sailors lost their last trade, Fine-Cut Void Salts from the College of Winterhold, after getting drunk
title: Salty Sea-Dogs
objective: bring Fine-Cut Void Salts back to Captain Wayfinder
description:
I am a sea captain by inheritance, as my men are fond of saying. Can't blame them, my mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house.
I've been trying to find new areas of business, trying to win the sailors' respect, but I keep having problems. Take the last trade we did. Some Fine-Cut Void Salts from the College of Winterhold. Plenty of coin if you know who to sell it to.
What happened to the Salts? Sailors are what happened to them. They got drunk and ended up losing the merchandise in some cave. If you're not afraid of little exploring, I'll pay good gold to get those Salts.

plots: the player asked Esbern what they need to learn Dragonrend
title: Elder Knowledge
objective: recover an Elder Scroll to learn Dragonrend
tasks: talk to the mages about finding an Elder Scroll
description:
Ah, you need an Elder Scroll. There's a pretty puzzle. Not the kind of thing you'll find in your local bookshop. Let me think...
Perhaps the College of Winterhold. What learning there is in Skyrim is gathered there. One of the mages there may be able to put you on the trail of this Elder Scroll.
This Elder Scroll might be able to show you the past in some way, and let you learn the Dragonrend shout.

plots: On the second floor of Baenlin's house is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace containing the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair: if the player loosens the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, the head will fall on Baenlin
title: Accidents Happen
objective: assassinate Baenlin by staging an accident
tasks: enter Baenlin's house secretly and avoid Gromm
description:
We need you to stage an... accident. Kill the target in the manner specified, and you'll receive a considerable bonus. The target is a Wood Elf named Baenlin. You will find him at his home in Bruma.
Enter secretly and avoid his manservant, Gromm. On the second floor is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace. Inside are the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair. Loosen the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, and the head will surely fall on Baenlin as he relaxes in his chair, as is custom. If Baenlin is killed in any other manner, or if the manservant Gromm is killed, you will forfeit the bonus.
Now go, and may Death be with you.

plots: Henantier and Kud-Ei were study-mates at the Arcane University
Henantier gets into trouble because of his careless experiments: Kud-Ei fears that Henantier has done this again
Henantier is trapped and there is no way Kud-Ei can free him
title: Through A Nightmare, Darkly
objective: help Kud-Ei save her friend Henantier
description:
Kud-Ei. I don't suppose you could help me locate my friend Henantier could you? If you find him, I'll be glad to offer you a sizable reward.
I miss Henantier so. We were study-mates at the Arcane University and we've come to grow fond of each other over the years. He's always getting himself into jams with the careless ways he performs his experiments, and well, I'm afraid he's done it again.
I'm going to level with you, as you seem like you wish to help. Henantier isn't missing. On the contrary, I know exactly where he is. The problem is he's trapped and there's no way I can free him.
Follow me. We aren't going far, so no need to prepare for a long journey. In fact, Henantier's still in town. More I can't say aloud without risk of others hearing.

plots: the player is Higgold's patron
Higgold has gathered together a play and a troupe of actors like he promised: the play is "The Sorcerer's Bane"
Higgold shall introduce the player both actresses and the rest of the actors
title: Who to Star
objective: choose who will play Karenina
tasks: choose between two female actresses who are desperate for the part of Karenina
description:
It is good to see you again, my patron. I have managed to gather together a play as well as a troupe of actors, as I promised.
They are a fine lot. I have worked with some, and they should serve well. As for the play, I have come across a translated copy of, uh, "The Sorcerer's Bane." You will like it, my patron. A grand epic about the pride of a great sorcerer and the love that is his downfall. Seldom performed, but well attended when it is.
The only problem I am having is deciding who will play Karenina, the lead female role. There are two actresses in the troupe who are desperate for the part. I know them both well and cannot decide, so I shall leave the choice to you. Here... I shall introduce you to both of them, as well as the rest of the actors.

plots: Ulfric has raised enough men to attack Whiterun, but Jarl Baalgruf refuses the Imperial Legion's support: the message should convince Jarl Baalgruf
title: A Decisive Message
objective: deliver a sensitive intelligence message for General Tullius
tasks: deliver the message to Jarl Baalgruf
description:
I need someone I can trust to deliver a message of great import to Jarl Baalgruf of Whiterun.
We have it on good authority that Ulfric has raised enough men to attack the city of Whiterun. The Jarl, however, refuses the Legion's support. This missive should convince him.
Be aware soldier, these documents contain sensitive intelligence for the Jarl's eyes only.

plots: Danno bought a love potion from Wallace at the market square: Danno gave Pala the love potion
Pala drank the love potion and collapsed
title: Save Pala
objective: save Pala from poisoning
description:
Oh, Mazzy! Thank the gods that I've found you! I've hurt Pala!
You have to save her! I didn't mean to do it. I bought a love potion from Wallace the peddler at the market square. I just wanted her to love me. She only had a sip of it, and she collapsed.
She is with your mother, Mazzy. How was I to know it was poison? Oh, please hurry! I will meet you in Trademeet.

plots: NONE
title: The Spiced Wine
objective: convince the East Empire Company to release Evette San's shipment of spices, and return back to Evette San for your reward
tasks: talk to Vittoria Vici about Evette San's shipment of spices
description:
Hello! I'm the spiced wine merchant Evette San. You wouldn't have a few minutes to run down to the docks would you?
I've got a shipment of spices the East Empire Company is holding up. I need someone to convince them to release it. The person handling shipments is called Vittoria Vici. You should try to talk to her about my shipment.
Get back to me when you're done and I'll give you something for your time. I swear it's a fight with them every shipment.

BG1263: Merchants' League Counting House, northeast section of Baldur's Gate, northeast from Elfsong Tavern

plots: The Merchants' League found Balduran's shipwreck on Balduran's Island
Mendas of Waterdeep wants to get Balduran's logbook before the merchants destroy it while they search for treasure
The Merchants' League keeps the sea charts locked up
Mendas of Waterdeep will give the player some gold to obtain the sea charts
title: The Reclusive Scholar
objective: travel to Balduran's Island to find Balduran's logbook for Mendas of Waterdeep
tasks: obtain the sea charts from the sea captain
description:
I am Mendas of Waterdeep, quester of small truth in this land. I am in need of favor from you. Can you help a gentle fellow in search for knowledge?
The Merchants' League sailors found Balduran's shipwreck on a small island. I wish to recover the ship's logbook. I will solve mystery of Balduran's final voyage. Merchants' League will destroy my artifacts to get treasure. This must not happen! If you help me, I get things precious to me, you get treasure, merchant men get nothing. You will help, yes?
These men that find island, they keep the sea charts locked up. In Baldur's Gate, there is building in northeast section of city called Merchants' League Counting House. To find it, just go northeast from Elfsong Tavern. The sea charts, they are in there. Most likely, captain of ship will have them. I don't know such things as chart retrieval, but you are hero, and it is no problem for heroes.
There might be small danger, so I give you some gold for the charts.

plots: the player met Coran in this wood
the mayor of Beregost hired Coran to hunt down a dragon with a barbed tail: Coran knows that dragons do not have barbed tails
title: Coran the Wyvern Hunter
objective: bring the wyvern's head to the mayor of Beregost
tasks: find the wyvern's nest with Coran and kill the wyvern
description:
It's refreshing to find other people in this wood. I am Coran, thief and archer!
I've been alone in the wilderness for far too long. I wouldn't mind returning to the big city, but I have yet to collect my bounty. I'd share the reward with the lot of you if you would help hasten the hunt.
The deal is this: I've been hired out by the mayor of Beregost to hunt down a great winged dragon that's been plaguing the caravan routes. He's offered 2,000 gold for its head. Now before you get cold feet, let me allay your fears. The only descriptions of the beast have always mentioned its deadly barbed tail. From what I know about dragons they don't have barbs on their tails — that's something unique to wyverns. So all we have to do is find this wyvern's nest and kill it. Our only worries are if it has friends over for dinner!
We shouldn't tarry any longer; let's collect the head of this soon-to-be-sorry wyvern.

plots: Roderick lies in eternal slumber, kept alive only by the daily administration of a powerful medicine
title: Bad Medicine
objective: assassinate Roderick without been seen by his company of loyal mercenaries
tasks: replace Roderick's medicine with a poisoned bottle Ocheeva gives you
description:
Far to the west there lives a fierce warlord and his company of loyal mercenaries. Your target is the warlord. Do you accept this contract?
Now listen closely. Nestled in the mountains to the west lies Fort Sutch. It is the home of the warlord Roderick and his mercenaries. Roderick has recently taken ill. He now lies in eternal slumber, kept alive only by the daily administration of a powerful medicine.
You must infiltrate Fort Sutch, find Roderick's medicine, and replace it with a poisoned bottle I will provide. But you must remain undetected! Whomever arranged this contract wants it to look like Roderick died from his illness, so discretion is essential. Attack no one! Be seen by no one! If you are detected, the poisoning will fail, and Roderick must be killed in some other manner. That will, of course, forfeit your bonus.
Roderick may lie near death, but dead he is not. Until his soul has passed, our client -- and the Grim Reaper himself -- will not be satisfied.

TESS178: a cave nearby, guarded by wolves

plots: NONE
title: Dragon's Breath Mead
objective: retrieve the Dragon's Breath Mead and give it to Olda
description:
My husband Horgeir promised me, swore on his ancestors, that he'd give up the mead. And what do I find out?
He's been stashing drink in a cave nearby. He even has some wolves guarding it. I swear, I should just cut out his tongue. That would be the end of it.
You could get Horgeir's stash for me, but I'll keep my dagger sharpened just in case. You can help yourself to any drink you find, but bring me the bottle of Dragon's Breath Mead. It's his favorite, so I know he has one there.

plots: NONE
title: Hunting the Monster
objective: destroy a vampire
tasks: visit the vampire's contact, and find out where the vampire is hiding
description:
I've learned of a possible vampire.
And while I do not know its exact whereabouts, I do have information suggesting someone who does.
Pay a visit to the beast's last known contact. Do what you must to find where it's hiding now.
Then root out the monster, and destroy it.

plots: NONE
title: Grimsever's Return
objective: recover Grimsever for Mjoll the Lioness
description:
My blade, the Grimsever, was lost years ago in a Dwemer ruin. Without it, I feel almost as defenseless as a newborn. I don't think I'll ever be able to find a replacement.
I was adventuring in the depths of the ruins when I was attacked by a massive construct... like nothing I had ever seen. When the colossus struck, Grimsever was knocked from my grasp and I was wounded badly. It was only through blind luck that I was able to crawl away from the Dwemer abomination and make my way to the surface.
I couldn't ask you to undertake such a treacherous journey, it would be a fool's errand. But I see that spark in your eye and I know better than to warn you away. Grimsever rests with the Dwemer ruin of Mzinchaleft. Tread carefully, friend... those same ruins almost took my life.

TESS914: an Ancestral Tomb beneath the Temple
TESS917: an Ancestral Tomb beneath the Temple

plots: Elder Othreloth gives the player a key that opens the door to the Ancestral Tomb
title: Clean Sweep
objective: cleanse the Ancestral Tomb
tasks: kill the ash spawn that defile the Ancestral Tomb
description:
The Ancestral Tombs are where we inter our dead. They are sacred places, meant to honor their passing. Sadly, we've been unable to use the Ancestral Tomb beneath the Temple as of late, and have resorted to other locations to scatter the remains.
Those foul vermin... the abominations we call ash spawn have risen from the ashes of our own ancestors. They're befouling the memories of our forefathers by defiling their remains.
Could you cleanse the tomb for us, wanderer? That would be most kind. Here, this key should open the door to the tomb.

plots: NONE
title: A Precious Horse
objective: save Arvak from Soul Cairn
description:
You must help me find my Arvak. He doesn't deserve to be in a place like this!
Arvak is my horse. We came to this horrible place together. We were attacked by monsters, so I told him to run.
Please, he's such a loyal creature, and he's been running for so long. You have to save him! A place like this will change you...
If you find him, I'll teach you how to call him to you. I'm sure he'd be much happier someplace sunnier.

plots: the Dwemer's greatest achievement has also been their greatest mystery: their instant, unexplainable disappearance
Arniel Gane tries to find out what happened to the Dwemer though experimentation
the player brought Arniel Gane Dwemer parts and a soul gem before
title: Thorough Cleaning
objective: purify a soul gem
tasks: place the soul gem in 3 Dwarven Convectors and heat them for 3 seconds with Arniel Gane's spell
description:
The Dwemer, they were uhh, masters of magic in a way we can't even begin to conceive of. Their greatest achievement, however, has also been their greatest, shall we say... mystery.
This mystery is their disappearance, of course! Instant, unexplainable. The stories have fascinated me... Ever since I was young, I wanted to know what really happened. After years and years of work, I'm closing in on a way to investigate what happened through experimentation.
Only now... Well, it's simply a disaster. Without boring you with the, ahh, details, I am attempting to re-create the circumstances of the event. I used the soul gem you brought me for this. The soul gem by itself isn't enough, you see. It needs to be altered, purified. The Dwemer had machines for this sort of thing. I attempted to build my own, based on designs and using parts you helped to provide. My very own Dwemer machine. It worked, but not fully. And the uhh... The device was destroyed in the process.
The designs for my Convector were based on real Dwemer machines, so there may still be some in existence. I'd go looking myself, but uhh... Yes, there are calculations to double- and triple-check. Many calculations. Perhaps you could seek out these Convectors in Skyrim ruins? I can even teach you the spell to heat them.
Just place the soul gem inside, and heat the Convector. At least three seconds. You'll almost certainly need to find multiple Convectors. I suspect it may be due to the nature of the soul gem versus the crystals this was intended for. Destroys the equipment in the process.
But, ahh... It's effective. Three times, and the crystal should be ready for the next step. Isn't this exciting?

plots: the player saved Tirdir from a grave
Tirdir was kidnapped: the 3 men who kidnapped Tirdir buried him alive in the grave
Tirdir tore off something from the shirt of the youngest man dressed in red
the gravekeeper might have spoken to the man dressed in red
title: Find the Kidnappers Who Buried Tirdir
objective: find the 3 men who buried Tirdir alive
tasks: talk to the gravekeeper about the man dressed in red
description:
Thank you for saving me! I'm Tirdir. I was buried by the men who kidnapped me!
*cough* They held me for ransom from my family, and after my family had paid, they knocked me out. I remember being carried here and thrown into that grave next to another body! And then they buried me alive! *cough*
I don't know their names. There were three of them. The youngest carried me here. He dressed all in red... strange and bright as you please.
I woke up with this in my hand. I think I must have torn it off his shirt when he threw me in the grave. Perhaps it will help you find him.
You must stop them! I beg of you! There was someone who spoke to this man. Perhaps the gravekeeper. You should talk to him at least... he must have seen something!

plots: the player is the Dragonborn
title: Alduin's Wall
objective: locate Alduin's Wall in Sky Haven Temple
tasks: find the entrance to Sky Haven Temple with Esbern
description:
Only a Dragonborn can stop Alduin and avert the end of the world!
But... I don't yet know how you can stop him. But Alduin's Wall does. I hope. It's in Sky Haven Temple, an ancient Blades sanctuary, hidden deep in the crags of the Reach.
Ah, yes. The entrance to Sky Haven Temple seems to be near what's now known as the Karthspire. We'll have to see what we find when we arrive there.
We should be careful. There's no telling what traps and wards the ancient Blades may have set.

plots: the information Modryn Oreyn got from the Argonian was valuable
the player will be on their own: they should steer clear of their fellow Fighters Guild members
title: Infiltration
objective: infiltrate the Blackwood Company, and find the secret of their success
description:
While the information we got from the Argonian was valuable, we need more. I want you to infiltrate them. See how they work from the inside.
I want you to get to Leyawiin and join the Blackwood Company. Find the secret of their success. You'll be on your own. Steer clear of me and all of your Fighters Guild brothers. It'll be rough going, but you can do it.
Good luck.

plots: Uriel Septim VII cannot go further
the player alone must stand against Mehrunes Dagon and his mortal servants: Mehrunes Dagon must not have the Amulet of Kings
title: The Voice of the Emperor
objective: find Uriel Septim VII's son and close shut the jaws of Oblivion
tasks: give the Amulet of Kings to Jauffre, and ask Jauffre about finding Uriel Septim VII's secret son
description:
I can go no further. You alone must stand against the Prince of Destruction and his mortal servants. He must not have the Amulet of Kings!
Take the Amulet. Give it to Jauffre. I have a secret son, and Jauffre alone knows where to find him.
Find my son, and close shut the jaws of Oblivion.

plots: the Jarl of Winterhold thinks that Malur Seloth has some connection with the College of Winterhold: he goes easy on Malur Seloth
title: Keeping Up the Appearances
objective: give Nelacar's mage's staff to Malur Seloth
tasks: steal Nelacar's mage's staff from his room
description:
I do nothing around here. And I hope to keep it that way. The Jarl is convinced I have some connection with the College, so he goes easy on me.
Maybe you'd like to help me keep up appearances? Old Nelacar has a mage's staff in his room in the Frozen Hearth. It'd be good to have that staff in case the Jarl starts wondering if I actually have a real connection to the College.
Pinch that staff for me. I'll be waiting for it. Once I have it, I'll show you a few tricks I've learned about buttering up royalty.

plots: the player has requested their first contract from Azzan
title: A Rat Problem
objective: take care of the rat problem, and return to Azzan
tasks: talk to Arvena Thelas about the rat problem in her house
description:
A contract for you? I, Azzan, think I've got something that suits your experience. Arvena Thelas has some problem with rats in her house.
As I said, rats. I'm sure she can explain it to you better than I. She lives here in Anvil. Go and talk to her.
Go take care of the rats. Then talk to me. Good luck!

plots: Count Hassildor of Skingrad contacted the Council of Mages: he has important information
Count Hassildor has asked for the player, specifically
title: Information at a Price
objective: receive vital information from Count Hassildor
description:
There is an urgent matter which requires your personal attention. This task falls to you, and only you.
Count Hassildor of Skingrad has contacted the Council. He claims to have information that is vital to us. He has requested that you personally travel to Skingrad to obtain this information. I cannot stress how important it is that our relationship with Hassildor be preserved. I expect you to visit him immediately.
I am unsure as to why he has requested that you, of all people, should be the one to visit him. I have no wish to put you in harm's way.
Please, travel there as soon as possible. The Count is waiting for you.

plots: NONE
title: A Job for Mead
objective: bring Siddgeir some Black-Briar Mead
description:
You're here for work? I demand tribute before you can be considered for any real tasks.
How about drink? None of that local piss. Real Black-Briar Mead, fresh from Riften.
You better bring me my mead. I hate people who waste my time.

plots: NONE
title: The Straw that Broke
objective: help Narfi get closure about Reyda
description:
Reyda was here, then gone. Went to gather plants and never came home... nope, nope. Everyone looked and no one could find her. Wilhelm said she'll be back... told Narfi not to worry... Reyda will come back.
With father I said goodbye... with mother I said goodbye. Reyda leaves and Narfi can't say goodbye. Makes Narfi very, very sad. Narfi needs Reyda to say goodbye.

plots: NONE
title: A Lovely Letter
objective: use a forged letter to resolve a love triangle between Faendal, Sven, and Camilla Valerius
tasks: take the forged letter to Camilla Valerius and say that it is from Sven
description:
Sven is a bard, so he says. Occasionally he finds time to do his job here at the mill. Thinks his ballads and sonnets are going to convince Camilla Valerius to marry him. As if she would say "yes".
An intelligent, beautiful woman like her wouldn't fall for that nonsense... I hope. I've been thinking... maybe Camilla needs a little help seeing Sven for what he is. Could you... could you give her this letter, and say it's from Sven? I think I've matched that Nord's lack of cleverness perfectly.
I would appreciate your help. You could take some gold I've saved up from working at the mill.

plots: NONE
title: Ghostly Justice
objective: avenge Larry
tasks: find Captain Stillheart, and kill him
description:
I was a villain, in my time. I broke into tombs and stole from the dead. But, one day, I realized how much pain I had caused those still living... and I swore it would stop.
My comrades... my accomplices... felt differently. They lured me out into these desolate sands and left me to die. My spirit has haunted this place ever since, bound here by the weight of my sins, hoping for vengeance. But they perished elsewhere, beyond my reach, even though they are now spirits as well. Seek their leader, Captain Stillheart, in Plunder Cove, and show him that justice can still find him!

plots: the player asked a recommendation from Carahil: the player is new to the Mages Guild
the Council of Mages has entrusted Carahil to take care of an issue of merchant killings along the Gold Road
a rogue mage is suspected of the merchant killings: the only link between the victims is the Brina Cross Inn
battlemages have been sent to the Brina Cross Inn
the player can learn Restoration while facing a life and death situation
title: Blood Money
objective: investigate a number of merchants' deaths along the Gold Road
tasks: speak with Arielle Jurard about further instructions
description:
So you are here for your recommendation? Unlike some frivolous tasks you may be given at other guild halls, this is a serious matter, and has consequences. Are you prepared?
