Allow me to explain the task. The Council of Mages has entrusted me with resolving a situation along the Gold Road. Several traveling merchants have been found dead along the Gold Road recently, with even more missing. The Council has asked that I put a stop to it. You are going to help me do so.
As you are new to the guild, you are less likely to be recognized as a member. This may give you an advantage in getting to the root of the problem. We believe the killings are the actions of a rogue mage. Battlemages have been sent to the Brina Cross Inn, the only common link between the victims.
You are to travel north to the Brina Cross Inn, and speak with Arielle Jurard. She will give you further instructions.
This is a harsh, dangerous task for you, I realize. Your unfamiliar face makes you most useful, however. And, what better way to learn the many uses of Restoration? Practical application is often the best educator. Even in life and death situations.

TL2149: crests, created by the Estherians, together form a map that shows the exact location of the Golden Gear

plots: the player saved Lord Taldimut and his Zeraphi envoy from goblins
Grand Regent Eldrayn allowed Lord Taldimut and his Zeraphi envoy to search for the Golden Gear
title: The Zeraphi Envoy
objective: help Lord Taldimut narrow down the location of the Golden Gear
tasks: find the 3 crests for Lord Taldimut
description:
My friend, thank you for coming to our aid. I am Lord Taldimut, the leader of this Zeraphi envoy, sent to procure the Estherians' aid in our upcoming war with the Ezrohir. Grand Regent Eldrayn gave us leave to search the Frosted Hills for the Golden Gear, and we had narrowed our search to these chilly hills before we were assaulted by these goblins.
Now we are too injured to continue our search. Can you aid us? The exact location of the Golden Gear is long forgotten, but the Estherians created a map from three crests. If you can find those, I can interpret the map and find the Gear! Search the Frosted Hills for the crests. Bring them to me, and I will reward you, on behalf of the Zeraphi people.

plots: Martin sent a messenger to High Chancellor Ocato while the player was killing Mankar Camoran
the Elder Council rules in the Emperor's absence: they should not object to crowning Martin the Emperor
title: Light the Dragonfires
objective: light the Dragonfires with Martin to close the Gates of Oblivion and stop Mehrunes Dagon's invasion
tasks: escort Martin to High Chancellor Ocato, who is waiting for you both
description:
While you were gone, I sent a messenger to High Chancellor Ocato. He waits for us in the Imperial City.
Chancellor Ocato is the head of the Elder Council. The Council rules in the Emperor's absence. I don't expect any objections from the Elder Council, but we should defer to their authority.
Let's go to the Imperial City at once, before the enemy can recover from Mankar Camoran's death. Until we light the Dragonfires, the Gates are open, and Mehrunes Dagon's invasion continues.

plots: the player just joined the Thieves Guild: the player should do as they're told and keep their blade clean to get their share of the loot
title: Meet the Family
objective: speak with some fellow members of the Thieves Guild and pick up your new armor
tasks: talk with Delvin Mallory and Vex and Tonilia for your armor
description:
Welcome to the family, kid. I'm expecting you to make us a lot of coin, so don't disappoint me.
This is how you get your cut of the spoils. Do as you're told and keep your blade clean. We can't turn a profit by killing.
You should talk with Delvin Mallory and Vex. They know their way around this place and they'll be able to kick some extra jobs your way.
Oh, and talk to Tonilia in the Flagon... she'll set you up with your new armor.

plots: the Clockwork Core can be restored with Ordrak's Heart
title: Into the Dark
objective: defeat the Alchemist and seize Ordrak's Heart before he destroys the Clockwork Core
tasks: overtake the Alchemist before he reaches the Clockwork Core
description:
You must overtake the Alchemist before he reaches the Clockwork Core. With the power of Ordrak's Heart, he could destroy the barrier between the worlds, which would mean the end of everything.
You must defeat the Alchemist and seize the Heart. He intends to use it for destruction, but, infused with the energy stolen from the Guardians, it now has the power to restore the Clockwork Core, and repair the damage to the barrier.

plots: Frida's husband died while searching for the Ring of Pure Mixtures
title: A Ring Worthy of Alchemists
objective: retrieve the Ring of Pure Mixtures for Frida
tasks: find the Ring of Pure Mixtures
description:
I'm Frida, the oldest woman in Dawnstar.
I picked up the herb trade from my husband. We used to go out in the wilds and collect ingredients together. He used to call me his "pretty Juniper." It's quite romantic, if you're an alchemist. Frost took the old fool a few seasons back, while he was looking for the Ring of Pure Mixtures.
I found the ring's resting place, Shrouded Grove, after he died, but I'm far too old to go exploring some cave, now. I'd be happy to give you some alchemy training in exchange for the ring, if you bring it to me.

plots: NONE
title: Protecting the Bloodline
objective: destroy a vampire before it turns its bandit allies into vampires
description:
A feral-blooded has holed up with a group of bandits. Likely wants to create a nest of broodlings.
We don't need competition for blood, and we don't want the mortals getting up in arms making things difficult for us. Go destroy the feral beast before this becomes a problem.

plots: Ulfric is addressing the player and the player's fellow Stormcloaks: the true sons and daughters of Skyrim
Sovngarde awaits those who die fighting
the gods will look down and see Skyrim as she was meant to be: full of Nords who are mighty, powerful, and free
title: A Crumbling Empire
objective: conquer Solitude, and free Skyrim from the Empire
tasks: fight your way to Castle Dour to cut the head off the Imperial legion itself
description:
This is it men! It's time to make this city ours!
We come to this moment carried by the sacrifices and the courage of our fellows. Those who have fallen. And those still bearing the shields to our right. On this day, our enemy will know the fullness of our determination, the true depth of our anger, and the exalted righteousness of our cause.
The gods are watching. The spirits of our ancestors are stirring. And the men under suns yet to dawn will be transformed by what we do here today. Fear neither pain, nor darkness. For Sovngarde awaits those who die with weapons in their hands, and courage in their hearts.
We now fight our way to Castle Dour to cut the head off the legion itself! And in that moment, the gods will look down and see Skyrim as she was meant to be. Full of Nords who are mighty, powerful, and free!
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the sons and daughters of Skyrim!

plots: the player told Vinicia Melissaeia that they want to buy a house in the Imperial City
Sergius Verus can sell the player some furnishings for the house
title: Shack for Sale
objective: purchase the house in the Imperial City
description:
Vinicia Melissaeia, Office of Imperial Commerce. You desire a house in the Imperial City?
Why? I mean... of course. All I have available right now is a hovel on the Waterfront. It's yours for mere 2,000 septims. You may give those septims to me.
You'll find the house in the Waterfront District. It's not much to look at. You may want to spruce it up a bit with some furnishings. I'd suggest talking to Sergius Verus at Three Brothers Trade Goods in the Market District.

plots: Vaermina has an awful hunger for people's memories: in return, she leaves behind nightmares
title: Waking Nightmare
objective: relieve the people of Dawnstar from Vaermina's damaging nightmares
tasks: return to Nightcaller Temple with Erandur, and help him end the nightmares
description:
The entire town is being plagued by horrible nightmares. They're in serious danger but I'm afraid there's little I can do about it.
These dreams are manifestations created by Vaermina. She has an awful hunger for our memories. In return, she leaves behind nightmares, not unlike a cough marks a serious illness. I must end her terrible influence over these people before the damage becomes permanent.
I need to return to the source of the problem, to Nightcaller Temple. Perhaps you'd be willing to assist me in that regard? I've already said too much. If anyone overhears what we're saying, it could start a panic. I would simply ask that you trust me and help me end Dawnstar's nightmares.
Nightcaller Temple is only a short walk from Dawnstar. Come, we must hurry.

BG22: in the cavern north of here
BG23: in the cavern north of here

plots: NONE
title: A Mage Imprisoned?
objective: free Vithal
description:
I would be careful in this place, if I were you. Many dangers around many corners. You will be lucky to live. No real secrets for those that travel here frequently.
A trespasser got his due from someone he crossed. Well, I suppose it did not end in death, but it was a mighty battle regardless. I do not know who the aggressor was, but I know who lost.
That person was a mage of power, I am sure, though not powerful enough in the end. A pity too. He seemed intent on unearthing an artifact of old or some such.
And his reward for his effort? Worse than death, even though he seemed willing to share. Imprisoned, magically confined in the cavern north of here. Pity.

plots: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
the player has the Skeleton Key: the player has done the Thieves Guild a great deed
title: Darkness Returns
objective: walk the Pilgrim's Path, and return the Skeleton Key to the Ebonmere
tasks: find and read the journal of the man who died attempting to walk the Pilgrim's Path
description:
The Key! You have the Skeleton Key! I never thought I'd see it again.
You've done the Guild a great deed. And although they may not show it, I'm certain they appreciate your sacrifices. My only regret is that you had to undertake this task alone.
Nothing would bring me more pride than to return the Key, but I'm afraid it's impossible. From the moment I arrived here, I've felt myself... well... dying.
I'm afraid you have return the Key alone. I'm weakening, and I can feel myself slipping away. The years without restoration of my power have taken their toll. Whatever damage has been caused can only be corrected by following the Pilgrim's Path to the Ebonmere and replacing the Key.
The only possible help I've come across are the remains of some poor fellow who was trying to follow in your footsteps. Perhaps his journal can help?

plots: Yamarz became weak: the giants sense Yamarz's weakness, and intrude on the orc clan's territory
Atub must petition Malacath for relief: the ritual must be done at the walled orc camp
title: The Cursed Tribe
objective: Help lift the curse placed on Yamarz
tasks: bring Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart to Atub
description:
Please, our tribe suffers and we need help.
Our Chief, Yamarz, was once a strong and proud warrior. Now he is stricken, cursed. He is weak, and so our tribe is weak. The giants sense this, and intrude on our territory. Now they assault our very home.
Yamarz refuses help, but I sense that you may be just what we need. He has demanded we stay inside the walls. We cannot leave. I must petition Malacath for relief. This curse must be lifted. But I cannot travel to Malacath's shrine. The ritual must be done here, and I do not have the materials I need.
I beg of you, can you bring me Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart? I have no wish to depend on a stranger, but I have no choice.

plots: Malene has seen undead of all types walking in the dark woods near the entrance to Moss Rock Cavern
title: The Gravefinder's Repose
objective: help Malene deal with Raelynn the Gravefinder
description:
Thank goodness someone that can help is here! I don't know how to make this request any simpler, but to put it bluntly, Raelynn the Gravefinder must die.
A few months ago, that witch of a Necromancer decided to inhabit Moss Rock Cavern just north of my inn. I don't know what she does in there; frankly, I don't want to know. However, I do know that after she arrived, the woods at night became unsafe.
I've seen undead of all types walking in the dark woods near the cave entrance. Now, this area's getting a bad reputation and my business has waned. Every day, it seems the number of undead increase.
If someone can get into the cave and kill Raelynn, maybe we can stem the tide. Her death pays a handsome bounty. I hope you'll take advantage of the opportunity. Raelynn will finally get what's coming to her.

plots: the player is an embodiment of Pelinal Whitestrake
Umaril the Unfeathered's Daedric nature allows his spirit to escape into Oblivion after death
title: Umaril the Unfeathered
objective: defeat Umaril the Unfeathered and kill him for good, in both the physical and spiritual planes
description:
Hear my final passings of praise and wisdom!
You have stepped from the humble shadows of obscurity and into legend. No feat you have accomplished in your life compares to what you have become. You are an embodiment of Pelinal Whitestrake, the bane of Umaril the Unfeathered.
The time has come for you to fulfill your destiny. Umaril lies hid in the ancient fane of Garlas Malatar. You must go there and destroy him. Umaril's Daedric nature allows his spirit to escape into Oblivion after death. This is what Pelinal learned upon defeating Umaril the first time. You must first kill his living body. While beyond the power of most mortals, this is only the lesser of your two tasks. It will allow you to follow Umaril into the spirit realm upon his death. It will allow you to destroy him, body and soul, utterly and for all time.

plots: Bellethe and Finnas are homesteaders with a small farm in the Frosted Hills: they went to get supplies from Estherian Enclave before winter
title: Little Lost Ones
objective: help Bellethe find Finnas and their precious animals
description:
Please, help me! Our dear little ones wandered into that cave! My husband Finnas ventured after them, but it is crawling with nasty creatures, and he hasn't returned!
My husband Finnas and I were on our way to the Estherian Enclave. We're homesteaders, with a small farm in the Frosted Hills. The weather is getting harsh, so we were making one last run for supplies before winter. Oh, I'm beside myself with worry! Please, find Finnas and our precious babies! You have to help us! You could have a special item as a token of our gratitude!

plots: the player is an Associate of the Mages Guild
the player has been found guilty of theft: the player's Mages Guild privileges have been suspended
title: Mages Guild Suspension
objective: collect alchemy samples to regain your Mages Guild membership
tasks: deliver 20 Dragon's Tongue and 20 Redwort to Raminus Polus
description:
It is unfortunate that we should meet under these circumstances, Associate. You have been found guilty of theft. As such, your guild privileges have been suspended. If you wish to be reinstated, you must perform a service for the guild. Are you willing to do so?
Make no mistake: this task is simple, but has a purpose. In selflessly serving the guild, at risk to yourself, while putting your own feelings aside, you prove your devotion to the cause. You will help replenish alchemical supplies for the guild.
Deliver 20 Dragon's Tongue flowers, and 20 Redwort flowers to me. Surprised? Annoyed? It is not unexpected. Nevertheless, that is your path to re-acceptance in the guild.

plots: the player asked Sinderion to train them
title: Alchemy Training
objective: bring a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad to Sinderion
tasks: find a bottle of Tamika's, and Surilie Brothers vintages of year 399
description:
Training? Oh, I'm afraid that's not my area of expertise. I'm very focused on wines right now, you see.
Wonderful thing, wine. It's all about the balance. The flavor, the bouquet, the consistency... just wonderful. I'm sorry, what? Training... right. I'll make you a deal: you fetch me a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad, and I'll think about it.
Both vineyards, Tamika's and Surilie Brothers. Vintage 399. Oh, what a good year that was...

plots: all citizens of Aleswell became invisible several weeks ago: the citizens of Aleswell think that Ancotar is behind their invisibility
there are invisible monsters in the ruins of Fort Caractacus
title: Zero Visibility
objective: help the citizens of Aleswell become visible again
tasks: Go to ruins of Fort Caractacus.
find Ancotar and make him remove the invisibility
description:
Excuse me. I'm innkeeper Diram Serethi. We have a small problem that we hope you can help us with.
You may be wondering why you can't see me. We are all wondering the same thing. Everyone in Aleswell suddenly became invisible several weeks ago. It was sort of fun at first, but the novelty has definitely worn off now. You can imagine how difficult it is to run an inn while invisible. Once you get a reputation as a haunted inn, you can just forget about it. So we've all been keeping quiet, hoping the spell will wear off. But we're running out of patience. We're sure it was Ancotar's doing, but we can't find him. If you can help us, we will be extremely grateful.
Ancotar's a wizard who took up residence in the ruins of Fort Caractacus a couple of years ago. He's caused us no end of trouble with his magical experiments, but nothing as bad as this. We've tried to find him, but had no luck. If he's still living in the fort, he's hiding from us, and no wonder. If you could find him and get him to remove this cursed invisibility, we will all be in your debt. The ruined fort is just to the southeast of here. Follow the path down the hill. But watch out for the invisible monsters that infest the ruins!
If you make us visible again, you'd be welcome at the Aleswell Inn anytime. Free of charge.

plots: the Shivering Isles lie through the door behind Haskill
Sheogorath seeks a mortal to act as his Champion
the Gatekeeper dislikes strangers to the Shivering Isles
title: Through the Fringe of Madness
objective: become Sheogorath's champion
tasks: get past the Gates of Madness
description:
I am Haskill, Chamberlain to the Lord Sheogorath.
You approach the Shivering Isles. Through the door behind me lies the realm of Sheogorath, Prince of Madness, Lord of the Never-There.
My Lord seeks a mortal to act as His Champion. Perhaps the Lord Sheogorath will find a use for you. You'll want to pass through the Gates of Madness. Oh, and mind the Gatekeeper. He dislikes strangers to the Realm.

plots: there is an iron shortage
title: Investigate the Nashkel Mines
objective: find out what caused miners to go missing and ore to become tainted
description:
I am Berrun Ghastkill, mayor of Nashkel.
I need someone to descend into the mines southeast of town and find what has caused our miners to go missing and our ore to become tainted. It won't solve everything, but it's the first step to easing the effects of the iron shortage.
The town can give you a reward of 900 gold pieces. We are a small community and that is all we can afford.
Please, go now and do what you can.

plots: NONE
title: Tolfdir the Absent-Minded
objective: help Tolfdir find his missing alembic
description:
This is rather embarrassing, but it seems I've misplaced something.
I can't find my Alembic. I need it for some research. I suppose I could use another one, but... well, it sounds silly, but mine has sentimental value.
If you happen to see it, would you mind bringing it to me?

plots: trouble began when Thoronir opened his store selling all kinds of merchandise undercutting the competition: Thoronir refuses to join the Society of Concerned Merchants or discuss the matter
title: Unfriendly Competition
objective: find proof about Thoronir's wrongdoing
tasks: investigate Thoronir's store to find out where he gets his inventory
description:
I think you may be just the kind of person we're looking for. Perhaps you can assist us with a problem we're having here in the Market District.
I'm the chairperson for the Society of Concerned Merchants. We formed this group a while back to keep a nice fair economic balance in town. Not every store is a member, but we're slowly trying to convince them to join. Everything was fine until Thoronir opened his shop nearby.
Selling all sorts of merchandise, Thoronir undercuts prices like you wouldn't believe. He doesn't always sell what we sell, but it is still a problem. People who buy tend to want to spend their money there. That leaves none for us. It's getting so bad, a few of us may have to close up shop. He outright refuses to join the Society or even discuss the matter. We are convinced he is up to no good.
What we need is for you to case his establishment, and figure out where he gets his inventory. Find some proof of his wrongdoing, and let us know. We cannot do it ourselves, as he recognizes all of us. The job pays a fair bounty in gold when he is brought to justice.

plots: the player told Jessa that her father is dead
title: The Locket
objective: bring the Locket to Jessa
description:
Oh, my poor father - I cannot believe that he is gone! Dear father...
Please try to retrieve the Locket - it belonged to my father. I cannot bear to think that it is lost in this foul place, corroding away in swamp water. He must have dropped it somewhere around here...

plots: NONE
title: Family Heirloom
objective: retrieve a stolen family heirloom from a group of wizards
description:
We have a bit of a sensitive matter this time. A wealthy family has... misplaced one of their heirlooms.
Of course, it's a group of wizards they're pointing their fingers at. Who knows what they want it for, but we want it back.
Move quickly so we can have this over and done with. These aren't the most glorious jobs, but they pay well.

plots: Jarl Elisif has forbidden the burning of King Olaf, a festival put on by the Bards College: to convince Jarl Elisif change her mind, Viarmo wants to read King Olaf's Verse
title: Tending the Flames
objective: become a member of the Bards College
description:
Welcome to the Bards College. I am Viarmo, the headmaster here.
Always a pleasure to meet a prospective bard. You should be aware that many apply but we accept very few people. When possible, we ask applicants to perform tasks the college needs completed. In this case, I do have a task befitting an aspiring bard...
Jarl Elisif has forbidden the Burning of King Olaf, a Festival put on by the Bards College. We need to change her mind. To convince her I want to read King Olaf's Verse. A part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim. Unfortunately the poem was lost long ago.
According to our histories keeper, the portion of the Edda dealing with King Olaf might still exist in Dead Men's Respite. I need you to retrieve the poem.

plots: the caravans are notorious for transporting illegal substances
title: Deal Like A Steal
objective: secure a merchandise transportation deal for the Thieves Guild
tasks: deliver a satchel of Moon Sugar to Ri'saad to secure the deal
description:
Before we get down to business, I've got something I need you to do.
Well, as you know, the Guild's growing and things are looking up around here. The only thing we're lacking is a reliable way to transport our merchandise across the land.
I'm not sure if you've noticed, but there are several caravans that travel across the realm. They're shrewd traders and don't mind getting their hands dirty.
I've bartered with their leader, Ri'saad, on more than one occasion. I want you to bring him something. You see, the caravans are notorious for transporting illegal substances.
Present Ri'saad with this satchel of Moon Sugar, and I bet my last coin he'll make a deal.

TESO128: Waterfront District of the Imperial City
TESO130: Waterfront District of the Imperial City

plots: this is the player's first assignment
the pirates have been moving cargo: the player may be able to smuggle themselves onboard the Marie Elena in one of the packing crates
the player's fellow assassins provide insight about any current contract
title: A Watery Grave
objective: assassinate Gaston Tussaud
description:
Warmest greetings to you. I am Vicente Valtieri. I'm eager to see how you fare on your first assignment.
Go to the Waterfront District of the Imperial City. There you will find a ship named the Marie Elena. Board the ship and find its captain, Gaston Tussaud. He'll be in his cabin. Eliminate Tussaud in any manner you see fit. As a pirate, Gaston Tussaud has certainly spilled his share of blood. Someone wants revenge, and they've hired us to extract it.
The pirates have been moving a lot of cargo onboard lately. You may be able to smuggle yourself onboard in one of the packing crates. Oh, and one more thing. Get into the habit of asking your fellow assassins about any current contract. Their insight may prove invaluable.

plots: Keldorn's tasks keep him away from home
title: Keldorn Wishes to Visit His Wife and Family
objective: visit Keldorn's estate
tasks: meet Keldorn's wife and daughters with Keldorn
description:
I am Keldorn, servant of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart.
My tasks for the church too often keep me away, but my estate is in this district, along with my wife and daughters. Would you like to come? I could introduce you.

plots: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood
Cicero went berserk because he overheard Astrid complain about the Night Mother and the player being the listener: Cicero wounded Veezara and tried to kill Astrid before fleeing
title: The Cure for Madness
objective: confront Cicero and kill him
tasks: find Arnbjorn and make sure he is alright
search Cicero's room for clues about where he has gone and let Astrid know about your findings
description:
The fool Cicero went absolutely berserk! He wounded Veezara, tried to kill me, and then he fled. I knew that lunatic couldn't be trusted.
Nothing set Cicero off. At least nothing I'm aware of. Well... If I'm being honest, I haven't exactly been discreet lately in expressing my frustration with this whole situation. Obeying the Night Mother. You being the Listener. It's ridiculous. No offense. Cicero may have overheard me talking to one of the others about the Night Mother. It's possible I was... not entirely respectful. But to go this far. To attempt to murder the leader of a Sanctuary. Cicero must pay with his life. There is no other option.
I want you to find that miserable little fool and end his life! But first... find my husband. Make sure he's all right. After the attack, Arnbjorn flew into a rage. When Cicero left... Arnbjorn went after him. They disappeared into the wild. Take my horse, Shadowmere. You'll find him outside, by the pool, when you go find Arnbjorn. Search Cicero's room here. Maybe there's something in there that sheds some light on where he might have gone.
Let me know the minute you find something. I've got to see to Veezara, and calm everyone down.

plots: Astrid sent the player to Gabriella
the Emperor will arrive in Skyrim: the Penitus Oculatus will need to begin its preparations immediately
Astrid and Gabriella have devised a plan to break Commander Maro and cripple the Emperor's protection
Gaius Maro is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim
Olava's token is to be given to Olava the Feeble for a reading of the player's future
title: Breaching Security
objective: assassinate Gaius Maro, and implicate him in a plot to kill the Emperor
tasks: go to Dragon Bridge, observe Gaius Maro's departure, follow him, waylay him in one of the major cities, kill him, and plant the false evidence on his body
description:
Dear sibling. I've been waiting for you. Your next contract awaits, as I'm sure Astrid indicated.
With the Emperor's arrival in Skyrim now a certainty, his security service, the Penitus Oculatus, will need to begin its preparations immediately. Security is being handled by a Commander Maro. Astrid and I have devised a plan to break the man, and in doing so, cripple the Emperor's protection.
You are to slay the commander's son, Gaius Maro, and once he is dead, plant false evidence on his body implicating him in a plot to kill the Emperor. He is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim. Go there now. Observe Gaius Maro's departure, and follow him. Waylay him in one of the cities, and send his soul to Sithis. Once he's dead, plant the incriminating letter on his body, and let fate take care of the rest. Oh, and one final thing...
To earn your bonus, do not kill Gaius Maro in Dragon Bridge, or on the road. Kill him in one of the other major cities he'll be visiting. There, the body will be discovered quickly, as will the letter implicating Gaius Maro in the plot to assassinate the Emperor. Do that, and Astrid has authorized me to grant you a rather unique bonus. It is a special token, to be given to Olava the Feeble, in Whiterun. Olava is an old and dear friend, and a powerful seer. The token entitles you to a reading of your future. It's an opportunity one should not pass up.

TL2188: next to the entrance to the Broken Mines
TL2189: next to the entrance to the Broken Mines

plots: the Alchemist went into the Broken Mines: he is nearing his goal
title: On the Alchemist's Trail
objective: stop the Alchemist
description:
This is the only entrance to the Broken Mines that we've found, so the Alchemist is almost certainly in there. That probably means he's near his goal, whatever that is... and that means he'll do everything he can to keep you from stopping him. He'll be even more desperate, more dangerous.
I don't know what we'll encounter in there.

plots: the Gauldur name wiped out from the annals of history
Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis lusted after Archmage Gauldur's power and prestige: they discovered Archmage Gauldur's source of power, the Gauldur Amulet
Archmage Gauldur was murdered by his sons Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis: they split the Gauldur Amulet between them
Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis laid waste to surrounding villages: the high king sent Archmage Geirmund and his battlemages after Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis
title: Forbidden Legend
objective: investigate the forgotten legend of Gauldur, and find the 3 pieces of the Gauldur Amulet
description:
Daynas Valen's Notes
by Daynas Valen

How to summarize a lifetime of research? So little of what I have learned matters now - the petty politics of ancient times, the age-long campaign to wipe out all mention of the Gauldur name.
In the opening days of the First Era, the Archmage Gauldur was revered throughout the north. Wisdom, wealth, honor, and power were his, and even the legendary heros' heirs sought his counsel.
Smothered by his shadow, Gauldur's three sons grew cruel and resentful. They lusted after their father's power and prestige, and eventually Jyrik, the eldest, discovered its source: a mysterious amulet, from which he never parted. Together, they conspired to murder their father in his sleep and divide his amulet between them. And so it was done.
Consumed by their newfound power, the brothers laid waste to the surrounding villages. So great was the carnage that the High King himself intervened, sending a company of battlemages led by the Archmage Geirmund to subdue the brothers. And after a devastating battle, the three fled the field.
Mikrul, the youngest, was run to ground in Folgunthur, the ancient barrows at the foot of Solitude. Geirmund pursued Jyrik to the shattered crypts of Saarthal, half-buried even then. And at last, Sigdis was cornered in the southernmost reaches of land and later entombed in Geirmund's Hall.

plots: NONE
title: Petrine's Cat
objective: bring Angel's angel skin ring to Petrine
description:
Hi, I'm Petrine and my folks aren't around no more and I ran away from my Uncle Bheren 'cause he's real mean.
My cat's really an angel, though, and she protects me when bad things happen. Or at least she did. I can't find her now, though. I think she went back to my uncle's to get her ring. There's this ring that she loves to play with, but when I ran away I had to leave it at my nasty uncle's. If you could just get me the ring, I'm sure Angel would come back.
Could you do it, oh please?

plots: Clavicus Vile is weak, since he banished Barbas: Clavicus Vile can only manifest at his shrines
title: A Daedra's Best Friend
objective: settle the disagreement between Barbas and Clavicus Vile
tasks: talk to Clavicus Vile at his shrine
description:
You are exactly what I was looking for. You see, my name is Barbas. And I have a problem I think you can help sort out.
My master and I had a bit of a falling out. We got into an argument and it got rather... heated. He's kicked me out until I find someone who can settle our disagreement. That's where you come in.
My master is Clavicus Vile, the prince of wishes. As you can imagine, he's quite the important person.  Now, since he banished me, Vile's been rather weak. He can't manifest very far from one of his shrines. I know there's a cult that worships him at Haemar's Shame. We should be able to talk to him there.
If this works out, I'll make sure you're rewarded. Just don't trust any offer he makes you... okay?

plots: the player freed Malo from bandits
title: An Enchanter in Chains
objective: get your reward from Malo
description:
Oh, thank you so much!  Here I was, afraid I'd never enchant anything ever again!
I'm was on my way to the Estherian Enclave when these brigands ambushed me. Once I gather my wits, I'll head over there. Come by and see me, if you get a chance! I'll have a reward for you.

plots: the player is a favored of Talos
Acolyte Vilon sends the player a few believers who need the guidance of Talos
title: Fulfill Your Duties to Talos
objective: speak to the believers of Talos
tasks: give guidance to the believers of Talos who seek the guidance of Talos
description:
Chosen of Talos! Over here! I, Acolyte Vilon, have words for you about your duties within the church!
As a favored of Talos, you will hear questions from the mewling dogs that seek the guidance of the Storm Lord. These weaklings seek guidance, and you are to give it. These worms are barely worthy of stepping upon the floor of the house of the Storm Lord! Nevertheless, you will hear them!
We all take our turn guiding the foolish. I shall send a few your way, and if you do well, perhaps you will not need to speak to any more. We shall see.
For now, guide them in the way of Talos. You must do what is best for the church, and that is all. Anything less and you will have your honors stripped.
Clear?

plots: Vitharn was overrun by Fanatics centuries ago: Count Cirion and his people failed to defend Vitharn
Sheogorath cursed the shades of Count Cirion's people to repeat the final moments of their failures
within Vitharn, no one will attack the player
title: Ghosts of Vitharn
objective: break the cycle of torment for the ghosts of Vitharn
tasks: correct the mistakes of the four people who failed to protect the gate lever
description:
I am Count Cirion, and you have violated the inner sanctum of Vitharn Keep.
However, my people and I are in need. Maybe you can help us. Centuries ago, Vitharn was overrun by Fanatics. We were soft and failed to defend ourselves. I was the weakest of all. Now, the shades of my people are cursed by Sheogorath to repeat the final moments of their failures, over and over again. You must help us break the cycle of torment.
Help my people overcome their weakness and defend Vitharn from the Fanatics. Walk among them. There were four who failed to protect the gate lever. Find out what they did wrong and help them correct it. You can put away your sword in these halls. Unlike the defending spirits, within these walls, none will war with you. Not even the Fanatics.
My people long to be laid to rest. Please help them.

plots: Drovas Relvi owes Mogrul 1,000 septims: Mogrul thinks that the player should pay Drovas Relvi's debt
title: A New Debt
objective: help Drovas Relvi with his debt to Mogrul
description:
It seems you've inherited a problem. Drovas Relvi owes me 1,000 septims. At least he did until you set him up with that powerful wizard. Now he's untouchable. The way I figure it, it's your fault he can't pay me. So I guess I'm going to have to collect it from you.
And if you don't pay me? Nothing for now. But watch your back. I'll be sending collectors to find you. They won't ask so nicely. One way or the other, I'll get my money.
When you are tired of looking over your shoulder, you'll pay me.

BG167: down south, where the Cloud Peaks tumble into the sea
BG168: down south, where the Cloud Peaks tumble into the sea

plots: NONE
title: Cordyr and the Sirines
objective: kill the sirines that sank Cordyr's fishing boat
description:
Pleasure to meet you. The name's Cordyr.
I'm from down south, where the Cloud Peaks tumble into the sea. A pair of sirines has been trying to move into the area. They sank my fishing boat and put me right out of work. *sigh* If they weren't so dang beautiful, it would be a lot easier to convince people of how much of a nuisance they can be. Can you kill them for me? It's a dirty deed but it's the cost of civilization, isn't it?
You can have a haste scroll as payment.

plots: Senna wakes the player up: the player does not remember anything about coming to the Temple of Dibella, blathering about marriage or a goat, and throwing trash all over the Temple of Dibella
title: A Night to Remember
objective: find Sam as you recover from a bad hangover
tasks: clean up the mess that you made, and apologize to Senna
description:
Wake up! That's right, it's time to wake up, you drunken blasphemer!
Of course! You don't remember getting here. I'm guessing you also don't remember coming in here and blathering incoherently about marriage or a goat. Which means you don't remember losing your temper and throwing trash all over the temple.
You want to know where your friend Sam has gone? Dibella teaches love and compassion, but that doesn't mean we're just going to tell you what you want to know and let you walk away from this. Pick up your mess, then apologize, and if we think you're sincere we'll consider lending you aid.

plots: the player defeated the Artificer in the Vaults: he enslaved the Guardian of Mana for the Alchemist
title: The Corrupted Guardian
objective: prevent the Alchemist from corrupting and controlling all the world's magic
tasks: free the Guardian of Mana from Ezrohir's control
description:
We must act quickly. It appears that the Artificer you defeated in the Vaults has enslaved the Guardian of Mana for the enemy. The most pressing danger is that they will use the enslaved Guardian to corrupt... and control... all the world's magic. Our only recourse in that event may be to destroy the Guardian.
There might still be hope. If we can find a way to free the Guardian from Ezrohir's control, we can thwart the Alchemist's plans.

plots: the player told Finnas that the player came here to rescue him, Snowbell and Sunbeam
title: The Not-So-Lost Husband
objective: tell Bellethe that Finnas is okay
tasks: take Snowbell and Sunbeam to Bellethe
description:
You ... you came to rescue us?  Thank the guardians!
I've managed to keep Snowbell and Sunbeam safe up here, but I injured my leg. I can't make my way out of this cave while carrying them. If you'll take them to Bellethe, I'll follow you out at my own pace. Tell Bellethe that I'm okay. My thanks to you for your help!

plots: the player has approached Namira's shrine
Forgotten have lived in peace for many years worshiping Namira from the dark, basking in their misery and filth: priests of Arkay seek to bring light to the Forgotten's darkness
title: Namira Versus the Priests of Arkay
objective: assist Forgotten in eliminating some priests of Arkay
tasks: cast a spell Namira gives you upon the priests of Arkay, and let Forgotten kill the priests
description:
You dare approach Namira's shrine, Child of the Light? You, who walk this plane basking in the light of the warm, cruel sun?
Prove to me that you deserve my favor. In Anga, my Forgotten have lived in peace for many years. They worship me from the dark, basking in their misery and filth. Now, though, some would seek to bring light to their darkness.
Priests of Arkay have intruded upon their squalor. I want you to help my Forgotten kill these priests of the Light. Cast this spell upon the priests. Allow my beloved Forgotten to kill the interlopers. When this is done, I shall reward you for your efforts.
You shall have my ring. Let it bring pain to others who would wish it upon you.

plots: Jaella just lies in bed staring at the wall
title: Lissa's Daughter Needs Healing
objective: heal Jaella
tasks: find out what Gerhardt knows about Jaella's condition
description:
My name is Lissa. Something's wrong with my daughter.
Her name is Jaella. She's hurt, traveler. I don't know what's wrong with her. She just lies in bed staring at the wall. Won't even eat.
Please heal her. She's just a little girl. Please, you must go and find out exactly what Gerhardt knows about Jaella's condition. You'll find him in the basement.

plots: NONE
title: Argonian Ale Extraction
objective: bring Brenuin a bottle of Argonian Ale
tasks: steal the bottle f Argonian Ale
description:
I'm drunk only if I can help it. But damn if I ain't almost sober.
Hey. In the Bannered Mare, there's this bottle of Argonian Ale. The good stuff. Get it for me. They won't even know it's gone. Come on...
Argonian Ale! I can almost taste it! I have something for you. This here healing potion. I, er, "found" it in a temple.

plots: NONE
title: Reparations
objective: make reparations for breaking the Thieves Guild rules
tasks: pay 1,000 gold to Vex for readmittance to the Thieves Guild
description:
I'm going to make this short and sweet, because frankly I don't think you deserve another shot. You've broken the rules and now you need to pay... and it's going to cost you quite a bit: 1,000 gold.
You claim to be a thief... act like one. Pick pockets, knock over houses... heck, I don't care if you have to bust into a palace. You do what you have to do to come up with the coin.
Anything you steal, you bring it straight to me. Now get out of here and don't come back until your pockets are full. Only then you're one of us again.

plots: Runil became a priest of Arkay after the Great War: many died by Runil's magics
Kust and the people of Falkreath have come to accept Runil as one of their own
title: A Journal of Regret
objective: retrieve Runil's journal for him
description:
I am Runil, a priest of Arkay. I came into Arkay's light after the Great War. So many died by my hands, my magics.
I'm fortunate that Kust and the people of Falkreath have come to accept me as one of their own.
Could you do an old elf a favor? I misplaced my journal in a cave I was exploring. I'll pay for its return.
Blessing of Arkay to you for your help.

plots: Madesi is one of the few traditional Saxhleel jewelers that remain in Tamriel
title: Ringmaker
objective: gather jewelry materials for Madesi
tasks: get two flawless sapphires, a mammoth tusk and a chunk of gold ore
description:
I make my own jewelry. Sadly, I'm one of the few traditional Saxhleel jewelers that remains in Tamriel; it's becoming a lost art. Only trouble is gathering materials has become hazardous. The roads to the mines and to the other cities are thick with bandits... and worse.
Would you be interested in gathering some materials for me? I'd certainly be happy to compensate you. I'm seeking a small list of items to complete my next creation: two flawless sapphires, a mammoth tusk and a chunk of gold ore.

plots: necromancers have been creating black soul gems for the King of Worms
Arch-Mage Traven believes that the Black Soul Gem may be instrumental in saving the Mages Guild
title: Ambush
objective: retrieve a unique Black Soul Gem from the necromancers, and return immediately to Arch-Mage Traven
tasks: oversee a contingent of Battlemages in their fight with the necromancers
description:
Time is against us, and our enemies grow stronger. There is much to do, and little time in which to do it. Your next task is essential.
Word has been sent that the Necromancers have been quite busy, creating black soul gems for their master. In particular, a unique Black Soul Gem has been crafted in the south of Cyrodiil, in the ruins of Silorn.
This gem needs to be confiscated and brought here, before it can be delivered to the King of Worms and used against us. I have need of it. I believe the Black Soul Gem  may be instrumental in saving our guild. I will explain once you have returned with it. Until then, discussion is useless.
A contingent of Battlemages has been sent to the site. I would like you to oversee their actions on my behalf. The only thing that matters is that gem. Do you understand? Once you have it safely in your possession, return here immediately.
Know that you have my complete confidence. I would not entrust this job to you if I did not feel you were prepared for it. Now, go.

plots: the player is a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
this is the player's final task
title: The Dragon Slayer
objective: retrieve the Holy Avenger from Firkraag
description:
Greetings. It is William Reirrac of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart and I believe it is time for you to perform one final task, if you are willing.
There is an item, a holy artifact, that lies within the hands of a great evil. Firkraag, the great red dragon, looms over the Windspear Hills. His reign must end, and from his lair you must retrieve the most holy of blades, the Holy Avenger. This tool of good has been in his possession for too long. Knight, I call upon you to slay the dragon and make a statement for right and justice.
The blade will be rescued, but so shall the lands that he rules. This is a great risk, but it must be dealt with sometime. Go, and may the forces of good be your salvation.
Accomplish this, and I can think of no one more worthy of wielding the Holy Avenger. In your hands, such a blade will strike deep to evil's heart.

plots: the player asked a recommendation to Raminus from Jeanne Frasoric: the player is an Associate of the Mages Guild
if someone from the Council were to visit Bruma Mages Guild, and find out that J'skar has vanished, it would look bad on Jeanne Frasoric
Volanaro thinks J'skar's spell backfired
title: Magely Mischief
objective: find J'skar, and make him re-appear
tasks: talk to the mages about J'skar's disappearance
description:
A recommendation, from me? Well, of course. Raminus would naturally want my opinion, wouldn't he?
This is a situation we can both benefit from, Associate. You do me a small favor, and I'll happily send along a glowing recommendation.
J'skar's disappeared. I mean he's really disappeared. No one here has seen him in days. Volanaro thinks maybe a spell backfired. If someone from the Council were to stop by, and find him gone, it'd look bad for me. I can't have that. Talk to the mages here, and see what you can find out.
If you can make J'skar re-appear, you'll have your recommendation.

plots: NONE
title: No Crown for You
objective: find the Jagged Crown before Galmar Stonefist
tasks: meet Legate Rikke and her men
description:
Ulfric's right-hand man, Galmar Stonefist, has located what he believes is the final resting place of the Jagged Crown. We're going to make sure he doesn't get his hands on it.
The rest of my men are already assembling outside Korvanjund. I'll meet you there as soon as I finish up here.

BG2131: the second floor in Delosar's Inn
BG2133: the second floor in Delosar's Inn

plots: Dennis refuses to pay his debts to Vittario
Dennis promised to pay Vittario's bar tab in exchange for some lessons on the gong
title: Help Vittorio Collect His Debt
objective: protect Vittario from Dennis while Vittario collects Dennis' debt
description:
I, Vittario, be in some need of assistance, me pal. There be a fellow within Delosar's Inn there... Dennis. He owes me a good deal of coin, an' refuses to pay!
He promised to pay off me bar tab, he did, in exchange for some lessons on the gong. Well, I teached him, I did... an' now he refuses to pay me tab!
Ehhh, well I be kicked out of Delosar's for not having my tab paid. Dennis be a big fellow... with big friends. I need some muscle behind me if I'm t' go within.
Come... follow me inside o' Delosar's, and let's have a little talk wi' Dennis, aye? I do believe he is on the second floor.
I be a poor, poor man, me pal... I have almost nothing to offer ye. I beg ye to help a destitute teacher find some justice!

plots: the player helped Elmus and the others reclaim the Thirsk Mead Hall from monsters
title: Berries for Elmus
objective: retrieve some juniper berries for Elmus
description:
We lost most of the mead batches we had brewing when... before those things were here. One is just ready to take its turn, though, and it's about time to add some of the flavorings.
You can't find them on Solstheim, but if you find yourself back in Skyrim, I wouldn't mind you bringing some juniper berries.
They add a different kind of sweetness. Tart. Makes the flavor more round.

plots: Quallo is standing next to a creature that he calls a friend
the blade is hidden
title: Solve the Riddle of the Sewers
objective: follow the One's path, and return to Quallo
tasks: find the clues from the One
description:
I'm Quallo, and this thing here is my friend.
You have come for the blade, I suppose. It is as we have always expected, my friend. (He glances to the creature beside him.) Too long in this pit, too long.
The gleam in your eye! It belies your greed, your passion. I've found this blade, child! It is hidden most insidiously. A cruel jest has been played upon us all. My friend here knows this!
The One has left clues for you. Have you not found the clues? Where the topside filth drains, there are the clues. Return to me ere you follow the One's path, for there is much that you must learn.

plots: NONE
title: Bring Out Your Dead
objective: recover the Rosamortis for Selrenki
tasks: convince the spirits to unlock the Ghost Chains
get the Rosamortis away from its big undead guardian
description:
I got a proposition for you... a little "I scratch my back, you scratch yours" kind of thing. See this crypt over here? It's called the Bone Gallery, and there's a little thing in there called the Rosamortis... a handy little thingamajig that can save the life of someone who's been mortally wounded... which, while pretty valuable, is also guarded by the biggest undead monstrosity I've ever seen!
Also, the entrance to the Bone Gallery is locked with chains only a ghost can open! You'll have to convince the spirits to unlock the Ghost Chains and give you access, then get the Rosamortis away from that monster... but I promise to make it worth your while!

plots: thieves broke into the Bards College and made off with a lot of valuable things: Finn's Lute included
Finn invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today
title: Finn's Lute
objective: return Finn's Lute to Inge Six Fingers
description:
Hmm? Oh, sorry. My mind wanders sometimes. I was just thinking about Finn's Lute.
Over a year ago, thieves broke into the College and made off with a lot of valuable things. Mostly gold and silver. But they also stole Finn's Lute. We just learned where the bandits fled to, and I very much want that lute back. They are at Stony Creek Cave.
Finn was the bard who invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today. Until he found a way to string the extra courses, bards only had six course lutes. The lute they stole is Finn's original eight course lute. I doubt they even realize its true value.
There is no way I can pay you what this Lute is worth. But I can teach you a few tricks I've learned over the years.

plots: Lena and Sam have been wandering in the wilderness
Sam will join the player
title: Sam and Lena
objective: save Sam from dying
description:
Please wait a moment, kind traveler! You've got to help me!
My name is Lena. You must forgive me for my appearance, but I've been wandering the wilderness for more than a week now.
My friend is badly hurt, and he might die if he doesn't get assistance soon. His name is Sam. If you were to take him to Gellana Mirrorshade at the Temple of Wisdom, she'd help him.
Please, can you do this?

plots: the player helped Widget and his cousins in the past
title: Fade's Passage
objective: ask Fade to open the hidden passage to Cacklespit's realm
tasks: search for the shrines that mark Fade's resting place
description:
Since you helped us in our time of need, we have been searching for a way to return the favor.
It seems you've met with some unexpected trouble from Cacklespit the witch. I've done a little research, and if you'd like to find her, I think I can help!
From the lore I've been able to piece together, there is a secret way to her hidden realm. The spirit, Fade, can open the way - but he may ask for something in return. You'll have to journey to the Sundered Battlefield in the north. Search for the shrines that mark Fade's resting place. I hope this helps you on your way! I'll keep researching in hopes of finding more information to help you.

plots: retired, blind Moth priests go to die in the Temple of the Ancestor Moths
the Gray Fox will mark the location of the Temple of the Ancestor Moths on the player's map
the player must not kill innocents: however, there is no bloodprice for slaying the stone's guardians
title: Turning a Blind Eye
objective: return to the Gray Fox with Savilla's Stone
tasks: Go to Temple of the Ancestor Moths.
description:
I have need of your special gifts. There is an item, hidden away in a remote monastery. I need you to go get it for me.
The monastery is extensive and well guarded, so you should make sure to be well prepared. Should you succeed, I will pay you well for your services.
The monastery is called the Temple of the Ancestor Moths. It is where retired, blind Moth priests go to wait out the rest of their days. I will mark the location on your map. Look for it in the far northeast of Cyrodiil, beyond Cheydinhal.
I need you to acquire Savilla's Stone. It is a large crystal with special properties that I need to gain... advantage. Remember, do not shed innocent blood. However, there is no bloodprice for slaying the stone's guardians, human or inhuman. When I receive word that Savilla's Stone is missing, I will be here waiting for you.

plots: the Dwemer discovered the Black Book that is connected with Miraak
Neloth found the Dwemer's "reading room" in Nchardak: Neloth was not able to open the protective case where the Black Book is sealed
title: The Path of Knowledge
objective: find the Black Book
description:
I know where to find the Black Book connected with Miraak. I haven't been able to get it, though. But maybe together we can unlock the secrets the Dwemer left behind.
Forbidden knowledge was somewhat a specialty of the ancient Dwemer. It seems they discovered this book and took it to study. I have found their "reading room" in the ruins of Nchardak. The book is there, but it's sealed in a protective case which I wasn't able to open.
But perhaps the two of us together will be able to get the book. To Nchardak, then. Follow me.

plots: fire spells are effective on gibberlings
title: The Gibberling Hordes
objective: help Laurel to fend off the gibberlings
description:
I am called Laurel. I am a traveling paladin.
Ah, travelers, this wilderness is too expansive to keep clear of monsters all on my own. Many gibberlings pass through this very spot day and night. Will you stay here and help fend them off?
Fire magics work well against the gibberlings, so if you have such spells, use them.

plots: the player does not know Marius Caro
title: Mazoga the Orc
objective: report to Marius Caro the reason Mazoga the Orc is in Leyawiin
tasks: find out why Mazoga the Orc is in Leyawiin
description:
Marius Caro, by grace of the Gods, Count of Leyawiin. You are a stranger to me, but well-met. Perhaps you would like to do a service for Leyawiin?
I need your help. An Orc named Mazoga here claims to be a knight, but will not reveal her business. Find out why she is here, and report to me, and you will earn a reward suitable for those who serve Leyawiin.

plots: the player asked Calcelmo to let the player inside his Dwemer museum: the Dwemer museum is a private place where Calcelmo can catalog his research
title: Nimhe, the Poisoned One
objective: kill Nimhe
description:
You idiot. Do you even know who I am? The most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel, and you people keep bothering me!
I... I'm sorry I... I got too excited. I'm in the middle of some very... stressful work, and I shouldn't have yelled. How can I help you?
You want to access my Dwemer museum? It's a private place where I can catalog my research. Occasionally, the nobles will come in and have questions, but that's thankfully rare.
I'll let you in if you agree to something for me. There's a giant spider in Nchuand-Zel, my excavation site. My workers call her 'Nimhe', the Poisoned One. If you deal with Nimhe, I'll let you into both the excavation site and my Dwemer Museum. What do you say?

plots: Ranarr-Jo thinks that Cindanwe can control minds
title: Everything In Its Place
objective: liberate Ranarr-Jo and others from mind control
description:
I'm Ranarr-Jo.
Perhaps you could help us? But why should I trust you? You might be, you know... one of Them.
Our situation is desperate, she controls our minds... but wait, I've said too much.
Talk to my Kishashi. If she will trust you, I will trust you.

plots: Tazok has been going to the Cloakwood regularly
there are important documents in the chest here
title: A Hidden Base in the Cloakwood
objective: investigate Tazok and his group of bandits
description:
This whole thing is dirty to the core, that's what I know! These aren't your ordinary bandits here. Tazok's been making regular visits to the Cloakwood, so that's where I'd start if I were you. There are some documents in that chest that might be worth taking a look at, too.
Now go step on some toes, all right? And you can tell them Ender Sai sent you.

plots: Tar-Meena is reading about Necromancy, only stopping to sleep, at the Arch-Mage's request
title: Necromancer's Moon
objective: find information on Black Soul Gems, especially about their powers and creation
tasks: speak to Tar-Meena about Black Soul Gems
description:
I'd like you to speak with Tar-Meena at the Mystic Archives. She is our specialist on magicka arcana, and has been helping gather information.
I believe we have been asking her the wrong questions, taxing her too much with vague attempts to make sense of all that we know. Speak with her specifically about these Black Soul Gems. If she knows anything about their powers or creation.
Her expertise in arcane knowledge and lore could be invaluable to us, if we can make proper use of it. She can likely be found in the Archives now, poring through materials on Necromancy. She stops only to sleep, at the Arch-Mage's request.

plots: NONE
title: Lisbet's Missing Shipment
objective: recover a stolen Dibella Statue for Lisbet
description:
This store would finally be on its feet if I hadn't lost my last shipment to Forsworn attacks. A specially-made Dibella statuette.
You aren't for hire, are you? A sellsword? I'll pay you if you can recover that statuette from the Forsworn at Broken Tower Redoubt.
I'll have a sum of gold waiting for you when you return.

plots: Astrid woke the player up from their sleep
Aventus Aretino was looking for the Dark Brotherhood: Grelod the Kind was a Dark Brotherhood contract, and the player must pay for killing her
title: With Friends Like These...
objective: kill one of the kidnapped people for the Dark brotherhood
tasks: turn around, and select the person who shall not leave the room alive
description:
Sleep well? Who I am really isn't as important as what I am. And what I am is an admirer. Of sorts.
You see, that little Aretino boy was looking for the Dark Brotherhood. For me, and my associates. Grelod the Kind was, by all rights, a Dark Brotherhood contract. A kill... that you stole. A kill you must repay.
If you turn around, you'll notice my guests. I've "collected" them from... well, that's not really important. The here and now. That's what matters. You see, there's a contract out on one of them, and that person can't leave this room alive. But... which one? Go on, see if you can figure it out.
Make your choice. Make your kill. I just want to observe... and admire.

plots: the Thing got in Bennings, but then Fuchs disappeared
title: The Thing
objective: destroy the Thing before it infects the whole world
description:
"Blair's Notes"
by Blair

It was in the ice. Who knows how long? But it wasn't dead. And now it's hiding, here somewhere... in one of us. We found it in Bennings, but then Fuchs disappeared. It's still here, and it's looking for a way out. If it gets out into the world, it can infect everyone, everywhere. Three years, at most. Gods forgive us for what we've set loose upon the world.

plots: Raerek is not a true son of Skyrim, as he still supports the Empire
the Jarl's men will arrest the player if they find the player in Raerek's quarters
title: Pushing Beliefs
objective: blackmail Raerek into helping the Stormcloaks
tasks: find proofs of Raerek's Talos worship in his quarters, and use them to blackmail Raerek
description:
Get over to Markarth. Rumor has it the Jarl's Steward, Raerek, is a faithful Talos worshiper, if not a true son of Skyrim - he still supports the Empire, after all.
But, if confronted with proof of his belief, you might be able to 'persuade' him to aid our cause, indirectly of course. Wouldn't want to sully his reputation, would we?
You'll need to be careful with this one. The Jarl's men won't look kindly on you rummaging through the steward's quarters.

plots: Lord Harkon is giving a speech to the player and their fellow vampires: the player and the other vampires will dominate over the sun itself, and forge a realm of eternal darkness
Lord Harkon has reclaimed one of his Elder Scrolls and needs a Moth Priest to read it
title: Prophet of the Night
objective: locate a Moth Priest for Lord Harkon
tasks: speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers and travelers about the rumors of a Moth Priest in Skyrim
description:
Scions of the night! Hear my words! The prophesied time is at last upon us. Soon we will claim dominion over the sun itself, and forge a new realm of eternal darkness.
Now that I have reclaimed one of my Elder Scrolls, we must find a Moth Priest to read it. I have spread false rumors about the discovery of an Elder Scroll in Skyrim to lure a Moth Priest here. Now it is time to see if those efforts have borne fruit.
Go forth, and search the land for rumors of a Moth Priest within our borders. Look to the cities. Speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers, anyone who would meet a traveler.
Go now, and carry out this task. This is my command!

plots: the Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim: the Synod will not be cooperative
title: Revealing the Unseen
objective: learn the location of the Staff of Magnus
tasks: find the members of the Synod
description:
The Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim. They inquired about the ruins of Mzulft, but that's all I remember.
It sounded like they were heading there, though they were rather secretive about why. I suppose if you're intent on looking for the staff, there's a chance they might be in Mzulft yet. Just don't expect them to be cooperative.

plots: Barthel Gernand and his family ran into goblin war parties northwest of here while starting to build a new settlement
title: Goblin Trouble
objective: stop a goblin war so that Barthel Gernand and his family can finish building their new settlement
tasks: talk to Mirisa about the goblins
description:
A word of advice! Watch for goblins if you're heading north. We ran into goblin war parties northwest of here, while starting to build a new settlement.
My family and I are still trying to figure out what to do. We spent everything we had to buy the land and supplies, so we can hardly go back.
Say, do you think you could help us? We need to get the goblins off our land so we can start building our new settlement. You should talk to Mirisa about the goblins. She's our guide and knows what needs to be done.
Take care, friend. Don't get yourself killed on our account.

plots: the player has summoned Meridia by the detritus of the profane
Meridia hates the undead and necromancers
title: Meridia Smites Necromancers
objective: wipe out a band of necromancers
description:
By the detritus of the profane, I am brought forth. And by your offering, you have made the profane your interest, mortal.
The undead are foul, unnatural things. Some of my rivals take pleasure in these abominations. Not Meridia. I wish these creatures destroyed. Hidden behind a door, deep in Howling Cave, are necromancers. They rob graves for the materials to raise their undead armies.
Find these necromancers. Destroy them and their abominations. Do this, and earn the gratitude of Meridia. You shall have the Ring of Khajiiti and go with my blessing.

plots: the player brought parts of the 4000 Model to Professor Stoker
title: Robot Parts
objective: talk to the 4000 Model
tasks: let Professor Stoker put the parts of the 4000 Model back together
description: What do we have here?  Wow, this is a 4000 Model robot! These are quite old - this one appears to have had a lot of work done to it. Not sure why it's in pieces - why don't we find out! Let me just put these together for you and we'll see what it has to say for itself.

plots: NONE
title: Body Work
objective: restore Umahd's physical form
tasks: find the Ezrohir marauder who wears Umahd's wrappings
description:
I am no ghost, only disembodied spirit: a Zeraphi warrior, torn from his wrappings, but unable to tear himself away from this world. Umahd is my name. I was defeated in battle, and my physical form taken from me, and made to serve the Ezrohir. But the Ezrohir Marauder who wears my wrappings has returned, no doubt thinking me long gone.
Find that Ezrohir Marauder! Restore my physical form, and I shall reward you!

plots: the player needs the Staff of Magnus to break through Ancano's dangerous magic

the player knows that the Staff of Magnus is in Labyrinthian: Savos Aren gave Mirabelle Ervine something from Labyrinthian before he died, Mirabelle Ervine gives the player this item and Savos Aren's amulet
title: The Staff of Magnus
objective: bring the Staff of Magnus to the College of Winterhold
description:
You need to get your hands on the Staff of Magnus. Now.
I've got to stay here, to see if we can get to Ancano and stop this. I need someone I can trust to do it. If the stories about the staff are true, if it really can absorb a tremendous amount of power, maybe we can break through Ancano's magic.
You know that the staff is in Labyrinthian? Are you... Are you sure? The staff is there? That can't be a coincidence. The Arch-Mage. Before... before he died. He... He gave me something just a little while ago. He told me it was from Labyrinthian, and that I would know what to do with it when the time came. I think... I think he meant this for you, then. I'm not sure why, but there was something very personal about it for him. Also, I think you should take this amulet. It belonged to Savos, but I think would do you the most good now. Take it, and get out of here.
Bring back that staff before Ancano brings the whole College down around us. If we can't stop this, what happens to the rest of Skyrim?

plots: NONE
title: Delayed Burial
objective: convince Loreius fix the wheel of Cicero's wagon
description:
Poor Cicero is stuck. Can't you see? I was transporting my dear, sweet mother. Well, not her. Her corpse! She's quite dead. I'm taking mother to a new home. A new crypt. But... aggh! Wagon wheel! Damnedest wagon wheel! It broke! Don't you see?
Oh. Oh yes! Yes, the kindly stranger can certainly help! Go to the farm - the Loreius Farm. Just over there, off the road. Talk to Loreius. He has tools! He can help me! But he won't! He refuses! Convince Loreius to fix my wheel! Do that, and poor Cicero will reward you. With coin! Gleamy, shiny coin!

plots: NONE
title: The Heist Job
objective: steal an item from a store strongbox
description:
Every now and again, we like to remind the shopkeepers that we're in charge. If that means breaking into their strongboxes and stealing something valuable from them, then so be it.
Feel like doing a bit of shopping... the Guild way? The owner of this shop stiffed us on their last protection payment, but we're taking it anyway.

plots: NONE
title: Raid on Greyland
objective: bring Kylius Lonavo's ring as the proof of his death to Lerexus Callidus
tasks: kill Kylius Lonavo and his group of Skooma dealers
description:
Hmmm. Perhaps you'll be able to assist me. I'm after some Skooma dealers.
A small group of Skooma dealers led by a Dunmer named Kylius Lonavo is holed up in the Greyland house just up the road. I've been trying to catch Lonavo for months, but every time I approach the place, his lookout sees me and he goes running. I need someone to go in there and put a stop to those fetchers. I don't care what it takes. We must get that poison they're selling off the street.
Bring me Lonavo's ring as proof he's... been dealt with... and I'll give you the bounty on him. Be vigilant. Lonavo is a snake.

plots: the player had to find Maglir before
Maglir had an easy contract for a local mage in Bravil: he has not reported to the client at all
title: More Unfinished Business
objective: make sure that Maglir's contract gets done, and send Maglir to Modryn Oreyn
tasks: find Maglir, and find out why he has defaulted on yet another contract
description:
I'm going to need you to find Maglir again. The little fetcher.
The little vermin has defaulted on another contract. I need you to go babysit him again.
Wish I knew what happened. He had a contract for a local mage in Bravil. Didn't seem like a particularly difficult assignment. He hasn't reported to the client at all. Get yourself down to Bravil and find Maglir.
Make sure that contract of his gets done. And send him to me.

BG1171: upriver, along the east bank, north of the bitch priestess
BG1172: upriver, along the east bank, north of the bitch priestess

plots: NONE
title: Quinn's Friend
objective: bring something belonging to Nester to Quinn
description:
I'm Quinn. There's some ankhegs causin' chaos upriver, alon' the east bank, just north o' that bitch priestess.
They took down my pal, Nester, and dang near hauled me under too. 'At's why I'm so glum now. Nester's mama's gonna want somepin' of 'is to bury, but I'm still gettin' too many nightmares and all to go back there.

BG1188: the pirate cove along the coast, south of Candlekeep
BG1189: the pirate cove along the coast, south of Candlekeep

plots: Safana will join the player
Safana has a map that shows the location of Black Alaric's treasure
title: Safana's Treasure Hunt
objective: get Black Alaric's treasure for yourself and Safana
tasks: find Black Alaric's treasure with Safana
description:
My name is Safana and I can make you richer than you could imagine.
I know where the pirate Black Alaric dumped his greatest trove of treasure. Knowing that you are a dynamic and intelligent person, I know you'd want to join me in a venture to get this treasure.
Well, we should be off then. From what my map showed, the pirate cove is located somewhere along the coast, just south of Candlekeep.

TESS193: in the southwest reaches of the realm, in the pine forest

plots: Astrid officially welcomes the player to the Dark Brotherhood
title: Sanctuary
objective: begin your new life as a member of the Dark Brotherhood, and see Astrid
tasks: find the entrance to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, and answer "Silence, my brother." when questioned by the black door
description:
I would like to officially extend to you an invitation to join my Family: the Dark Brotherhood.
In the southwest reaches of the realm, in the Pine Forest, you'll find the entrance to our Sanctuary. It's just beneath the road, hidden from view. When questioned by the Black Door, answer with the correct passphrase: "Silence, my brother." Then you're in. And your new life begins.
I'll see you at home.

plots: NONE
title: The Break of Dawn
objective: kill Malkoran, and retrieve the Dawnbreaker
description:
The Necromancer Malkoran defiles my shrine with vile corruptions, trapping lost souls left in the wake of this war to do his bidding. Worse still, he uses the power stored within my own token to fuel his foul deeds.
Mortals call my token Dawnbreaker, for it was forged in a holy light that breaks upon my foes, burning away corruption and false life. You will enter my shrine, destroy Malkoran, and retrieve this mighty blade.
I have brought you here, mortal, to be my champion. You will do this. I have commanded it!

plots: Valdr, Ari and Niels tracked a bear to Moss Mother Cavern: Spriggans appeared and killed Ari and Niels
title: Moss Mother Cavern
objective: help Valdr avenge his fallen friends
description:
Name's Valdr. I hunt out of Falkreath.
We tracked a bear to this den, Moss Mother Cavern. Good coin for those pelts. We had the big sow cornered when they showed up. Three of them, out of nowhere. Spriggans.
Niels went down before we even knew to run. Ari died just inside. I never even thought the things were real. But now what? I can't just walk away. Not with my friends' bodies in there, being torn apart by those beasts.
You would help me clear out the Spriggans? You'd do that for a stranger? I don't know what to say. Lead on, I suppose.

plots: NONE
title: Kill the Forsworn Leader
objective: kill a Forsworn leader
description:
Are you a sellsword? I don't like your kind. No honor. No loyalty. Unreliable. But I can't turn away a potential ally in these times. Let's see if you're better than a common mercenary.
My scouts have tracked down one of the Forsworn leaders, hiding out in their blood-soaked camps at Serpent's Bluff Redoubt. Deal with that Forsworn leader.

plots: the player is the Arch-Mage
the player should have the Staff of Magnus
title: Aftershock
objective: take care of a magical disturbance
tasks: contain the power from the Eye of Magnus with the Staff of Magnus
description:
There is something you should be aware of, Arch-Mage. We've been contacted by the Jarl of Markarth. It would seem there's some sort of disturbance.
From what few details we were given, it sounds quite familiar. I suspect that the power released by the Eye of Magnus was not fully contained, and has coalesced in this part of Skyrim. I do hope you still have the Staff of Magnus someplace. I suspect you're going to need it to contain the power.
I'm sure the Jarl will be quite pleased to. I think it only fitting that the Arch-Mage personally receive a large portion of the reward.

plots: NONE
title: Bleak Falls Barrow
objective: retrieve the Dragonstone for Farengar Secret-Fire
tasks: find the Dragonstone in the main chamber of Bleak Falls Barrow
description:
I could use someone to fetch something for me. Well, when I say fetch, I really mean delve into a dangerous ruin in search of an ancient stone tablet that may or may not actually be there.
I, ah, learned of a certain stone tablet said to be housed in Bleak Falls Barrow - a 'Dragonstone,' said to contain a map of dragon burial sites. Go to Bleak Falls Barrow, find this tablet - no doubt interred in the main chamber - and bring it to me. Simplicity itself.

plots: Anska's family legend states that they are descendants of Ysgramor
title: A Scroll For Anska
objective: help Anska find a scroll about her family legend
tasks: defeat Vokun, a powerful old priest buried here, with Anska
description:
I'm Anska. Are you here to help?
I've finally located Vokun's crypt! The scroll I'm looking for just has to be here. Maybe you could help find it, I just know it's in here.
Vokun is some old priest buried here long ago. I've been searching for his tomb for a few years now. If Vokun is as powerful as I think, I may need a little help um... dealing with him. With the two of us this should be easy.
You can have anything except the scroll of course. It's probably meaningless to you, but according to family legend it links our bloodline back to Ysgramor himself.

plots: Fuller knows the player
title: An Errand for Fuller
objective: bring a quarrel of crossbow bolts to Fuller
description:
Hey kid, it's me, Fuller.
I need a quarrel of crossbow bolts. If you could get some off Winthrop at the inn, I'll reimburse you. there'll be a dagger in it for you too. My father killed a hobgoblin with it once, many years ago. Stabbed him right in the back, he did. It ain't no broadsword, but it'll do in a pinch.

plots: Stalleo and his men left to help with the war: meanwhile Brurid and his bandits seized Treva's Watch and kidnapped Stalleo's family
title: Infiltration
objective: help Stalleo to take back Treva's Watch from bandits
tasks: use the mine entrance behind Stalleo and his men, and open the front gate
description:
Are you here to help? Finally, reinforcements have arrived. I was expecting more though, you'd better be good.
We left to help with the war and these filth bags swooped in and seized the place. I suspect Brurid planned this, there's been bad blood between us since the king's death. But to invade my home, kidnap my family...
The front gate is locked so you'll need to use the mine entrance behind us. Open the front gate and we'll try and give you some support. My family is everything to me. Clear the fort and on top of the posted reward you can have whatever items you'd like.

plots: Fralia Gray-Mane was told that Thorald was killed in the war against the Empire, but she knows that Thorald is alive: the Battle-Borns know that too
title: Missing In Action
objective: find Thorald
tasks: talk to Fralia Gray-Mane privately about the Battle-Borns and their lies
description:
All I can think about is my son, my Thorald... they say that he was killed, but I know better. I know my son is alive! Those Battle-Borns... they're in with the Imperials. They know it too, and yet they lie to my very face!
It's not wise to discuss how I know about their lies here. Please, if you truly wish to help, meet me at my home. I'll tell you the whole story.

plots: Euric ran away from home
Nadine gives the player a good luck talisman
title: Nadine and Euric
objective: give Euric a good luck talisman and return to Nadine
description:
I, Nadine, desperately need someone's help.
Euric, my youngest son, has run away again... He's always had a touch of the wanderer in him and he knows how to take care of himself, but... Oh, I'm just worried sick. This city gets more dangerous every day... If you find him, could you give him this good luck talisman? I'm sure we'd all sleep a little better.
Let me give you this necklace as a token of my thanks upon your return. I don't know if it's worth anything but it has been in the family for years.

plots: the player asked Vex information about Vald
title: Vald's Debt
objective: ask Vald to betray Mercer Frey
tasks: talk to Maven Black-Briar about erasing Vald's debts
description:
