Vald? That pig? Oh, I have info on him. More than you care to know. Vald does not have a good side. The only thing he understands is gold. A man after my own heart.
You can try to buy him off, but he'll ask for a whole lot. I mean, you are asking him to betray Mercer Frey. Your best bet would be to erase his debt with Maven Black-Briar. If you talk to her, she might be able to give you the details.
Of course, you could just run him through and take what you need off of his corpse... I could care less.

plots: Shandalar lives inside a Halruaan skyship
Shandalar knows how to produce Halruaan skyships: Shandalar plans to sell the knowledge of building Halruaan skyships to Grand Duchess Liia Jannath
Halruaans do not want others to obtain their skyships
spellbook, statuette, and artifact fragment are the ingredients needed to keep the skyships aloft: Shandalar's daughters have them
title: Alatos and the Thieves' Guild
objective: steal spellbook, statuette, and artifact fragment, and bring them to Alatos Thuibuld
description:
I am Alatos Thuibuld, though I thank you not to mention that too often.
A local wizard by the name of Shandalar makes his home in a moored Halruaan skyship. It would appear that he has the knowledge to reproduce these flying marvels and is currently organizing the sale of the recipe to Grand Duchess Liia Jannath. He has drawn up a set of rituals and has procured an artifact fragment and an ancient statuette vital to the spell that keeps the ships aloft. These he has divided amongst his daughters until the deal is to proceed. I have been contacted by a representative of the Halruaans, and they have no wish to see scores of flying ships manufactured in every port. You are to infiltrate the place of exchange that is known as Oberan's Estate, steal the ingredients, and return here with them. Simple enough.
You would be well paid. Enough gold to give you a backache and, if I am well pleased, mayhaps a magical weapon or two. Perhaps a little more, perhaps a little less. It entirely depends upon your performance.

plots: Benirus Manor belonged to Velwyn's grandfather: Velwyn is selling Benirus Manor because he has pressing matters elsewhere
the player gets the key to the front door and the deed of ownership after buying Benirus Manor
title: Where Spirits Have Lease
objective: purchase Benirus Manor
description:
I'm Velwyn. You wouldn't happen to be in the market for a home would you? If you are, I just happen to be selling a manor located right here in Anvil.
I'm selling my grandfather's house, Benirus Manor. If you're interested, I could let you have it for a modest sum, 5,000 gold. I have to sell it soon, as I have pressing matters elsewhere. You're welcome to take a look at it. It is located across the street from the Chapel.
Once you buy, you get the key to the front door and the deed of ownership. That's the deal.

plots: most businesses in Skyrim keep their transactions recorded within business ledgers
title: The Numbers Job
objective: make the shortfalls from Thieves Guild's other jobs look legit
tasks: change the numbers in the business ledger
description:
Most of the establishments in Skyrim keep their transactions recorded within business ledgers.
Your job would be to change the numbers in those books so the shortfalls from our other jobs look legit. In this case, we want to waylay a shipment on the way from this business without them even noticin' anything went missin'.
Feel like doing a bit of writin' in Bits and Pieces in Solitude?

plots: Hareph and his Zeraphi crew came to the outpost to deal with the Skara: the crew went to investigate the stacks and never came back
Hareph gives the player explosives
title: Shadow of the Skara
objective: help the Zeraphi any way you can
description:
I'm so relieved you have arrived! My crew and I journeyed to this outpost to deal with the increasingly aggressive Skara.
I remained here to fashion additional explosives while my crew investigated the stacks, but they never returned. I have been unable to leave here because of the swarming Skara.
Please take these explosives with you and journey to Swarm Point, and search for any surviving Zeraphi and help them in any way you can!

plots: the player saved Duros the Blade from imprisonment
title: Risk and Reward
objective: meet Duros the Blade in Zeryphesh
tasks: see if your luck holds out
description: Finally saved! Thank you! You look like a person who likes risk! I'm heading back to town now. Meet me there and see if your luck holds out!

plots: Talvas Fathryon conjured an Ash Guardian without Neloth's approval: the Ash Guardian is not under Talvas Fathryon's control
title: From the Ashes
objective: help Talvas Fathryon by killing an Ash Guardian
description:
You've got to help me! I conjured an Ash Guardian and now it's running amok in Tel Mithryn.
Master Neloth refused to teach me the Ash Guardian spell. So I read his spell book on my own and learned it. Something went wrong when I cast it. The creature is attacking everything in sight.
I need to keep Master Neloth distracted so he doesn't find out what I did. There is no telling what he would do to me. While you are taking care of the creature, I'll try to figure out what went wrong.
I don't have any gold to pay you with, but I can give you this staff.

plots: Eola assumes that the player is a cannibal
Eola has been eating the dead people of Markarth
title: The Taste of Death
objective: find your place as a follower of Namira
tasks: meet Eola and fight your way through the undead with her
description:
You were young when you first tasted human flesh, weren't you? A brother or sister had died? An accident, of course.
Then the hunger set in. Curiosity. What's the harm in just one bite? It's okay, now. You've found a friend who understands you. You can let go of your guilt.
A lot of our kind block out the memory of their first meal. The shame is too much. But you don't need to hide anymore. Namira, the Lady of Decay, accepts you for what you are.
She has a place for us, where we can sate our appetites without judgment. It's inside Reachcliff Cave. But the dead have stirred from their slumber recently, and I was forced here. Meet me there. We will fight our way to Namira's embrace together.
Until then, tell the people of Markarth that their dead won't be disturbed, anymore. We have bigger plans ahead.

plots: Hirrus Clutumnus is  going to go about his daily life
title: Final Resting
objective: help Hirrus Clutumnus end his life
tasks: kill Hirrus Clutumnus when he is unaware
description:
Won't someone end me? Take my life, please!
I, Hirrus Clutumnus, am in desperate need of a champion, a hero. Are you brave and fearless? There's a... a simple task. Yes, a simple task that you must perform.
This life, it's... well, it's too painful. Everywhere I look, I see death, dying, and decay. When I dream, I see a world without sunshine. I'm constantly on the verge of retching up, or falling asleep, or screaming at someone who doesn't deserve it. I'm just so fed up with it all.
I need your help. I need you to send my soul away from this world! You must... you must kill me. I don't necessarily want to see it coming. And I want to die here in the city so all these people finally believe me. They'll wish they were nicer. You probably want to do it without spectators though, so you don't get in trouble. Best to make it look like an accident. But remember, I don't want to see it coming. Take me unaware!
I'm going to go about my daily life, such as it is, as if nothing has changed. Make your move when you wish. But, please, do it soon. When you kill me, take the key to my house. Nothing really worth taking, except what's locked up in the jewelry box. You can have that.

plots: the player asked smithing training from Gin-Wulm
title: Smithing Training
objective: answer Gin-Wulm what the name Hazadir means, proving Gin-Wulm that you know about the history of smithing
tasks: find a book about Hazadir to find the answer
description:
Mighty bold of you, asking for smithing training. What makes you think you're worth my time?
I bet you don't know the first thing about smithing. Have you read up on the history of the craft? I doubt it. You answer a simple question, and I'll think about training you.
So here it is: What does the name Hazadir mean to you? Few recognize the name anymore, even though he was famous.
Had a book written about him, in fact! I don't have a copy myself, but there was one in First Edition last time I was browsing there. At least some people take an interest in history.

plots: if Balgruuf the Greater keeps the axe, Ulfric will bide his time
if Balgruuf the Greater returns the axe to the player, it means war
title: Message to Whiterun
objective: make a delivery for Ulfric
tasks: deliver an axe to Balgruuf the Greater
description:
I'm glad you're here. I have a message I need delivered to the Jarl of Whiterun. Deliver this axe to Balgruuf the Greater.
Men who understand each other often have no need for words. There are but a few simple truths behind one warrior giving another his axe. Balgruuf will know my meaning.
Give the man my axe. If he keeps it, I will bide my time. If he returns it to you, it means war.

plots: Quaranir stopped time around the player for speaking privately: the player is a student at the College of Winterhold
the Psijic Order has tried to contact the player previously with visions to warn the player about the Eye of Magnus
title: Good Intentions
objective: deal with the Eye of Magnus
tasks: seek out the Augur of Dunlain
description:
I've given us a chance to speak privately, but I'm afraid I can't do this for long. We must be brief.
The situation here at your College is of dire importance, and attempts to contact you as we have previously have failed. I believe it is due to the very source of our concern. This object... The Eye of Magnus as your people have taken to calling it. The energy coming from it has prevented us from reaching you with the visions you have already seen. The longer it remains here, the more dangerous the situation becomes. And so I have come here personally to tell you it must be dealt with.
I fear I have already overstepped the bounds of my Order, but I will offer this: seek out the Augur of Dunlain here in your College. His perception may be more coherent than ours.

TESO5: a small campsite, on the summit of Gnoll Mountain

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #6" is addressed toward Silencer
Silencer assassinated Alval Uvani like all the others
Havilstein Hoar-Blood savagely butchered the chieftain of a mead hall on Solstheim
in the flooded section of Nornal, Silencer will find a chest submerged in the water: the chest contains contains Silencer's reward for killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood, and Silencer's next contract
title: The Coldest Sleep
objective: receive Silencer's next contract after killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood
description:
Dead Drop Orders #6
by Lucien Lachance

Alval Uvani is dead, just like all the others. You continue to impress me, Silencer, and I am only too eager to indulge your homicidal instincts.
Your next target is a savage Nord barbarian, living alone and exposed at a small campsite on the summit of Gnoll Mountain. This barbarian, Havilstein Hoar-Blood by name, savagely butchered the chieftain of a mead hall on the island of Solstheim. The chieftain's sister has forgone the Nord custom of extracting the monetary retribution of wergild, and instead wants Hoar-Blood to pay with his life. You, dear Silencer, will help put her family at peace.
You are to go to Gnoll Mountain, locate Havilstein Hoar-Blood, and send his soul to the great beyond.
When Hoar-Blood has been executed, journey to the ancient ruin of Nornal. In the flooded section of that ruin you will find a chest, submerged in the water. As you may have guessed, the chest contains your reward for killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood, 500 gold, and your next contract.

TESS555: Stone of Barenziah, Stones of Barenziah

plots: the player showed a Stone of Barenziah to Vex for appraisal
title: No Stone Unturned
objective: talk to Vex after collecting the 24 Stones of Barenziah
description:
Been a while since I've seen one of those. What you've got there is a Stone of Barenziah. The stone was pried off of Barenziah's ceremonial crown by a thief in order to cover his tracks.
I think there were twenty-four in all; supposedly, all of them are in Skyrim. Most people keep them as a curiosity. Some of the Guild members have tried to locate them over the years, but they haven't been successful... well, until now.
I only buy things I can turn around quickly for a profit. And no one wants those stones unless they have the whole set. Tell you what, if you find the rest of them, talk to me again. Otherwise, keep it and maybe it'll bring you luck.

plots: NONE
title: Harsh Master
objective: take care of a runaway sailor and his gang of thieves
description:
The North Wind is my mistress, and I'm her master. I don't tolerate any disloyalty. You looking for work? Got a sailor who thought running a gang of thieves would be more money than hauling my cargo.
You make an example of that gang, I'll give you a year's worth of pay.  Don't spend it all on mead.

plots: Sylgja assumes that Verner have something for her
title: A Mail Delivery
objective: make a delivery for Sylgja to her parents
tasks: deliver a satchel of letters to Verner
description:
Would you happen to be headed towards Darkwater Crossing?
My parents live there. I usually make the journey to bring them gifts and to just say hello, but I haven't been well lately.
I've written some letters and placed them in a satchel. Perhaps you wouldn't mind delivering it to them on my behalf? I would insist on rewarding you for your time.
Here, take my satchel and give it to my father, Verner. He'll likely have something for you to bring back.

BG1107: on the other side of that bridge
BG1108: on the other side of that bridge

plots: NONE
title: Jared and the Bear
objective: kill the bear pursuing Jared
description:
Oh, thank goodness someone came by.
I'm Jared. There's a bear on the other side of that bridge, and it's coming this way! I can't run anymore!
Please hold it off — I'll give you anything!

plots: NONE
title: Ancient Power
objective: retrieve the petrified remains of an elder vampire
description:
I've been performing a little research on the Bloodstone Chalice. I believe we can prolong its salutary effects if we infuse it with potent vampiric blood.
I've located the petrified remains of an elder vampire in Cold Rock Pass. Bring them to me, and I should be able to extend the effects granted by the Bloodstone Chalice.

plots: NONE
title: Dreppin's Cow
objective: give an antidote potion to Dreppin so he can cure Nessa's illness
tasks: find one of Hull's antidote potions
description:
Hi. I'm Dreppin. Nice day, ain't it? Too bad Nessa the cow here ain't enjoyin' it though, her bein' sick 'n all.
I need to get her one of them potions of antidote off Hull. He stayed up drinkin' last night and got hauled outta bed to man the gates early this morning, so I bet he's got a few of them lyin' around somewheres.

plots: NONE
title: Pinching A Bottle
objective: give a bottle of double-distilled Skooma to Stands-In-Shallows
tasks: steal the bottle of double-distilled Skooma
description:
I feel like my scales are clawing into me. Maybe you could help an old Argonian out?
I heard some of the sailors talking about how they stashed a bottle of Double-Distilled Skooma in the Gnisis Cornerclub. I just need a taste.
Please, snatch the bottle for me. I'll be waiting for it. Then, let me show you a thing or two about not attracting attention to yourself.

plots: the player told Taarie that the player is going to the Blue Palace
title: Fit for a Jarl
objective: promote the Radiant Raiment to Jarl Elisif
tasks: wear one of the Radiant Raiment's outfits, and speak to Elisif about it
description:
You're really going to the Blue Palace? That presents an opportunity.
If you were willing to wear one of Radiant Raiment's outfits and speak to the Jarl I would not only pay you but let you keep the outfit.
Here's the outfit. Try to get Jarl Elisif's opinion on it and if she likes it mention it's from Radiant Raiment.

plots: the player asked Olyn Seran to train them  in Conjuration
title: Conjuration Training
objective: prove Olyn Seran that you are worthy of his teachings
tasks: summon a Faded Wraith right here, before Olyn Seran
description:
You would seek Conjuration training from me? Well, then my request is small. Prove to me that you are capable of serving Molag Bal in your own way.
Summon a Faded Wraith right here, before me. When I have seen it with my own eyes, you shall be worthy of my teachings.

plots: NONE
title: Begging for Death
objective: assassinate Narfi
description:
Go assassinate Narfi. He's a hapless beggar living in some ruins just outside the village of Ivarstead. Easy even for you.
You get to slaughter an emaciated beggar in cold blood. You are truly an opponent to be feared. I'll have your payment waiting for you.

plots: Ployer has cursed Jaheira: the curse might resist removal by normal means
all magic is regulated in Athkatla
Ployer spoke to Jaheira before: Ployer mentioned that he lived in squalor, and also mentioned Belgrade
title: Save Jaheira from Ployer's Curse
objective: break Jaheira's curse
tasks: ask about the mages in strange colors who were with Ployer
description:
Ployer! That... that fat excuse for a slaver, he's cursed me! Damn him! If the curse was tailored to me, it might resist removal by normal means. I doubt Ployer would have done this if the solution were simple.
I have a few options. Ployer mentioned that he lived in squalor, suggesting he may be in the poor section of the city. Not likely to find him quick though. The mages with him wore odd colors that might be traceable. Ask at the government building, as all magic is regulated in Athkatla. If they will talk... He also mentioned Belgrade, a merchant that helped expose Ployer. He frequents the Copper Coronet, and the bartender Bernard might know his whereabouts.
My very bones ache today. It is as though I age on the inside. Ohh, this cannot go on for long. We must remove this curse!

plots: Martin has deciphered one of the four items needed for the ritual needed to open a portal to Camoran's Paradise with the Mysterium Xarxes: the blood of a Daedra Lord
"Modern Heretics" is the best introduction to Daedric cults: the library here has a copy
the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will consume the physical form of the Daedric artifact
title: Blood of the Daedra
objective: acquire a Daedric artifact for Martin
tasks: locate one of the Daedric cults
description:
I've deciphered part of the ritual needed to open a portal to Camoran's Paradise.
The Mysterium Xarxes mentions four items needed for the ritual, but so far I have only deciphered one of them: the 'blood of a Daedra Lord'. In fact, Daedric artifacts are known to be formed from the essence of a Daedric Lord, from whence they derive their great power. Not an easy thing to come by, obviously, but we will need a Daedric artifact.
The only way to obtain a Daedric artifact is through the cults devoted to each of the Daedric Lords. The book "Modern Heretics" is the best introduction to Daedric cults. The library here has a copy if you need it.
Bring the artifact to me when you have acquired one. Remember, the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will consume the physical form of the artifact in order to release its Daedric power.

plots: Delvin sent the player to Erikur
Captain Volf neglected to honor a trade agreement between him and Erikur
title: The Dainty Sload
objective: frame Captain Volf by planting some contraband
tasks: get some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette
plant the Balmora Blue in Captain Volf's footlocker
description:
It's about time you got here. I'm not accustomed to dealing with people who are unreliable. That's why I asked Delvin to send me his best.
Nothing raises my ire more than having an agreement broken. It's bad for business and it wastes time. Captain Volf of the Dainty Sload has decided to test my patience on this matter by neglecting to honor a trade agreement we had established.
I need you to help me show him the error of his ways by sneaking on board the Sload and planting some contraband. You'll need to get your hands on some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette down by the docks. She's the first mate on another ship, the Red Wave.
Once you get your hands on it, I want you to plant it in Captain Volf's footlocker. I'll take care of the rest. Captain Volf is ashore right now and I want the authorities waiting for him when he gets back.
Now get going... I don't want to see your face until the job's done.

plots: Aldeth Sashenstar has been holed up in a cabin for several days
the savages threatened Aldeth Sashenstar and his friends to stop hunting
the savages killed Elban
title: Aldeth and the Group of Savages
objective: protect Aldeth Sashenstar and his friends from a group of savages
tasks: prepare for the savages' attack on Aldeth Sashenstar's cottage
description:
I am Aldeth Sashenstar. You must understand that at the moment, I'm under a terrible amount of stress.
You see, my dear friend, there is a group of uncouth savages that has declared their intention of killing my friends and me. I've been holed up in this cabin for several days and have lacked the wherewithal to try to make an escape.
My friends and I come here every year to do some sport hunting. This year however, a group of woodland savages threatened us with bodily harm if we did not stop our hunting trip. Being civilized men, we realized that it's well within our rights to hunt where we damn well please. After a few more days of hunting, the crass woodmen lost all pretense of humanity and murdered Elban, one of my oldest friends.
I'm sure that they plan to attack our cottage here, so we had best be prepared.

TESS710: Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil
TESS711: Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil
TESS714: Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil

plots: the player breached the inner sanctum of the Temple of Dibella and interrupted the Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil
title: The Heart of Dibella
objective: find a new Sybil for the Temple of Dibella
tasks: retrieve the new Sybil, a young girl
description:
You have committed a breach, and must pay the penalty. Normally, a quick death would be required. Luckily for you, there are more pressing matters.
The ceremony you so rudely interrupted was the Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil. I don't expect you to know what that means. Suffice to say that our Sybil was recently lost to us. Through the ceremony, we have seen the home of the next Sybil, to the north, in a small village pressed against the stone.
If you can travel there, and retrieve our young Sybil, your transgression will be forgiven. We believe the place in our vision to be Karthwasten. Now move quickly. The girl must be brought to the temple as soon as possible.
You, my dear, can earn the blessing of Dibella as your reward.

plots: NONE
title: A Sickly Brother
objective: deliver a note about Joric's health to Danica Pure-Spring
description:
My brother Joric is... sensitive. He has trouble focusing his attention on things.
We were taking him to the Temple of Kynareth in Whiterun, just so the healers could make sure he was in good health, and they say he's fine.
Are you heading to Whiterun? Could you take this letter to the priestess, Danica Pure-Spring? It's a note about Joric's health.

plots: the player, a member of the Dark Brotherhood, came to see Amaund Motierre after he had performed the Black Sacrament
Amaund Motierre wants to arrange several assassination contracts with the Dark Brotherhood, leading to the assassination of the emperor
Amaund Motierre gives the player two items: a sealed letter that will explain everything that needs to be done, and a valuable amulet - the player can use it to pay for any and all expenses
title: The Silence Has Been Broken
objective: accept Amaund Motierre's assassination contract
tasks: take the sealed letter and the valuable amulet to your superior in the Dark Brotherhood
description:
By the almighty Divines. You've come. You've actually come. This dreadful Black Sacrament thing... it worked.
Well, I won't waste your time. I would like to arrange a contract. Several, actually. I daresay, the work I'm offering has more significance than anything your organization has experienced in, well, centuries.
As I said, I want you to kill several people. You'll find the targets, as well as their manners of elimination, quite varied. I'm sure someone of your disposition will probably even find it enjoyable. But you should know that these killings are but a means to an end. For they pave the way to the most important target. The real reason I'm speaking with a cutthroat in the bowels of this detestable crypt. For I seek the assassination of... ...the Emperor.
What I ask is no small thing, of course. But you represent the Dark Brotherhood. This is... what you do? No? You must understand. So much has led to this day. So much planning, and maneuvering. Now, it's as if the very stars have finally aligned. But I digress. Here, take these two items. They need to be delivered to your, um... superior. The sealed letter will explain everything that needs to be done. The amulet is quite valuable - you can use it to pay for any and all expenses.

plots: Martin has everything in place for the Mysterium Xarxes: Martin will open the portal whenever the player is ready
the portal Martin creates through the Mysterium Xarxes will close behind the player: the player will have to find another way back
Mankar Camoran acts as the "anchor" for Paradise, just as a sigil stone anchors an Oblivion Gate in place
title: Paradise
objective: kill Mankar Camoran to unmake his Paradise, and retrieve the Amulet of Kings
tasks: travel through Martin's portal to Mankar Camoran's Paradise
description:
I have everything in place for the ritual. I'll open the portal whenever you're ready. I don't know what you'll find in Camoran's Paradise. I do know the portal I create through the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will close behind you. You'll have to find another way back.
I believe that Mankar Camoran acts as the "anchor" for Paradise, just as a sigil stone anchors an Oblivion Gate in place. Kill Mankar Camoran, and you will unmake his Paradise.
Farewell, my friend. Our fate is in your hands. Bring back the Amulet of Kings. Brace yourself.

plots: Shalidor holed himself up in Labyrinthian, and devoted all of his time to research and study
title: Shalidor's Insights
objective: bring the writings of Shalidor to Urag gro-Shub
description:
Have you ever heard of Shalidor? Immensely powerful mage, back in the First Era. Had an understanding of magic few have ever matched. He holed himself up in Labyrinthian, and devoted all of his time to research and study. Wrote more than you would imagine possible.
Since then, his writings have been scattered all over Skyrim, but are little use to anyone who can't translate them. I'm one of the few who can. I'm always trying to find more of Shalidor's writings.
I've heard whispers of more of his work having turned up. If you can track it down, it may prove useful to all of us.

plots: Mr. Colquetle's son and his wife traveled away and went missing
title: Colquetle's Family
objective: find out what happened to Mr. Colquetle's son and his wife
tasks: find Mr. Colquetle's son and his wife
description:
What cruel whim of the fates controls this torment of me?!
I, Mr. Colquetle, have heard nothing from my son and his wife for nigh unto a week now, and all else pales in importance until I do. I should have known better than to allow his travel in these dangerous times.

plots: NONE
title: Proven Paranoia
objective: assassinate Ennodius Papius
description:
Ennodius Papius lives just outside Anga's Mill, in the woods. He was once the miller. Now Papius is just a paranoid recluse who thinks someone is out to get him. And he's right.
You will assassinate him and prove his paranoia legitimate.

plots: 5 followers of Azura slew Dratik and its vampire kin: the 5 followers of Azura were infected with vampirism and sealed themselves in the Gutted Mine
title: Azura's Unfortunate Followers
objective: perform a service to Azura
description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Azura, known as the Queen of Dawn and Dusk.
I have seen your name, traveler, and heard it whispered in twilight. I ask a service, which holds promise of fame and reward.
Many years ago, five followers of mine slew the vampire Dratik and its kin, but all were infected by the foul creature. Knowing their fate, they sealed themselves up in the vampire's lair. Their suffering weighs heavily on me. Five bright candles shall burn forever in memory of their sacrifice.
Travel to the Gutted Mine. The door will open to you. Bring the peace of death to my followers, and you shall earn my gratitude. For your service, you shall have my Star, that your deeds might be entered in the Book of Fate.

plots: NONE
title: Fahrington's Scroll
objective: return Fahrington's scroll of wisdom to him
tasks: find the tasloi holding Fahrington's scroll of wisdom
description:
I am Fahrington.
A tasloi has stolen my scroll of wisdom, wanderer, and fled eastward towards the ettercap's lair. The poor tasloi is probably quite dead by now but the ettercaps, of course, will not recognize the scroll's value.
If you could retrieve it for me, I promise to brighten your karma.

plots: in Bleaker's Way, two families, Nord and Dunmer, live in perfect harmony
don't get caught or killed while starting the feud
title: Mephala's Web of Lies
objective: Start a feud between two prominent families
tasks: kill the leaders of the two families and plant evidence to implicate the other family as the killer
description:
I'm Mephala. Call me 'Webspinner'. Pluck but a single thread, and the weave unravels.
In Bleaker's Way, two families, Nord and Dunmer, live in perfect harmony. But beneath the surface lurks the secret seed of strife. Kill the leaders of the two families. Plant evidence to implicate the other family as the killer. And don't get caught. Be cunning. Don't spoil my scheme. And don't die... that would spoil everything. Ha-ha-ha-hah!
And there'll be a little needle to help you stitch your own tangled tapestries: the Ebony Blade.

plots: NONE
title: A Shattered Visage Lies
objective: help the Faceless King reunite the Zeraphi and Ezrohir
tasks: find the Royal Masks, and bring them to the Faceless King
description:
I am called the Faceless King, and I have resided here since the Zeraphi and Ezrohir were one race. I was their king. It has been my dream to reunite them by accessing the Vault of Souls, but the Vault will not open without the masks of the royal line, which were stolen from me ages ago.
If you can locate the Royal Masks and return them to me, I can unlock the Vault of Souls, and reunite the Zeraphi and Ezrohir! Please, my mortal friend... help me end this war.

plots: Ahjazda is the only one who sees the approaching storm
title: The Coming Storm
objective: help Ahjazda prepare for the coming storm
tasks: bring the Amulet of Disintegration, the Ring of Desiccation, and the Calming Pants to Ahjazda
description:
So much to gather, so little time. Perhaps you can help? You might help against the coming storm.
It's coming. I, Ahjazda, think I'm the only one who sees it, though. And I'm going to be ready. Oh, yes. I'll be ready. I've been stockpiling supplies. Things I'll need to ride it out... or survive when they come for me.
I've been gathering things for quite a while, but there are still a few I'm missing. Perhaps you'd bring them to me? I still need the Amulet of Disintegration, the Ring of Desiccation, and, of course, the Calming Pants. Must have the Calming Pants. Bring these to me, and I will reward you well. Ahjazda has many, many things.
Let me teach you a special spell, Ahjazda's Paranoia, after you return with the items. It will affect all those around you. You might find it handy to cause confusion in your enemies. You know... when the time comes.

plots: Kodlak's final teaching: those with beastblood cannot enter Sovngarde
the player has a head of the Glenmoril that is needed to cure lycanthropy
title: Purity
objective: handle Vilkas' personal troubles
tasks: help Vilkas give up his beastblood
description:
There is always work for the Companions. But there is more personal task before me.
Kodlak's final teaching is troubling me. I think he was right about beastblood and Sovngarde. I wish to cleanse myself that I might know glory in the afterlife.
Will you help me give up my beasthood? You still bear a head of the Glenmoril betrayers, yes? Then lead on, back to the Tomb of Ysgramor.
My soul is now prepared.

plots: there are guards on the streets: there's been a string of killings
the murderer has been killing paupers, sometimes in the alley where they sleep
the murderer flays his victims alive
title: Solve the "Skinner" Murders
objective: bring information about the murders to Lieutenant Aegisfield
description:
I'm Lieutenant Aegisfield. I'm warning everyone so as to get the word out that there are guards on the streets. We've had a... a string of killings, and I don't want any more happening.
Bandits I can understand; they are easy enough to figure out. What's happening here is... it's murder, but not like I've ever seen. There's a disgustingly sick person out there, and I simply don't have the manpower to protect everyone. He's been killing paupers, sometimes in the alley where they sleep. They have nothing to take. He kills them and that is all. Not only is it pointless, but he does it in as painful a way as possible. It's... it's sick. He flays them... alive. There has been blood all over the area.
I must go about my rounds. If you find any information about the murders, be sure to let me know. Don't go looking for trouble though.

plots: NONE
title: Thane of Winterhold
objective: gain the honorary title of thane of Winterhold
description:
There is room in my court for a new Thane. It's an honorary title, mainly, but there are a few perks someone like you could make use of.
However, I could only grant the title to someone who is known throughout my Hold.
You help my people, and I'll make you my Thane.

plots: the player read "The Aetherium Wars"
title: Lost to the Ages
objective: search for the Aetherium Forge with Katria
tasks: find Katria's journal, which contains her notes about the Aetherium Forge
description:
The name's Katria. I am - was - an adventurer. Raided ruins like this for nigh on twenty years. I was on the trail of something big. It led me here, and... I didn't make it.
Oh. You read the book, didn't you? "The Aetherium Wars"? It was my theory, you know. My research. My life's work. All of it, lost! Stolen by my own damn apprentice! That's how I ended up here. I can't rest. Not until I find the Aetherium Forge, until I can prove that it was my discovery. Mine, not his!
Hmm... well, you can pick up where I left off. My notes should still be in my journal, if you can read it. We still have to find the Forge itself. I had a lead on that, too.

plots: Baldor Iron-Shaper is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim
Deor Woodcutter saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them in the woods on the day Baldor Iron-Shaper disappeared: the elves went south and west
title: A New Source of Stalhrim
objective: find Baldor Iron-Shaper
tasks: search for any sign of Baldor
description:
I am in no mood to talk, outsider. One of the Skaal has gone missing. It is Baldor Iron-Shaper. As our only smith, Baldor is very important to the village.
Baldor is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim. It is an art we Skaal hold sacred. If someone wanted to make such weapons, they would have to get that knowledge from Baldor.
I did see something in the woods on the day he disappeared. I saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them. Hunters often visit our lands, so I thought little of it.
The elves went south and west. If your road takes you that way, perhaps you could search for any sign of Baldor. The Skaal would be grateful.

BG1124: Landrin's house in Beregost, west of the Jovial Juggler Inn
BG1126: Landrin's house in Beregost, west of the Jovial Juggler Inn

plots: Landrin gives the player antidote potions against poison
title: Landrin's Possessions
objective: deal with the spider infestation in Landrin's cellar
tasks: kill spiders, and fetch Landrin's husband's boots and Landrin's bottle of wine
description:
Hey, I'm Landrin.
I've got an infestation of poisonous spiders in my cellar in Beregost. You'll know the house when you see it: just to the west of the Jovial Juggler Inn.
Here, take these potions with you. They're antidotes against the poison.
Keep whatever you don't use and I'll give you an extra 120 gold pieces if you bring back my husband's old boots that he keeps down there. If you bring back one of their bodies and my ol' bottle of wine as well, I might toss in a little something extra too.

plots: the player looks at the Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
Dwemer blood can unlock the Dwemer lockbox: the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer, can be used instead
title: Discerning the Transmundane
objective: uncover the secrets of the mysterious Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
tasks: gather the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer with an extractor Septimus Signus gives you
description:
You see this masterwork of the Dwemer. Deep inside their greatest knowings. Septimus is clever among men, but he is but an idiot child compared to the dullest of the Dwemer.
To harness it is to know. The fundaments. The Dwemer lockbox hides it from me. I see it now. The sealing structure interlocks in the tiniest fractals. Dwemer blood can loose the hooks, but none alive remain to bear it. A panoply of their brethren could gather to form a facsimile. A trick. Something they didn't anticipate, no, not even them.
The blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer. The elves still living provide the key. Bear you hence this extractor. It will drink the fresh blood of elves. Come when its set is complete.

plots: several mages tend the grove
title: A Mage's Staff
objective: complete your induction into the Mages Guild by creating your own staff
tasks: speak to Zahrasha or Eletta, and choose wisely
description:
Before you can begin work for the guild, you'll need to do something for yourself. Every mage carries a staff. It is crafted and enchanted by the guild, and is a symbol of status. You need such a staff.
The wood used for staves comes from a grove to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave. Several mages tend to the grove, and should be able to assist you. Speak with either Zahrasha or Eletta when you arrive.
And choose wisely.

plots: someone opened a secret gate into Saradush: the enemy came through a small sewer outlet that was protected by both a locked iron grate and several powerful magical wards
the Saradush guard found three soldiers in the area: Mateo, Ardic Santele, and Kiser Jhaeri
Countess Santele told the Saradush guard that Ardic Santele had implicated Mateo before Ardic Santele disappeared
the jailer will let the player see Mateo
title: Justice for Mateo
objective: discover the real traitor
description:
My name is Captain Samand, and I'm a very busy man right now.
A few days ago, someone opened a secret gate into the town — Saradush could easily have been overrun. We just discovered the traitor was a young man named Mateo. There's no doubt in my mind that *someone* betrayed us. The enemy came through a small sewer outlet that was protected by both a locked iron grate and several powerful magical wards. There is no way to open that entrance from the outside. But Mateo is a faithful soldier, not the type of man to betray Saradush.
An alarm was raised, and my soldiers arrived only a few moments after the gate was opened. We found three soldiers in the area: Mateo, Ardic Santele, and the merchant Kiser Jhaeri. We didn't get a chance to complete our investigations. Ardic, the son of the Countess Santele, disappeared. He was our primary witness. Our attention was focused on the vile Kiser Jhaeri, but we had no proof. Then the countess told us that Ardic, her son, had implicated Mateo before he disappeared.
If you wish to investigate further, I will not stand in your way. Speak to Mateo in his cell. The jailer will let you see him.

plots: the player is a vampire
Falion has considered becoming a vampire himself, but that would endanger Agni
title: Rising at Dawn
objective: return to Falion with a filled black soul gem, and he will perform a vampirism cure ritual
tasks: get a black soul gem, and fill it by killing someone
description:
I know many things. I have studied things beyond the reach of most humans, traveled the other planes, seen things one should not see.
I have met gods and long-dead races of people and everything in between and I know enough to see a vampire where others would see a man. I met several of your kind during my studies of life-extending magics. I even considered becoming a vampire myself. In the end, vampirism would endanger my ward Agni which would defeat the intended purpose.
It is possible to cure vampirism. I know of a ritual but I've never performed it. It requires a filled black soul gem. You will need to kill someone. When you have a gem and have filled it return to me and I will perform the ritual. I will bring life to your dead body, vampire.

plots: Noster Eagle-Eye tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble: he lost his helmet in one of the old caves
title: Noster's Lost Helmet
objective: retrieve Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet for him
description:
I'm Noster Eagle-Eye. I was the finest scout in the Imperial Legion, once. Tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble.
Lost my helmet in one of the old caves. My pretty, pretty helmet. Life just got worse after that. Kept losing things. So many things....
Oh, could you find that helmet for me? I sure would love to have it again. Could show you some of my old scouting tricks.

plots: NONE
title: Boethiah's Calling
objective: get a glimpse of Boethiah
tasks: gain someone's trust, lead him to the shrine above, instruct him to touch the pillar of sacrifice to trap him, and kill him with the ceremonial blade
description:
We are forged by Boethiah's example. We carve our will upon the world through our tongues and our blades. You? You are nothing. An empty vapor, dispersed by the slightest breeze.
If you desire a glimpse of Boethiah, our Dark Mistress, then this is what you must do. First, prove your tongue can wield a lie. Find someone. Gain his trust. Lead him to the shrine above. Next, instruct your thrall to touch the Pillar of Sacrifice. Its magic will ensnare him, rendering him helpless. Then, girded with certitude, plant the ceremonial blade deeply, so that the waters of his heart wash over you.
If your will is strong enough, it will stir Boethiah in her Dark Mansion, and she will appear before us.

plots: the player asked Neloth if he has found more Black Books
the Black Book might contain the final secrets of Xarxes
title: Lost Knowledge
objective: retrieve a Black Book so that Neloth can make a copy of it
description:
Yes. Hermaeus Mora is devious, but then so am I. Now, it's only a rumor of a whisper of a conjecture. But I think this is the place. Benkongerike. One of the Books is hidden there.
Now, hurry and find that Black Book. That Book might contain the final secrets of Xarxes, for all we know. I'll just make a copy for myself. It's far too dangerous to carry the real Black Book around.
Of course, I'm sure you can handle yourself. Of course you can. You can keep the original Black Book.

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #1" is addressed to the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
title: Affairs of a Wizard
objective: assassinate Celedaen
tasks: search for Celedaen's written records that may contain evidence of some kind of weakness of his
description:
Dead Drop Orders #1
by Lucien Lachance

Silencer,
You are now reading your first dead drop note, here on Hero Hill, which proves to me you were well-appointed to the tasks that lie ahead.
Journey now to Leafrot Cave. There you will encounter an ancient necromancer who is attempting to escape death by transforming himself into a lich. This necromancer, Celedaen, has not yet completed his metamorphosis, but is still immensely powerful, possibly too powerful to destroy if confronted directly. Search Leafrot Cave. Necromancers are wizards after all, and wizards are prolific by nature. Celedaen surely has written records, and these records may contain evidence of some kind of weakness. Perhaps there is some other way to destroy Celedaen besides a direct confrontation. But destroy him you must!
When the necromancer lies dead, journey to the city of Chorrol for your next dead drop. At the foot of the Great Oak, hidden in the bushes, is an old sack. Inside you will find your reward for killing the necromancer, as well as information regarding your next contract.
Serve me well, Silencer, and there's no telling just how far you might advance.

plots: the miners need medicines to combat the ore dust
title: A Bad Cough
objective: deliver a message about medicines for miners to Quintus
description:
This mine is only a few years old, but I've been digging up ore for over a century.
We're getting to the point where the tunnels are getting deep into the rock. People complain of bad coughs and foul air. I've seen this before. We need some medicines to combat the ore dust. I was about to send a message to Windhelm for aid.
Could you deliver that message on my behalf? Take it to Quintus, in the White Phial.

plots: NONE
title: The Elven Maiden
objective: steal a bust of Llathasa Indarys, and bring it back to Armand Christophe
tasks: ask the beggars where to find the bust of Llathasa Indarys
description:
The Guild has received a 'request' to obtain a unique statuette. It is a bust of Llathasa Indarys, the recently slain Countess of Cheydinhal. You will be paid a modest sum. Do you want this job?
Travel to Cheydinhal, and ask the beggars for more information about the bust.
Bring it back to me once you have it.

BG1249: the badlands to the south of Beregost
BG1250: the badlands to the south of Beregost

plots: NONE
title: Zhurlong's Missing Boots
objective: return Zhurlong's Boots of Stealth to their owner
tasks: find the hobgoblins who stole Zhurlong's Boots of Stealth
description:
Hey, I'm Zhurlong! What is a thief to do, huh? You invest in some Boots of Stealth, you set up shop in the badlands to the south of Beregost and then, WHAM... Along comes a tribe of hobgoblins and they tear the boots from right off your feet!
Damn-blasted hobgoblin bullies... I'll pay you 100 gold pieces to show them who's boss and get those boots back...

plots: the Gray Fox himself hunts for the "Lost Histories of Tamriel"
title: Lost Histories
objective: help Theranis bring back the "Lost Histories of Tamriel", or bring it yourself if Theranis is unwilling or unable
tasks: find Theranis who was sent to find "Lost Histories of Tamriel"
description:
We meet again. I have need of a very special book, the "Lost Histories of Tamriel".
The cat burglar Theranis was sent hunting in Skingrad for this book. However, Theranis has not been seen since. The Gray Fox himself hunts for this book.
I need you to find Theranis. Help Theranis bring back this book. If Theranis is unwilling or unable, bring back the book yourself.
Go to Skingrad. The trail starts there.

plots: the player brought a power source to Professor Stoker: it is completely drained
title: The Sundered Battlefield
objective: recharge the power source, and return to Professor Stoker to install the power source in the automaton
tasks: find the Emberworks on the far side of the Sundered Battlefield
description:
Oh, no... I was afraid of this! The Power Source is completely drained! This is going to be more difficult than I'd anticipated. This is only a minor setback. We knew about these Power Sources from our explorations of the Emberworks, on the far side of the Sundered Battlefield. We found machines there that the ancient dwarves once used to craft them. If you can reach the Emberworks, it should be child's play to recharge it.
You'll have to make your way through Rivenskull Pass to reach the battlefield. Once you've charged the Power Source, come back here, and we'll install it in the Automaton.

plots: the Gray Fox has worked for eleven years planning this final heist: Savilla's Stone provided the last bit of information he needed
the Elder Scrolls are kept in the Imperial Palace behind a door that cannot be breached: the player will take the Old Way instead
the Gray Fox gives the player the key for the gate to the section of the sewers housing the Old Way
the Gray Fox gives the player the Boots of Springheel Jak, and the Arrow of Extrication: the player needs them to overcome the obstacles in the Old Way
in the reading room, the blind priests will deliver a scroll to the player thinking that the player is Celia Camoran if the player does not speak to them
the Gray Fox will pay the bloodprice for anyone the player kills during this heist, but he cannot stop the Watch from putting a price on the player's head
the Gray Fox has written the player a book with instructions
title: The Ultimate Heist
objective: steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace
tasks: locate the Old Way and use it to travel to the Imperial Palace
description:
This is the big one. This is the heist that will be written about and talked about for decades to come. We are going to steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace. Are you ready for this challenge?
There is no buyer. This is for glory, not for money. Our names will become legend. I also have a personal need for this particular scroll. As for your compensation, I ask you to trust me. If my plan works, you will get a reward worth far more than mere money.
I have worked for eleven years planning this heist. Savilla's Stone provided the last bit of information I needed. The Elder Scrolls are kept in the Imperial Palace behind a door that cannot be breached. Savilla's Stone has revealed a path around this door. You will have to travel the Old Way. Once used as an escape route for Imperial Emperors, it has been forgotten for centuries.
The Old Way can be found in the Imperial Sewers. Here is the key for the gate to that section of the sewers. My scrying with Savilla's Stone has provided clues, but not the details. I know the tools you will need there, but not the obstacles themselves. The Boots of Springheel Jak will allow you to leap to an unreachable place. They will also protect you from a long fall. The Arrow of Extrication is the only way to unlock the final door. Take them both.
Once you are inside the Palace itself, you need to find the reading room. The blind priests will deliver a scroll to you there. I arranged for the notable Celia Camoran to want to read a particular Elder Scroll. Don't ask how. However, she will be... unavoidably detained. You will take her place. Do not speak to the priests. They are blindfolded and will not realize it isn't her unless you speak. As the guildmaster, I am waiving bloodprice for anyone you kill during this heist. However, I can't stop the Watch from putting a price on your head.
I have written it all down for you in this book. I've chosen you because you are the best. Good luck.

BG286: the skin dancer's lair north of the east gate, in a walled-off section of town with an orange pavilion
BG287: the skin dancer's lair north of the east gate, in a walled-off section of town with an orange pavilion

plots: NONE
title: Hunt the Skin Dancer with Darsidian Moor
objective: help Darsidian Moor kill a skin dancer
description:
I am Darsidian Moor, and I hunt a creature known as the skin dancer, a man-like beast without true flesh of its own.
I must follow the leads I have found here and confront this creature once and for all. Will you aid me in killing this creature of evil?
The skin dancer's lair is just north of the east gate, in a walled-off section of town with an orange pavilion. I intend to travel ahead and scout out the area.
Meet me there as soon as possible... I could certainly use your aid.

plots: Dengeir of Stuhn thinks that Lod wrote a letter to General Tullius
title: Imperial Spy?
objective: give Lod's letter to Dengeir of Stuhn
description:
There's a plot. Not against me. Against all of Falkreath. Those Imperial bastards are spying on every one of us.
Last night I saw Lod the blacksmith writing a letter. Probably sending word to Solitude and General Tullius. Are you loyal to Skyrim? Break into Lod's house and get that letter.
The Empire is probably making Lod smith up more swords and armor for them.

plots: NONE
title: Trouble in Eastmarch
objective: take care of the bandits troubling farmers
description:
There's some trouble in Eastmarch. Farmers getting troubled by some bad types who've built up a stronghold in the area.
There's nothing but a bunch of lowly bandits. Cowards, who will take little effort.
Take care of them. Do not spare them your blade.

plots: the player is an adventurer
title: Erik the Adventurer
objective: help Erik become an adventurer
tasks: convince Mralki buy armor for Erik
description:
You look like you've seen your share of adventure. I envy you that. In fact, maybe you can help me with something.
I want to be an adventurer like you, but my father says I can't. He says that he needs me to stay here and work the farm, and even if he did let me be an adventurer, we couldn't afford to buy armor. His name's Mralki, and he's the innkeeper here. I hope you can change my father's mind. He can be a little stubborn.
I can't stand the thought of being trapped in this village for the rest of my days.

plots: NONE
title: The Forsworn Conspiracy
objective: investigate the attack market in the market
tasks: find out why Margret was attacked, and who is behind the Forsworn
description:
I'm sorry to drag you into Markarth's problems, but after that attack in the market, I'm running out of time.
You want answers? Well so do I. So does everyone in this city. A man goes crazy in the market. Everyone knows he's a Forsworn agent. Guards do nothing. Nothing but clean up the mess.
This has been going on for years. And all I've been able to find is murder and blood. I need help. Please. You find out why that woman Margret was attacked, who's behind the Forsworn, and I'll pay you for any information you bring me.

plots: Risa does not talk much since the death of her parents
title: Locate a Caretaker for Risa
objective: do something to help Risa
description:
I am Dawnlord Arenthis of the church of Lathander... excuse my young charge. Risa doesn't talk much since the recent death of her parents.
There is very little that can be done for her as well... other than to put her into an orphanage, I suppose. She is so shy and sad, though, I am sure it will do her no good.
If only there were someone who would care for her. Might you know of someone who would make a suitable guardian?

plots: Farkas will answer the player's questions about the Companions
title: Proving Honor
objective: complete your trial of claiming a fragment of Wuuthrad
tasks: claim another fragment of Wuuthrad with Farkas
description:
We have something special for you this time.
Last week a scholar came to us. He said he knew where we could find another fragment of Wuuthrad. He seemed a fool to me, but if he's right, the honor of the Companions demands that we seek it out in Dustman's Cairn.
This is a simple errand, but the time is right for it to be your Trial. Carry yourself with honor, and you'll become a true Companion. Farkas will be your Shield-Sibling on this venture, whelp. He'll answer any questions you have.
Try not to disappoint. Or to get Farkas killed.

plots: the player lured Odahviing to Dragonsreach and took him prisoner: the player distrust Odahviing
title: The World-Eater's Eyrie
objective: fly to Skuldafn on Odahviing and face Alduin
description:
It was you that lured me here and took me prisoner... I have done nothing to earn your distrust.
Wisdom sees the doorway. It would be wise to recognize when you only have one choice. You can trust me. I am not treacherous. Alduin has proven himself unworthy to rule. I go my own way now. He has traveled to Sovngarde to regain his strength, devouring the souls of the mortal dead. A privilege he jealously guards... His door to Sovngarde is at Skuldafn, one of his ancient fanes high in the eastern mountains. I surely do not need to warn you that all his remaining strength is marshaled there.
Free me, and I will carry you to Skuldafn so that you can face Alduin in battle. I warn you, once you've flown the skies, your envy of the dragons will only increase.

plots: Guardian of the Wild fears that the Alchemist uses the power of the Guardians to open a portal to the Nether Realm, plunging the world into eternal chaos
title: Return to the Enclave
objective: stop the Alchemist before he can drain the two Guardians in the Ossean Wastes
tasks: talk to Commander Vale about getting to the Ossean Wastes
description:
I fear the Alchemist is a pawn of the Netherim. With the power of the Guardians, a portal to the Nether Realm could be thrown wide, and the world would be plunged into an age of never-ending torment.
Return to the Enclave immediately. Commander Vale can help you secure passage to the Ossean Wastes, where two of my fellow Guardians can be found. Stop the Alchemist before he can drain them as well!

plots: Falk Firebeard thinks that checking out the Wolfskull Cave is not worth his time with the war going on
title: The Man Who Cried Wolf
objective: investigate the reports of strange happenings near Wolfskull Cave
description:
There have been reports of weird happenings near Wolfskull Cave. Travelers disappearing, odd lights. I suspect wild animals or perhaps bandits.
The cave has a bad history. Long ago, Potema the Wolf Queen used it for necromantic rituals. That's where it got the name. That was over 500 years ago. Nothing much down there now - but everyone's always convinced the cave is haunted.
I don't think it's worth our time with the war going on, but if you want to clear out the cave, I'll make sure you're repaid for your work.

plots: the Thieves Guild gets rid of people without killing them, unlike the Dark Brotherhood
title: The Shill Job
objective: frame Carlotta Valentia to get her out of the way
tasks: place an item as evidence inside Carlotta Valentia's home
description:
When a client needs us to eliminate another, we don't operate like the Dark Brotherhood. We find alternate means to get them out of the way.
We send you to plant some phony evidence in the mark's house, and then tip off the town guard... the rest takes care of itself. Sound like you can handle it?
Go place an item as evidence inside Carlotta Valentia's home. She must have ticked-off our client badly. The client's impatient and keeps asking if the job's done. Can you get him off my back?

plots: Ragefast imprisoned Ragefast's nymph in Ragefast's house
title: A Nymph for Ramazith
objective: free Ragefast's nymph and bring her to Ramazith
description:
Greetings to you and yours, my friend. I'm Ramazith.
Might I have your ear a moment? My proposition is thus: I would have you enter into the home of a colleague of mine and effect the release of a creature he has imprisoned there. Ragefast be his name, and he has in his possession one of the most beautiful and useful creatures in all of Faerûn. It's a nymph he captured some time ago, and I know not what laughable plans he has for her, but I am sure she be more... productive in my care.
I not so rich as to be able to offer huge gold, but as competent wizard I do have the odd magical item of worth. Perhaps an enchanted item will serve your needs, no?

plots: the player is Higgold's patron
the Turmish fanatics are not permitting the play: the dress rehearsal is supposed to be tomorrow
title: Barbarians Have Invaded the Theatre
objective: do something about the Turmish fanatics
description:
Ah! Patron! This is unbelievable! There are... a group of Turmish fanatics in the playhouse! They have taken it over!
They charged in and scared the cast to death yelling nonsense about not permitting the play! They said they would sooner burn the playhouse than allow the show! And the dress rehearsal is supposed to be tomorrow! Gah! Patron, you've got to do something! Stop them, please!

plots: the player asked Neloth whether they could help with his research
title: Experimental Subject
objective: help Neloth by being a test subject in his experiment
tasks: stand still and let Neloth cast an experimental spell on you
description:
You want to help with my research? Are you willing to be an experimental subject?
Oh, it's nothing too dangerous. The experiment should provide an additional spectral tether from your own lifespark to the divine realm. You would experience it as a sort of... increased vigor. You would fight longer, feel stronger, that sort of thing. At least I think it will. Probably. Almost certainly. Of course, you never can tell.
Now stand still... it's my first time casting this spell, and I don't need any additional distractions.

plots: NONE
title: Branwen Rescued
objective: unpetrify Branwen
tasks: buy a Stone to Flesh scroll from Zeke for 500 gold
description:
Come one, come all! Zeke's got something to show you!
Take a look at the stone warrior maiden. How long has she been trapped in this petrified form, no one knows! Be the first to learn, for the mere price of 500 gold. For that small amount of money, I shall give you a magic scroll, and with this scroll you can release the maiden from her stone prison. Think of the gratitude she would feel to her saviors. Perhaps she's a princess from some far-off land, or maybe a powerful sorceress in search of a concubine. You can't afford not to know!
Buy the scroll!

TESS918: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella
TESS919: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella
TESS920: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella
TESS921: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella
TESS922: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella

plots: when Haelga sleeps with a man, Haelga gives the man a Mark of Dibella
title: Caught Red Handed
objective: help Svana Far-Shield embarrass Haelga
tasks: gather 3 Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn, and confront Haelga with the Marks of Dibella
description:
I hate Haelga! It's everything about her. She's disgusting. I think she takes her worship of Dibella a bit too seriously.
Do you know she's slept with three different men in the last month alone? What kind of a woman would do such a thing? Just for once, I'd like to see her squirm... to rub her nose in it.
Actually, there is a way to do this, but I don't think I could get away with doing it. She'd kill me if she found out. You see, I happen to know after she makes love, she gives her partner a token of her affection called a Mark of Dibella. If you confront her with three of the Marks of Dibella, she'd be so embarrassed... well, I don't know what she'd do!
Oh, this is going to be great! You need to get the Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn. Not sure how you're going to do that, but try your best. Then just confront Haelga with them and the rest works itself out.

plots: Francois Motierre is waiting for the player inside his house: the player should not kill him
Francois Motierre's debtors have sent an enforcer to kill him
Vicente Valtieri gives the player a knife: the blade has been coated with Languorwine, and there's only enough Languorwine for slicing Francois Motierre
Vicente Valtieri will give the player a vial of antidote, which will be used to revive Francois Motierre after the player successfully stages his death
title: The Assassinated Man
objective: help Francois Motierre fake his death to escape his debts
description:
I, Vicente Valtieri, have a special contract that needs fulfillment. In truth. I don't wish to offer it to any other guild member. I've come to rely on your abilities.
We're usually called upon to take a life, but not this time. This contract requires us to stage the assassination of a marked man.
You must go to the city of Chorrol and break into the house of Francois Motierre. Inside you will find Motierre waiting for you. Do not kill him! You see, Francois Motierre is a marked man. He owes a considerable sum to the wrong kind of people. So, they have sent an enforcer to kill him. This is an unusual contract, Motierre had to make a special arrangement with us before it was approved. I trust in your professionalism.
Here, take this knife. The blade has been coated with a rare poison called Languorwine. One drop in a normal human bloodstream will mimic the effects of death immediately. I will provide you with a vial of antidote, which will be used to revive Francois Motierre after you successfully stage his death. You should also know that there's only enough Languorwine on the blade for this one contract. After Motierre is sliced, the knife will be useless.
As payment, I'll be pleased to award you this amulet, Cruelty's Heart.

plots: NONE
title: Drienne's Cat
objective: bring Pixie to Drienne
description:
I'm just a little girl Drienne.
Mommy says if you ever need to know something important, you should ask an adult. Pixie, my cat, she was playing close to the waterfall and slipped... I hope she's all right.
You can have this scroll Daddy gave me, if you find Pixie. I can't read the words yet anyways.

plots: Kodlak said that werewolves can't be good Nords
Aela said a Hagraven's head is needed to cure lycanthropy
title: Sanctity
objective: cure Farkas' lycanthropy
tasks: get a special Hagraven's head with Farkas
description:
There is always work. My mind is someplace else, though.
I think that maybe Kodlak was right. As a werewolf, I can't be a good Nord. I want to be clean, like he was, and go to Sovngarde when I finally die.
Aela said we would need a Hagraven's head. I already have one of them, but she said it was a special kind. And that you knew where to get more.
Let's go find one!

plots: Cindiri Arano sent the Folio to the First Edition to be rebound: they sent it back on the Strident Squall
title: First Edition
objective: locate a Folio for Cindiri Arano
description:
A few months ago, I had sent an important Folio to the First Edition to be rebound. They sent it back to me recently, but it never arrived.
The Folio was aboard the "Strident Squall" or something like that. The damn thing sunk right off the coast of Solstheim. Can you imagine? One of the sailors survived. Poor thing crawled all the way to Raven Rock on his hands and knees. Before he died, he told the guard about the wreck and warned us that it was going to be crawling with reavers.
Could you find the Folio for me? You have no idea how much it hurts losing such a precious item!

TESO103: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin
TESO105: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin

plots: the player has passed the gauntlet unlike others in three hundred years: the player can redeem the souls of the ghost knights and restore their order
Sir Ralvas placed his own will and lust for fame over the will of the Nine
Sir Ralvas failed the challenge of Zenithar: the inscription for the challenge says to "walk in the faith"
the player must pray at the shrine of Saint Kaladas to receive a vision: the player will see the Mace of Zenithar, separated from them by a great chasm
Sir Ralvas fell from the platform each time he tried to cross the chasm
title: The Path of the Righteous
objective: retrieve the Mace of Zenithar for yourself
description:
You have my, Sir Ralvas', tribute, sir knight. In three hundred years, none have passed the gauntlet. In three hundred years, we have never known hope. But for the first time, it seems that someone may succeed where we have failed. I see in you the chance to redeem our souls and restore the order. And now, I must ask you to press forward where I could not. I must ask you to face the challenge of Zenithar.
I was arrogant and foolhardy. I sought personal glory. I placed my own will and my own lust for fame over the will of the Nine. In facing the challenge of Zenithar, I failed. I tried dozens -- no, hundreds of times to reach the Mace. I fell each time. And each time I awoke in the chapel, I leaped again. I tried to enlist the help of the other knights, but none would come to my aid. The inscription says to "walk in the faith" but even now, I do not know what this means.
Below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin there is a shrine to the great craftsman, Saint Kaladas. Those seeking the Mace must pray before the shrine. When you bow, you will receive a vision -- or perhaps not. It is unclear. The priests saw that my body never moved, but it felt so real. You will see the Mace of Zenithar, separated from you by a great chasm. The chasm represents your doubt. Your faith must be your guide across it.
This is what I know. As I said, my faith was weak. I did not understand the test and I fell from the platform each time I tried to cross. I have told you all that I know. All that is left is for you to prove yourself more worthy than I. If you seek the Mace, travel to Leyawiin's chapel, kneel at the shrine in the undercroft, and let your faith in the Nine be the salvation of us all.

plots: just outside of the Imperial Prison is a grating that leads to the sewers: it has recently been tightly locked, but Vicente Valtieri will provide a key
title: Scheduled for Execution
objective: assassinate Valen Dreth in the Imperial Prison
tasks: infiltrate the Imperial Prison via a set of secret tunnels
description:
Back for more? It just so happens I have another contract available, one that requires an expert in infiltration.
Ever broken out of jail? How do you feel about breaking into one? The Imperial Prison, to be exact. We need a prisoner... silenced. Can you do it?
Your target is a Dark Elf named Valen Dreth. He thinks he's safe in prison. He is tragically mistaken. A prisoner recently escaped from the prison, using a set of secret tunnels connecting to the Imperial City's sewer system. It's a perfect way inside. Just outside of the Imperial Prison is a grating that leads to the sewers. It has recently been tightly locked, but I will provide a key. It should be easy enough to locate Dreth in his small cell. Besides, I think you know the way, hmmm. He he he he he.
Valen Dreth has been imprisoned for many years. His tongue is sharp, but his body is limp and frail. He will prove an easy, pleasurable kill. You will receive a bonus if you fulfill the contract without killing any of the prison guards. Now go, and may the Night Mother go with you.

plots: NONE
title: Brithaur the Thief
objective: stop Brithaur from stealing from the shopkeepers of Crucible
description:
Brithaur's a thorn in my side that never seems to go away!
I'd have his heart on a plate if I could! I wish he'd simply disappear from the streets of New Sheoth forever! Oh look, just talking about it has given me another gray hair!
Brithaur is a thief, but what irks me the most is that he's a BAD thief. Between my shop and a few others in Crucible, he's been caught stealing maybe a dozen times last month. Who has time for this sort of thing? I mean, at this rate, I'll grow old and die before he's out of our hair! I'll tell you what I tell anyone else who asks.
Get rid of him for me and I'll make it worth your while. Do hurry... time's wasting!

plots: NONE
title: Workplace Enjoyment
objective: convince Mulush treat his workers better
description:
Mulush is a damn tyrant. Always being goaded on by the Silver-Bloods to get more work out of us.
They pay us next to nothing. We get beaten if we make a mistake, and where are our kind Silver-Blood rulers? What are they doing? Typical.
You would stick up for us. You're going to try to talk sense into that man? I'll believe it when I see it.
It's a week's wages for me, but you've earned every coin if you talk some sense into Mulush.

plots: Beitild and her ex-husband run competing mining operations in Dawnstar
title: Lethal Competition
objective: assassinate Beitild
description:
Someone has contracted us to kill Beitild. She separated from her husband several months ago. Now the two run competing mining operations in Dawnstar. I hear the mining business is extremely cutthroat. And those hours... they're murder.
Beitild's angry and desperate. A fighter.

plots: the leadership of the Seven Suns have acted strangely lately by selling off valuable assets and neglecting many profitable trading ventures
Scar talked with Jhasso, but Jhasso rudely rebuffed Scar
use stealth while investigating the Seven Suns compound
title: The Seven Suns
objective: investigate the Seven Suns, and report back to Scar
tasks: break into the Seven Suns compound
description:
First off, let me introduce myself. I'm Scar, second-in-command of the Flaming Fist.
I need you to begin an investigation of the Seven Suns trading coster. The Seven Suns leadership has been acting strangely of late. They've been selling off valuable assets and neglecting many of their more profitable trading ventures. Considering the importance that the trading coster holds over the economy of the city, the Grand Dukes are noticeably upset. I've gone to talk to the coster's head, Jhasso. He rudely rebuffed me, telling me to mind my own business. I've known Jhasso for many years, and this isn't his usual behavior. I can't start up an official investigation, as there is no real reason for doing so. That's why I need you.
I want you to break into the Seven Suns compound and find out what's wrong. Use stealth in your investigations; I don't want this operation to cause too much fuss. The most important person to watch for is Jhasso.
Once you've found out as much as possible, report back to me at the Flaming Fist compound.
I'll pay you 2,000 gold for this favor.

plots: the player is an assassin of the Dark Brotherhood: Lucien Lachance has not spoken to the player in a while
the Black Hand has learned that the Dark Brotherhood has been infiltrated: the player is not suspected, because they joined the Dark Brotherhood after the traitor became active
from this point forward, the player is no longer bound by the Five Tenets: Sithis will forgive any murder, any theft, so long as the player serves the Black Hand
Lucien Lachance gives the player a poisoned apple and a unique scroll of summoning
title: The Purification
objective: perform the ancient rite known as Purification by killing everyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, and return to Lucien Lachance
tasks: assassinate Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar and Teinaava
description:
I have been waiting for you, assassin. We have not spoken in some time, but I am well aware of your accomplishments within the Dark Brotherhood. That is why I have sent for you. I'm afraid there is a... situation.
The time has come to test both your skill and your loyalty to Sithis. The Black Hand has learned that the Dark Brotherhood has been infiltrated. By whom, and for what purpose, we do not yet know. What we do know is that there is some link between the traitor and the Cheydinhal Sanctuary. The traitor has tainted that place beyond repair. It was learned that the traitor has been active for quite some time, since before you joined the Brotherhood. That absolves you of any suspicion.
The Black Hand has chosen you to perform the ancient rite known as Purification. Everyone inside the Sanctuary must die! You must break one of the Tenets you have sworn to uphold. I know this is an unexpected turn of events, but drastic measures must be taken. Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar and Teinaava. All of these family members must die! From this point forward, you are no longer bound by the Five Tenets! Sithis will forgive any murder, any theft, so long as you serve the Black Hand!
When the rite of Purification has been completed, return to me here at Fort Farragut, and we will discuss your future. Now, take these special gifts. They will help you greatly. One is a poisoned apple. The other, a unique scroll of summoning. Good luck... assassin.

plots: "Crumpled Note" is addressed to an old friend of G.S.
G.S. recounts how he stole a magical ring from a wizard and escaped from the owner of the ring until he ended up into Pale Pass
title: The Forgotten Chests of Pale Pass
objective: find the magical ring that G.S. hid inside some old barrels
tasks: use a key to open a chest to find another key for an another chest until you find the ring
description:
Crumpled Note
by G.S.

I guess you found the message I told you about, old friend. We've traveled together for so long, and you're the only one I trust with the ring and my story.
I knew climbing into the window of that wizard's house was a mistake, but the bounty on the ring was just too enticing to pass up. They said it was worth thousands of drakes... enough to keep me comfortable for a while as I lay low. They also said the owner of the ring was out of town at some meeting of wizards or some such.
They were wrong on both counts. You'd think I'd be used to this by now, dealing with the unpredictable in our line of work. But after trying to fence the ring all over the realm, no one would touch it. Worse still, the wizard was pursuing me the entire time. I had to call in many favors to stay one step ahead of him.
I decided to strike north and make for the neighboring land. As I was crossing the Jeralls, he finally caught up to me. Two fireballs later, I found myself tumbling down a steep snowy slope into a valley. Don't know where I am, but there are ruins of some old fort here. Luckily, that fetcher didn't follow me down; I assume he gave me up for dead.
I think I'm going to stash the ring in this valley, cross the border north, and return later when I feel it's safe. I've used some old chests I found in the ruins to make sure nobody stumbles across the ring by mistake; you know, the old key to a key thing like we used to do. If I don't make it back here, and you're reading this message, then the ring is all yours, my friend. Use it well and remember me.
G.S.

plots: Delsvirftanyon sells things for the tourists in the Durlag's Tower, but bandits on the road keep people away
Delsvirftanyon has ward tokens of all shapes and sizes
title: A Curious Business Proposal
objective: buy everything from Delsvirftanyon for 500 gold
description:
I'm Delsvirftanyon, a merchant by trade.
I sell the small and shinies for the tourists in the Durlag's Tower but there are none now there! Bandits on the roads keep the people off and away so I'm stuck with all this stock I am. Ward tokens I have of all shapes and size. Some I found by elven ruin and some I made myself I made. Maybe some good or maybe all bad but don't they all look pretty? I tell you what I will. I'll sell you everything I have you buy for low low price of 500 gold is all. Then I go home where they appreciate a bauble shine.
Buy or no and walk the walk?

plots: NONE
title: Dravynea's Frost Salts
objective: bring frost salts to Dravynea the Stoneweaver
description:
