I was a mage back in Morrowind. I lend my talents to the mines here, helping them keep the tunnels safe. By Azura, it gets hot in there. I use Frost Salts for a potion to keep the heat bearable, but I'm out.
If you want to go to the trouble of getting me some frost salts, feel free. I suppose I could offer you a bit of free Alteration training when you get back.

plots: the player has volunteered to close the Oblivion Gate: Savlian Matius sent men in the Oblivion Gate to see if they could find a way to shut it
title: Breaking the Siege of Kvatch
objective: help defeat the Daedra invaders, and end the siege of Kvatch
description:
You want to help? You're kidding, right? Hmm... if you're serious, maybe I can put you to use. It'll likely mean your death, though.
I don't know how to close this Gate, but it must be possible, because the enemy closed the ones they opened during the initial attack. You can see the marks on the ground where they were, with the Great Gate right in the middle. I sent men into the Gate, to see if they could find a way to shut it. They haven't come back. If you can get in there, find out what happened to them. If they're alive, help them finish the job. If not, see what you can do on your own.
The best I can say is, good luck. If you make it back alive, we'll be waiting for you. It's a brave thing you're doing.

plots: Savilla's Stone has revealed that the Gray Fox needs something special for his plans: the Arrow of Extrication
the player may kill Fathis Aren, but not in the castle of Bravil
title: Arrow of Extrication
objective: steal the Arrow of Extrication from Fathis Aren, and bring it to the Gray Fox
tasks: talk to the beggars about locating the Arrow of Extrication
description:
My work with Savilla's Stone has revealed that I need something special for my plans. It's a small item in the possession of a powerful court wizard. Will you do this for me? I will pay you well.
Bring me the Arrow of Extrication. It has a key shaped head. Bravil's court wizard, Fathis Aren, recently acquired this unique item. You may kill Fathis if necessary, but not in the castle. My spy network will tell me when you have it. Return here with the arrow when you do.
The beggars in Bravil will surely know where Aren keeps the Arrow. Now we should get out of Malintus' house before we wear out our welcome.

plots: keep away from the keep and the city guards: they won't accept the missives
title: Spread the Love
objective: distribute all religious missives to the citizens of Riften
description:
Riften is drowning in a sea of sin and wickedness and it's my personal mission to let everyone know that the warmth of Mara can see them through.
All I need is a messenger to bring Her words to these poor souls by distributing these missives. Lady Mara would be so pleased, if you could distribute the missives! Let me give you the missives. Here you are. Now make sure you give out every single one, we can't afford to let even one lost soul stray from Her warmth.
Almost anyone in Riften is in dire need of those missives. Speak to them, child. You will know who will listen and who will sin. A word of advice, keep away from the Keep and the city guards. They follow their own path and have already forsaken Her.
Allow me to give you Mara's gift as a reward... a true blessing to aid you in times of need. Despair not, her warmth will protect you always!

plots: Bodhi wants to break a monopoly in this town
the shipment of supplies arrives by boat: if the player does not get the shipment of supplies in the next few days, the player will fail
title: Breaking a Monopoly
objective: weaken the "resources" of the Shadow Thieves
tasks: steal the shipment of supplies belonging to the Shadow Thieves
description:
I am Bodhi, and I greet you warmly.
There is a monopoly in this town, and I intend to break it. I will ask you to weaken the "resources" of the Shadow Thieves. I wish a campaign of disruption, and you will begin it. There is a shipment of supplies arriving by boat. You are to... confiscate it.
I suggest you move against that ship coming in. They won't be at the docks for long, and if you do not get the cargo in the next few days, you will fail.
Farewell and good fortune.

plots: Modryn Oreyn has one final duty for the player to perform
everyone is in danger, as long as the Blackwood Company has access to the sap from the Hist Tree
Ri'Zakar will have the Hist Tree well guarded
title: The Hist
objective: return to the Blackwood Company hall to destroy the Hist Tree and anyone that stands in your way
tasks: find Ri'Zakar's key that opens the door to the Hist tree
description:
It is time for decisive action. I have one more duty for you to perform. It is clear to me what must be done. The Hist Tree must be destroyed. This tree is the source of our problems. It is an abomination of nature, and it must be destroyed. As long as the Blackwood Company has access to the sap, we are all in danger. I fear they no longer know what they do.
You must find a way to destroy the Hist, though I can imagine Ri'Zakar will have it well guarded. He's a warrior, a battle-hardened mercenary who's spent time all over Tamriel. He'll keep his prize tree locked away. You'll need to find his key.
Expect an unfriendly welcome at their hall. Finish it.

plots: Sheogorath gives the player summon Haskill spell for their previous services
the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia show the player what New Sheoth truly is
once the player understands what Sheogorath's Realm is, the player might understand why it's important to keep it intact
title: Understanding Madness
objective: meet the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia, and join their courts
tasks: seek out the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia
description:
I'm Sheogorath, Prince of Madness. And other things. I'm not talking about them. As you should know by now.
You've run a maze like a good little rat, but no cheese for you yet. Well, maybe a little. I've granted you a new spell - the ability to summon Haskill, my Chamberlain, to aid you in your travels. He knows a lot. More than he knows.
Now we're going to give you a taste of where you have found yourself. You're going to learn. Two halves, two rulers, two places within my palace. Meet and greet. Do what they will, so you know what they're about.
The Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia. Seek them out, and let them show you what New Sheoth is. You might be surprised. Once you understand what My Realm is, you might understand why it's important to keep it intact. And maybe you'll make some friends along the way. That's always nice!

plots: NONE
title: Restocking Soul Gems
objective: bring 7 Common Soul Gems to Sergius Turrianus
description:
I need some more supplies. Can you help out with that?
I'm running low on Common Soul Gems. Bring me another seven of them, if you can.

plots: the player was sent by the Madgod
the player will be Syl's Grand Inquisitor
title: The Lady of Paranoia
objective: find the people who conspire against Syl
description:
Why do you approach Syl, the Duchess of Dementia? Do you seek death?
You're the one the Madgod sent, aren't you? Then you're safe for now. Speak to no one unless I instruct you to. None of them can be trusted. Do you hear me? None! Surrounded by traitors and spies, I am. Always, always. They watch and wait, eager to slip a knife into my spine when I'm not looking.
Could be all of them. Every last one. None can be trusted. But they'll never take me down. Never! I'll see them all rotting in shallow graves before I let my guard down! You... you will help me. Yes, yes. You will be most useful.
You're going to find out who knows. You're going to learn who keeps secrets, who conspires against me. You will be my Grand Inquisitor. Expose the conspirators, and they will be punished, I assure you. Find out who keeps secrets, and what they are. Speak with Herdir. He will help you. Do you understand what is required of you? If no one is found, you will be held responsible.

plots: Arkion and Nemphre used to be lovers
Arkion wants Nemphre's Onyx Ring
Nemphre wants Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet
title: Arkion and Nemphre
objective: steal Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring, and bring them to Ordulinian
tasks: find Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring
description:
Ah, fair adventurers, I'm Ordulinian.
The roads of this fair city are lined with fools, are they not? Two of the greatest are Arkion and Nemphre, necromancers grown bitter over lost love. Alas, but they use petty trinkets as their excuse for enmity. Nemphre covets Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Arkion dreams of her Onyx Ring. Steal those trinkets and bring them to me and perhaps those two fools can at last find peace.
For your troubles I will give you a Cloak of Non-Detection. It may be of some use to you in the future.

plots: the player summoned Hircine
title: Hircine's Unicorn Hunt
objective: bring an unicorn horn to Hircine
description:
Summoned by prey. The hare crouches before the fox's muzzle. Perhaps I, Hircine, shall task you, mortal. Set you to hunt for my amusement.
In Harcane Grove is a quarry worthy of the chase. First named, last tamed, the unicorn runs wild there. Bring me this creature's horn, mortal. If you dare. Do taste its flesh and drink its blood. Never waste the spoils of a kill.
Please me, hunter, and you shall have my token, Saviour's Hide, and wear it well. Hereafter, take your prey, and whisper my name.

plots: the player told Gruiand Garrana that they want to better themselves
title: Speechcraft Training
objective: do a task for Gruiand Garrana and return to her afterwards
description:
I am Gruiand Garrana. You would seek to better yourself?
First, I would ask that you look to the poor and the suffering around Cyrodiil. Travel to all of our cities, and speak with the unfortunate souls forced to beg for change. Look into their hearts, and then look into your own.
Return to me when you have spoken with all of them. Then we shall talk of training.

plots: the Morningales have been murdered: Tyrianna survived her family
title: Tyrianna's Family
objective: escort Tyrianna to the building beside the temple in the docks and wait for Hurgis Baltezan to arrive
description:
I have a vital mission for you that must take precedence over all else.
We have received word of a great atrocity, one that must not be completed. There has been... murder is too weak a word. An entire family has been decimated. The Morningales have been a model of decency in this city, and their work in opposing the slave trade has earned them renown across the land. It also earned them many enemies. This past tenday has seen the family murdered in their homes, almost to the last. It would seem they were made examples of.
The time for justice will come, but what is important now is that someone survived, praise Helm. Tyrianna — she hid in a cellar while all others were executed. She must be protected until escorted from the city. Her survival will be a symbol to persevere in the fight against slavery, despite the ferocity of the enemy. You will go to a safe house we have set up, and you will make sure she remains secure. It is as secret as we could make it, though nothing is ever absolute.
In the morning, her godparent will arrive. He is from Baldur's Gate and will accept no other guards besides his own. You will see that she reaches his care. Go to the building beside the temple in the docks and await him. She should be safe in his care. Hurgis Baltezan is his name, and a more upright citizen you will not find. He earned the title "Hand of Torm" in his service to the god of duty.
The Order shall reward you with a suit of powerful armor for your good works.

plots: NONE
title: Noralee's Gauntlets
objective: bring Noralee's gauntlets to her
tasks: find Noralee's gauntlets inside a shipping crate
description:
I'm Noralee.
I just had some new armor shipped in from a far-away city and I'm afraid I must have dropped the gauntlets into one of the shipping crates somewhere between here and the harbor.
Please, if you can find them before somebody else picks them up, I would be most grateful.

plots: NONE
title: At the Summit of Miraak's Defeat
objective: destroy Miraak and lift his master's shadow from the land
description:
Go. My father sacrificed himself so that you could destroy Miraak and lift his master's shadow from the land.
Go, then. Kill Miraak. Do not fail.

plots: Mad Arcand the Stinking's ring is cursed
title: Arcand the Mad
objective: bring Mad Arcand the Stinking's ring to him
tasks: find Mad Arcand the Stinking's ring
description:
I like you, yes I do (wertle, wertle, wertle, wooo...) and I know of a way to make you like me too (wertle, wertle, wertle-wooooo...).
Down by the ocean, down by the sea, there's a pirate ship waiting for you and for me. Bring me what's in it, but don't ever wear it, or sure enough, soon enough, you'll wertle too... A beautiful ring! Where to get it? (Most likely quite near where exactly I put it...) Wertle, oh wertle, oh dear wertle-wooo... wertle, oh wertle, oh woo...
Oh, I know what you're thinking of Mad Arcand the Stinking who takes what you give him and gives not in return. So there is this bottle, but please don't topple or (wertle, poor wertle), you'll surely get burned.

plots: the player and Ralof are making their escape together: the player is a Nord
title: Unbound
objective: escape Imperial custody with Ralof
tasks: jump through the roof of the inn on the other side and keep running
description:
Hey, Nord. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance!
See the inn on the other side? Jump through the roof and keep going! Go! I'll follow when I can!

plots: NONE
title: *Seeing Things
objective: help Guard kill invisible demons
tasks: kill the invisible demons that surround Guard
description:
Thank the Gods you're here! These... demons just came out of nowhere! I've been able to hold them off so far, but, with you here, we'll soon triumph over them!
Why are you looking at me like that? Can't you see them? They're all around us! Please... you've got to believe me!

plots: the player freed Elder Josimon from the slavers: he had recovered the Passkey Ember from them, but they captured him
title: Up In Smoke
objective: put the slavers out of the picture for good
description:
Thank you for rescuing me. I had recovered the Passkey Ember from these slavers, but they captured me as I was trying to return to the Enclave.
I could use your help with one small matter before you go. These slavers have been harrying the Estherians for several weeks now. You defeated many, but there are many more watching us from the safety of those huts. Burn them out! If they are allowed to remain, the Frosted Hills will never be safe.

plots: Rogatus Salvius does no think highly of his son
title: Rogatus's Letter
objective: deliver a letter to Leontius
description:
My boy Leontius lives in Old Hroldan. Old inn to the south.
Damn drunk. The oaf doesn't even bother to visit these days. What am I supposed to do if the dragons burn down the farm?
You're a traveler, right? I have this letter for him. Let him know how much of a failure he is. You make sure the lug tips you when he gets it.

plots: Edovar stole the Glyph of Balthazar from the Wellspring Basin: he died while trying to use the Glyph of Balthazar and was trapped drowning forever
title: Wash Away My Sins
objective: set Edovar free
description:
I am merely spirit, but I mean you no harm. In life, I was an ambitious thief, and I thought I was invincible. My greatest achievement was when I stole the Glyph of Balthazar from the Wellspring Basin. I thought I could master its power over water, but I was very, very wrong.
Now I am trapped here in eternal torment, drowning forever, unable to rectify my mistake. Will you return the Glyph of Balthazar to the Wellspring Basin, and set my spirit free at last?

plots: goblins killed Kayleen while Corrick Northwode was away on business
title: Revenge Served Cold
objective: find Kayleen's jade amulet that was stolen by goblins, and bring it back to Corrick Northwode
tasks: avenge Kayleen by killing the goblins that killed her
description:
Please... I implore you, help me, Corrick Northwode, avenge my wife's death!
Barely a week ago, I left Harm's Folly to go buy supplies as I usually do once a month. What a fool I was to leave my wife alone. The goblins must have been watching me, as they knew right when to strike. I could hear her screams from far away. Those wretched beasts killed her! Filthy animals! Had I only been there to stop them!
I'll tell you how you can help. Go to Exhausted Mine. Kill those goblins. Every last one of them! They destroyed everything I hold dear! In their greed, the creatures grabbed a jade amulet off of Kayleen's... body. Bring me back that amulet, so I may use it to remember her by.
Please, I'll give you six gems as a token of my gratitude. They're all I have left of value, but you must have them if you do the deed.

plots: Thadon is inebriated from withdrawal effects of Felldew
title: Addiction
objective: return the Chalice of Reversal to Thadon
description:
Ahh yes, THERE you are! You couldn't imagine how long I, Thadon, the Duke of Mania, have been waiting for you. So little to do, and so much time. Hmm, could you, in fact, imagine just how long I've been waiting? I don't think you could, but I might be wrong.
It felt like rather a long time, but then long times get longer when you're standing around thinking about them. A curious thing, that. Long roads get longer too, if you're thinking about them, but what about long words? They don't change nearly as much. Long, short -- it all ends up the same. Dust and tears. Usually tears first, then the dust. Dust can't cry, you see. That would be... well, amusing. You know what's NOT amusing? I don't have my Chalice of Reversal. It makes me sad. When I get sad, I don't care to do much of anything. I certainly don't care to help people who show up on my doorstep wanting something. Are we getting the picture here?
The Chalice of Reversal is one of my favorite toys. Does wonders for creativity. Well, not by itself, but it helps. Is this making sense? Look, you eat the Felldew, then use the chalice, and find the world a much brighter and happier place. Honest. But I don't have it. So I can't eat Felldew, because that would just be bad. I mean, really bad. Find my chalice!

plots: NONE
title: The Potato Snatcher
objective: return the Jumbo Potatoes to S'jirra
tasks: find the person who stole S'jirra's Jumbo Potatoes
description:
Ohhhh... what am I, S'jirra, to do? They're gone... all gone.
Can you help me find my lost Jumbo Potatoes? Please, you must help me find them! If I don't have them for the next batch of my famous potato bread, I don't know what I'll do! My potatoes are like my children. I care for and nurture each one individually. That way, they grow up to be big and strong. How stupid I was to leave them outside all alone like that! All I wanted to do was give them some sun. Next thing I knew, they were gone!
I saw someone running off to the west, but I'm too frightened to journey into the woods alone. Please... can you help me? I'll give you my famous potato bread. I swear!

BG292: a tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District

plots: Korgan Bloodaxe and his fellows were on a mission to obtain the Book of Kaza for a book collector
Korgan Bloodaxe and his fellows had a heated argument: only Korgan Bloodaxe remained alive afterwards
title: Help Korgan Recover the Book of Kaza
objective: bring the the Book of Kaza to the book collector
tasks: find the Book of Kaza with Korgan Bloodaxe
description:
I'm scouring for a band of desperate adventurers to aid me in a gallant task. Come and hear Korgan Bloodaxe's tale!
A fortnight past, me fellows and I were in the midst of obtaining an ancient text fer our patron when a skirmish visited our midst. Vile words, alas, became a lake of bloodshed. So it goes the sacred grimoire ne'er made it to our benefactor's hand. And now he awaits its arrival with a zeal reserved for a grog-blossom in an alekeg. The scuttlebutt is the pay is handsome and worthy of note — sacks of loot and odd magics. The volume sits not far from 'ere, and the bibliomaniac, he paces the floor in the meantime. 'Tis called the Book of Kaza.
The Book of Kaza is in some hobnail's tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District. It's nae abandoned, but rumors and half-truths only scare the young and infirm. Keeps the curious away, me guess.
Well... it'll take far more than a few shambling bags of skin and stitches to deter Korgan Bloodaxe from a king's ransom! A foolhardy jaunt into a hive of undead? How could ye resist?

plots: Sickly Bernice thinks these may be her last days in the Shivering Isles
on the lowest level of the Knotty Bramble, there is a pool containing Aquanostrum: Sickly Bernice gives the player a special flask to collect the Aquanostrum
title: A Liquid Solution
objective: bring Aquanostrum to Sickly Bernice
tasks: find Aquanostrum to cure Sickly Bernice's illness
description:
Oh... hello. Sickly Bernice, proprietor. Don't get too close now. You might catch what I have.
Well... it seems I am dying. Yes, these may be my last days in the Shivering Isles. That is, unless someone like yourself could help me find the cure. But no one has taken me up on my offer, even with the promise of a reward. Ah well, it's been a good life I suppose....
There's only one place in all the Isles to get the cure for what I have... Knotty Bramble. I'll mark it on your map. There, on the lowest level of the place, is a pool containing the cure: Aquanostrum. Legend has it that it bubbles up from around an old statue. Bring me back the remedy, and I will reward you well with a Circlet of Verdure. Here, take this special flask to collect the Aquanostrum.

plots: Faralda has taught the player everything she can about Destruction magic
title: Mastering Destruction
objective: learn powerful Destruction magics lost to the ages
tasks: read the "Power of the Elements" that Faralda gives you
description:
I daresay you've learned all I can teach you about Destruction magic. But... That doesn't mean there isn't more out there.
Over the years I've heard things. Powerful magics lost to the ages, incredible spells that only the most skilled mages can master. This book, "Power of the Elements", is the only thing I've ever found. I think it's better off in your hands.

plots: Rieklings had invaded the Thirsk Mead Hall, but the player helped Hilund and her friends to drive them out: Hilund wants to ring the whole Thirsk Mead Hall with Riekling spears to remember that moment of weakness
title: A Reminder
objective: bring a bunch of Rieklings' spears to Hilund
description:
To tell you the truth, I've been a little distracted. I've got this... idea.
I want to ring the whole hall with Rieklings' little spears. Mocking us, from the past. Making us work harder. Fight better. The only problem is, I'm going to need a lot of spears. A lot. So, if you could find a bunch of them for me, that would make it easier on me.

plots: NONE
title: Hired Muscle
objective: intimidate Erikur into submission without killing him
description:
We've gotten a letter about Erikur needing some muscle up in Solitude.
I don't know what the fight is about, and that's not our business anyway. I just need you to go out there, look tough, and scare this milk drinker Erikur into submission.
No more than that. I don't want to hear about a killing, understand? Go. Bring honor to yourself, and the Companions.

plots: the Dawnguard are getting the Dawnguard Fortress back into shape
Isran gives the player a crossbow: crossbows are good for hunting vampires before they get too close
title: Awakening
objective: find out what vampires are looking for at Dimhollow Crypt
tasks: meet Tolan, who will try to assist you
description:
I need someone out in the field, taking the fight to the damn vampires, while we're getting the fort back into shape...
Go see what the vampires were looking for in Dimhollow Crypt. With any luck, they'll still be there. Here, you should take a crossbow. Good for hunting out those fiends before they get too close.
Tolan'll meet you at Dimhollow. He will try to assist you. Watch out. Vigilants of Stendarr were never trained for vampire hunting...

plots: Umbacano has invited the player here to his house: the ancient Ayleid statue that the player recently sold cheap to an anonymous merchant is placed on a table
title: The Collector
objective: recover the complete set of 10 ancient statues for Umbacano
description:
Thank you for coming.
You may recognize that statue over there on the table. The very one that you recently sold -- for less than its true worth.
As you may know, I am somewhat of an enthusiast for Ayleid antiquities. In my own modest way, I have amassed a rather considerable collection.
I have recently become interested in obtaining the complete set of these ancient statues. I believe that ten still exist within the various ancient Ayleid Ruins. No mere shopkeeper knows their true worth.
If you bring them to me when you find them, I will pay you double for each one.

plots: there are five empty chests
a famous person will appear in front of each empty chest: each famous person will give the player a gift that belongs to another famous person and will give a hint about the gift's owner
the player must place each gift to the correct chest behind each famous person
title: Game of the Imps
objective: play the imps' game
tasks: place the gifts, and talk to the imps
description:
We are two imps, little demonic people. We want to play a game.
Okay, big peoples... this is how our game will go! There is five chests here with nothings in them! In front of each empty chest, a famous big people will appear! Famous big people! Oh, yes, powerful famous big people! Each famous big people will give you a gift that belongs to another famous big people... and they will hints to you what gifts belong to them! If you thinks you knows which famous big people a gift belongs to, you puts it in the empty chest behind them, yes? Very simple!
Once you places all five, you comes and asks us! If you wrong, we laugh at you! If you right, we open the sixth chest! The sixth chest has all of the drow's treasure! All of it!

plots: the spiders of Redbelly Mine almost killed Grogmar and Filnjar
title: Mine or Yours
objective: help Filnjar by clearing out spiders from the Redbelly Mine
description:
Sorry, the Redbelly Mine's dry right now. What's wrong with the mine, you might ask. It's full of spiders, that's what's wrong with it!
Almost killed Grogmar and me when they showed up. I'm worried that they'll come out of the mine looking for food soon... then we're in even bigger trouble.
You'd  clear them out for us? Tell you what. Keep to your word, and I'll line your pockets with as much as I can scrape up.

plots: the general sent Captain Valmir to obtain a powerful weapon for the war effort
dragons granted terrible power to the Dragon Cult for their bloody sacrifices: they were swept out during the dragon war because of their cruelty
title: Siege on the Dragon Cult
objective: recover the Dragon Cult leader's mask for Captain Valmir
tasks: find the Dragon Cult leader's mask
description:
You there! As an officer of the Imperial Legion, I require your assistance to complete my mission.
The General has sent me to obtain a powerful weapon for the war effort. This was the last great bastion of the Dragon Cult, and their leader's mask was reported to be quite powerful.
They were among the first men to arrive from Atmora and they worshiped certain animals as avatars of the Gods; Dragons being foremost. And for their bloody sacrifices, the Dragons gifted their priests with terrible power. But their cruelty was too great for men to bear, and they rose up in what would be called the Dragon War and the Cult swept from the land.
I'll pay for the Dragon Cult leader's mask. Get in there, find the mask, return it to me, and earn your pay.

plots: the player is a devoted student of restoration: most mages of the College of Winterhold look down on restoration magic
title: Restoration Ritual
objective: learn more about restoration magic from the Augur
tasks: talk with the Augur, who's expecting you
description:
Look at you. Such a devoted student of Restoration. It's comforting to see that not everyone has dismissed it as entirely as most members of the College. Truly comforting.
It looks like you're ready to speak with the Augur. He was a brilliant mage. Truly inspired. Mastered spells others could barely comprehend. He was especially gifted when it came to Restoration.
The Augur's... Well, he's very particular about who shares the knowledge. So you'll need his approval first. Go on, go talk to him. I'm sure he's been paying attention, and will be expecting you.

plots: Gunmar and Sorine Jurard think that the Dawnguard are going to need Florentius to help against the vampires
Florentius had regular contact with the Vigilants: Isran has kept track of the Vigilants
title: Bolstering the Ranks
objective: find Florentius and recruit him into the Dawnguard
tasks: ask Isran whether he knows where Florentius is
description:
These vampires are a new threat, and a truly deadly one. Gunmar and I agree that we're going to need Florentius to help.
Gunmar and I have a lot of work to do here, so we were hoping that maybe you could track him down. He's a priest of Arkay. Well, he was. It's... it's complicated. Florentius's a little eccentric, but we can trust him and we could definitely use his skills.
Here's the thing. We don't know where Florentius is. Haven't seen him in years. I think he had regular contact with the Vigilants, and I know Isran kept track of them... So maybe you could ask Isran if he knows anything?
Just keep in mind that Isran... well, he might not like the idea. The two of them just never got along.

plots: the Ezrohir are preparing to assault Zeryphesh
title: A High-Value Target
objective: prevent the Ezrohir from interrogating Commander Muzaffar
tasks: rescue Commander Muzaffar from the Ezrohir, before they take him to Riftkeep
description:
Greetings, my friend! Welcome to Zeryphesh! I am Malik Vosh. I speak for the Zeraphi.
As you know, the Ezrohir are preparing to assault our city. Our military leader, Commander Muzaffar, has apparently been captured by the Ezrohir, out in the Ossean Wastes. They'll have sent for soldiers to take their prisoners back to their stronghold. Once they get him to Riftkeep, they'll identify him quickly enough, and then they'll interrogate him until they know everything about our defenses.
I believe you're going out to the Ossean Wastes, the vast desert. Please, rescue Muzaffar. We need him.

plots: Hroggar's wife and daughter died in the fire: Hroggar blames his wife for starting the fire because she spilled bear fat in the fireplace
rumors say that Hroggar started the fire himself so that he could get together with Alva
title: Laid to Rest
objective: investigate Hroggar's house fire
description:
I want you to look into Hroggar's house fire. He lost his wife and daughter in the blaze. My people believe the house to be cursed now. Who am I to gainsay them?
How the fire started? Hroggar blames his wife for spilling bear fat in the fire. Many folk think he set the fire himself. Lust can make a man do the unthinkable. The ashes were still warm when he pledged himself to to a woman named Alva.
I can't arrest Hroggar on rumor and gossip. But you, a stranger, might find the truth for us. Sift through the ashes at Hroggar's house that others are too fearful to touch. See what they tell you.
Should you prove him guilty or innocent, I will reward you.

plots: the player is a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Metrich wants some squatters removed from his lands: the squatters used violence against Metrich's men
title: Dealing with the Baron
objective: restore order to the lands of Metrich by solving a land dispute
tasks: Go to a neutral meeting place.
description:
Knight, we have been commissioned by a local barony. Such service to political figures is good for the Order, and you will serve quite well in the task.
It is necessary for us to be accessible in local concerns lest we seem above the people. In this case, a baron has petitioned us to solve a land dispute. Baron Metrich wishes some squatters removed and has cited violence against his men as reason for it. Go to his lands, restore order, and bring favor to us.
The baron waits in a neutral meeting place. He is in a tavern in the Umar Hills, in the village of Imnesvale. Go now.

plots: the player is torturing their prisoner: the prisoner's father hid her dowry
title: Canceled Wedding
objective: find the hidden dowry for yourself
tasks: get your prisoner's dowry from a hollowed-out tree stump
description:
You... you can't do this to me. Do you have any idea who I am? When my father hears about this, he will gut you.
Ah, now I understand. This is about my father's hidden cache, isn't it? The dowry for my wedding? Ha! Well it's safely hidden away, in a hollowed-out tree stump. Just outside Riften, tucked away nice and secure. You'll never find it.
Damn it. I gave it away, didn't I?

plots: Kidrik the Mauler slipped away during the attack
title: Hostage Negotiations
objective: defeat Kidrik the Mauler, and free his hostages
tasks: find Kidrik the Mauler and his captives
description:
Kidrik the Mauler must have slipped away during the attack, and concealed himself in the underground slave den! And, if the captives are there, as well, Kidrik must be holding them hostage!
You must defeat Kidrik and free the captives, or all that has been done to stop the slavers will have been for naught!

plots: the Alchemist gets more dangerous each time he siphons off energy from Guardians
title: Regroup at the Enclave
objective: plan your next move with Commander Vale
description:
The Alchemist must be stopped before he attacks any more Guardians! Each time he siphons off our energy, he becomes more dangerous.
You and Commander Vale should return the Estherian Enclave, and plan your next move.

plots: Caranya removed the Necromancer's Amulet from the Arcane University
Caranya is not safe from the minions of the King of Worms
title: The Necromancer's Amulet
objective: return the Necromancer's Amulet to the Arcane University
tasks: get the Necromancer's Amulet from Caranya
description:
Caranya insisted on removing the Necromancer's Amulet from the Arcane University. She said it posed a threat to the safety of the Imperial City.
While I do not doubt that Caranya was right, I question whether her motives were genuine. She seemed all too eager to explore its power. I fear she is not safe from the minions of the King of Worms.
Caranya is at Fort Ontus; please, go there and return with the Amulet. Help her to see that she should not use the weapons of the enemy, especially out of fear.

plots: NONE
title: The Noble's Daughter
objective: find Lord Rugdumph gro-Shurgak's missing daughter
tasks: talk to Lord Rugdumph gro-Shurgak about his missing daughter
description:
I'll assume you're back for more work, because I don't see a big need to chat with you.
I've got more for you. Important stuff, actually. You need to go talk to Lord Rugdumph gro-Shurgak. He's an Orcish noble. A fine man. Our families go back a bit. Anyway, his daughter is missing.
Head to his estate and talk to him. Find his daughter. And mind your manners! I don't want you embarrassing me!
Now go help Lord Rugdumph. And wipe that smile off your face!

plots: Baldrick the Enchanter can't enchant anything without enchanting tools
title: Hidden Costs
objective: bring enchanting tools to Baldrick the Enchanter
tasks: Go to Path of the Honored Dead.
search Path of the Honored Dead for a Beornen
description:
Welcome! Welcome, my friend. I have numerous enchantments available... weapons, armor, trinkets, and the like. Or, rather, I would, if I hadn't lost my enchantment kit!
Maybe you can help me. I've heard there's a Beornen shaman or something out in the Path of the Honored Dead, who has the kind of enchanting tools I need. If you could locate this bear-mage and acquire those tools, I would happily give you your first enchantment, free of charge!

plots: Teinaava needs help with a personal matter
just as a member of the Dark Brotherhood cannot kill a fellow family member, a Shadowscale is forbidden from slaying another Shadowscale
title: The Renegade Shadowscale
objective: bring back Scar-Tail's heart as proof for Teinaava
description:
Ah, dear friend, may I steal a moment of your time? I have a rather delicate situation I was hoping you could help me with. This is a personal matter, and will have no bearing on your standing within the Dark Brotherhood. Would you like to hear more?
Now, the details. Far south of here, on the southern end of Cyrodiil, lies a swamp called Bogwater. Hiding in that swamp you will find an Argonian Shadowscale named Scar-Tail. Kill this renegade. and bring me his heart as proof of the deed.
I have some history with Scar-Tail. When Ocheeva and I trained with the Dark Brotherhood as children, we befriended another initiate, a Shadowscale by the name of Scar-Tail. The three of us were inseparable. When our training was completed, we reluctantly parted ways. But now... Now, the unthinkable has happened! Scar-Tail has fled Black Marsh and refuses to fulfill his duties as royal assassin! This is an act of treason! This treachery must be punished! Just as a member of the Dark Brotherhood cannot kill a fellow family member, a Shadowscale is forbidden from slaying another Shadowscale. That is why you must go to Bogwater and eliminate that treacherous snake!
Please kill Scar-Tail, so Ocheeva and I can put this matter behind us.

plots: Jorundr and Arnora Auria have had a rocky relationship: Jorundr and Arnora Auria committed petty crimes all over Cyrodiil
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets
Arnora Auria got afraid of Jorundr

Jorundr and Arnora Auria's last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City: Jorundr killed a guard and he was captured by the Bruma guard two days later at Jorundr and Arnora Auria's makeshift campsite
Jorundr had moved the stolen gold away from the campsite
title: Two Sides of the Coin
objective: find out where Jorundr and Arnora Auria's stolen gold is hidden
description:
Here's the deal. Jorundr and I have had a rocky relationship at best.
Against my will, I've been dragged all over Cyrodiil helping him commit petty crimes. I wouldn't say we're thieves. I mean, we've stolen things... sure. But we've never stolen that much at one time. Just enough to keep us going. That is, until last year.
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets. Not just lone merchants, mind you. I'm talking about the bigger scores. Like estates and tax shipments. I begged him to stop, as I knew that his capers would one day lead to violence. He just threatened to... hurt me if I got in his way. I think the gold changed him. I really do. He wasn't the man I met seven years ago. The few times I tried to say something, he'd strike me or push me away. I began to become frightened of him.
Our last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City. We robbed it, and in the midst of the chaos, Jorundr killed a guard. I was mortified. We snatched up the gold and holed up in the mountains. He said if I breathed a word of the murder to anyone, he'd kill me. I was terrified of him at this point. Two days later, the Bruma City Guard traced us to our makeshift campsite. I was off gathering food, but Jorundr was captured. Served him right. When I went back to the site later, the gold was gone! He'd moved it! What I need you to do is go to the Bruma Castle Dungeons and speak to him for me. Convince him to tell you where the gold is and then we split it.

plots: the Gray Fox has used Savilla's Stone, again, to find out that he needs another special item, the boots of Springheel Jak, to move forward with his plans
the Earl of Imbel is the last known descendant of Springheel Jak
title: Boots of Springheel Jak
objective: find out where Springheel Jak is buried, and retrieve his boots for the Gray Fox
tasks: search for clues in the Earl of Imbel's house
description:
Further use of Savilla's Stone has revealed that I need another special item to move forward with my plans. I need the boots of Springheel Jak. He is a famous thief that died some 300 years ago. Legend has it that he was buried with his boots on.
Find out where Springheel Jak is buried and bring me back those boots. Will you do this for me? It pays well.
The Earl of Imbel is the only descendant of Springheel Jak's line that I have been able to locate. His name is Jakben, and he lives somewhere in the Imperial City. There might be a clue in the Earl's house.

plots: Jaheira kept the player waiting as there were things she had to take care of
Jaheira was asked to bring the player to the Harper Hold
title: Summoned to the Harper Hold
objective: see the Harpers with Jaheira
description:
Hail there! I said I would return, and I have. Sorry to have kept you waiting, but there were things I had to take care of. Now that we have met once again, there is something I must ask of you.
We must go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla. I have been asked to bring you, and we must go soon. They will allow us to pass the wards of the door, but I must be with you.

plots: Idgrod gets lost in her visions
title: For the Good of Morthal
objective: help Gorm to address his worries about Idgrod's leadership
tasks: deliver Gorm's letter to Captain Aldis
description:
My mind weighs heavy enough. Idgrod's so lost in her visions, and it's only getting worse. I've looked after her safety for so long... If she can't tell what's real and what's not, how will she continue to lead Morthal?
There is a letter, one I have had for some time now. I think it is time it gets delivered. I cannot leave Idgrod's side, so I must stay here. Could you see that it reaches Captain Aldis in Solitude?
Please, do not open it. It is... private.

plots: the player saved Aldeth Sashenstar on his hunting trip
Aldeth Sashenstar thinks that Irlentree and Zorl Miyar have become different people when he was gone: they spend their and Aldeth Sashenstar's company's resources on frivolous and stupid ideas
title: Investigating the Merchants' League Estate
objective: investigate Irlentree and Zorl Miyar, and report back to Aldeth Sashenstar
tasks: go with Aldeth Sashenstar, let him introduce you as his old friend and quarter you in the guest chambers
description:
It is so pleasant to see your face once again. Don't you recognize me? It is I, Aldeth Sashenstar. I am so glad to have met you, especially at a time like this. I need to speak with you privately.
I'm sorry for all of this hiding and skulking, but there are dire events afoot. You know that I am one of the principal shareholders of the Merchants' League. Well, I share ownership of the company with two others: Irlentree and Zorl Miyar, two very distinguished gentlemen. When I returned from my hunting trip — thanks to you, I might add — I found that my two partners had undergone some profound changes, nothing physical or overt, but something far more sinister.
It's as if my partners had become wholly different people while I was gone. They almost take an active interest in squandering our company's resources on frivolous and stupid ideas. If they continue on this course, the company will be in shambles in but a few weeks. I know you have already helped me once, but I ask for your assistance again. I have no other recourse.
Come into the Merchants' League Estate with me. I will explain that you are an old friend of mine and will quarter you in the guest chambers. From there, please investigate my partners, perhaps using magic or any of the other skills you possess. Learn as much as you can during your visit and then report back to me after you're done. It should only take a couple of days.

plots: NONE
title: The Book of Love
objective: act as the hands of Mara in the world
tasks: help Fastred with her fickle love
description:
I am devoted to the Goddess Mara, who gave mortals the gift of love that they might have a hint of eternity. Her blessings are many. To love is to know the true nature of the gods.
Not all can hear the broad echoes of deepest dawn. To receive the touch of Mara, you must first act as her hands in the world. Explore the facets of the infinite jewel. Are you prepared, then, to help bring the light across this land?
The dawn surely opens upon you, child. You must bear its light that all may see. Mara has reflected an image to me. A young woman... almost a girl... her fickle love must resolve itself. The village of Ivarstead. The woman, Fastred. This is the prayer heard by the goddess and relayed to her servants.
Return when Fastred has seen her path. I will entreat Mara on your behalf.

plots: NONE
title: Fetch the Netch
objective: obtain five samples of Netch jelly for Milore Ienth
description:
I'm proud to say that I grow or harvest most of my exotic ingredients myself.
I only wish I had a better source for Netch jelly. Those creatures are difficult to track down since it's so dangerous beyond the the town walls.
Could you gather some Netch jelly for me? That would be splendid! Five samples should be enough. I'd be more than happy to give you something for the effort.

plots: NONE
title: Amulet of the Moon
objective: bring Kharjo's Moon Amulet back to him
description:
A few days ago, our caravan was ambushed. A nuisance, really, but many of the marauders had quick fingers.
One of them stole my Moon Amulet, given to me by my mother when I was just a cub. It is my only memory of home in this cold land.
You offer to get my amulet back? We believe the bandits are a part of a group headquartered in Faldar's Tooth. Be careful. I miss my amulet, but a life cannot be replaced as easily.

plots: NONE
title: Athletics Training
objective: prove that you are well-traveled enough to receive training from Rusia
tasks: discover to new places and travel to lands you've never seen
description:
I'm Rusia. My husband is General Silgor Bradus, one of County Anvil's commanders in the field.
I did quite a bit of traveling. Back before I met Silgor, and decided to settle down. It's all about pacing yourself. You should get out there, and experience things for yourself. Discover new places, travel to lands you've never seen.
Maybe once you've done that, we can talk about how to better pace yourself. I'll teach you what I know about athletics. Maybe we can swap stories about life on the road, too.

plots: Serana thinks that the player can't trust Harkon after they spoke with Serana's mother in the Soul Cairn: the player can't bring the bow to Harkon
title: Kindred Judgment
objective: kill Harkon
description:
I think we both know... it's time to face my father Harkon. If we don't, he'll keep chasing us for the rest of our lives.
Well, before we spoke to my mother in the Soul Cairn, I would have said we bring the bow to my father. But after everything with her... I don't think we can trust him. No. He has to die. We have no choice.
Let's face him together.

plots: NONE
title: Dragonhide
objective: help Tolfdir finish his research on the Dragonhide
tasks: retrieve Kahvozein's Fang, and use it to carve a few heartscales off a dead dragon
description:
I've been working on something. An improvement on the Ebonyflesh spell. I've made progress, but then hit a snag. I think perhaps you could help.
I made some progress using the essence of dragon scales. But they're just not quite potent enough. My knowledge of history is far from complete, but I did some research and discovered two things.
First, there are ancient references to dragon "heartscales". What little I could learn suggests they may be what I need. Second, there are stories of a dagger called Kahvozein's Fang, said to be sharp enough to carve heartscales off a dragon.
First you'll need to retrieve the dagger, then use it to carve a few heartscales off a dragon. Presumably a deceased one.
If my research succeeds, I certainly think you deserve the first copy of the Dragonhide spell tome.

plots: Susanna and other two girls were killed the same way: stabbed and cut apart with a blade
there's a war: no one has time to spend on murder investigations
title: Blood on the Ice
objective: investigate the brutal murders of women
tasks: Go to Hall of the Dead.
check out a trail of blood leading away from the murder scene
description:
Another girl killed. The victim is Susanna, from Candlehearth Hall. Served me a drink just a few nights ago... but I can't say I knew her.
She was killed the same way as the other two girls. Looks like she was stabbed, and then cut apart. It's like an animal got to her, but these are the wounds of a blade.
You could help us with the investigation. We're stretched thin as it is with the war. Nobody has the time to spend on this. Not pleasant, but it's the truth.
Here are some starting points for you. I noticed a trail of blood leading away from here. Helgird's taken Susanna's body into the Hall of the Dead to prepare for burial. She's a little crazy, but if she knows anything, it's dead bodies.

plots: the player asked J'baana to train them in lockpicking
title: Lockpicking Training
objective: get the message to J'baana from S'Krivva
description:
Do you have business with me, J'baana?
You ask me to train you in lockpicking? How very arrogant of you. To think that I would aid you out of the kindness of my heart?
Since you are here, and since you want something, you are useful to me. Travel to Bravil, and speak with S'Krivva. She should have a message for me.
Until you have the message from S'Krivva, we have nothing further to say to one another.

plots: Ranmir is sure that Isabelle Rolaine ran away with Vex
title: Drowned Sorrows
objective: find Isabelle Rolaine
tasks: talk to Vex about Isabelle Rolaine
description:
I'm Dagur, an innkeeper.
I wondered if I could ask a favor of you. It's about Ranmir. Don't get me wrong, I don't have a problem with him being in my inn all the time. He mostly keeps to himself, and so far he's been able to pay. I just hate to see what's happened to him. He hasn't always been like this, you know. Drunk, I mean.
He was a different person. Happy, outgoing... Like anyone who's in love. See, Ranmir was involved with a pretty young woman named Isabelle Rolaine. The two of them were very happy together, I thought. One day, she just disappeared. Ranmir was convinced she'd run off with someone else, leaving him behind. He turned to drinking, and what's left of him is what you see here every day.
I hoped that maybe if she could be found, if he had some sort of explanation, that maybe he could put himself back together. I'm in no position to go searching for her, but perhaps you could. Ranmir seemed convinced that Isabelle'd run off to Riften with someone named Vex. That's all I remember.

plots: the player summoned Sheogorath
Sheogorath wants to make Border Watch an interesting place
the people of Border Watch are superstitious
title: Entertaining Sheogorath
objective: find a way to make the first two parts of the K'Sharra come true
tasks: ask about the K'Sharra from the shaman
description:
Another mortal dares to summon me, Sheogorath, and already I am bored. But enough about me. Let's talk about you.
I could turn you into a goat. Or a puddle. Or a bad idea. I could make you eat your own fingers. Or fall in love with a cloud. Perhaps I could make you into something useful. Let's find out.
There's a little settlement called Border Watch. It's a nice, peaceful place... and dull, dull, dull. You're going to make their lives interesting. They're a superstitious bunch. Everything is an omen or a portent. Let's make one come true. Find their shaman and ask about the K'Sharra prophecy. You are to find a way to make the first two parts of the prophecy come true. I'll take care of the rest, because it's the most fun. Now, run along.

TESS672: the Jarl's or Steward's chambers in Dragonsreach
TESS675: the Jarl's or Steward's chambers in Dragonsreach

plots: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild: the player was sent to do a job for Olfrid Battle-Born
Arn fled from Solitude to Whiterun, but was arrested for drunken behavior
the letter and the prison registry are inside : visitors are not allowed to enter them
Olfrid Battle-Born can't help the player if the player gets caught
title: Imitation Amnesty
objective: help Olfrid Battle-Born save Arn from getting executed for a serious crime in Solitude
tasks: steal a letter that was sent from Solitude warning the Whiterun guard to be on the lookout for Arn
change Arn's name in the prison registry to his new identity
description:
You're here! And not a moment too soon. If anything should happen to Arn, there'll be hell to pay.
Arn's a close friend of mine. We fought together on the battlefield for many years until old age got the better of us. Now it's up to me to save him one more time... this time from the executioner's block in Solitude.
The city guard in Solitude is seeking Arn for a serious crime. When he fled here, he was arrested for drunken behavior. Can you imagine? Fortunately, his identity isn't known to the authorities in Whiterun, so there's still a chance to save him.
The job is two-fold. First, steal a letter that was sent from Solitude warning Whiterun's guard to be on the lookout for Arn. The second is to change Arn's name in the prison registry to his new identity.
The job is relatively difficult. If it was easy, I would have hired a local thug instead of a professional from the Thieves Guild. You see both of these items are kept inside Dragonsreach, and they don't allow visitors inside the Jarl's or the Steward's chambers.
One more thing. If you get caught, I can't afford to be connected to you. Remember that before you do anything stupid.

plots: the player told Shum gro-Yarug that they want to buy a house
Rosethorn Hall is currently occupied by Vandorallen Trebatius
Shum gro-Yarug will have Vandorallen Trebatius evicted from Rosethorn Hall
title: Buying a House in Skingrad
objective: purchase Rosethorn Hall
description:
I'm Shum gro-Yarug, the Count's butler.
So you want to buy a house? I can speak for the Count. Rosethorn Hall is a stately manor currently occupied by Vandorallen Trebatius. You won't find a better property for sale in Skingrad. It's just inside the main gate, near the bridge to the chapel.
The house costs 25,000 septims. Give me the septims, and I will order the deed to the house drawn up.
Don't worry about Vandorallen Trebatius. I'll have him evicted. I'm sure he'll find another home easily.

plots: NONE
title: Bow to the Master
objective: retrieve Dravin Llanith's stolen bow
tasks: find the thieves who stole Dravin Llanith's bow
description:
A few days ago, some thieves from Riften broke in here and stole it! Can you imagine? Took the only thing of value we had. It was a family heirloom. I can't even put a price on how much that thing means to me.
I'm sure that they are from Riften. I bumped into them when I was coming back to my farm after buying supplies. I know those lowlifes took it with them back to the Ratway. They left an unmistakable stench behind.
If you have the guts to head into the Ratway and get my bow back, I'll pay you what I can. It would be nice to have it back... means a lot to me.

plots: NONE
title: The Gift of Beastblood
objective: meet Skjor in the Underforge tonight
tasks: let Skjor show you the way to the hidden door to the Underforge
description:
I have something a little different planned this time. But it's not for everyone to hear. Meet me in the Underforge tonight.
Oh yes, you don't yet know where the Underforge is. I forget that you've never seen it. Beneath the Skyforge, where Eorlund works.
All I say is that you will receive a gift. A gift that will join your spirit with the beast world, friend.
The door to the Underforge is hidden, but I will show you the way.  We will speak more.

plots: Cicero has been concerning Astrid ever since he arrived at the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary: Astrid thinks that Cicero is plotting to overtake the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary and restore the Old Ways
title: Whispers in the Dark
objective: spy on Cicero and the person he is talking with
tasks: hide inside the Night Mother's coffin to eavesdrop on the meeting between Cicero and a mystery person
description:
Cicero concerns me. Ever since he arrived, his behavior's been... Well, erratic would be an understatement. I do believe he is truly mad. But it's worse than that.
Cicero's taken to locking himself in the Night Mother's chamber, and talking. To someone. In hushed, but frantic tones. Who is he speaking with? What are they planning? I fear treachery. As the Night Mother's Keeper, he believes he's entitled to the rule of this Sanctuary. Cicero will cite our independence as the need to revert to the Old Ways. He'll claim we're undisciplined, unruly. Heretical, even. Ironically, the Night Mother could prove to be just as much a victim. The queen in a fool's twisted game of chess.
I need you to steal into that chamber, and eavesdrop on their meeting. It'll be no use clinging to the shadows. They'll see you for sure. No, you need a hiding place. Somewhere they'd never think to look. Like inside the Night Mother's coffin.

plots: ankheg armor is comparable to full plate with half the weight
there is an iron shortage
title: An Offer from Taerom
objective: sell your ankheg shells
tasks: give your ankheg shells to Taerom Fuiruim
description:
Hello there, I'm Taerom Fuiruim, a blacksmith of some renown.
An interesting piece o' material you got there. Ankheg, if I'm not mistaken. Been a while since I seen the like, but if I remember correctly, it makes a fine set of armor. If properly treated it's comparable to full plate with half the weight!
If you're willing to part with your shells I'll give you 500 gold for the lot of them. No more can I offer with business as slow as it is.
Iron shortage hurting us all.

plots: NONE
title: Anomen Returns Home After His Sister's Death
objective: investigate the murder of Anomen's sister
tasks: go to Lord Cor's home with Anomen
description:
I am Anomen, a warrior priest.
I must discover the truth about my sister's murder. We must head for my father's home in the Government District of Athkatla!

plots: the note is addressed toward the player: the player is the Silence of the Dark Brotherhood
the player assassinated Shaleez for Lucien Lachance
Alval Uvani is renting a house in Leyawiin
Alval Uvani's wife hired the Dark Brotherhood to kill her husband: the Morag Tong of Morrowind can't reach Alval Uvani in Cyrodiil
Alval Uvani suffers from a rare Dunmer condition, a serious allergy to honey: he would suffer from complete paralyzation after drinking honey-based mead
title: A Matter of Honor
objective: assassinate Alval Uvani
tasks: locate Alval Uvani with a schedule included in this dead drop
description:
Dead Drop Orders #5
by Lucien Lachance

If you're reading this note, Shaleez is dead. You've done the world a great service, Silencer. It's time to continue the good work.
Your next target is a traveling Dark Elf merchant by the name of Alval Uvani, who is currently renting a house in the city of Leyawiin. Uvani is a well-respected tradesman back in his native Morrowind, but his business often takes him very far from home. Therein lies the problem. Alval Uvani's wife has become disillusioned with her husband's repeated, extended absences and wishes to dissolve their marriage, and has sought the Dark Brotherhood's assistance. Lucky for us Cyrodiil is a bit beyond the reach of Morrowind's Morag Tong.
Alval Uvani is currently traveling around Cyrodiil, and is never in one place for more than a couple of days. In this dead drop you will also find a schedule detailing the Dark Elf's whereabouts; use it to locate him and plan your elimination. Be aware, however, that because he is forced to travel alone to the farthest reaches of the Empire, Uvani has learned to defend himself. He is a master of the Destruction school of Magicka, and is no stranger to killing.
When Alval Uvani lies rotting, journey to the Market District of the Imperial City. There you will find a shop called Stonewall Shields. Your dead drop is located behind that building, in a hollowed-out tree stump. As usual, you will find your reward for the previous contract, as well as information on your next.
Ah yes, I must mention one last detail. Apparently Alval Uvani suffers from a rare Dark Elf condition, a serious allergy to honey. If you could somehow get Uvani to drink the honey-based mead, perhaps by replacing his food, he would suffer from complete paralyzation. This would certainly make the Dark Elf a bit easier to deal with.

BG277: the south end of the Windspear Hills
BG278: the south end of the Windspear Hills
BG280: the south end of the Windspear Hills
BG281: the south end of the Windspear Hills

plots: Irenicus has enslaved the three dryads
title: Helping Irenicus' Captive Dryads
objective: take the three dryads' acorns to the Fairy Queen in the south end of the Windspear Hills
tasks: get the three dryads' acorns from Ilyich
description:
We are the three dryads. You must help us get free of this... creature Irenicus! We are Irenicus's possessions, servants, and concubines.
You must get our acorns back from Ilyich, the clan leader of Irenicus's duergar slaves. He is somewhere within this dungeon. Please take the acorns to the Fairy Queen who lives in the south end of the Windspear Hills.

plots: the player has helped Raven Rock before
the Ulen Family has placed a deathmark on Councilor Morvayn's head
title: Served Cold
objective: search Raven Rock and root out traitors who want to assassinate Councilor Morvayn
tasks: talk to Geldis Sadri and check out any leads he provides you
description:
After everything you've already done for Raven Rock, I hate to ask for more but I can't risk Councilor Morvayn being killed.
The Ulen Family of House Hlaalu, a rival Great House, has placed a deathmark on the Councilor's head. I need you to start out by being my eyes and ears... search Raven Rock and see if you can root out these traitors.
The best place to start would be Geldis Sadri over at the Retching Netch Cornerclub. If he provides you any leads, check them out before bringing them to my attention. I can't afford to make any mistakes.

plots: Bera left the Skaal village to return to Skyrim with her love: Morwen's father, a sailor from Skyrim
Morwen thinks that Bera would like her necklace be placed upon her grave in Falkreath
title: Last Goodbyes
objective: take Bera's necklace to Runil, and return to Morwen
tasks: give Bera's necklace to Runil and tell him that Morwen sent you
description:
My mother, Bera, was Skaal, but she left the village and I was born in Skyrim. A trade ship from Skyrim struck ice off the coast near the village, and the Skaal took in the surviving sailors. My mother fell in love with one of the sailors - my father - and eventually returned with him to Skyrim.
I came across a few of my mother's old things not long ago. Among them was a necklace that my father gave to her when they were married. I believe she would want it placed upon her tombstone in Falkreath, as a symbol of her undying love and the great sacrifice she made for it.
If you find yourself in Falkreath, please give this amulet to the priest Runil and tell him that I sent you. He will understand. I don't have much to give in reward, but return to me when the task is done and I'll do what I can. Thank you, Skaal-friend.

plots: Suurootan can acquire furnishings for the house
title: Bruma House for Sale
objective: purchase the house in Bruma
description:
Lady Narina Carvain, Countess of Bruma. Welcome.
I've been looking for just the right owner for a special home I have. It's a quaint little house conveniently located just off the main gate. I'll sell it to you for 10,000 gold.
I've had a look at the place myself, and it could use some furnishings inside. Quite barren in there I'm afraid. I'm fairly certain that Suurootan at Novaroma here in Bruma can acquire the things you'll need to make it look like home.

plots: NONE
title: Blunt Training
objective: become Irene Metrick's equal in killing
description:
I'm Irene Metrick. If you needed to know more, you'd already know.
How many people have you killed in your lifetime, eh? Not as many as I, my little friend. When we're equals, you might interest me and get some blunt weapons training out of it.
If you've killed fifty people, it's still not enough for my tastes, but I might reconsider training you at that point.
Leave some bloody trails and tell yourself they all deserved it. Right? Ha, ha.

plots: Kyr's bandit gang dug up Frostmere Crypt: Kyr took the Pale Blade from the monument within
Ra'jirr keeps muttering about a Pale Lady, who is going to kill all of Kyr's bandits if they do not return the Pale Blade
title: The Pale Lady
objective: Find out what happened in Frostmere Crypt
description:
Eisa's Journal
by Eisa Blackthorn

Night shift woke me to say they'd hit something big. Kyr, Ra'jirr, and I went down to take a look. It's huge, like a whole forest was just swallowed up by the earth, with a big old monument out in the center. Kyr took a sword from the monument as a trophy and dubbed it the "Pale Blade", proof his whole plan was finally paying off. For once, he might be right.

Ra'jirr's been having nightmares over the past few days. He keeps muttering about a "Pale Lady" - one of those swamp women who steal children away at night, I think. To think some fool story could turn the toughest bandit I know into a cowering kitten, frightened of his own shadow. I'm just glad none of the others see him like this.

It's getting worse. Ra'jirr can barely sleep at all now, and whenever he dozes off, he wakes up screaming - woke the whole place last night. He says the "Pale Lady" is coming for us - she's down in the forest, we have to return the sword or she'll kill us all. Not a chance - the boss clings to that thing like he was born with it. I've told everyone Ra'jirr just has a fever, but this can't go on. I've pulled a few things together. I'll slip out tonight and never look back.

plots: the player came to Olava the Feeble for a reading
title: Locate the Assassin of Old
objective: go on an adventure
tasks: find the final resting place of the assassin of old
description:
Come to Olava for a reading, did you? Hmph. Yes. Yes, I surely can give you a reading.
It's not something I do lightly, mind you, and it's not as specific as you might want. But yes. I will do this for you. Please, relax. Free your mind. Yes, that's it...
A potential for adventure, and wealth. It is a ruin, ripe for the plunder. Deepwood Redoubt. Far to the northwest... Through there is... Hag's End. The last resting place of an assassin of old. A dark brother, who bequeaths his ancient earthly possessions... to you.
No... no, that is all. Now... now please. I find myself very weary all of sudden.

plots: "Letter from Calcelmo" is addressed toward the player
title: An Offer
objective: help Calcelmo with his research
tasks: bring the Dwemer sword you bough from Warmaiden's to Calcelmo
description:
Letter from Calcelmo
by Calcelmo

Dragonborn,
It has come to my attention you may have recently acquired a certain Dwemer sword from Warmaiden's.
I'm not sure how such an object came to find itself resting there... but I've been trying to obtain one for my research.
If you still have it, or if not, find another one, I would be most appreciative if you were to bring it to me here in Markarth. I will pay handsomely.

Sincerely,
Calcelmo

BG2165: Garren Windspear's cabin, a short distance south of here
BG2166: Garren Windspear's cabin, a short distance south of here

plots: Garren Windspear saw the player change their shape
Garren Windspear observed the player kill knights who looked like beasts: priests of Helm will seek justice and only the player's head will suffice
title: The Mystery of Monster Knights
objective: discover why you were tricked to kill knights
description:
I'm Garren Windspear. What goes on here? I've seen many a strange thing in my time, but the events of the past few moments tops them all.
Who are you that can change shape so readily, and why have you slain these beasts that become men?
It appears that you have been tricked into killing these knights! Though the priests of Helm will not believe what has happened. They will seek justice, and only your head will suffice.
I suggest that you take sanctuary with me until you can discover how this unfortunate event came to pass. My cabin is but a short distance south of here. I will meet you there.

plots: NONE
title: Few and Far Between
objective: help Ingun Black-Briar restock rare ingredients
description:
I'm aspiring to earn the title of an alchemist. However, the road ahead is paved with loose cobbles and deadly pitfalls.
Master Elgrim says I'm a natural; that I have a unique talent. But I fear his approval masks his intolerance for my mistakes. My errant formulas have cost Master Elgrim a fortune in ingredients; some of which are almost irreplaceable.
To restore Master Elgrim's supply I would need 20 deathbell, 20 nightshade and 20 nirnroot. Am I sensing that you may be interested in gathering these rare ingredients for me? That means more time for my experiments and less time in the field. Much appreciated.

plots: NONE
title: Retrieval
objective: retrieve a piece of Wuuthrad
tasks: find the group of Silver Hand who have the piece of Wuuthrad
description:
The Silver Hand has been scouring the world for more pieces of Wuuthrad. A group of their members has managed to secure one of the pieces.
They have gone hidden out in Eastmarch, somewhere inside Cragslane Cavern. The piece of Wuuthrad should be there with them.
Get that piece of Wuuthrad back, for the honor of us all.

plots: the player asked Farengar Secret-Fire whether he is the only wizard in Whiterun: Farengar Secret-Fire is the only wizard, but Whiterun is also home to a priest, a priestess, and alchemist, and others
title: Salt for Arcadia
objective: deliver some frost salts for Farengar Secret-Fire
tasks: give the frost salts to Arcadia, the local alchemist
description:
I believe I am, yes. Technically speaking, of course. The city is also home to a priest, a priestess, an alchemist, and I'm sure others who practice. Ah, that reminds me. Speaking of alchemists, I have some frost salts for Arcadia. She asked me to obtain them for one of her potions.
Would you be so kind as to deliver the frost salts for me? I'm sure Arcadia will provide some form of recompense…

plots: the player has proven themselves to Siddgeir
title: Kill the Bandits
objective: slay bandits for Siddgeir
tasks: find all bandits, and kill them
description:
You've proven reliable. There's a group of bandits in my hold that I... may have had a few discreet dealings with.
The cut they were giving me was good at first, but now it's time to clean things up. Go to Embershard Mine and take care of them. Teach them to stop paying me. Execute every last bandit. Spare no one.

plots: Laila Law-Giver gives the player the key to the warehouse
title: The Raid
objective: help Laila Law-Giver to uncover and stop the illegal Skooma trade in Riften
tasks: convince Sarthis close down his Skooma operation permanently
description:
We're aware of a Skooma dealer's presence in the warehouse within this city. Unfortunately, we're certain this Skooma dealer, Sarthis, has informants within the city guard. Every time we've made a move to arrest him, he's escaped.
However, if you'd take care of this discreetly, you might be able to surprise him without warning. Here, this is the key to the warehouse. See if you can drop in on this dealer of poison and convince him to close down his operation permanently.

plots: Roggi Knot-Beard's clan was one of the first to settle Kynesgrove: Lenne was the first to discover the mines
title: Roggi's Family Shield
objective: retrieve the Knot-Beard shield for Roggi Knot-Beard
description:
I'm from from here. I've wandered a bit, but I always come back to Kynesgrove. My clan was one of the first to settle here.
Legend says that my forefather Lenne discovered the mines after he stumbled into a dark cave to relieve himself. Too much mead. Of course, there's another story of Lenne losing the family shield in a different cave, so it depends on who you believe.
According to my grandfather at least, the family shield should be in the cave. He swore that version of the legend was true, even found the cave old Lenne stumbled into: Ansilvund. Hey, if you find it, I could show you some of the clan's favorite fighting moves. They're all shield techniques.

plots: the player is a noble
Chanelle was an orphan who was took in by the de'Arnise family: the player is Chanelle's guardian as the ruler of the keep
no one can marry Chanelle without the player's permission
title: The Maid & Her Suitors
objective: decide who gets to marry Chanelle
tasks: go see Chanelle and her two suitors
description:
Greetings, Your Grace. It is I, the majordomo of your castle. We have a small problem here at the keep, one that I doubt that you would be aware of at all.
I am unsure if you have met Chanelle... She has been a maid here most of her life. She was an orphan, and the de'Arnise family took her in as a servant when she was young. As the ruler of the keep, you are technically her guardian. Ordinarily, that would not be a problem, but there are two men who desire her hand in marriage. It is... up to you, my liege, to give her away and decide which of the men has your blessing for the marriage.
I shall bring them in to see you, my liege. If you do not resolve this issue, then... no one shall be permitted to marry Chanelle. And I am sure that is not what she wants.

plots: Madulf and his fellow ogres want to be left alone
Madulf wants peace with humans
title: Madulf Wants to Make a Deal with the Village
objective: tell the villagers of Imnesvale that Madulf can protect them from orcs in mountains
description:
Me Madulf... lead fellows from great army of Sythillis in the south. No want to kill races no more. Lead fellows in desertion. We just wants be left alone.
Always Madulf and fellows be chased and hated 'cause me an ogre! We just wants to be left alone. We come here one moon ago, tries to settle for a while, yes?
We needs you bring word to human village... humans run when Madulf goes, so me needs youse to do it for me. Youse bring word, yes?
Madulf no want death... Madulf no want fight. Just want peace. You tell villagers, maybe, that Madulf and fellows will protect village... protect from orcs in mountains, yes?
We have shield to give you... is magic, from Sythillis's army... we no use. Maybe you like.

plots: Arkion was Nemphre's lover
title: Arkion's Amulet
objective: steal Arkion's amulet and bring it to Nemphre
description:
Mmm, be a sweet one. Could you do a favor for Nemphre?
An old lover of mine has followed me here to the city and has been threatening me with some very dark magic. His name is Arkion and, if you could just get a certain amulet of his to me, perhaps there are a few things I could do for you? Such as giving you a Scroll of Vampiric Touch, mmn?

plots: the player is the new Arch-Mage after Traven
title: Alchemy Acquisitions
objective: use the expertise of Julienne Fanis for your own benefit
tasks: talk to Julienne Fanis about her collecting alchemical ingredients for you
description:
As the Arch-Mage, you are entitled to certain privileges.
In addition to the full use of all Guild facilities, there is one service available to you. Julienne Fanis has long served Arch-Mage Traven in collecting alchemical ingredients for his personal research. As the new Arch-Mage, I'm sure she'll extend the service to you as well.
At your convenience, consult her at the Lustratorium.

plots: the player is the Harbinger of the Companions
Skjor and Kodlak talked about totems of Hircine: simple-looking objects that could channel the powers of the werewolf in new directions
title: Totem of Hircine
objective: find a totem of Hircine with Aela the Huntress
description:
Harbinger, I'd be honored if you joined me in my search.
I had once heard Skjor and Kodlak talking about the totems of Hircine. Simple-looking objects that could channel the powers of the werewolf in new directions.
Once Kodlak began looking for his cure, I'd wager Skjor didn't bring it up again. But I was going through his things and found a book I had never seen before. All about the Totems. I've been talking to my sources around the holds, and think I may have heard where one of them lays.
Want to come along and help me find this totem of Hircine?

plots: Trill is known throughout Veras: from Torchlight to Redhaven
title: The Three Sisters
objective: find the 3 sisters
tasks: investigate a tree trunk in an area full of spiders
description:
Greetings! I am the great bard Trill. You've heard of me of course, my talent is known throughout all of Veras. From Torchlight to Redhaven they sing of my.. songs.
Torchlight... did something happen there? I feel a bit... Ah, nevermind. I recognize this place!
The spiders called, the Sisters three, the old trunk yawning wide,
Through ancient halls, dark ancestry, they met their fates inside.
An apt verse, you'll agree. I wrote it myself of course.
The rest of the song eludes me... Leniency please! Of course such a lapse is unforgivable in a great bard such as myself, but I feel a bit.. off.
Still, even that bare fragment of verse can lead you to glory. Go forth, brave warrior, and slay the mighty beasts! Whatever they may be...

plots: the player found Trill-Bot 4000's body, which stores his memories
title: Loose Connections
objective: reacquire the rest of Trill-Bot 4000's components
description:
It appears you have found my body. Very good. This is where my memories are stored … including the locations of multiple caches of treasure. I could share these with you, if you would help me reacquire the rest of my components.
We should begin with my Cognition Linkage. Without that, I won't be able to do much more than repeat this message. My sensors tell me it is somewhere nearby. Find it and reinstall it, and I will direct you to one of those treasure troves.

plots: NONE
title: A Trip to Eternity
objective: assassinate Ma'randru-jo
description:
Ma'randru-jo is an accomplished wizard, and your assassination target. Locating him may be challenging, as he travels with the caravans.
Those caravaners can be an elusive bunch. Takes a fair bit of stalking to take one down. But then, that's half the fun, isn't it?

plots: NONE
title: Unwanted Tenants
objective: kill a beast for Pavo Attius
description:
Pavo Attius has asked for our help. It seems a predator has invaded his home, and someone needs to clear the beast out.
Be cautious. Beasts are not nearly as predictable as men. Give the thing a quick death.

plots: Paarthurnax was the right hand of Alduin, and responsible for many atrocities during the ancient dragon war
title: Blood to the Blades!
objective: kill Paarthurnax
description:
I'm afraid there's a problem. A serious one. I've discovered who the Greybeards' leader really is.
