He's a dragon. Not just any dragon, but the right hand of Alduin, responsible for many atrocities during the ancient Dragon War. It's true that his crimes are long in the past, but justice does not count the passage of years.
Justice demands that he, Paarthurnax, dies for his crimes. Until he is dead, I'm afraid my oath as a Blade prevents me from offering you aid and comfort.

plots: the player has been imprisoned in Cidhna Mine without any reason
title: No One Escapes Cidhna Mine
objective: discover how widespread the injustice of Markarth is
tasks: talk to Braig: tell him that Madanach sent you, and ask him why he is in Cidhna Mine
description:
Well, well. Look at you. The authorities of Markarth have turned you into an animal. A wild beast caged up and left to go mad.
So, my fellow beast, what do you want? Answers about the Forsworn? Revenge for trying to have you killed? You're one of us now, you see? A slave. The boot of the false, unjust law stepping on your throat. Maybe if you understood that, I could help you.
There's a man named Braig inside these mines. Besides me, he's been here the longest. Tell him I sent you. Ask him why he's here. I want you to know how widespread the injustice of Markarth is. Then, we might discuss about an early pardon.

TESO425: somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala
TESO427: somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala

plots: the player reunited Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane
ogres attacked Weatherleah when Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane were little children: Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's parents fled from Weatherleah
Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's father carried Guilbert Jemane to safety and later returned to Weatherleah believing Reynald Jemane and the boys' mother had perished
Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's mother carried Reynald to safety: their mother did not survive
title: Legacy Lost
objective: help Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane recover Weatherleah
tasks: find Weatherleah, and see if it is still inhabited by ogres
description:
I can't thank you enough for helping to reunite me with Reynald. I never would have guessed he was still alive. We have much to discuss, but if you have time, I'd beg you stay a moment longer and hear about our home, Weatherleah.
Weatherleah was our family's home for generations. Our parents fled it when ogres attacked; they became separated. My father carried me to safety. He later returned and believed Reynald and my mother had perished. Since ogres are cannibals, he didn't expect to find their bodies. Thankfully, however, it seems that my mother managed to carry Reynald to safety. While my mother didn't survive, Reynald did, and for that I'm grateful.
But we both want more - we want our home back. We're not fighters; you appear to have more skill than either of us. Would you go to Weatherleah, and see if it's still inhabited by ogres?
Now, we're not quite sure where the estate is located. We'll offer up what we know, however. We believe it's somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala. It may be difficult to find. Since no one's lived there for many years, it may be quite overgrown by now.
If you find Weatherleah, let us know. We'll be waiting anxiously.

plots: Saffir doesn't like that Amren has been spending so much time looking for his father's old sword
title: A Sharp Heirloom
objective: retrieve Amren's father's sword for Amren
description:
I'm Amren, the husband of Saffir.
My Saffir doesn't like that I've been spending so much time looking for my father's old sword. He fed his entire family with the gold he made using that weapon. I'm not about to let it gather dust in some thief's trophy room.
I tracked it to a group of bandits nearby. The place is called Halted Stream Camp. But I'm no fool. I'd need the Whiterun guards or maybe hire some mercenaries to get it. I don't know why I'm saying this, but if you find it out in your travels, I'd be grateful to you.

plots: NONE
title: The Djinni's First Task
objective: perform three tasks for Fazeer Shah's amusement
tasks: recover Fazeer Shah's Lamp of Wonders from the Tu'tara
description:
The Artificer and the Alchemist might be formidable, but even their combined powers are nothing more than parlor tricks to one such as me. I can easily undo anything that they have done to your "Guardian." I will of course require something in return.
My only real enemy in this desert is boredom. I will make you a bargain: Perform three tasks for my amusement. If your struggles provide suitable entertainment, then, and only then, will I free your Guardian.
Your first task: Journey to the Sadwa Mesa, and recover my Lamp of Wonders from the Tu'tara!

plots: NONE
title: Jondal's Murder
objective: avenge Jondal for Kryla
tasks: kill the werewolves that killed Jondal
description:
Oh, please help me! I'm Kryla. They kill poor Jondal. The wolf-men.
They attack us as we search for roots in the forest. Please avenge my Jondal. He was so young...
They are this way. Please kill them, I am so frightened.

plots: Umbra the Sword contains the soul of Umbra the Hero
title: Clavicus Vile's Lost Sword
objective: retrieve Umbra the Sword for Clavicus Vile
tasks: begin your search for Umbra the Sword
description:
A mortal! Wonderful. Always a pleasure. I'm Clavicus Vile, the Prince of Trickery and Bargains.
Perhaps you'll do a service for me, mortal. And I'll reward you. A fair bargain, don't you think? You will retrieve for me a sword, a very special sword. It contains the soul of Umbra the Hero, a hero I have had dealings with in the past.
Bring the sword to me, and I'll reward you with my Masque. You'll not find a better bargain, mortal. Begin your search in Pell's Gate.

plots: the East Empire Company swept something big under the rug two centuries ago: it killed Gratian Caerellius and ruined the Raven Rock Mine
Crescius Caerellius and his wife found Gratian Caerellius' things in their home: an unsent letter to the East Empire Company, and a key to the locked off section of the Raven Rock Mine
title: The Final Descent
objective: find out what happened to Gratian Caerellius
tasks: find and unlock the locked off section of the mine
description:
Who in the blazes are you?! Can't you see I'm busy? Or, perhaps you could help me. Hmph, maybe. Been difficult trusting people lately, they think I'm crazy.
Mark my words, these mines hold a secret that could put Raven Rock back on the map. A secret the East Empire Company swept under the rug two centuries ago. It killed my great-grandfather, Gratian Caerellius, and left Raven Rock with a worthless and tainted mine.
East Empire Company called it "a terrible accident", claiming that he was lost in a rockfall, but I know better. My wife and I were cleaning out our home, and we came across some of my great-grandfather's things locked in an old chest. I found an unsent letter he'd written to the East Empire Company, and a key.
The letter describes a discovery that was made in the mine by some of the diggers. They wanted Gratian to take a closer look. The East Empire Company must have felt it was of great value, as they locked that section of the mine off from everyone else. I assume the key unlocks that section of the mine. I haven't been able to find the entrance.
I'm telling you... there's something big down there, something that the East Empire Company wanted to hide from everyone.

plots: NONE
title: Ogre Hunting
objective: kill ogres
description:
Hmph. I am Sarhedra and I don't like you.
I bet you're another one of those adventurers wantin' to change the world or somethin'. Well, go pick on the ogres to the south if it will make you feel better.
Go find someone else to talk to, I'm no good at this quest stuff. I have... ummm... people to see and places to be.

plots: Jadok found volume 4 of Alchemist's Journals: it describes entering the mine at Torchlight and retrieving Ordrak's Heart
title: Taking Notes
objective: figure out how to stop the Alchemist
tasks: find the 3 Alchemist's Journals that remain
description:
Your arrival is well-timed. I believe I have located the Alchemist's lair, here in the Icedeep Caverns. I found a Journal just inside the entrance; it speaks of entering the mine at Torchlight and retrieving Ordrak's Heart. I intended to look for more, further inside the icy caverns, but the creatures dwelling there now are too much for me.
Finding the rest of the Alchemist's Journals would probably be very helpful in ascertaining how to stop him. The one I saw was volume four, so there are probably three more in the Icedeep Caverns.

plots: the player told Garan Marethi that Harkon wants the Bloodstone Chalice without addressing Harkon properly as Lord Harkon
Harkon has owned the Bloodstone Chalice for a long time
title: The Bloodstone Chalice
objective: fill the Bloodstone Chalice for Harkon
tasks: follow Garan Marethi to the Bloodstone Chalice
description:
Lord Harkon. Remember your place. Now, he wants the Chalice, then.
You've heard of the Bloodstone Chalice? The Chalice has been in Lord Harkon's possession for quite some time now. It is, when used properly, able to increase the potency of our powers.
Lord Harkon has neglected using the Chalice for ages. If he wants it filled now, then grander things are afoot. This is good.
Follow me. I'll take you to the Bloodstone Chalice.

plots: Oublek knows the player
Prism the Sculptor stole 2 emeralds
Prism the Sculptor can live or die
title: Prism's Emeralds
objective: return 2 emeralds to Oublek
description:
It's me, Oublek.
A bit of nonsense from a local artist named Prism. Made off with a couple of emeralds, he did.
There is a reward for the return of the gems: a 300 gold bounty.
Prism's fate is of less importance.

BG1209: in his room in Feldepost's Inn
BG1211: in his room in Feldepost's Inn
BG1212: in his room in Feldepost's Inn

plots: NONE
title: Steal Algernon's Cloak
objective: bring Algernon's cloak to Pheirkas
tasks: steal Algernon's cloak off his person without killing him
description:
Hmm, I am Pheirkas and I prefer not to work with amateurs.
There's a fat man by the name of Algernon staying at Feldepost's Inn in Beregost. He keeps a cloak with him in his room and I need you to get your larcenous hands on it and bring it back to me.
I assure you that your reward will be handsome.
Try not to kill him, just filch it off his person.

plots: NONE
title: The Impatient Jarl
objective: deliver a note to Skald the Elder
tasks: tell Skald the Elder that he will get his lumber
description:
If you're one of the Jarl's men, you'll get your lumber. Anga's Mill pays its debts.
Sorry, I thought Skald the Elder sent you. We've got an order to fill, and he's not known for patience.
Look, if you're heading towards Dawnstar anytime soon, can you give the Jarl this note? Let him know he'll get his lumber.

plots: Armand Christophe is addressing the player, Methredhel, and Amusei
members of the Thieves Guild are followers of the Gray Fox: the one who wins the contest is allowed to join the Thieves Guild
the beggars will help the player locate Amantius Allectus's diary, for a price
Armand Christophe can sell the player lockpicks
title: May the Best Thief Win
objective: win the contest against Methredhel and Amusei
tasks: steal Amantius Allectus's diary without killing him, Methredhel, or Amusei
description:
Everyone is here, let's begin.
Each of you is seeking membership in the Thieves Guild. The Thieves Guild is not a myth. We are followers of the Gray Fox, and I am his Doyen.
Merely by finding me, you have passed the first test. It's unusual for us to have three potential recruits at the same time. Rather than the normal test of skill, I'm going to make this a contest. Methredhel, you know the rules. However, for Amusei and the newcomer, let me state them clearly.
Whoever brings me the diary of Amantius Allectus, without killing him, will be invited into the guild. It's somewhere in the Imperial City. The beggars will help you locate it, for a price. I can sell you lockpicks if you need them.
One more thing. You cannot kill each other during this trial. We may be thieves, but we're not murderers.

plots: the player is presenting an ancient Falmer tome to Urag gro-Shub and asking if Urag gro-Shub is interested in buying it
title: Forgotten Books
objective: bring ancient Falmer tomes to Urag gro-Shub
description:
Well, well. I haven't seen one of these beauties in a long time. A rare find in the original Falmer language. You're damn right I'm interested. Question is, are you selling?
Well, considering no one else in Skyrim would buy something they couldn't possibly read, I'd say you don't have much of a choice. Tell you what, you bring me books like this, and I'll pay a thousand gold each. I'll even throw in a translated edition I have for free.
If you're holding out for more gold, it's never going to happen.

plots: the knight Order Sir Henrik belonged to crumbled: Sir Henrik found the Shield of the Crusader on his own and brought it to Fort Bulwark
Sir Henrik and his trusted friends began work to keep the Shield of the Crusader safe forever
Sir Henrik died defending the Shield of the Crusader at Fort Bulwark
title: Wisdom of the Ages
objective: get the Shield of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: find the Shield of the Crusader
description:
In life, I was known as Sir Henrik.
If you are true to the teachings of Julianos, it may be possible for you to find the Shield of the Crusader.
When the Order crumbled, I set out on my own. After years of searching, I found the Shield and brought it to Fort Bulwark for safe keeping. With the help of a few trusted friends, I began work to keep the Shield safe for all eternity. I never saw my work finished. I died defending the fort from those who would take and misuse the Shield. I never saw our work finished; I trust that the others carried on without me.
The fort lies in the southeast of Cyrodiil, near the Black Marsh border. If all went according to plan, it should be very well guarded now.

plots: the player fought against Durnehviir in the past: Durnehviir respects the player
title: Durnehviir
objective: learn a dragon shout from Durnehviir
tasks: summon Durnehviir by speaking his name to the heavens
description:
My desire to speak with you was born from the result of our battle. I merely wish to respectfully ask a favor of you.
For countless years I've roamed the Soul Cairn, in unintended service to the Ideal Masters. Before this, I roamed the skies above Tamriel. I desire to return there.
I fear that my time here has taken its toll upon me. I share a bond with this dreaded place. If I ventured far from the Soul Cairn, my strength would begin to wane until I was no more.
I will place my name with you and grant you the right to call my name from Tamriel. Do me this simple honor and I will fight at your side as your Grah-Zeymahzin, your Ally, and teach you my Thu'um.
Simply speak my name to the heavens when you feel the time is right.

BG2218: the tomb of the founder of Trademeet in the Trademeet graveyard

plots: the player is the hero of Trademeet
the player spoke to Skarmaen before
the Alibakkars and the Lurraxols have been feuding for generations
the Alibakkars refuse to acknowledge the fact that the Lurraxols are the only true noble family in Trademeet, having founded it
Lady Lilith wants the Mantle of Waukeen to prove that her family founded Trademeet
Lady Lilith will give the player the key to the tomb
title: The Battle of Families
objective: bring the Mantle of Waukeen to Lady Lilith
description:
Ah! It is the hero of Trademeet, come to see me at last. I trust that all is well? That pig, Skarmaen Alibakkar, did not speak too harshly about me, I trust? No matter. He is a stubborn, deluded fool. Our families have been at odds for generations, you see. The Alibakkars refuse to acknowledge the fact that we are the only true noble family in Trademeet, having founded it. Why they would think themselves higher than they are is beyond my ken. What is unfortunate, however, is that my family has never had actual, physical proof of the truth of our claim.
That has changed, however. A tome has recently been uncovered... an old tome belonging to my family... that states there is proof right here in Trademeet under our noses. In the graveyard, here in town, lies the crypt of the founder... my ancestor. With him lies the Mantle of Waukeen. A pretty name for an old gold circlet. That circlet, however, would prove my claim once and for all and shut those Alibakkars up. I would get it myself, but the tomb is haunted, you see. Here is the key to the tomb... the fact that we possess it is yet more proof of our legitimacy. Use it to enter and obtain the mantle, and then return to me when you are done.
You are a hero who might enter that tomb and retrieve the circlet for me, if you are willing. In return, I will pay you 1,000 gold. What do you say, my hero?

plots: Habd and Ramati sailed for years from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back: Habd and Ramati bought Frostflow Lighthouse to settle down with Mani and Sudi
things went missing from the cellar and strange noises came from there as well

Habd went away from Frostflow Lighthouse to buy some traps: after returning home, he found out that Ramati was killed by a bug-like creature; Habd killed the creature and went into the cellar to save his family, locking the door behind him
title: A Tragedy at Frostflow
objective: uncover the tragic events inside Frostflow Lighthouse
description:
Habd's Journal
by Habd

After years of sailing from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back, Ramati and I have finally saved enough money to buy that old light house we spotted on the coast and we are moving in next month.
These northerners really know how to live. It may be cold, but you can't beat the tranquility of the watching icebergs to live out your silver years. Ramati loves the place too, despite the occasional leaky ceiling. Mani and Sudi, unfortunately, seem miserable here; I know the kids are old enough to strike out on their own, but I hope they'll grow to love the peace and quiet here as I have.
Mani and Sudi continue to bicker and harass each other and they seem to have started in on their mother as well. Ramati keeps finding things missing from the cellar. Sudi said she heard a noise down there but Mani just thinks their mother is going mad from isolation. The very thought of it is ridiculous, she's always wanted to retire here!
Sudi keeps saying that she hears scratching coming from the cellar at night. I think she's just trying to get her mother's goat, but I'd better head into town to get a few traps just in case it's rats. Should only take a couple days. I just hope those two go easy on Ramati while I'm gone.
Oh gods. Oh gods why? I returned home to find my beautiful Ramati killed and this thing, this horrible bug-like creature ransacking our home. I managed to kill the damned thing, I think it might be a demon! I've never seen anything like it! Oh gods poor Ramati. It must have come out of the cellar. I'm going down there and locking the door behind me to make sure they don't escape. I don't know if I'll make it out, but I have to save my family!

plots: NONE
title: A Contract Killing
objective: assassinate Cyrdemac
description:
Perhaps... perhaps you are the type of people who can help me. I am in need of someone to... perform a service for me. I need someone... removed. This scoundrel is no innocent! He threatens to ruin my life with... with the spreading of... accusations. He threatens to ruin my reputation and standing unless I pay him an exorbitant sum almost weekly! I beg of thee... you must help me. His name is Cyrdemac and he frequents the Elfsong Tavern. I have not been there myself, but I hear it is quite a rough place. You could do the deed in the main bar itself and likely none would call the guards. I know not if he will have friends with him though. Thank you for this.
Upon your return I shall pay you 2,000 gold. A small price to have this embarrassment removed.

TESO1: Matthias Draconis, Andreas Draconis, Sibylla Draconis, Caelia Draconis

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #2" is addressed toward the player: the player is a Silencer
the player killed Celedaen in the player's previous assignment
title: Next of Kin
objective: assassinate all five members of the Draconis
tasks: get the locations of other Draconis from Perennia Draconis, and assassinate her
description:
Dead Drop Orders #2
by Lucien Lachance

The Necromancer Celedaen is dead, and you are not. That is quite an accomplishment. But your work as a Silencer has just begun.
Your next assignment requires you to eliminate not just one target, but five. An entire family, in fact. The unlucky kin are Perennia Draconis, Matthias Draconis, Andreas Draconis, Sibylla Draconis and Caelia Draconis. The locations of most of the family members are unknown, so you should begin your search with the family matron, Perennia, who resides at the farm called Applewatch.
You must discern the locations of all the Draconis family members and then systematically eliminate them. I suggest you first speak with the mother and find out if she has any valuable information on the whereabouts of her children, before ending her life.
When every member of the Draconis family lies dead, journey to the city of Skingrad. In the castle courtyard you will find a well containing your reward for the Draconis contract, as well any further assignment I might have.

plots: NONE
title: A Plot Revealed
objective: find out why Jeanne Frasoric has stopped correspondence with Arch-Mage Traven
tasks: find out if Jeanne Frasoric is all right, and let Arch-Mage Traven know if she needs anything
description:
I am unable to look into something that has been brought to my attention. Are you capable of going on my behalf?
Please go to the Bruma Mages Guild; I have not heard from Jeanne Frasoric for a few days now, which is unusual for her. While I welcome the break from correspondence with her, I worry that something may be amiss, given recent developments.
Find out if Jeanne is all right, and let me know if she needs anything.

plots: the Knights of the Nine failed to uphold their knightly vows in life: they uphold them in death and do not let unworthy souls take the Cuirass of the Crusader
title: Priory of the Nine
objective: retrieve the Cuirass of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: defeat the ghosts of the Knights of the Nine in honorable combat
description:
By the strength and guidance of the Nine, who comes before us upon this sacred ground seeking the Cuirass of the Divine Crusader?
Step forward, adventurer, and face us, the Knights of the Nine, each in honorable combat. For the vows we failed to revere in life, we shall uphold in death. No unworthy soul shall lay hands upon this sacred artifact without the leave of the Knights of the Nine.

plots: NONE
title: Rescue Mission
objective: rescue a kidnapped citizen
description:
We've received a desperate missive. A citizen of the Rift has been kidnapped.
The Companions have been asked for assistance, and we shall answer. Particularly when the pay is as good as this.
Get moving. Find the kidnapped citizen at Faldar's Tooth and save them. I shudder to think what might happen if you're too late.
Bring honor to the Companions and yourself.

plots: the player was on a mission for Aran Linvail last night: Bodhi attacked Aran Linvail's guild in the meantime
there is a network of tombs beneath the graves where another spy tracked one of Bodhi's servants: the player shall find a set of blue doors just north of a spider den
the doors are too heavy for any mortal to open: Aran Linvail sends a mage to open the doors for the player
Aran Linvail gives the player stakes: the stakes can kill vampires permanently
title: A Counter-attack
objective: find the rival guild's hideout, and destroy the rival guild
description:
You were not the only one who was busy last night.
The leader of this rival guild, Bodhi by name, made a daring attack upon us. She can only be a vampire, and I suspect many of her servants are as well. The time has come to strike back to protect our people and the city she has invaded.
Go to the Graveyard District and find their hideout. There is a network of tombs beneath the graves where another spy tracked one of Bodhi's servants. There you shall find a set of blue doors just north of a spider den. The doors are too heavy for any mortal to open, but the vampires likely pass with ease. I shall send a mage to meet you there and arrange for the doors to be opened. Here, you shall need these stakes if you are to truly finish these creatures.
Be on your guard. This Bodhi is the most intelligent and brutal foe I have ever had. If we are lax in our vigilance, we will be at the disadvantage. When you have destroyed their evil, return to me and I will fulfill our bargain.

plots: the player asked Balgruuf the Greater to help the player trap a dragon in Whiterun: Ulfric and General Tullius want to capture Whiterun
getting both sides of war to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point
title: Season Unending
objective: negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius
tasks: ask the Greybeards hold a peace council
description:
I want to help you, Dragonborn. And I will. But I need your help first.
Ulfric and General Tullius are both just waiting for me to make a wrong move. Do you think they will sit idle while a dragon is slaughtering my men and burning my city? No. I can't risk weakening the city while we are under the threat of enemy attack. I'm sorry.
If only you could negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius. Then I would be glad to help you with your mad dragon-trapping scheme. But getting both sides to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point. The bitterness has gone too deep. Maybe... hmm... what of the Greybeards? They are respected by everyone. High Hrothgar is neutral territory. If the Greybeards were willing to host a peace council... then maybe Ulfric and Tullius would have to listen.

plots: the player killed Havilstein Hoar-Blood for Lucien Lachance
Ungolim spends his days securely locked inside his house
title: A Kiss Before Dying
objective: assassinate Ungolim
tasks: eliminate Ungolim when he visits the Lucky Old Lady at night between 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM
description:
Dead Drop Orders #7
by Lucien Lachance

My compliments on another job well done! Havilstein Hoar-Blood was more swine than man, and deserved to die quivering like an animal! You must not stop! You must kill again!
Your next target is a Wood Elf named Ungolim, who resides in the city of Bravil. Bravil is also home to an ancient statue known as the Lucky Old Lady. It is seen as a symbol of good luck and prosperity, and the fools of Bravil often speak to the statue and wish for good tidings. Every night, poor lovestruck Ungolim visits the statue and pleads desperately for the heart of a young maiden. This maiden is married, and her husband has learned of Ungolim's affection for his bride. He fears the competition, it would seem, and has commissioned the Dark Brotherhood to help in the matter.
You must go to Bravil, locate Ungolim, and kill him. The Wood Elf owns a house in the city, but he spends his days securely locked inside. I recommend you lie in wait at the Lucky Old Lady statue, and then eliminate Ungolim when he arrives for his nightly visit. He's generally there between the hours of 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM.
By all accounts, Ungolim is a deadly archer and a fearless opponent. I also have reason to believe he is expecting trouble, so if Ungolim senses danger, he may attack you on sight. Be vigilant, and bring the Wood Elf down! You must not fail!
When Ungolim's body lies broken at the foot of his dear statue, you must journey to the city of Anvil. Your dead drop is in a barrel located behind the statue in the pond. As is standard, your reward and next contract will be waiting.

plots: the player thought that the Dark Alchemist is after the Guardian Of Air's power: he left the desert for Grunnheim
the Dark Alchemist is powerful enough to destroy the barrier between the player's world and the realm of the Netherim
title: On to Grunnheim!
objective: defeat the Dark Alchemist before he gets to the Clockwork Core
tasks: speak to the Railmaster, and depart to Grunnheim
description:
Let us return to the matter of the Dark Alchemist. He has now stolen the energy of three Guardians, and we thought he desired my power as well. But, for some reason, he has left the desert, and is now en route to Grunnheim.
That can only mean that he is bound for the Clockwork Core. With the power he has amassed, he could destroy the barrier between our world and the realm of the Netherim. They would pour through by the millions.
Seek the Railmaster, and depart for Grunnheim as soon as you are able.

plots: Hert is always near Hern
title: Undead to Plain Dead
objective: assassinate Hern
description:
You are going to assassinate Hern. He's a vampire, and has blended into human society for years. He's never far from his female companion, Hert. Also a vampire.
The contract is for the male, Hern. But you'll probably have to contend with the female, too. They both live in Half-Moon Mill. So for Sithis' sake, watch yourself.
Face a vampire, and live to tell the tale!

plots: the player is a ranger
Delon has been looking for the player
Nelleck saw orcs coming down from the hills: he says that the orcs will be at the village no later than three or four days from now
title: Orc Attack
objective: repel orcs
description:
Oh! There you are, my noble ranger! It's me, Delon. I... I've been looking all over the place for you! You... you've got to come to Imnesvale!
There's orcs... big ones! Nelleck says he saw them coming down from the hills. Soon they'll attack! The Minister sent me to find you! Nelleck says that they'll be at the village soon... no later than three or four days from now. You've got to hurry!
I'll run back and tell Minister Lloyd that you're coming! Everyone will be so relieved!

TESO371: the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood in the Imperial City
TESO372: the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood in the Imperial City
Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City
TESO374: Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City

plots: the player is a famous hero: the player has not met Seridur before
Seridur and his fellow vampire hunters are only 3 old men lacking the strength to defeat vampires in battle
Roland killed his girlfriend in the back garden of his house by sucking her blood out of her neck
the player should return to the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood if they have questions: the Order of the Virtuous Blood meet at night
title: Order of the Virtuous Blood
objective: kill Roland Jenseric
tasks: search for clues about Roland Jenseric's whereabouts
description:
It's an honor to finally meet you. When I heard you were in town, I just had to send for your help. Your reputation precedes you. Oh, allow me to introduce myself. I am Seridur.
Welcome. You're now in the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood. Few outside our circle have ever set foot in our hallowed hall. We are, for lack of a better word, defenders. We guard this city from an infestation that plagues it. We are vampire hunters. I'm sure you are familiar with those despicable beings. Feeding on the innocent as if they were cattle. Well, this group was formed to combat them. Alas, we are but 3 old men, not able to match the fighting prowess of the vampire. We lack the strength to defeat them in battle.
Our goal is to root out the vampires that live in our fair city. So far, we've been unsuccessful finding one until now. It's come to the Order's attention that Temple District resident Roland Jenseric is a vampire, and has already claimed one victim. That's where you come in. We want you to slay this vampire and cleanse the city of his filth before he can feed or kill again.
A few nights ago, I was roaming the city as I often do, looking for any signs of a vampire. As I headed past Roland's house I heard a cry. I rushed into the back garden to find Roland struggling with a woman he'd been courting. I tried to intervene, but he was too strong. He threw his lover to the ground and turned his attention on me. Luckily, I managed to run back into the street and escape his grasp. I hid for a while and then returned to the garden. Roland was gone and the woman was dead. She had two puncture marks on the nape of her neck. That's when I realized he was a vampire. The Order needs you to track him and destroy him.
I would start by searching his home. He hasn't been there for days, so it should be safe. Return to us here if you have questions. We meet at night.

plots: NONE
title: Ahdarji's Heirloom
objective: recover Ahdarji's ring that was stolen by a freelance thief, and return it to Ahdarji
tasks: speak with Ahdarji about her ring that was stolen
description:
I have a special request from the widow of a former fence in Leyawiin. As your new Doyen, I am asking you to help her.
A street scavenger made off with a ring that the widow Ahdarji values highly. She is offering a reward. The guild frowns on freelance thieves.
Go to Leyawiin. Speak with Ahdarji and help her find her ring.

TESS517: East Empire Company's rundown offices in Windhelm
TESS518: East Empire Company's rundown offices in Windhelm

plots: pirates have been raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell: the East Empire Company's security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in the war
title: Rise in the East
objective: help Orthus Endario prove that the Shatter-Shields are in league with pirates
tasks: steal Suvaris Atheron's logbook and bring it to Orthus Endario
description:
Sad, isn't it? We can't afford to keep the place running since these attacks started. Pirates, you see. Raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell.
Our own security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in this ridiculous war. We don't even know their base of operations, and attacking single ships won't really solve the problem.
Only the Shatter-Shields appear safe. They are a very powerful family here in Windhelm. They run a private shipping operation, and would love to have the docks to themselves. Wouldn't surprise me if they were in league with the pirates, somehow.
Not yet, no. But perhaps an intrepid person such as yourself could help with that. They have a dark elf who oversees their operations. Suvaris Atheron. She's meticulous to a fault, and keeps a logbook with every transaction she makes.
If you get me the logbook, I'll have proof of Shatter-Shield's treachery.

plots: the Vanquisher told the Imperial Railmaster that the player is coming to him
title: Onward to Zeryphesh!
objective: travel to Zeryphesh on the Imperial Railmaster's Embercraft
tasks: tell the Imperial Railmaster when your ready to go
description: You're the one the Vanquisher lady told me about, then? Alright... whenever you're ready to get rollin', we'll get your gear aboard our Embercraft, and we'll set out to Zeryphesh. Shouldn't take us more than a couple of days to get there!

plots: the player has worked for Azzan before
title: The Unfortunate Shopkeeper
objective: stop the break-ins to Quality Merchandise
description:
Looking for more work, eh? Good. I have got a contract for you. I'd like you to go talk to Norbert Lelles, here in Anvil.
He runs Quality Merchandise here in Anvil. He's been having problems with break-ins, though, and he's hired us to put a stop to it. Sounds like he wants your help stopping the theft at his store.
Take care of Lelles. He needs the help.

plots: with Traven's gem in the player's possession, the player will be impervious to Mannimarco's attempt to enthrall them
Traven will die after giving the quest to the player
title: Confront the King
objective: defeat Mannimarco once and for all
tasks: get Traven's gem after speaking with Traven, and seek out Mannimarco
description:
Hear me, and hear me well. Mannimarco will have what he seeks, but it will be his undoing at your hands.
With this gem in your possession, you will be impervious to his attempt to enthrall you. When he fails, that is when you shall strike. When we are done speaking, you will take this gem, you will then seek out Mannimarco, and destroy him. Get to him anyway you can. It is your only hope for defeating him. I have full confidence in you, and so I leave the guild in your care.
When I am gone, you will be recognized as Arch-Mage and leader of the Guild. Lead your fellow mages, and lead them well. The future rests on your shoulders.
Farewell, my friend.

plots: Ezrohir have the Celestial Armory under siege
title: The Key to Victory
objective: help Lord Taldimut gather up weapons and armor from the Celestial Armory without Ezrohir noticing
tasks: use the Golden Gear to get inside the Celestial Armory, and activate the Armory Portal
description:
It's good to see you again, my friend! I know that I promised you a greater reward, should you come to visit... but that was before I returned to the Ossean Wastes and found the Celestial Armory under siege by Ezrohir.
What if I give you your choice of artifacts from the Armory? The Celestial Armory houses some of the finest weapons in the world! You have but to use the Golden Gear to get inside, then activate the Armory Portal, which will allow us to gather up the weapons and armor safely... with the Ezrohir none the wiser!

plots: Lucien Lachance has been framed as the traitor to the Dark Brotherhood: Fort Farragut is under watch by the Black Hand
title: Following a Lead
objective: uncover the true traitor's identity, and come see Lucien Lachance at Applewatch
tasks: go to your next dead drop, lie in wait, and confront whomever drops off the false contract
description:
You and I have been deceived, dear friend. We must find out who is behind this betrayal! We haven't much time... I am hunted day and night by the Black Hand! They want me dead!
Here is what you must do. Go now to your next dead drop, lie in wait, and confront whomever drops off the false contract!
Uncover the true traitor's identity, and then come see me. I'll be in hiding. Fort Farragut is no longer secure. It's under watch by the Black Hand. I'll wait for you at Applewatch, the farm where you killed the old Draconis woman. It should be empty, and safe.
Now go! And may the god of death help us all!

TESO224: small book, tells the player how to activate Xedilian

plots: Sheogorath gives the player the Attenuator of Judgement and a small book: the player can get more information from Haskill
title: A Better Mousetrap
objective: activate Xedilian to make unwanted guests to stay away from Sheogorath's realm
tasks: use the Attenuator of Judgement and the small book to activate Xedilian
description:
I'm Sheogorath, the Daedric Prince of Madness. I've been waiting for you, or someone like you, or someone other than you, for some time.
Now? You run an errand for me. An important one. Of course, anything I tell you to do is important. My Realm, my rules. You're going to Xedilian, one of my favorite spots in the Shivering Isles. It's a little place I use to take care of unwanted visitors. And some are more unwanted than others.
There are those that have other ways into my Realm, and they're on the move. We don't want them here. Trust me. So, you're going to get Xedilian up and running. Here's a little book to tell you how, and the Attenuator of Judgement. You'll need that, too. Of course, you can always get more details from Haskill. He's a detail-oriented type of person. A big help. And a snappy dresser.
Now, get going. Before I change my mind. Or my mind changes me.

plots: the player drove Rieklings away from Halbarn Iron-Fur's forge
title: Materials for Smithing
objective: bring Stalhrim or Ebony to Halbarn Iron-Fur
description:
Cleaning out the forge was the easy part. But those blasted Rieklings made off with most of my materials. And I can't forge air.
You tend to wander around, don't you? If you come across any Stalhrim or Ebony in your travels, bring them back to old Halbarn. Help each other out.

plots: Degaine doesn't want the Thieves Guild to find out about his plans
title: Lusting After Gold
objective: steal a child-sized gold statue for Degaine
tasks: sneak inside the temple and find the gold statue
description:
You see that Temple? Way up there. All them women, keeping to themselves.
Won't let poor Degaine in, no. Not even for a look. But they've got a treasure in there. Gold statue, size of a child. Who knows what they use it for, but I know what I'll use it for.
Stealing it and selling it for profit. Well let's not put it like that. Wouldn't want the Thieves Guild catching wind of us, eh? Nah, just creep in and have a go at taking it out. I'll be here, and pay you half of what my man in Riften promised for it.
You'll be helping out an old beggar, and the gods smile on that sort of thing.

plots: NONE
title: De'Tranion's Liquor
objective: give a jug of this town's hardest liquor to Captain Tollar Kieres
description:
Ohoy, I'm Captain Tollar Kieres.
A jug o' this town's hardest liquor would make for a fine departure, if ye'd be so kind.
Old De'Tranion brews a vile swill at'll do the trick. Ye can find the old coot at the Blushing Mermaid.

plots: NONE
title: Ankheg Culling
objective: kill exactly 4 ankhegs
description:
I'm Gerde, a ranger.
You've come here to fight ankhegs? Well, listen up: it's mating season, so it's primarily females coming up to the surface, looking to put on a little extra weight. They're hungry, they're aggressive, and there are a lot of them. Now, the point of this exercise is not to exterminate them, but to keep their population to a manageable level. Remember, they aerate the soil and thereby improve crop yields by as much as 15%. Food is going to be scarce enough in the next few years, so keep that in mind when you're out there. No more than four ankhegs per party. After that it's catch and release, all right? Most of the activity starts about fifty yards to the east.
Now move out, everyone. You'll get 75 gold pieces, if you stick to the quota.

plots: Dradeel converted to the Church of Selûne recently
there are werewolves everywhere
Dradeel might find a way out of this island if his spellbook was returned to him
title: Returning Dradeel's Spellbook
objective: destroy the lycanthropes' lair, and bring Dradeel's spellbook back to its owner
tasks: find the lycanthropes' lair and Dradeel's spellbook within it
description:
I am Dradeel, mage and recent convert to the Church of Selûne.
I was the guide for Balduran's brave adventures to the ends of the world and beyond. The wolf-men are everywhere. The lycanthropes' lair is in Balduran's ship. My spellbook lies within. With it, I am a powerful mage. Without it, I am the pauper that stands before you. With my spellbook retrieved, I may be able to discover a way off of the island.
If you go to destroy the lycanthropes' lair, I would ask that you find my book.

plots: NONE
title: A Child in the Lighthouse
objective: save Ardrouine's little son from worgs
description:
Please help me, I am just poor Ardrouine!
I don't know where else to turn. My little boy was playing in that abandoned lighthouse to the northwest when a pack of worgs surrounded it. Please just turn them back, and I can coax him down. There's not much time!
I can pay you 60 coins: this money is all my husband brought back from market this past week. My son's life is worth this and so much more.

plots: there are many new artworks and aged relics on display at the temple of Lathander
Dawn Ring was stolen from the temple of Lathander
the thieves were hired by the Talassans of temple of Talos
title: Another Mission for the Temple of Lathander
objective: return Dawn Ring to the temple of Lathander
tasks: intercept the thieves transporting Dawn Ring
description:
Good day, it's Dawnbringer Sain, the priest of Lathander.
I would ask a dangerous thing of you. You're free to refuse, but the greater glory of Lathander is at stake.
The Morninglord takes great pride in the artifacts of his rule. We have many items on display at the temple of Lathander, from new artworks to the aged relics of bygone days. Today we are one less. We are the victims of thievery, and our followers have been shaken by this vulnerability. Quick steps must be taken to rectify this.
We know the culprits; they have not concealed their crime. Talassans, slinking from their temple to degrade our worship, hired common thieves for the deed! They fear no retribution. The Morninglord cannot suffer his relics in the hands of such evil.
Find these thieves before the Talassans receive the items.
The spark of dawn has lit the way.
Go to the filth of the slums at night and intercept the delivery of our Dawn Ring. Bring it back to its proper place.

plots: Liefnarr went to trade some grain with people at Broken Helm Hollow: he never came back
title: Flight or Fight
objective: tell Liefnarr that he is not welcome home
description:
My husband Liefnarr said he was going east towards the border of Morrowind to trade some of our grain to some folks at Broken Helm Hollow.
I waited and waited, and he never came back. Probably shacked up with some elven whore. Good riddance to him I say. If I only knew where he was, I'd sure give him a piece of my mind.
If you see him, tell him Grosta said he can go straight to hell... he's not welcome here any more.

BG2106: in the north side of this chamber
BG2107: in the north side of this chamber

plots: Aerie works in the circus with Quayle
there's an illusion that makes Aerie look like a monster
Aerie has been chained: the key to her chains looks like a sword
the commoners have the key
Aerie regains her normal form after becoming free
title: Set Aerie Free
objective: free Aerie
tasks: get the key to Aerie's chains from commoners
description:
M-my name is Aerie. I... work in the circus with my uncle, Quayle... I... I'm not a monster! I'm an elf, a winged elf... or at least I was... This... this covering you see is some kind of illusion, but if you believe in it, then it becomes real! P-please believe me! Now go before something happens to you, I beg of you!
If... if you're not going to flee, then maybe you can help free me from the chains that keep me bound in this form — and then maybe I can help you!
You... you need the key to these chains. But... but it won't look like a key! There are a couple of... commoners... in the north side of this chamber...
Don't be fooled by the illusion, though... they are monsters! They have a sword which is actually my key... if you get it from them, I can remove the chain and regain my normal form!
But please be careful! You... you can't trust anything you see here!

plots: the player is torturing their prisoner
the player's prisoner has hidden her inheritance
title: The Inheritance
objective: find the hidden treasure for yourself
tasks: get your prisoner's treasure from a hollowed-out tree stump
description:
Why are you people doing this? Is it information you want?
This... this is about the inheritance, isn't it? All right! I'll tell you where I've hidden it. It's in a hollowed-out tree stump. In the marsh, south of Solitude. Now please, you'll let me go now. Right?
Why don't you be a dear and let me go now. All right? I won't say a word to anyone. Our little secret. I promise.

plots: the player is the newest member of the Thieves Guild
Hieronymus Lex collected taxes from the Waterfront: the city usually doesn't bother collecting taxes from the Waterfront District, because it costs more money than its worth
the Gray Fox has always protected the poor of the Waterfront
title: Untaxing the Poor
objective: steal back the taxes of the poor Waterfront citizens
tasks: find out where Hieronymus Lex is keeping the taxes and tax records
description:
Ah! Our newest member. I'm glad you stopped by. I have a... situation that you might be able to help with.
The Gray Fox has asked me to take care of a problem, and I'm putting you on it. Hieronymus Lex actually collected taxes from everyone living here on the Waterfront! Your job is to recover those taxes.
The people of the waterfront are very poor. Traditionally the city has not collected taxes from them, even though by law they could. The money the city would collect would barely cover the cost of collecting. The Gray Fox has always guaranteed protection to the poor of the waterfront. He doesn't want to let this injustice stand. It's a matter of principle.
Find out where Hieronymus Lex is keeping the taxes and bring them to me. I'll also need the tax records of what each citizen paid so we can return it.

plots: Hareph left with a crew to determine why the Skara have become aggressive
title: The Missing Man
objective: find out what happened to Hareph
description:
If you're heading out into the Salt Barrens, could you find out what happened to my companion Hareph?
He left with a crew to determine why the Skara have become so aggressive lately, but no one has come back.
If you travel North to the Swarm Stacks, you should be able to find him - or at least what happened to him.

plots: the player told Marana Rian that they want training
title: Sneak Training
objective: get training from Marana Rian
tasks: steal a coin from Marana Rian
description:
You seek training? From me? A few too many loose lips, it seems. It's not something I want to be public knowledge, if you understand my meaning. Very well.
Simple task for you. I just dropped a favorite coin of mine into my pocket. If you can steal it from me, I'll train you.

TESS2: an abandoned fort in the Reach

plots: the Dawnguard will become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered
title: Destroying the Dawnguard
objective: prevent the Dawnguard from becoming a serious threat against the vampires
description:
The Dawnguard will, no doubt, soon become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered.
We need to strike a crippling blow against them before they muster more men against us. They've holed up in an abandoned fort in the Reach. The Dawnguard are apparently focused on exterminating vampires, noble and brute alike. Not a serious threat, but we can't leave them completely unchecked or they may become one.
But their time has come to an end. And you will be the one that ends it. Killing their leaders should discourage them from an out and out war with us.

plots: NONE
title: Ghost of a Chance
objective: master all challenges
description:
I have been dead a very long time, and in all those centuries, I have not found one soul worthy of taking up the mantle of hero, as I once did, and seeking adventure.
Will you be that hero? I offer you five challenges. Defeat each of the five Spectral Champions in Crows' Pass: these ghostly champions will be your challenges. Should you master them all, my most prized possession is yours...

plots: the Captain's guards are engaging the Knights
title: The End of Order
objective: fight the last battle against Jyggalag and his forces of Order
description:
My Liege. I'm glad to see you. We have a developing situation that requires your attention.
An Obelisk of Order has activated in the Palace courtyard. My guards are engaging the Knights as we speak. We will defend the Palace to the end of our strength, and will cast ourselves in the path of cursed Jyggalag himself should he come here.
You must deactivate the Obelisk to be rid of the Knights! This will be our final battle against Jyggalag and his forces of Order!

plots: NONE
title: Wind and Sand
objective: retrieve a copy of "Wind and Sand" for Neloth
tasks: find a copy of "Wind and Sand"
description:
I've been trying to adapt Redguard magic to the ash. I think the key concept I'm missing is recorded in Afa-Saryat's book, Wind and Sand.
I have some associates and correspondents who find things for me. One of them has a credible rumor on where this book might be. And I'd like you to find the truth of the matter.
Go to Druadach Redoubt and fetch the book for me, will you?

plots: NONE
title: The Wandering Scholar
objective: protect Elante of Alinor
tasks: meet up with Elante of Alinor, and help her find a shrine
description:
Hello again. It's me, Azzan.
Good to see that you're looking for more work. There's certainly more to be done. I need you to help Elante of Alinor.
Elante is a scholar, interested in researching Daedra worship. Meet her in Brittlerock Cave, help her find the shrine, and keep her safe.

plots: NONE
title: Silence at Last!
objective: assassinate Lurbuk
description:
Your next assassination target is Lurbuk. He is staying at Moorside Inn in Morthal.
Lurbuk is, by all accounts, the worst bard in all of Skyrim. No one would hold it against you if you flayed that horrible bard alive and made a drum from his skin... Apparently so many people sought his death, a lottery had to be arranged to determine the client.
The only good bard is a dead one, as far as I'm concerned. All that singing and... mirth.

plots: NONE
title: Drinks for Stories
objective: convince Roggi that he should not worry about his bar tab to Iddra
description:
Roggi has been in Kynesgrove forever. Great storyteller. Keeps everyone's spirits up. Owes me a lot of coin for drinks. I keep telling him not to worry about it, but he's got the stubborn Nord blood.
Damn fool doesn't have the coin to pay me back, so he just beats himself up over it, and then he gets thirsty, and it cycles all over again. If you could convince him that I don't care about his tab, it'd certainly make me feel better.
Roggi pawned a few of his things back when he still had things to pawn. Take them as your reward.

plots: the player seeks restoration training from Oleta
title: Restoration Training
objective: receive restoration training from Oleta
description:
Greetings, traveler. You would seek restoration training from me?
Your courage is admirable, but now is not the time. Once Kvatch is safe from these attackers, then we might speak of training.
While Daedra still roam free in Kvatch, I can think of nothing else. When my city is safe, then I will train you.

plots: the player is Dragonborn
title: Dragon Hunting
objective: kill a dragon with the Blades
tasks: ask Esbern to send the Blades to the dragon
description:
The Blades of the old hunted down many dragons in their day, and they have records of where the beasts lived.
Only you can truly defeat these monsters, Dragonborn, but you do not have to do so alone. The Blades can help you.
Just ask whenever you're ready to take on a dragon. We will send the Blades to help you fulfill your destiny. The dragon's soul should make you stronger.

plots: the Empire demanded Skald the Elder to leave giants be, but the Imperial authority does not apply here anymore
title: Kill the Giant
objective: slay a giant
description:
Giants are a common problem in the Pale. The Empire always demanded I leave them be, but the Empire isn't here now.
Go and slay one of the beasts. It should let them know that Dawnstar is not to be trifled with. I'm counting on you.

plots: Alessandra did not want to become a Priest of Arkay like her father
Alessandra gives the player her ceremonial dagger
title: Pilgrimage
objective: help Alessandra make peace with her dead father
tasks: Go to Hall of the Dead.
bring Alessandra's ceremonial dagger to Andurs so it can be interred with Alessandra's father's remains
description:
I am Alessandra, a priest of Arkay.
My father was a Priest of Arkay, as well. All my life was spent around the dead, being forced to learn the proper burial rituals and prayers. I never had any friends; who'd want to spend time with 'the little weird girl who hangs around dead people?' So I grew up with a miserable trade. This is all I know how to do... prepare and inter the deceased.
I'd like to make the journey to the Hall of the Dead in Whiterun and give my ceremonial dagger to Andurs, the caretaker. I believe once it's interred with my father's remains I'll be at peace with his memory.
A Priest of Arkay is entrusted with a ceremonial dagger once they've completed their training. It's usually given by the head priest who sanctified the ritual. In my case, the head priest happened to be my father. The thing is, I never wanted to follow in his footsteps... In some ways I still don't.
I'm entrusting you with the dagger. Bring it to Andurs and he'll take care of the rest.

plots: Astrid betrayed the player by giving the player to the Penitus Oculatus: the Penitus Oculatus destroyed the Dark Brotherhood
Astrid opposed the old ways that guided the Dark Brotherhood for centuries unlike the player and the Night Mother
title: Death Incarnate
objective: fulfill Astrid's contract
description:
Alive.... You're alive... Thank Sithis...
Ssshhh.... Please. There is much... I have to say. And... not much time... I'm sorry. So very sorry. The Penitus Oculatus... Maro... He said that by giving you to them, he would leave the Dark Brotherhood alone. Forever. By Sithis, I was such a fool. All of this... it's all my fault. You are the best of us, and I nearly killed you... as I've killed everyone else...
I'm saying you were right. The Night Mother was right. The old ways... they guided the Dark Brotherhood for centuries. I was a fool to oppose them. And to prove my... sincerity, I have prayed for a contract. You lead this Family now. I give you the Blade of Woe, so that you can see it through.
You must kill... Me.

plots: the player walked on Zordral while he tried to kill Bentha
Zordral believes that Bentha is evil
Zordral thinks that the player is a threat to him and tries to kill the player too
title: Zordral's Witchhunt
objective: save yourself and Bentha from Zordral's wrath
description:
You there, stay back! If any of you come any closer, I'll kill her. I'm serious. Don't make me do it. All I have to do is say the last word of my spell and she'll die.
She's a witch. She'll use her magics to poison the children of this town. She'll butcher the livestock and she'll seduce the young men, make them her puppets. She must be killed!
Are you mocking me?! No one mocks the great Zordral. You will pay for your insolence!

plots: NONE
title: The Ember Keys
objective: use the Ember Keys to open the Watchweald Portal
tasks: get the Passkey Ember from the slavers, and Latchkey Ember from the goblins
description:
I was planning to enter the Watchweald Portal in the Old Estherian Refuge. Unfortunately the keys have been stolen. Goblin miners took one, and we believe that some slavers who recently moved into the area have the other. It takes both keys to activate the Watchweald Portal... and it is beyond my abilities to retrieve them.
Recover the Passkey Ember from the slavers, and the Latchkey Ember from the goblins. You can use them to open the Portal in the Refuge.

BG24: a svirfneblin village to the north

plots: the player released Vithal from imprisonment
Vithal lost his book of rituals
Vithal needs the book of rituals to breach the walls between dimensions
title: A Mage's Proposal
objective: help Vithal breach the walls between dimensions
description:
Ahh! Thank you for releasing me. I'm Vithal, an adventuring mage. If you could aid me a bit, I would be forever grateful. There will be items enough for us both.
This spot is "thin," and careful spells may breach the walls between dimensions. On the other side, one might find some valuable magic, if one knows where to look. I cannot cast the actual dimension-breaching spells without the procedures outlined in my book of rituals. I imagine it was taken after I was imprisoned. There were svirfneblin observing my conflict: Perhaps they took it. I cannot blame them. I am sure I appeared quite permanently lost.
I believe there is a svirfneblin village to the north. They may have taken my gear there. If you go, tell them they may keep everything but the book.

plots: the Thalmor hunted the Blades down, but the Blades have a headquarters of a sort now: it's time to rebuild the Blades
being a Blade is a lifelong commitment
title: Rebuilding the Blades
objective: recruit new members for the Blades
tasks: find anyone who would make a good Blades recruit and bring them to Delphine
description:
The Thalmor hunted us down. It wasn't exactly great for recruitment. But we have a headquarters of a sort now. We'll rebuild the Blades.
If you find anyone you think would make a good recruit, I can certainly take a look at them. Remember, though, being a Blade is a lifelong commitment. Their loyalty has to be with us once they're in.
After you have recruited enough new Blades, ask Esbern about the dragon lairs he's been studying. We'll have the recruits do some dragon hunting with you.

plots: Samuel is traveling with a woman
title: Samuel the Deserter
objective: capture Samuel
description:
I am a proud member of the Flaming Fist. I've been searching for a deserter. His name is Samuel, and he should be traveling with a woman.
There is a bounty of 50 gold for his capture.

plots: the player told Maramal that the player wants to get married
these are difficult times
title: The Bonds of Matrimony
objective: get married
tasks: attend your wedding tomorrow, from dawn until dusk
description:
Mara is the Goddess of Love. The temple spreads her gifts by tending to the sick, the poor, and the lost. We also perform wedding ceremonies for all the loving couples.
You wish to be married to your future spouse? It's good to see love blossoming, even during these difficult times. Your wedding will be held tomorrow, from dawn until dusk, in the Temple of Mara.

plots: the player told Alawen that they want marksman training from her
title: Marksman Training
objective: receive training from Alawen
description:
Why do you bother me, stranger? You make far too much noise.
You wish to learn? Hmm. You have potential, I see, but your equipment! A true marksman is only as good as his bow. When you have a good, solid Elven bow, then I shall teach you what you need to know.

plots: the player is Higgold's patron, and a bard
Zaren is ill: the player must replace him
the player observed the rehearsals of the play
title: Who's the Big Star?
objective: do not upset the member of the city council who is among the audience of the play
description:
Ooooh... my patron... We have a real problem. A very large problem. A gigantic problem!
One of... one of the council members is here... or, at least, I believe he is one! On opening night! This... this could make or break the playhouse! And Zaren... Zaren is ill! Deathly ill! He cannot even move from his bed! I see only one chance... it's too late for anything else... You must play Velden. You are a bard, naturally gifted... you observed our rehearsals.
Please, my patron, I'm begging you! This could be the biggest chance for all of us! And... and we mustn't upset the council member! PLEASE, you must do it!

BG2163: Mairyn's sacred lands to the north of this place where the temple of the sun god once stood
BG2164: Mairyn's sacred lands to the north of this place where the temple of the sun god once stood

plots: the player is a ranger
the humans have come recently, digging and tearing down the trees: Mairyn begged the humans to stop but they refused
title: Humans Destroying Forest
objective: stop the humans from further desecrating Mairyn's forest
tasks: seek out the nature of the humans' quest
description:
Good ranger! My name is Mairyn... I am a spirit of this forest, and I am in desperate need of your aid!
There are... other humans... in my sacred lands to the north of this place where the temple of the sun god once stood. They have come recently, digging and tearing down the trees... I have begged them to stop, good ranger... I have pleaded with them that they are destroying not only me, but many of the other forest spirits as well. The humans have refused.
I implore you... go to the forest in the north and do whatever you can to stop these humans from further desecrating my forest! You must go to them, and seek out the nature of their quest, if you wish. Whatever you do, however, you must stop them.
I... I have nothing to offer you, ranger, other than my gratitude. May Mielikki shine on you, good ranger.

plots: Brunwulf Free-Winter's guards are unaware of the threat, and will treat violence against the visiting advisor as a crime
title: A Jarl's Justice
objective: kill a vampire masquerading as a visiting advisor in Brunwulf Free-Winter's court
tasks: convince Brunwulf Free-Winter that the visiting advisor is a threat to him
description:
Jarl Brunwulf Free-Winter is in danger. A vampire plays as a visiting "advisor" to the court of Windhelm. Destroy it before it's able to complete its foul business.
But be warned. The Jarl's guards are unaware of the threat, and will treat violence against this "advisor" as a crime. Convince the Jarl of the threat and he'll let you destroy the creature. If not, then do your best not to get caught.
Quickly now! The longer you delay, the more danger the Jarl is in.

plots: the Ghost of Old Hroldan thinks that the player is Hjalti
title: The Ghost of Old Hroldan
objective: put the Ghost of Old Hroldan to rest
tasks: find Hjalti's sword ,and give it to the Ghost of Old Hroldan
description:
You don't remember me, Hjalti? Two campaigns we served together. You saved my life time and time again. You promised me, Hjalti. You promised that when we sacked Hroldan, you would make me your sworn brother.
And I've waited. Even after the enemies' arrows dug into my chest and their hammers crushed my bones. I've waited.
Give me your sword, Hjalti. That we may become brothers as you promised.

plots: the player asked Kesh the Clean about speaking with Peryite
deathbell grow in the frozen tundra
the player might find the ruby and silver in a mine
vampire dust comes from vampires
title: An Ill Meeting
objective: make incense with Kesh the Clean
tasks: gather a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust for making the incense
description:
Not everyone has the stomach required to entreat my Lord. He is the pus in the wound. Oh, proper ones curl their noses, but it's pus that drinks foul humors and restores the blood. But Kesh likes you, friend.
There is a way Peryite may speak to us who will take Him in. If you wish to commune with Him, we'll need the incense. Fetch for me a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust. Then I will show you how.
How to gather the ingredients? This one would try a shop. You might prefer the direct route, hm? Deathbell grow in the frozen tundra. You might nip into a mine for the ruby and silver. Vampire Dust is tricky. Vampires, you know.

plots: the player was captured by the mind flayers while trespassing their home
the mind flayers like watching their captives fight in the arena
the player should not attack the mind flayers
the player should not anger the arena spectators: they are especially strong because of their big brain
title: Captured by Mind Flayers
objective: survive the mind flayers' arena
description:
Me a servant ogre. Now it time to fight!
You fight in the arena. Listen, I tell you what you need to know.
You trespass on the home of the mind flayers, and you got caught. Now you pay for your stay. Understand?
Next thing, you better fight well in the arena, because if you don't fight well, you die. If you don't fight at all, you die.
Oh, last rule, never attack the mind flayers. You are in their home. They kill you with their thoughts.
You will live if you fight well.
I warn though: Do not anger spectators. They extra strong in this place because of big brain.

plots: NONE
title: A Suspicious Deal
objective: get the item from Enthir for Arniel Gane
tasks: talk to Enthir and convince him to give you the item Arniel Gane hired Enthir to acquire
description:
There is something you can do for me.
I had retained Enthir's services in, uhh, acquiring something specific. But now he's refusing to deliver. Could you perhaps speak with him, and see if we can come to some sort of arrangement?

plots: Nathan and his friends disappeared some days ago
title: Farmer Brun's Missing Son
objective: find Nathan
description:
I beseech thee, kind soul, please help.
I'm farmer Brun. It's strange happenings at my farm, and I've not the strength I once had. I've nothing to offer, and even if I did I doubt such as you would have need of it. My son Nathan and his friends went looking for our missing cattle, then they just up and disappeared! Been gone for days now and, with all the bandits around, who knows what's happened. I don't know where they were heading, but I saw some sort o' tracks to the west.
Please find Nathan. I can't afford to keep the farm without my son.

plots: NONE
title: The Prey
objective: remind the Dawnguard that they are the prey
tasks: track down a Dawnguard member, and kill him discreetly
description:
I've learned the whereabouts of a troublesome Dawnguard member. You will track him down and dispose of him.
But please, do be discreet. Don't. Get. Caught. Our aim isn't to stir the nest, just to skin a rat, reminding them that they are the prey.

plots: the player is the Dragonborn
title: The Words of Power
objective: find a lost word of power
tasks: get to the location marked on your map
description:
You have learned so much already, Dragonborn. Growing your gift too quickly would be dangerous.
But there are many Words of Power in Skyrim, carved in the Dragon tongue. Even from here, we can feel the Thu'um resonate from them. Finding these lost Words would be a sufficient test, to temper your abilities with experience.
We have felt the whisper of a Word. Give me your map, and I will show you where its echo can be found.

plots: NONE
title: Falling Awake
objective: help Amiable Fanriene to have some sleep
tasks: find a safe place to sleep outside
description:
Hello... don't mind me... Amiable Fanriene. I'm a little tired. Can't sleep at home, you know. The walls. They aren't safe.
I need someplace to sleep. I have seen some people sleeping out on the street, but they huddle too close to the walls. I need someplace safe. I can't just sleep anywhere. There're walls and statues and all sorts of things that can fall on me. Can't have that. Nope. But... if you find me a good place to sleep, a safe place -- outside -- I'll reward you!
Remember, walk lightly, and always look up.

plots: Commander Brage found a cursed sword and killed his family
Commander Brage was a well-liked man before the cursed sword changed him
title: The Tale of Commander Brage
objective: kill Commander Brage
description:
State your business with the guard and go! Oh, that came out a bit harsher than I meant. I am sorry for my mood. All the guard are still grieving the loss of Commander Brage.
The commander was friend to many before he found a cursed sword. He's not the man he was, by Helm. I'll not believe a man of Brage's rank could kill his own family. 'Twas evil magics of some sort. An entire unit went west after Brage to try to talk some sense to him. It's been a week, and none have returned.
The reward for the commander's head is a king's ransom, but I'll not be lifting MY sword against a brother soldier.
Travel lightly, wanderer. The woods harbor strange things.

plots: Hillevi Cruel-Sea's goods are grown at Hollyfrost Farm
title: Who to Poison?
objective: deliver a bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth
description:
Everything you see is grown at my family's own Hollyfrost Farm. Fresh and filling.
I also do a little herb growing. The court wizard, Wuunferth, pays us to plant a little Nightshade. Who knows what he uses it for? A poison like that?
Hey, could you deliver this bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth?

plots: the player freed Graman gro-Marad from a storage room
not long ago, the Blackwater Brigands stormed the Bloated Float: the Blackwater Brigands took Graman gro-Marad and Ormil hostage and and put the Bloated Float to the sea
title: An Unexpected Voyage
objective: clear a safe path to the top deck for Graman gro-Marad
description:
About time someone showed up. Thank you for freeing me. I'm Graman gro-Marad, the Bloated Float's bouncer and helmsman.
I've been locked in that storage room for hours. I don't know exactly what's going on, but not long ago, a gang of thieves calling themselves The Blackwater Brigands stormed the ship. They took myself and Ormil, the Bloated Float's owner, hostage and put the ship to sea. I have no idea what they're after. If you can get me safely to the top deck, I can steer the Float home. But I'm not budging until the coast is clear. I'm used to dealing with drunken louts, not a gang of well-armed thieves.
Good luck... you'll need it.

plots: Medresi Dran's work force ran away while excavating Angarvunde: they opened a chamber full of undead
title: Medresi Dran and the Wandering Dead
objective: discover the treasure of Angarvunde
tasks: clear the main chamber of restless undead
description:
I'm on the verge of incredible wealth, but my cowardly work force ran at the first sign of danger. We were excavating this old tomb when we opened a chamber full of corpses. The team took one look, turned tail, and ran.
Legend says this tomb holds a treasure that bestows great power on the one who discovers it. Beyond that, not much more is known. Obviously, this treasure will fetch a good deal of gold, and I'm willing to let you share in the reward when we find it.
I'll tell you what. You help me get the treasure and I'll split it with you. First, I need you to clear the main chamber of those restless dead. I'll stay here until you're finished, planning our next move.
With my brains and your brawn, that treasure will soon be mine... uh, ours.

TESO168: along the Corbolo, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal
TESO170: along the Corbolo, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal
TESO173: along the Corbolo, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal

plots: the player has not met Janus Hassildor before: the player and Janus Hassildor are both looking for a cure for vampirism
over 50 years ago Rona and Janus Hassildor were turned into vampires: Janus Hassildor embraced the vampirism, Rona did not
Rona slipped into coma from refusing to feed herself: Janus Hassildor wants to cure Rona's vampirism
Janus Hassildor cannot risk drawing too much attention on himself by searching for a cure to vampirism by himself: he found out that witches of Glenmoril have made a cure for vampirism before
title: Vampire Cure
objective: report to Janus Hassildor's steward after finding a cure for vampirism
description:
I'm sorry. We've not met. I'm Janus Hassildor, Count of Skingrad. I understand you're looking for a cure for vampirism. This is fortunate, as I also seek the cure.
I wish to tell you a story so that you might understand why I would trust you with my secrets. More than 50 years ago, my wife Rona and I were both turned into vampires. While I came to embrace the changes in myself, she did not. She hated what she had become, and refused to feed to keep herself healthy. She eventually slipped into a coma from which she has not awoken. My trusted servants have cared for her all this time, but I wish for her to at last find peace. The cure is for her. I have researched what I can, but acquiring the cure is beyond my grasp. I cannot risk drawing too much attention to myself. So I would ask that you took up the search on my behalf. If you are successful, I will reward you in whatever small way I can. Will you aid me?
What little I have discovered points to the witches of Glenmoril. In the past, they have been capable of creating a cure. I have searched for these witches throughout Cyrodiil, but no covens still exist within its borders. There may be one left. I have unconfirmed reports of a woman seen near the Corbolo river, who fits the description of these witches. Seek her out, and learn whether she can help. She lives somewhere along the river, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal. If you are successful in finding a cure, report to my steward. You have my thanks.

plots: NONE
title: Truffle Kerfuffle
objective: bring 12 Ember Truffles to Clive
description:
I'm a botanist, serving the Empire by gathering various Ember-infused plants.  And I've found a virtual treasure trove of Ember Truffles, down in the Muckery... but some of them have already attained sentience, and that's making it difficult for me to gather them.
If you can bring me, say, a dozen Ember Truffles, I'll keep ten for the Empire, and I'll use the other two to make a Super Mana Potion for you.
Do we have a deal?

plots: Ma'dran would help Ysolda start her own business for a mammoth's tusk
title: A Mammoth Powered Startup
objective: bring Ysolda a mammoth's tusk
description:
I'm Ysolda. Before my ma and da passed, I told them that one day, I'd become the best trader in Skyrim.
I met one of the caravan leaders, Ma'dran. He said he'd help get me started if I could bring him a mammoth's tusk. Easier said than done.
If you find one, I could teach you a thing or two about trading. Help you get a fair bargain in the future.

plots: Sheogorath is gone: Jyggalag will win, if the throne of Madness remains empty
the Staff of Sheogorath faded with Sheogorath
Haskill gives the player a crystal that opens the sealed door at Knifepoint Hollow: the library is a thing of Order, and it will still serve that end
title: Symbols of Office
objective: remake the Staff of Sheogorath and fill the throne of Madness after Sheogorath's passing
tasks: find the being who can help you to remake the Staff of Sheogorath
description:
Sheogorath is gone, but hope is not lost. We have a rare opportunity here, but I hesitate to do what must be done. If the Throne of Madness remains empty when Jyggalag storms the palace, he will prevail. But there is a chance that the throne may not be empty. The only way to protect the Realm from Jyggalag is to place you in the Throne of Madness.
Unfortunately, when Sheogorath faded, the power of the Staff of Sheogorath faded with him. It must now be remade. The Staff is the symbol of power in this Realm. He who rightfully holds the Staff may hold the throne of the Shivering Isles. However, the secrets of its construction are lost.
That which is lost can be found again. There is one being in the Shivering Isles who may be able to assist you in the construction of a new Staff. The ruins of Knifepoint Hollow once served as a great library. There, you will find a door. Behind that door, you will find the answer you seek.
Take this crystal. It contains the power to open the sealed door. Inside, you will find the final remnants of the library. Be mindful of what you find there. The library is a thing of Order, and it will still serve that end.

plots: the Thieves Guild had an arrangement with Maven: the Thieves Guild kept an eye on Goldenglow Estate to make sure the honey kept flowing, and Maven allowed the Thieves Guild to extort Aringoth and bring in a huge payout
Aringoth stopped sending the Thieves Guild extortion money: Mercer was angry
the player may kill Aringoth, but Maven would prefer him alive
title: Loud and Clear
objective: teach Aringoth a lesson
tasks: burn down three bee hives without burning the whole Goldenglow Estate down, and clear out the safe in the main house of the Goldenglow Estate
description:
Goldenglow Estate is a bee farm; they raise the wretched little things for honey. It's owned by some smart-mouth wood elf named Aringoth.
