We had an arrangement with Maven. We kept an eye on Goldenglow Estate to make sure the honey kept flowing. In return, Maven allowed us to extort Aringoth and bring in a huge payout.
Goldenglow Estate brought in a mountain of gold for the Guild. You could almost call it our sweetest deal. Then out of the clear blue, Aringoth stops sending us our cut. Mercer was... well, angry to put it kindly.
We need you to teach Aringoth a lesson by burning down three of the estate's hives and clearing out the safe in the main house. The catch is that you can't burn the whole place to the ground. Maven would be furious if you did. She also prefers that Aringoth remains alive, but if he tries to stop you from getting the job done, kill him.
The Guild has a lot riding on this. Don't make me look foolish by mucking it up.

TESO319: riddle, "Two bodies have I, though both joined in one. The more I stand still, the quicker I run."
TESO324: riddle, "Two bodies have I, though both joined in one. The more I stand still, the quicker I run."

plots: "Long Forgotten Note" is addressed to Daravyn the Gray's fiancée
Daravyn the Gray escaped from the prison in the Imperial City
title: The Rosethorn Cache
objective: find Daravyn the Gray's hidden treasure
tasks: solve the riddle that takes you to the treasure
description:
Long Forgotten Note
by Daravyn the Gray

My love,
I write this with trembling hands. The guards are after me, and I have nowhere else to turn. Soon they will be at the doors to Rosethorn Hall, and nothing will keep them from taking me away back to that horrible prison. I don't know how they found me; perhaps it was that traitor, Delgariun. Whoever told them I was hiding in your home must have known both of us very well. I know Delgariun has eyes for you, I know he's the one that framed me in the first place and had me sent to that dank hole in the Imperial City. He has to be the one. Beware of him, my love. He's treacherous and only wants you to get to the treasure. I didn't give it up to the guards, and I won't give it up to Delgariun. I've hidden the treasure within the walls of Rosethorn Hall. Remember the toy we played with as we ran through this place as children?
Remember the riddle we had for it? It was our secret code: "Two bodies have I, though both joined in one. The more I stand still, the quicker I run."
The key to the treasure lies with the answer. Take care of it, my love. It is your ticket far from Delgariun. Do not fret, I've escaped once, I shall do so again. Soon we will be together, and the sun will shine upon us.
Daravyn the Gray

plots: the player has recently escorted the two Jemane brothers back to Weatherleah
Albert Jemane was supposed to obtain a valuable item for Fathis Ules, but he kept it for himself
Albert Jemane fled from Chorrol with his family to wilderness, and was never heard from again: only his small son Reynald was found
Albert Jemane kept the item in Weatherleah, but Weatherleah was ransacked by ogres: they took the item
title: Sins of the Father
objective: recover an item stolen by Albert Jemane from ogres
tasks: find the item in a troll lair
description:
Fathis Ules. I may have a bit of a proposition for you involving the Jemane family you so recently assisted.
It was kind of you to escort the Jemanes back to Weatherleah. However, their father, the original owner of Weatherleah left them an even greater legacy.
My tale actually begins with the father, Albert Jemane. He was once in my employ, or should I say the employ of my organization. He was very good at obtaining things from people who did not want to part with. A professional thief, to put it bluntly. He was assigned to obtain a very valuable item for me. He succeeded, but decided to keep this item for himself. An unfortunate decision.
Albert Jemane fled from Chorrol with his family, and was never heard from again. Only his small son Reynald was found, wandering alone in the wilderness. Naturally, my associates and I believed he had perished. The wilderness is, after all, a dangerous place. No place to take your family. Then, these many years later, voila! The brother reappears. It seems the rest of the family did not die in the wilderness after all.
What is the point of my tale? Albert Jemane builds Weatherleah way out in the middle of nowhere. He was a thief, not a farmer. The only reason to establish such a place would be to stay out of the Chorrol Guard's sight. I believe that the item Albert stole, which rightly belongs to me, was hidden at Weatherleah. Unfortunately, the notorious Redguard Valley Ogres ransacked the place and probably took all of the loot back with them.
If you were to obtain this item, somehow, and bring it to me, I would pay you very well for it.

plots: finding Faelian will be challenging: the player should speak to their fellow Dark Brotherhood members for advice
Adamus Phillida does not tolerate Dark Brotherhood operations within the Imperial City
title: The Lonely Wanderer
objective: assassinate Faelian without attraction the attention of Adamus Phillida
description:
In the Imperial City there lives a High Elf who must be removed from existence. Finding this person may prove... challenging. Are you interested?
Your target is a High Elf named Faelian. He lives somewhere in the Imperial City, and fancies long walks. Unfortunately, that's all we know. We don't know which district he calls home, which establishments he frequents, or anything about his schedule.
This contract will require a bit of detective work. I suggest you to speak to your fellow Brothers and Sisters and see if they can offer any advice. Ah yes, there is one more thing. The Imperial City is also home to an Imperial Legion captain named Adamus Phillida. Phillida has dedicated his life to eradicating the Dark Brotherhood. He will not tolerate our operations within the Imperial City.
When that happens, he tends to make our lives uncomfortable. Let's not give the good captain any reason to go poking around in our affairs, hmm? If possible, do away with Faelian someplace out of the way. Definitely indoors, with no other people around. A secure location, with no witnesses. This will make it look like a simple murder. Phillida will be none the wiser, and you'll receive a nice bonus.
Now go, and may the Reaper of Souls go with you.

plots: Tova is not handling the death of her and Torbjorn Shatter-Shield's daughter well
title: A Comforting Amulet
objective: bring Torbjorn Shatter-Shield an amulet of Arkay
description:
Please forgive my mood. I'm still coming to terms with my daughter's death. Our little girl died recently. I've been shouldering my days with strong mead, but nothing gives my Tova peace.
I've been looking for an Amulet of Arkay to remind my wife that our child is with the gods now, but I can't find one. Would you be willing to give me an Amulet of Arkay, should you find one?
I hope Arkay grants my wife some comfort.

plots: the cloak is an important symbol of old times
the cloak draped the village center
the recent storm moved the cloak beyond the village walls
there are beasts outside the village walls
title: Delainy's Task
objective: bring the cloak to Delainy
description:
My name is Delainy, and I am pleasured to meet ye. I seek the return of an item, more an icon.
No doubt you felt the storm that passed just by and by? Village-home did as well, and the cloak that draped the village center was cast to the wind. I think it is beyond the wall, and will not risk the beasts to get it. Will you?
I can offer little besides my gratitude. The cloak is a keepsake, a symbol of old times.

plots: Heddic Volunnar is scouting out Volunruud: the relief not far from the entrance hides Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb
the two hidden keys to Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb are ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj
title: Silenced Tongues
objective: unlock the burial chamber of Tongue Chieftain Kvenel
description:
Heddic's Volunruud Notes
by Heddic Volunnar

I was skeptical, but it's obvious now. The old hymns had truth to them! The relief wasn't far from the entrance, just as they said. I've no doubt now that it hides the entrance to Kvenel's tomb.
The two keys must be hidden somewhere nearby - ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj, favored weapons when Kvenel went into battle. I don't dare explore further without hiring bodyguards to accompany me, however. To think - The Tongue Chieftain Kvenel could be entombed behind just a few feet of stone! The ancestor we scarcely believed was real.
Twice damned for planning this foolish scouting trip. I should have hired those sellswords in the first place. Perhaps there's no need. This place is just a tomb, after all, and there are no obvious signs of habitation. It isn't as though the thousand-year dead will mind if I have a look around.

plots: the ancients built many of the fortresses that dot the landscape of Skyrim: most have fallen into disrepair and overrun with bandits
title: Serving the Empire
objective: prove yourself worthy of joining the Imperial Legion
description:
I've got a good feeling about you. And I don't often get good feelings about anything. A warrior knows to trust her gut... I'm not going to go through the normal process with you. I've got a little test lined up. Pass that, and we'll talk about you joining the Legion.
The ancients built many of the fortresses that dot the landscape of Skyrim. Sadly, most have fallen into disrepair. And nearly all have been overrun with bandits or other vagabonds. Fort Hraggstad is one of the few that remains mostly intact. We're going to install a garrison there, but first, you're going to clean out the bandits that have moved in.
Then, it's time for you to officially join the Legion.

plots: NONE
title: The Sweep Job
objective: clear out valuables from Atheron Residence
description:
One of the quickest ways to make some coin in Skyrim is to clear out some of the wealthier homes of their valuables.
If you're interested, I could point out a good place that could use a little housecleaning by stealing three items of value.
The place in question is the Atheron Residence in Windhelm. The people in this home recently got one of your fellow Guild mates sent to jail.
How about you make them pay for that? Just remember the order: do job first, get drunk second.

plots: Jaylos and Caehan are planning leave Aran Linvail's guild to join the rival guild: they are supposed to meet their contact on the second floor of the Five Flagons
title: Switching Sides
objective: find the lair of the rival guild
tasks: pose as the rival guild's new recruit to the rival guild's recruiter
description:
Two of our men, Jaylos and Caehan by name, are planning to leave our little community and join with our enemies. Greener grass and all of that, I suppose.
They are to meet their contact on the second floor of the Five Flagons tavern in the Bridge District. Go there and pose as one of our enemy's new recruits. I want to know where our enemy's lair is. We have yet to find it.
This recruiter could arrive at any time so I suggest that you go to the Five Flagons now. They may prove unreasonable, so prepare yourself for hostility.
Return when you have the information we need.

plots: Quintus Navale has thought about repairing the White Phial
Nurelion was obsessed with the White Phial: his obsession consumed him
title: Repairing the Phial
objective: acquire the materials necessary to repair the White Phial
tasks: Go to Throat of the World.
description:
I have some thoughts about repairing the White Phial. There are three crucial elements. Some may be easier to find than others.
On the top of the Throat of the World is a patch of unmelting snow. No heat can touch it. Then we need the tusk of a mammoth, ground to a fine powder as only the giants know how. The final step is tricky. It requires the briar heart from a Forsworn of the Reach.
If you can bring me these materials, the Phial can again be made whole. You can keep the White Phial after I have repaired it. I fear keeping the Phial would just remind me of Nurelion's obsession, and how it consumed him.

plots: the player asked Gilgondorin about the Watchman
Gilgondorin pinpoints where the Watchman appears on the player's map
title: The Forlorn Watchman
objective: lay the Watchman to rest
tasks: go see the Watchman at 8 o'clock at night
description:
So you want to learn more about the ghostly Watchman?
The Watchman looks like he may have been a sailor. No one knows where he came from, or why he looks so sad. I don't like talking about the dead like they're some kind of tourist attraction, but that spirit has been making his ghostly journey for years now. We've learned to just accept that he's there.
Every night, sure as clockwork, he appears at Bawnwatch Camp at 8 on the shore of Niben Bay. He's never harmed anyone, but most people give him a wide berth. You seem curious enough, so I'll be glad to pinpoint where he appears on your map.

plots: NONE
title: An Axe to Find
objective: retrieve Glover Mallory's Ancient Nordic Pickaxe
tasks: tell Crescius Caerellius give Glover Mallory his Ancient Nordic Pickaxe back
description:
You haven't seen Crescius Caerellius have you? That foolish old man's taken my pickaxe again!
I'm not fussing over a simple pickaxe. No, no, no. This isn't just your run-of-the-mill pickaxe... I'm talking about an Ancient Nordic Pickaxe. They don't exactly grow on trees, you know.
An Ancient Nordic Pickaxe is the only tool tough enough to crack stalhrim, is what it is. Not many of those beauties left in the world... forging them is a lost art.
Look, if you see Crescius, tell him to give me that pickaxe back and I'll pay you for the trouble.

plots: NONE
title: Climb the Steps
objective: deliver a bag of food supplies to the Greybeards for Klimmek
tasks: climb the 7,000 steps to High Hrothgar, and put the bag of food supplies in the offering chest at the top of the steps
description:
Passing through on your way to High Hrothgar? About to make a delivery up there myself.
I mostly deliver food supplies like dried fish and salted meats; you know, things that keep fresh for a long time. The Greybeards tend not to get out much, if you catch my meaning.
It's kind of an understanding between us. I mean, it just wouldn't feel right to charge them for a bit of preserved food. Trouble is, my legs aren't what they used to be and climbing the 7,000 Steps takes its toll.
You'd like to make the delivery for me? Really? That would be kind of you. Here, take this bag of supplies. At the top of the steps you'll see the offering chest. Just leave the bag inside and you're done.

plots: Mironda is not good with names
title: A Beer for Mironda
objective: bring a cask of Halfling's Help to Mironda
tasks: get the cask from Old Vyatri
description:
Name's Mironda. Pleased to see yer face and make its acquaintance. I'm no good with names; if ye can remember mine, ye've already beaten me. I forgot yers by the end of the first syllable.
Maybe it's the wild mage in me comin' out, but I can't stand not tastin' something new once in a while. Most dwarves will drink the same mountain swill from crib to dust-crib, but I'm always hankering for the latest brew. Old Vyatri in Trademeet was just getting a shipment from Luiren I'd dearly love to sample. If ye happen to run by his place in yer travels, get a cask of it for me and I'll pay ye well!
Can't wait to taste it. Halfling's Help, it's called — I hope it works on dwarves, too

plots: Martin has made some progress in deciphering the Mysterium Xarxes ritual while the player was gone
the player may have seen lesser Welkynd Stones: they are common in Ayleid ruins
title: Miscarcand
objective: recover a Great Welkynd Stone for Martin
description:
While you were gone, I've made some progress in deciphering the Mysterium Xarxes ritual.
The third item we need is a Great Welkynd Stone. You may have run across lesser Welkynd Stones; they are fairly common in Ayleid ruins. But a Great Welkynd Stone will not be easy to come by. They have been plundered one by one over the years, due to their great value to mages and occultists.
There is only one place that is rumored to still contain one: the ruins of the Ayleid city of Miscarcand. A place where many have perished seeking its Great Welkynd Stone. But nothing else will do, so you must succeed where all others have failed.

plots: Bhisha the Khajiit follows Ushnar gro-Shadborgob everywhere
title: Ushnar's Terror
objective: stop Bhisha the Khajiit from tailing Ushnar gro-Shadborgob
tasks: make Bhisha the Khajiit go away for good
description:
That cat beggar Bhisha the Khajiit is following me! He's going to eat me, I just know it. Don't look! He's standing right over there.
You haven't seen that filthy cat beggar have you? He's still around. I've seen him skulking like the filthy cat he is.
Isn't he scary? I wish someone would just make him disappear. I would do just about anything for you if you make him go away. Permanently. For good. Never to be seen again.
You need a dog. I happen to have one of my old ones still lying around. I'll send it to you after you get rid of the filthy cat man.

plots: the player is a friend of the Zeraphi
title: The Crab Trap
objective: stop the Ezrohir from getting scrap metal from the crabs
tasks: prevent the Crab King from finishing his negotiations with the Ezrohir
description:
Your timing is perfect, my friend! Below us, in the Dead Shoals, the Crab King is negotiating with a representative of the Ezrohir, to provide the Ezrohir with a huge cache of scrap metal they have salvaged. The Ezrohir will use that scrap to forge more arms to bring against us! They must be stopped!
I beg you: Go down into the Dead Shoals and prevent the Crab King from concluding his negotiations with the Ezrohir! I realize this is not much in the way of a reward, but this potion is all I can offer.

plots: NONE
title: Grin and Bear It
objective: bring 10 bear pelts to Temba Wide-Arm
tasks: get 10 bear pelts by killing bears
description:
Have you ever seen what a bear does to the trees? They jump up on their hind legs and scratch them to bits... marking their territory or something.
It's getting to the point where I have to scour Skyrim for untouched trees at the right size. Costs me too much time and money.
Tell you what. Bring me ten of bear pelts from anywhere in Skyrim I'll gladly pay you for thinning out the herd.

plots: Joseph wears a greenstone wedding ring on his left hand
Joseph went missing in the mines
men have disappeared in the mines before
title: Joseph's Wife
objective: investigate Joseph's fate for his wife
description:
My husband is missing in the mines. All I know about the mines are that men keep on disappearing in their hellish depths.
My husband is one of the miners, but he hasn't been home for weeks. His name is Joseph, and he wears his wedding ring on his left hand. It's a greenstone ring.
Please, find him and tell me how he is doing!

plots: only the player can send the Ebony Warrior to Sovngarde
title: The Ebony Warrior
objective: fight the Ebony Warrior
description:
I am the Ebony Warrior. I have come to challenge you to a fight.
I have done all that can be done. There is nothing left. No quests to be undertaken. No villains to be slain. No challenges to face.
Except for you. You are my last challenge. Only you can send me to Sovngarde with honor.
Make your preparations. When you are ready, come find me at my last vigil.

plots: NONE
title: One Man's Trash
objective: find out whether a used Ember can be recharged, and return to Nerasis
tasks: attempt to charge the Spent Ember
description:
Hello there! I wonder if you have a moment to help me out? My name is Nerasis; I'm a researcher for the Empire. I've been working on a theory that used Ember can be recharged, with exposure to a suitably large source of mana. My research led me to Tarroch's Rift, where the mana output ratio is... well, it's very high.
The problem is that there are quite a few horrible monsters between me and the mana source. I would be willing to pay you to take this burned-out Spent Ember into Tarroch's Rift and attempt to charge it, then bring it back here so I can see if my theory is correct.

plots: the player told J'bari that they want light armor training from him
title: Light Armor Training
objective: give an unenchanted Elven cuirass to J'bari
description:
If you want training from me, you're going to have to get something for me first.
I need a new Elven cuirass. Nothing fancy, nothing enchanted. Just a decent piece of armor. You get that for me, and I'll train you. That's the deal.

plots: the player asked more work from Igmund
Igmund's father tried to negotiate with the Forsworn: they took his shield to Hagravens
title: A Shield for Igmund
objective: retrieve the shield for Igmund
tasks: get Igmund's father's shield back from Hagravens
description:
I do have more work for you. A personal matter. My father died trying to negotiate with the Forsworn, back when that was possible.
They took his shield to Hag's End, to those Hagraven beasts they consort with. I need you to bring it home where it belongs. I warn you, it's dangerous work. No man of mine has ever faced a Hagraven and lived. I'll understand if you decline.
Return my father's shield to me and I'll grant you permission to purchase property in my city.
Divines watch over you.

TESS802: around the main gate of Windhelm
TESS803: around the main gate of Windhelm

plots: the player saved Malborn from the Thalmor in the past
Malborn could not leave Windhelm for Morrowind because of the Khajiit
title: Assassin at Large
objective: kill the Khajiit who wants to assassinate Malborn
description:
Oh, it's you. I didn't expect to see you again.
I'm trying to stay alive. I think time's running out though. I'm pretty sure the Thalmor know where I am. Maybe you can help me.
I was trying to get to Morrowind. The Dunmer don't care much for the Thalmor and I figured I'd be safe there. As safe as anywhere, that is. But there's a Khajiit hanging around the main gate. I didn't like the way he was looking at me. I'm sure he's Thalmor. Just waiting for me to leave Windhelm so he can follow me and kill me in a lonely place.
You'd be saving my life. Again. I know I probably seemed ungrateful... I've just been so scared. Expecting a knife at my throat any minute.

TESO261: Sunken One, He Who Shakes The Ground
TESO262: Sunken One, He Who Shakes The Ground

plots: Kvatch was destroyed because they did not heed Slythe Seringi's warning about the Sunken One
Slythe Seringi has gone to give an offering to the Sunken One so that he does not sack any other cities: Anvil, Chorrol, the Imperial City
title: The Sunken One
objective: investigate the Sunken One
description:
Slythe's Journal
by Slythe Seringi

As midnight approaches, I still watch the fires burn. The great city of man, Kvatch, lay in ruins. They didn't heed my words. They didn't listen to my voice. Now, they are all paying the cost of ignorance. The Sunken One strikes swift and hard. He swats those who oppose Him as if they did not exist at all. The excuses of man fall upon deaf ears. The Sunken One has no pity; He has no mercy, He only sits below and passes sentence. And now, with a mighty stroke, He's toppled one of man's pitiful blights on His land. And yet, He still hungers. His appetite is voracious. Kvatch will not be the last city to fall by His hand. The world of man grows more and more corrupt, and it angers Him. Man's lies and deceit will be his undoing as The Sunken One grows impatient and no longer waits for or accepts the proper offering.
The burden is mine to shoulder. I am the last who knows of He Who Shakes The Ground. If I do not bring him the Offering, who knows what city may fall prey to his whim? Anvil? Chorrol? Or perhaps He will turn his eyes on the greatest boil of all, the great Imperial City itself. No, I must not let that happen. I must get the Offering to him like my father did before me. Man may be fallen in His eyes, but they must have time to learn The Sunken One's teachings. Destroying man now would be a waste, when I am certain that given the chance, they will come to see His ways. Yes, I will do this thing. I will brave the depths of Sandstone Cavern to see Him. My weapons will be my will and my word. The Sunken One will watch over me and guide me. I must depart soon, before it is too late. If anyone finds this journal, let them know that I, Slythe Seringi, do this for the good of all man.

plots: NONE
title: Kylee's Dagger
objective: return Kylee's dagger to its owner
description:
Are you going to be going down into the mines? If so, could you return this dagger to Kylee?
He dropped it when he went into the mine the other day and I haven't seen him since.

plots: Modryn Oreyn has been expelled from the Fighters Guild: Vilena Donton would expel the player from the guild too if she knew they were here
Modryn Oreyn wants to take down the Blackwood Company: he needs more information about them
the Blackwood Company is trying to expand
title: Information Gathering
objective: bring Ajum-Kajin to Modryn Oreyn so that Modryn Oreyn can "persuade" Ajum-Kajin to talk
description:
These certainly won't be official duties. Fact is, you'll likely be expelled from the Guild if Vilena gets wind of the fact that you're here. And I've already been expelled. Doesn't mean I'm done, though.
I'm taking down the Blackwood Company, and I want your help doing it. To bring them down, I need more information. My sources tell me they're trying to expand, and they've set up camp in Glademist Cave. I want you to go there and capture Ajum-Kajin, one of their leaders. Bring him back to me. I'd like to spend some time... talking to him.

plots: thieves stole Shahvee's sacred amulet of Zenithar as soon as she bought it
title: Good Fortunes
objective: retrieve Shahvee's amulet for her
description:
I'm Shahvee.
We Argonians have not fared well outside our native Black Marsh, but we're determined to make the best of things.
I began praying to Zenithar, the god of wealth, to bring us some fortune, but thieves made off with my sacred amulet almost as soon as I bought it.
If you found my Amulet, Shahvee would be in your debt, kind one.

plots: Sir Casimir followed Sir Berich into a war after the Order fractured
the war changed Sir Casimir: he no longer had sympathy for the weak, or pity for the suffering
after the war, Sir Casimir tried to serve the Nine at the Chapel of Stendarr in Chorrol
Sir Casimir was cursed after killing a beggar at the Chapel of Stendarr: he was weak, constantly weary, and lacked the energy to do almost anything
the Gauntlets of the Crusader slipped from Sir Casimir's hands after killing the beggar: they are still in the Chapel of Stendarr, too heavy to move
title: Stendarr's Mercy
objective: retrieve the Gauntlets of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: talk to the priests of Stendarr
description:
I, Sir Casimir, know where you may find the Gauntlets of the Crusader, for I was the one who lost them when I was still alive. Though many know where they are, they are still lost. I believe there is something you must do in order to retrieve them.
When the Order fractured, I followed Sir Berich into war, taking the Gauntlets with me. When it was over, I returned to this land. I attempted to return to the service of the Nine, but the war had changed me. I no longer had sympathy for the weak, or pity for the suffering. In the brief time I was there, I did more to hurt the Chapel of Stendarr than help it. It was there that I was cursed.
A beggar who came to the Chapel each day for help tried my patience one too many times. I lost my temper, and struck him. My blow landed harder than I had intended, and he fell to the floor, dead. Killed in the very Chapel of the God of Mercy. I left the Chapel at once, of course, but the damage was done. I was weak, constantly weary, and lacked the energy to do almost anything.
As proof of the deed, when I struck the poor man the Gauntlets slipped right off my hands and fell to the floor. Heavy as stone, they would not move. None could lift them. I suspect they lie there still, in Chorrol's Chapel. You must prove to Stendarr you are worthy to lift the Gauntlets once more. Seek out the priests of Stendarr in Chorrol. Perhaps they can help you.

plots: Mercer Frey never stays at Riftweald Manor: he hired Vald to guard Riftweald Manor
the player has the permission to kill anyone who stands in their way
title: The Pursuit
objective: search for clues about Mercer Frey's whereabouts
description:
I have an important task for you. I need you to break into Mercer Frey's home and search for anything that could tell us where he's gone.
Mercer's house is in Riften. A gift from the Black-Briars after they kicked the previous family out... a place called Riftweald Manor. He never stays there, just pays for the upkeep on it. Hired some lout by the name of Vald to guard the place.
Be careful, kid. This is the last place in Skyrim I'd ever want to send you. Just find a way in, get the information and leave. And you have permission to kill anyone that stands in your way.

plots: NONE
title: Killing Rats
objective: kill rats
description:
I thought I asked you to clean the rats out of this building yesterday, already. Hop to it! Get in there!
Ah yes, kill them like the rats that they are! A glorious battle unlike any this world has ever seen...
I'll give you 5 gp, don't spend it all in one place.

plots: the player is a noble: Bolumir would like to be the chaplain of the player's keep
Bolumir does not promise to stay long at the player's keep
title: The Priest of Tempus
objective: deal with Bolumir
tasks: decide whether to accept Bolumir's offer or not
description:
My name be Bolumir, priest of Tempus, the god of battles!
Hahr... it has been some time since I have rested my feet in any place, to tell the truth. I've been wandering for many a year now. The traveling does wear on me, to tell the truth. I've come to ask if you've a chapel that a priest of Tempus might set himself up in... bring the good Word to the folk of the area.
What do you say, eh? If my manner does not strike you as offensive, I would be glad to be chaplain of your wee keep here. I can help your people here much while I stay. But I do not promise to stay for long. Either you accept me or you don't, my liege... that is your choice, and I'll not begrudge it you.

plots: the player is a noble
there have been minor thefts in the player's keep: Cernick investigated the thefts and caught Lastin taking a necklace that belonged to Lady de'Arnise
Lastin has confessed his crime
the player is being watched carefully by the people who oppose the player's rule
title: The Thieving Guard
objective: punish Lastin for thieving in the keep
description:
Greetings, my liege. It is I, Cernick, your captain of the guard.
I am not sure if you have been aware, but we have been experiencing a number of thefts in the keep over the past couple of weeks. A goblet, some silverware, a few coins from the servants' quarters. All of these things have value, although none of them were major thefts.
Still... I investigated. Lastin here is one of the new guards. I caught him red-handed, attempting to take a necklace that belonged to the late Lady de'Arnise. Lastin has confessed his crime. I am unsure how to punish him, my liege, so I have brought this before you.
He is your subject, my liege, so yours is the right to decide punishment, but you are also... being watched carefully by those who oppose your rule, however.

plots: Rjorn entered Halldir's Cairn in secret, and presumably died there
title: Rjorn's Drum
objective: retrieve the Rjorn' drum for  Giraud Gemane
description:
They found it! They actually found Rjorn's drum!
You don't know who Rjorn is? You're joking, right? Rjorn? Only the most famous battle drummer of the second age. Well, famous among bards at least. That drum has been in half a dozen famous battles. It's a priceless artifact.
Nobody knows where he died, and therefore where his drum might be. Halldir was the missing link. Rjorn was always looking for new stories to tell. It seems he was writing a lay about Halldir when he vanished. Rjorn entered Halldir's Cairn in secret, and presumably died there.
Now all I need to do is find someone to get it. Wait. You. You could do it. I need you to get me that drum. The college treasury is a bit thin right now. But I can show you some tricks I learned from my days with the army.

plots: the aspiring wizard wants to join the College of Winterhold
title: Magic Student
objective: help an aspiring wizard learn warding spells
tasks: raise your own warding spell and allow the aspiring wizard to cast a spell at it
description:
I've finally found you! I want to join the College of Winterhold. But I need help with my wards. Can you teach me?
So, first, you raise your ward and I'll throw a little spell at it. That way I can see the 'right' way to do things.

plots: Agronak gro-Malog's mother fled with Agronak gro-Malog from the wrath of Lady Lovidicus
Agronak gro-Malog's mother gave Agronak gro-Malog a key to Crowhaven to "unlock the truth" before dying
title: Origin of the Gray Prince
objective: find proof of Agronak gro-Malog's noble birthright
tasks: travel to the place of Agronak gro-Malog's birth
description:
Hail, friend. I don't believe I've ever seen you down here in the Bloodworks before. Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Agronak gro-Malog.
I grew up here in the Imperial City, but I was born elsewhere. My mother was a servant in the employ of Lord Lovidicus, and resided at his fortress. Lady Lovidicus was a shrew of a woman. The Lord and my mother grew close, and ultimately fell in love. I was the result of their union. When the Lady learned of my birth she was furious, and threatened to kill both my mother and me. So we fled, leaving my claim to nobility behind.
My mother died recently. Before she passed, she gave me this key, and told me it would "unlock the truth," at the place of my birth, Crowhaven. Crowhaven is a ruined fort far to the west of here. I'd go myself, but my training regiment doesn't allow for the luxury of such an excursion.
My friend, you must travel to Crowhaven and use the key to unlock whatever it is that holds the proof of my birthright! Find this proof and return it to me, and I'll share with you some of my finest combat techniques. Trust me, you can't learn these moves in a book!

plots: NONE
title: Larceny at the Hall of Wonders
objective: steal a telescope without hurting anyone, just like Danilo Thann of Waterdeep
description:
HELLO! SHHH! Shh... ah... um... I mean, hello.
Might I have but a moment of your, ah, time? I should like to procure your talents for a, ah, unique service, though it's not like you would have to do anything socially untoward. Okay, it's stealing, but it's only the one item: A wondrously curious little toy from distant land. What did they call it? Oh, yes, a "telescope," of all things. It's a misleading name for such an interestingly crafted artifact. "Golden Extra-Farseer" would have suited its craftsmanship so much better. The tele-thingy is on display at the Hall of Wonders, and were it in the possession of anyone else it might be purchasable. It's roguery on par with Danilo Thann of Waterdeep, and I don't want anybody hurt.
I'll pay you well: 500 gold for one night's work. It's better than you could hope for in a year on the docks!

plots: the player entered the room where Melka has been imprisoned
title: The Affairs of Hagravens
objective: help Melka reclaim her tower by killing Petra
tasks: let Melka out of the cage
description:
Who enters? Will nobody save poor Melka?
You, meat! Come, come. Don't leave poor Melka to die. Pretty, pretty flesh. Let me out!
Petra! Evil Petra put me in a cage, stole my tower. Hate her, chew her bones! Let me out, kind, kind meat.
Ah, I have a pretty staff. Help me find Petra, wring her neck, pluck her eyes. Take my prize staff, I just want my tower back!

plots: the player saved Captain Veleth's life: his guardsman was killed by an ash spawn though
the ash spawn have been coming from this direction to Raven Rock
title: March of the Dead
objective: stop the ash spawn attacks on Raven Rock
tasks: search for clues about where the ash spawn come from
description:
Thanks... I wasn't sure I'd make it off this farm alive. I wish I could have said the same for my man here.
Some of the Redoran Guard have taken to calling them "ash spawn". Me? I don't care what they're called... all I know is they're a danger to Raven Rock and they need to be stopped.
I was going to search for clues that might lead me to wherever they're coming from. I know it isn't the best place to start, but we know they've been coming from this direction.
Could you lend me a hand? We were searching the farm when the ash spawn ambushed us. Have a look around and see if you can turn up anything useful.

BG1222: near a small shack to the north
Priestess of the Bitch Queen Umberlee
BG1223: Priestess of the Bitch Queen Umberlee

plots: NONE
title: The Fishermen and the Priestess
objective: force the Priestess of the Bitch Queen Umberlee to leave the fishermen alone
tasks: find the Priestess of the Bitch Queen Umberlee
description:
We're being harassed by a Priestess of the Bitch Queen Umberlee. We don't even know why, but whenever we attempt to fish she turns the weather sour. Two of us were washed away just walking to the docks, but we cannot prove to the guard it was her. We be needin' someone to strong-arm her into leaving us alone.
We've not much money, but I'll gladly give you a... magical weapon from my grandfather's adventuring days. It's a meager amount for your trouble, but it would be a great service to us.
Will you help a group of poor fishermen? She hides out near a small shack to the north. Watch yer back and act quickly; she's tricky.

plots: someone stole a painting from Countess Arriana Valga's bedchamber: do not accuse the wrong person
Countess Arriana Valga gives the player some keys that allow the player access to many of the restricted areas in Castle Chorrol
title: Canvas the Castle
objective: recover a painting, and bring the culprit to justice
tasks: gather clues about the identity of the culprit
description:
I am Countess Arriana Valga of Chorrol. I wish I had time to chat, but I'm afraid I am in the middle of an investigation.
You seem the trusting type. Perhaps you can assist me? It seems someone has taken away an heirloom that is quite dear to me. I want you to help me recover a stolen painting. The painting was of my lost love, the Count Valga, and it has been stolen from my bedchamber. If you find the painting, and bring the culprit to justice, you shall be justly rewarded.
I suggest you begin to gather clues. And I warn you: do not accuse the wrong person, or I shall be quite cross with you. Here are some keys. They should allow you access to many of the restricted areas in Castle Chorrol.

plots: NONE
title: The Whispering Door
objective: find out why Nelkir has become brooding
description:
My youngest son, Nelkir, is a dark child. I don't know what to do with him.
He was always a quiet lad, but lately... something has changed. He's become brooding. Violent. He won't say a word to me, but I don't know how I upset him.
If you could speak to him. Draw out the truth. I would be immensely grateful.

plots: the Gray Fox has asked that the player does this personally, as this is a delicate matter
Lady Umbranox is looking for a new guard captain: the Legion Commander of the Imperial Watch sent her a list of guard captain candidates
Dairihill lied to Lady Umbranox, telling her that the list has yet to arrive
the Gray Fox has extended his protection to the Umbranox family and Lady Umbranox in particular: Hieronymus Lex's unwavering loyalty and resolve make him the perfect protector for Lady Umbranox
title: Taking Care of Lex
objective: get Hieronymus Lex reassigned as the captain of the guard in Anvil
tasks: steal the list of guard captain candidates from Dairihill's desk
find a forger to make a forgery of the candidate list
sneak into the Legion Commander's office and seal the forged letter with his seal
deliver the letter to Lady Umbranox in person
description:
S'Krivva gives you greeting. Hieronymus Lex must be eliminated once and for all. The Gray Fox has asked that you do this personally. It is a most delicate matter.
Lady Umbranox of Anvil, is hunting for a new captain of her guard. The Legion Commander of the Imperial Watch sent her a list of candidates. The Gray Fox wants this list replaced with one that highly recommends Hieronymus Lex. From Anvil he can do little harm to the guild. The letter carrying the list is currently in steward Dairihill's desk. She has lied to Lady Umbranox, telling her that the letter has yet to arrive.
For reasons unknown to this one, the Gray Fox has extended his protection to the Umbranox family and Lady Umbranox in particular. While Lex is a problem for the guild, his unwavering loyalty and resolve make him the perfect protector for Lady Umbranox.
You will have to track down a forger on your own. I don't know of any in Bravil. With the forged letter in hand, sneak into the Legion Commander's office in the Imperial City Prison and seal it with his seal. Dairihill cannot be trusted. You must deliver the letter to Lady Umbranox in person.
Remember, this is a mission of stealth, not blood. Your payment will be higher than normal to cover the expense of the forgery.

plots: NONE
title: Ancient Technology
objective: retrieve Dwemer schematics for Sorine Jurard
description:
I want to add some punch to our crossbow capabilities, I've done all I can on my own. I need a little inspiration. I've always been fascinated with Dwemer artifacts. I take them apart, poke around in their guts, and try to figure things out - with mixed results.
But as luck would have it, I've tracked down the location of some actual Dwemer diagram drawings! So, if you'd be a dear and collect those plans for me at Irkngthand?
With the Dwemer diagrams and a little tinkering I should be able to improve the capabilities of our crossbows.

BG178: west of Nashkel, near the gnoll stronghold
BG179: west of Nashkel, near the gnoll stronghold

plots: NONE
title: Edwin and Dynaheir
objective: kill Dynaheir
description:
I am Edwin, a wizard, and I require you! (Yes, they will do nicely.)
I would have you kill a witch, the witch Dynaheir. She is treacherous, but with your participation I foresee no difficulty. Last I heard of her, she was traveling to the west of Nashkel, close to the gnoll stronghold located there. Will you assist?
The prize I offer would surely be beyond measure in your meager understanding. Your payment shall be one year of my services as a wizard. I am sure you agree that my guidance will be far more valuable than any monetary sum.

plots: Aventus Aretino did the Black Sacrament: he thinks that the player is an assassin from the Dark Brotherhood
Aventus Aretino was sent to Honorhall Orphanage after his mother died: he ran away back to Aretino Residence
title: Innocence Lost
objective: do an assassination contract for Aventus Aretino
tasks: kill Grelod the Kind, the evil, cruel woman who works as the headmistress
description:
I did the Black Sacrament, over and over. And then you came! An assassin from the Dark Brotherhood!
It took so long. So very long. But now that you're here, you can accept my contract. My mother, she... she died. I... I'm all alone now. So they sent me to that terrible orphanage in Riften. Honorhall. The headmistress is an evil, cruel woman. They call her Grelod the Kind. But she's not kind. She's terrible. To all of us. So I ran away, and came home. And performed the Black Sacrament.
And you can kill Grelod the Kind! I have a family heirloom you can have. Supposed to be sort of valuable. I hope that's all right.

plots: the player is not a believer of Helm
title: A Mission From Oisig
objective: discuss your mission with Oisig
description:
Greetings. I am Oisig, cleric of Helm.
I would speak with you. I would hire you as a mercenary in the service of Helm. I would prefer a person of faith, but you will be adequate.
Follow me to the temple of Helm. I will discuss what is required of you there. Do not take too long; Helm requires you now.

plots: Dervenin's master says that Dervenin is interrupting his vacation
without Dervenin's master's guidance, Dervenin's homeland is falling apart
Dervenin's master went into the Pelagius Wing to talk with an old friend
Dervenin gives the player a hip bone: the player can't enter Pelagius Wing without it
title: The Mind of Madness
objective: gain access to the Pelagius Wing, and find Dervenin's master
tasks: talk to Una or Erdi about entering the Pelagius Wing
description:
My master has abandoned me! Abandoned his people. And nothing I say can change his mind. Now he refuses to even see me. He says I interrupt his vacation! It's been so many years... Won't you please help?
Without his guidance, our homeland is falling apart. North wages war against the south! We need his return. Oh, but... I'm sure he'll repay you when he comes to his senses! His favor is a powerful, powerful thing. And so very worth any... inconveniences.
Last I saw him, he was visiting a friend in the Blue Palace. But no one as mundane as the local ruler. No, no... such people are below him. No, he went into the forbidden wing of the palace, to speak with an old friend. Said it had been ages since they had last had tea. Oh and you'll need the hip bone... it's very important. No entering Pelagius Wing without that.
The doors to the Pelagius Wing are locked. But I hear the maids, Una and Erdi, know how to enter it for cleaning. Surely they can help for such an important matter?

plots: the player has seen Akaviri relics displayed by Countess Narina Carvain
Countess Narina Carvain gives the player a translation of an Akaviri messenger's translated diary, a rough map and a unique key that may help the player in the ruins in Pale Pass
title: Lifting the Vale
objective: bring the Draconian Madstone to Countess Narina Carvain
description:
Allow me to formally introduce myself. I'm Countess Narina Carvain. I assume you've noticed all of the Akaviri relics I'm displaying.
Well, it's safe to say I'm a collector of sorts. I've invested a great deal of time and money acquiring these bits of ancient history. In fact, I'd be so bold as to proclaim my collection the most complete in all Cyrodiil; perhaps even beyond. Except for one thing.
A particular relic has eluded me for many years. Possessing this piece of Akaviri antiquity would make my collection complete. I'm of course referring to The Draconian Madstone. The stone is a fine bit of Akaviri craftsmanship. Worn like an amulet, this talisman is said to protect the wearer from poisons of any type. The talisman appears as a snake coiled around and encircling itself. The eyes of the snake are supposed to be precious gems or some such. Through my sources, I've learned that the last reported location of the Draconian Madstone was the ruins at Pale Pass.
If you retrieve the Draconian Madstone for me, I'll be happy to compensate you by rewarding you with another Akaviri artifact. Are you in the game?
Let me tell you how you're going to find the talisman. I've come into the possession of a diary written by an Akaviri messenger. I suspect that the text within can lead you to the ruins. Here's a translation of the passages we could still read. It was quite damaged. I've also included a rough map that was drawn in the diary as well. I'm also providing you with a unique key that was supposedly found with the diary. I'm assuming it will prove useful when you arrive at the site.

plots: Haer'Dalis is an actor in Raelis Shai's troupe
Haer'Dalis was captured by Mekrath because Mekrath coveted Haer'Dalis' gem
title: Free Haer'Dalis from Inprisonment by Mekrath
objective: return Haer'Dalis and his gem to the troupe
description:
I am Raelis Shai, the leader of this merry troupe.
The vagaries of fortune blow an ill wind over us. One of our members is absent due to circumstances we cannot control.
You must hear our story. One of our actors, Haer'Dalis, has been kidnapped by a wizard native to this city... he has made no effort to negotiate with us. The wizard's greed may have called to him at the sight of Haer'Dalis's beloved gem... something our sparrow would not gladly surrender. So this wizard has stolen both away, and there is nothing we can do. I would ask that you return our sparrow and his gem to us both, by whatever means possible.
The wizard's name is Mekrath, I believe... I know that his lair can be accessed through the city's sewers, though where exactly it lies is a mystery.
We are but a destitute troupe of players, child, and can afford little. Mekrath may have treasure of his own... Wrest it from his grasp if you wish to do so.

plots: knights who wished to quest for the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake would walk the Pilgrim's Way: the player should pray to each of the gods in turn, and ask their favor upon the player's quest
title: Pilgrimage
objective: show that you are a worthy knight to seek out the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake
tasks: Go to Wayshrines of the Nine Divines.
complete the Pilgrimage of the Nine Divines
description:
Oh my. To what do I owe this honor? I am but a humble prophet. What business do you have with me?
You would quest for the holy panoply of Pelinal Whitestrake? The legendary Relics that have been sought by mighty warriors throughout the ages? Are you a worthy knight?
The gods grant insight to those they deem worthy. Why and how they act is not predictable. What I can tell you is that traditionally, knights who wished to quest for the Relics would walk the Pilgrim's Way.
Travel to the Wayshrines of the Nine Divines. Pray to each of the gods in turn, and ask their favor upon your quest.

plots: Burz gro-Khash has one more contract for the player
title: Mystery at Harlun's Watch
objective: investigate the disappearances at Harlun's Watch
tasks: talk to Drarana Thelis for the details about the missing people
description:
I've got one more contract for you, meat. I assume you can handle it. I need you to investigate some disappearances at Harlun's Watch.
We've been contracted to find out what's happened. Speak to Drarana Thelis for all the details.
Get going.

plots: NONE
title: Hungry Pups
objective: deliver spiced beef to Voada
description:
My family has been breeding and training dogs for years. You need one out in the wilderness. Don't want to be alone when some bandit comes swinging.
I personally trained a whole litter for the Jarl. That reminds me, I was going to deliver some dog food to the Keep. Spiced beef. Their favorite.
You volunteer to make trip and deliver the food? Well, look at you, thanks. Take it to Voada, she handles all the dogs for the Jarl.

plots: Jauffre has received a message from the Countess: an Oblivion Gate has opened outside the city, and the Mythic Dawn are putting their plan to attack Bruma into motion
Jauffre wants the player to show the Countess's guard how to close Oblivion Gates
title: Bruma Gate
objective: help the Bruma guard close an Oblivion Gate just outside Bruma
tasks: meet up with Captain Burd and let him show you the Oblivion Gate
description:
I've just received word from the Countess of Bruma that an Oblivion Gate has opened outside the city. It seems that the Mythic Dawn are putting their plan to attack Bruma into motion.
Since you've dealt with these Gates before, I'd like you to help the Countess's guard close this gate. Once they've seen how it's done, they should be able to handle any new gates on their own.
Captain Burd is waiting for you outside the Bruma city gate. He'll show you the Oblivion Gate. Although I doubt it will be hard to find.

plots: Edla recently lost her husband: Nikulas is everything she has left
title: The Lure of of the World
objective: convince Nikulas to stay with his mother
tasks: counsel Nikulas on the perils of the world
description:
I'm Edla. I have a son. His name is Nikulas. He's a good lad, strong and loyal. I only wish he wasn't so eager to leave the village. I've tried to tell him that the world beyond our lands is dangerous and cruel, but he won't listen.
For now, I need Nikulas here. You see, his father, my husband, was recently lost to us. Nikulas is all that I have left in this world. I know it is selfish of me to say so, but I cannot lose him. Not while I still grieve. Also, I know his heart. Nikulas is reckless and foolish, like most young men. He cannot understand what awaits him in the wide world.
Could you talk to Nikulas? I know he would listen to you. You've been out there in the wide world. You know its perils.

plots: NONE
title: Healing a House
objective: help Elynea Mothren to repair Neloth's tower
tasks: find 3 taproots, soak them in the headwaters of Harstrad, and bring them to Elynea Mothren
description:
I don't care if he's a master wizard. He can't treat me like this! Master Neloth, that fetcher, told me to fix his house. If I don't, he'll find a new mycologist who will. Decades of loyal service, and he'd just throw me out like yesterday's breakfast!
I need three taproots soaked in the headwaters of the Harstrad river to fix Neloth's tower. I'm an old woman. I can't possibly make that trip. It's way too dangerous.
If you get some taproots, I'll pay you to dip them in the headwaters and bring them to me.

plots: two Sturmbeorn blacksmiths are making suits of armor for Warbeasts
title: The Warbeast Armory
objective: steal the armor schematics
tasks: get inside the Sturmbeorn makeshift smithy
description:
If you're going out to the Temple Steppes, I could use your help. The Sturmbeorn have set up a makeshift smithy there, and they have two blacksmiths making suits of armor for wild Warbeasts they've captured.
Those Sturmbeorn seem to be working from schematics, but they keep them under lock and key. Do you think you might be able to get in there and grab the armor schematics?

TESS747: the hills on the western edge of Skyrim

plots: Briarhearts remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds, putting their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces
title: Briarheart Necropsy
objective: examine a Briarheart for Neloth so that he can improve his heart stone experiments
description:
I've been having difficulties with my heart stone experiments.
Have you heard of the Briarhearts? They are fierce warriors of the Forsworn tribes. They actually remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds. It puts their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces.
Well, I'm hoping to do something similar... if I could connect a living being to the forces of nature... well... that would be formidable. I've done some experiments in this area, but, well, my test subjects are far too fragile. I'm hoping to learn some of the Briarheart techniques, their methods.
I need you to examine one of them. Just investigate as much as you can. The Forsworn live in the hills on the western edge of Skyrim. From there, you're on your own. I'm given to understand that they are not difficult to find, if you gather my inference.

BG2212: the tomb of the founder of Trademeet in the graveyard

plots: both Lilith and Lord Skarmaen asked to see the player before
the Alibakkars and the Lurraxols have been feuding for generations
the Lurraxols think that their family founded Trademeet
Lord Skarmaen wants the Mantle of Waukeen to prove that his family founded Trademeet
Lord Skarmaen will give the player the key to the tomb
title: The Dueling Families of Trademeet
objective: bring the Mantle of Waukeen to Lord Skarmaen
description:
Hello once again!
It is pleasing to see that you did not respond to the call of that harlot, Lilith Lurraxol. The woman is too deluded to see the truth, as I said. A commoner that has risen above her station. Our two houses have been feuding for generations. The Lurraxols seem to be possessed of the notion that their family founded this town... what an absurd thought!
Why they would even presume to suppose such a thing, I have no idea. It is sad, however, that the Alibakkars have never had the evidence to prove our claim to them... though it galls me that we would need it. All that has recently changed. An old tome belonging to my family states that there is proof — that proof can be found right here in Trademeet. In the graveyard is a tomb that has been long abandoned... but which also houses the founder of the town. My ancestor. With him lies a large circlet called the Mantle of Waukeen.
Possessing that circlet would be all the proof I need, so I wish to acquire it. I would do so myself, but there happens to be a good reason the tomb is abandoned. It is... haunted, so they say. The exact nature of its danger I do not know... but you are a hero who surely could face its perils and return safely with the mantle, yes? In return, I shall pay you 1,000 gold. I shall give you the key, then, which will allow you into the tomb... the key itself having been in my family for some time as well. More proof, yes? Go, then, and return with the mantle.

plots: NONE
title: The Fallen
objective: capture and interrogate a dragon to learn Alduin's location
tasks: convince the Jarl of Whiterun to help you capture a dragon in his palace
description:
Do you know Dragonsreach? The Jarl of Whiterun's palace? Its name is no accident. The palace was originally built to hold a captive dragon.
You might be able to trap a dragon there, interrogate him and learn Alduin's location. You'd require the Jarl's cooperation, of course. That might not be easy to come by.
You must trust in the rightness of your cause, and the strength of your Voice.

plots: Malaaq was bound to guard Irenicus' items and the player's weapon
Malaaq was captured from his home, Plane of Air, by Irenicus
Malaaq will be free if he is given his original flask
title: Free the Genie
objective: return Malaaq's flask to him
description:
I am djinni Malaaq and I have been bound by a wizard to guard his items, and your item it seems. I can sense your touch upon this weapon.
If you can secure the means of my release, I will give you your weapon.
I was captured in my home, on Plane of Air, by some wizard. He bound me to this flask that I might guard his things. You must find my original flask and bring it back to me. Once it is within my grasp, I can break the enchantment and be freed.
